reviewText: This item seems to have disappeared from stores in my area, but happily Amazon has it.  I use this as an addition to homemade tomato sauces of different types and find it adds just the right depth of flavor and texture.  I generally use tomatoes from my garden, fresh or frozen, as a base and paste from a tube to help thicken it.  The herbs and spices are up to me and while I enjoy adding various things depending on the purpose for the sauce, using a bit of this product in addition seems to ensure consistently good results.  I'd like it even better without the MSG, but since the portion size isn't huge, I can live with it.  I end up with sauces that guests and family rave about and can definitely tell the difference when I don't have any.  Maybe someday I'll figure out how to duplicate the flavor, but until then I'm keeping this product in my pantry.

This Spanish style Sofrito is a great shortcut to a wide variety of Spanish, Caribbean,and Mexican dishes.Sofrito is a basic tomato sauce that is made all over Spain. Tomatoes, onions, garlic, greenpeppers and olive oil are sautéed in a frying pan, so that the acid in the tomatoes mellows andmixes with the flavors of the onion, pepper and garlic. It can be eaten with rice or eggs, but oftenit is used as an ingredient in other dishes, such as chicken and pork dishes or the filling forempanadas.This is a great shortcut and the flavors of the onions, coriander, and garlic blend nicely. Howeverthis former 5 star product gets dinged one star for soybean oil and other ingredients that werenot present in this Goya classic not long ago....I also see MSG in there now and many people aresensitive to that so mind the ingredients before you buy.
summary: No kitchen should be without one of these.

reviewText: I haven't used a lot yet, but the two dishes that I have made,  I like the taste very much. Will buy again

Although easy to make from scratch I always keep a few jars of this sofrito in my pantry for when I am too busy to whip one up myself.The uses for this are as varied as patterns in snowflakes. I use it as a base for stews and soups, for basting fish before broiling or cooking it en papillote style, and even for adding to salsas and bruschetta to impart an ineffable flavor that never fails to please my guests.You need to be aware of a few potential problems with this sofrito though. First is it contains MSG (monosodium glutamate). If you get a reaction from that then you may want to avoid this particular product. Second, it contains 2565 mg of sodium, which can be a problem for people on a low sodium diet. Finally it contains soy that can cause reactions in some people. These do not necessarily detract from the quality and flavor of this sofrito, but you should be aware of their presence if you or anyone in your family has issues with them.Not only is this an essential ingredient for many Hispanic dishes, it also enhances a lot of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern recipes. I also keep a few jars ofGoya Recaitoaround when I want a sofrito that is better suited for Puerto Rican cuisine.

...MAKES FOR A HAPPY ITALIAN WIFE. I BOUGHT THIS GOYA RECAITO ALONG WITH SEVERAL OTHER GOYA PRODUCTS LIKE SOFRITO, TOMATO SAUCE, ALCAPARRADO MANZANILLA OLIVES, SAZON con CULANTRO Y ACHIOTE & CUBITOS en POLVO, JUST 2 NAME A FEW. I HAND OVER THE KITCHEN ONCE A WEEK & THESE ARE JUST SOME OF THE GOYA PRODUCTS HE WONT DO WITHOUT. BEING ABLE TO BUY THEM HERE @AMAZON IN BULK SAVES ME MONEY & TICKLES HIM PINK. LIFE IS GOOD. AS WITH 99.99% OF EVERYTHING I PURCHASE THROUGH AMAZON, ALL THE ABOVE MENTIONED GOYA PRODUCTS ARRIVED LIGHTENING QUICK, IN PRISTINE CONDITION & WITH FAR IN THE FUTURE EXPIRATION DATES.

Don't be intimidated by all these exotic Goya products, the company is actuallythe oldest and most revered of all the commercial Spanish foods companies.This Recaito is a fantastic shortcut for some of the best homemade salsa you evertasted. Its also a great compliment to simple dishes like beans and rice, or inmarinades or to give a boost to any of your other veggie dishes. A mild cilantroflavor infused with garlic and onion in an olive oil base. You're likely to finda dozen uses for this magic stuff. For me, I'm off to the store to get some chipsand tomatoes for another batch of salsa.BTW, I've just discovered Arroz Con Pollo, a Spanish chicken and rice dish.....thisRecaito is the base for the recipe and I was blown away by how good it turned out.This will be a weekly staple in my house from now on!

I haven't cooked w/ this yet, but I opened a jar & tasted a spoonful ~ WOW ~ lot's of inspiration as to how I will use this, so I'm pretty stoked to have three jars at once.Great price at $3.26 per 12 oz bottle ~ you'd spend at least that much on fresh ingredients & have a whole lot of prep going into homemade.

I discovered Recaito while in Puerto Rico on vacation.  They use it in many Puerto Rican dishes.  We use it in every Kale dish we ever make, and there are many kale dishes that we make.  This stuff is awesome.  We also use it in stir fry, stews, soups... dishes that contain vegetables, dishes that contains ham, pork or chicken, dishes that contain beans/rice/peas.  It is just versatile.  it adds a bang-punch of wonderful flavors to any ordinary dish, even casseroles.  If you like cilantro, you will LOVE this.  We keep Recaito well stocked in our pantry and use it all of the time.  I highly recommend.

Although this is really not good for me, due to the monsodium glutemate, I just really love this stuff.  Even just as a spread for a sandwich.  Yummmmmmm...and when making spanish beans, this is just an amazingly tasty addition.

This recaito is the next best thing to homemade in my opinion. I keep a few jars in my pantry for last minute dishes. Do note that this contains MSG, so if that ingredient causes any physical problems you should not purchase this product. It also contains some soy, another ingredient that causes problems with some people.What I love is the versatility of recaito in general. And despite my preference for making it from scratch, Goya definitely does an excellent job with this ready-made one.It is a perfect base for just about any soup or stew recipe you can think of, and is also an excellent garnish over the top of lentils, meats and entrees.  I use it on fish when I am cooking it 'en papillote' style, which has always been a big hit among my guests.A companion product that I always have on hand (and prefer making myself when I have the time) isGoya Sofrito, which is equally versatile and can be used for the same dishes and recipes as this recaito (although the recaito is a must for imparting an authentic flavor to Puertorriqueño cuisine.)
summary: Not as good as homemade, but ...

reviewText: Good instant coffee, but expensive, so glad to see it available now on Amazon via Subscribe & Save which reduces cost and is shipped free (for Prime members, also free for single purchases).

Taster's Choice Original House Blend Instant Coffee has been my preferred coffee for years too numerous to even remember. It has been the standard in my household for years. It is the BEST instant coffee on the market. This I stand by. I prefer Taster's Choice to any perked coffee any day. I go nuts when I can't find this on the shelf.
summary: I prefer Taster's Choice to any perked coffee any day.

reviewText: Could not imagine having such a rich tasting coffee from a powder, but here it is. Taster's choice has taken the best cup of coffee ever brewed, dried it and all you have to do is add hot water. Plus, you don't have to buy an expensive coffee brewing system to get it.

I really like Taster's Choice coffees; though it's instant, it has a robust flavor that pleases this coffee fiend! I like that I can have decaf as an alternate from regular Taster's Choice throughout the day, especially when I add hazelnut flavoring to it. I would have given it five stars, except that I reserve 5 stars for the fully-leaded Taster's Choice --- there's just nothing better than the real thing! That said, this is my favorite decaf coffee!
summary: Quick and convenient, Taster's Choice is tops!

reviewText: I like Taster's Choice better than any of the other instant coffees, so when I see this at a good price I always get it.  French Roast is my favorite type of coffee and so I had to order this when I saw the price was right.  After reading some of the other comments, I will have to watch the pricing on this if I order it again.  As for now, I am enjoying my purchase.

Strong coffee for the wakeup.  If I have something sweet to eat, the strong taste fits the bill or need.  If in a hurry, its a packet  of sugar alternative added to get the best taste to suit me.  Thanks

You just can't compare the taste of Taster's Choice Instant coffee to other instant coffees.  Even the smell is more delicious.  I often go for the cheaper brands because this brand is more expensive, but if I wasn't so thrifty, I'd go for this one all the time :D

Smuckers Natural Creamy Peanut Butter.  I only eat natural peanut butter.  I do not eat peanut butter that has those ingredients that I cannot have or do not eat.  I appreciate this peanut butter because it has none of those bad ingredients.First I tried the chunky (because I know I prefer the chunky), and then I tried the creamy.  I like them both, and both are worthy of five stars.  But I do love the chunky better.  But I do love them both.I do prefer to eat healthy.  But I'm also at that age where I NEED to eat healthy, not just WANT to eat healthy.  Thanks to Smuckers for this peanut butter!I eat peanut butter on top of rice cakes.  These are good for meals, snacks, work, traveling, camping, tailgating, when the storms knock out the electricity (that happened to us not too long ago), etc.Tomorrow, if the weather's good, I plan to take my granddaughter to the park after church.  We will have a tailgate.

This stuff is so good! I don't eat sugar, and this PB is great because it has no sugar in it (unlike Jif, Peter Pan, etc.). It took me awhile to get used to the taste--at first I thought it was a little chalky, but now I love it and would NEVER go back to the cruddy stuff. The worst part about this stuff is that I tend to eat it straight out of the jar....:).Hints:-When you get first get it, store the jar upside-down for awhile. When you're ready to eat it, turn it over and all the oil will be on the bottom. It's much easier to stir it this way than when the oil is on top.-MAKE SURE you store it in the refrigerator after it is opened. Natural peanut butter, being natural, HAS to go in there otherwise it will go bad very quickly.Enjoy!

I love this stuff. Before mixing the oil together with the peanut butter I add in 7-10 drops of liquid splenda which adds sweetness but it's great just on it's own too. Nice and oily, easy to just eat spoonful after spoonful!

reviewerName: Heather L. Parisi "Robert and Heather Parisi"
reviewText: CONTENTS - PEANUTS + 120 Mg. SALT - STILL 100% NATURAL + EVEN MORE AFFORDABLE FOR EVERYDAY CONSUMPTION & INCREASED PALATABILITY MEANS MORE PEOPLE WILL EAT MORE OF THIS GOOD STUFF -ESPECIALY FUSSY EATING KIDS - LIKE MINE!IN A PEANUT SHELL: 5 STARS BECAUSE UNSALTED SHOULD GET 6 STARS!It couldn't be MUCH simpler -- ONLY 1 NATURAL ELEMENT ADDED: SALT = THE 2nd BEST PEANUT BUTTER!IS THIS "NOTHING ADDED" REALLY A BIG DEAL?Some of the national brands offer peanut butter products that contain as much as 40% "ingredients other than peanuts", and much of those other ingredients are not natural, but rather chemical or synthetic additives, preservatives and fat emulsifiers, with salt and sugar being the best things that are added. WOW!!Probably the most significant NOTHING ADDED, is the absence of HYDROGENATION which is what makes things like margarine. and lard even worse for human consumption than they already would be.ABOUT THE ADDED SALT: WHEN OUTDOORS: THE SUMMER HEAT MAY INCREASE THE NEED FOR SALTThe small amount of salt 120 mg. per serving, or about 1.5 grams for the entire jar, is probably a good thing for must people to consume, especially in the summer when electrolite loss is an issue.Bear in mind that the daily RDA for salt is 2.5 to 3.5 grams.BOTTOM LINE: SMUCKERS IS THE NEXT BEST THING TO "CERTIFIED ORGANIC"For whatever benefits peanuts may offer, this is the best way to get those benefits other than just eating the nuts or securing a "certified organic" product which of course is prohibitively expensive.If you are on a salt-restricted diet try the no-salt added product.[I AM NOT AFFILIATED WITH ANY PRODUCT OR COMPANY]
summary: THOUGH I EAT THE UNSALTED VARIETY - 120 MG. OF SALT IS A SMALL PRICE TO PAY FOR PALATABILITY

reviewText: I stopped eating peanut butter for several years when all I could find had cottonseed oil in it.I am deathly allergic to cottonseed oil .It is put in peanut butter to keep it from separating .I kept reading labels & after about 3 years I found some from Bama .I ate that for several years .But it was discontinued .Oh no ,no peanut butter again .Shortly thereafter I found the Smuckers which I buy at WalMart Supercenter because it's cheaper .I saw the price here & freaked a bit .I buy 6 jars at a time ,some crunchy & some creamy & seem to eat most of it right out of the jar while watching TV .I Love the stuff . Smuckers sells a Lid with a stirrer in it for about $12 . A heavy table knife works just fine & flipping the jars helps too .The oil is also great for chapped lips .

Some of the popular brands of peanut butter have added salt, sugar and oil in them. Not this peanut butter. I sampled it for the first time this week and love it. It contains less than 1% of added salt. When you open it, there is some oil on the top which you just stir into the peanut butter. A nutritionist recommends keeping the peanut butter in the frig. I think it helps to preserve the nutrients.This is very easy to spread on to a muffin etc., and is a tasty treat. Will definitely buy more of this brand and want to try the chunky version of Smucker's natural peanut butter.
summary: Tasty, Natural and Healthy Peanut Butter

reviewText: As a 27 year old man, some might say it is a shame that my favorite food is a good old fashioned Peanut Butter Sandwich, or a classic 'Peter combo' which is a peanut butter sandwich with tortilla chips on the inside, or a 'Peter Special' which is a pb sandwich with BBQ chips. I stand by my choice.I love peanut butter and for years I went with good old 'Peter Pan' and Jiffy, but my mind was blowing when I first tried Smucker's Natural.There is no added sugar or binding agents to make it 'Silky' and 'Creamy'The taste is purely provided by the peanut. It tastes like peanut butter, minus all the stuff that is bad for you.For the price, there is no difference between Smuckers NATTY and the 'other' brands.The taste is superior, it is better for you.The downsides are, of course, it separates, so you have to mix the oil back into the peanuts. It can be a little hard to spread. It can be difficult to work with compared to 'Peter Pan' brand.But once you get used to it, if you appreciate the taste of peanuts over sugar, you won't believe you went so long without using Smucker's Natural Peanut Butter.

Nutty tasting. textured. The real deal of peanut butter!As a kid my great Uncle had a peanut farm in Maryland and he and my great Aunt made their own peanut brittle and peanut butter... and this Smuckers Natural peanut butter is as close as anyone has ever come to recreating those memories for me.As natural unprocessed PBs do, the peanut oil will separate and you will need to stir the product well before first use. That's actually not as much of a pain as it sounds... you can do it by hand but that gets tiring, so we just use a small rubber spatula to scoop out the entire product into a medium size glass bowl, then we hit it with our electric mixer on medium speed for a couple minutes to mix it all together. Once to the desired creaminess, we use the same spatula to put the mixed PB back into the jar and we store it in the refrigerator from that point forward to keep it from separating again.The end result is a textured, creamy real peanutty tasting peanut butter that just can't be beat!If you are looking for a more healthy peanut butter alternative for your family, one that really has that peanut taste, got for it! We recommend this PB very highly.
summary: Excellent peanut butter! We will never go back to the other greasy kinds...

reviewText: I dont have much to say that hasnt already been said - but i know when i go on here to buy food product, i like to read the reviews, and see how many stars the products get and WHY.I have tried many natural PB's, and this is now my peanut butter.  I am a vegetarian, so i like to have something like this for protein.  I also cannot eat whole nuts.  This peanut butter tastes GREAT.I do store it in the fridge, but i sit it out to get room temp before i make my sandwich or toast or whatever.  It quickly comes together and becomes spreadable again.Love this peanut butter!!
Well, "With a name like Smucker's it has to be good" and this PB definitely is.  It has the taste of peanuts rather than a pasty mix of all sorts of ingredients.

This is the peanut butter we buy all the time.  It just has peanuts and salt and I'm quoting the label.  I've been pouring most of the oil off when I open a jar, but I saw the suggestion in another review here that says to store it upside down until you open it.  I'll have to try that and see how it works.  It's a great tasting peanut butter.  The price on this one seems very high though.

We inhale easily 8 bags a day of tea. Or more. Aromatic Earl Gray my favorite, which is unfortunately NOT available in USA, so the bags from Sainsbury in UK are saved for weekends. Red Rosé or Trader Joe's Irish blend our full body every day tea.
summary: As tea drinkers, this is a great everyday tea

reviewText: I have fond memories of drinking Red Rose Tea with my Mother, from the time I was a little girl. Of course, one of the reasons I especially enjoyed it was the free porcelin doll inside. Usually, it was either some type of animal or a circus performer. This was just an added bonus, to drinking it. We would usually serve it with a splash of milk and a plate of graham crackers. This tea has a wonderful, clean black tea flavor - like you are drinking straight from the plant. I can't explain it better than that. It just tastes so pure. I am no aficianado, but, I know good tea when I taste it, and ain't nothin' like the real thing baby. I am going to go drink a cuppa, now.....
summary: a wonderful black tea that brings back memories....

reviewText: My mother loves red rose tea!  I actually thought that my store stopped carrying these large boxes with the ceramic figurine inside, but it turns out I was just going to the wrong store.  So unfortunately I purchased it here on Amazon (price point of about 7 dollars) when they were at another local grocery store for 2.37.The tea is fantastic, though.  I wish it was in sealed wrappers, but it does taste fresh regardless and very good.
summary: Red Rose tea is the b-e-st!

reviewText: I have had nothing but Red Rose growing up near the Canadian Border in the US. I have drank it for over 40 years and in my opinion nothing compares to it. I live in Indiana now and was able to get it at a local grocer much to my happiness but recently they quit selling it and I had to go home to Niagara Falls Ny to get it. I just noticed you sell it, (yea) and it should be much cheaper now getting it from you seeing gas prices are so high and the casino there cost me also dearly..lol so who cares what shipping cost right? Please continue to sell it. Thanks

I find this to be the perfect blend for morning or afternoon tea. It also makes the best iced tea you can have.I have drunk Red Rose for over thirty years and living in different places has made getting it quite difficult - thank goodness for friends who would ship it to us.Red Rose is a lovely blend of Black and Orange Pekoe teas. It is a smooth flavor which is refreshing and also soothing at the same time. It does not have the harshness or "bite" that so many teas have. It does not have added blends or flavors so what you get is a nice, straight-forward cup of tea.It makes a lovely spiced tea - put some Cloves, a stick of Cinnamon, and the rind of half an Orange in a pot with the correct number of tea bags for the pot. Steep for at least six minutes. Add honey to your cup and enjoy!
summary: Still the best little tea bag this side of the pond

reviewText: Oddly enough this was my grandmothers favorite tea, and I grew to love it myself. It is rich in flavor, well paired with milk and sugar, and enjoyable year round. It's usually had as part if my afternoon tea and makes a very relaxing cup.
summary: Been drinking this tea since childhood

reviewText: OK, I'm British and have been a big tea drinker for decades. We purchased several boxes of this tea since they had a promotion with nice Wade figurines. The figurines were nice, but the tea - insipid is the only word I can use to describe this.  I would put this on a par with the Liptons tea in a yellow box that is totally overhyped in the US, but nowhere near the usual standard British cuppa - PG Tips, Yorkshire Tea, Tetley Tea, Typhoo, and any major UK supermarket brand.I guess from the glowing reviews of many that if you are used to this then it's great but I cannot imagine many Brits finding this particularly palatable.We keep this is the cupboard as an emergency when we run out of other tea.
summary: Insipid tasting tea, but it will do in an emergency

reviewText: Just my opinion and based on my reading up on Red Rose...What we get in the U.S. now is not the same great Red Rose we used to get in the 1970's/early 80's. The company broke up it's operations between Unilever and Redco (?) and the difference is the Canadian version is Orange Pekoe Black and Pekoe Black cut teas with the American version just Black cut tea and Black Pekoe cut tea.  The difference is very noticeable as the original great aromatic flavor with that great after taste is gone. What we get in the U.S. is more like the Australian "Billy Tea" (also made by Red Rose, U.S.); in short, a stronger version of Lipton. Kinda bland.But I have found the Unilever version at my local WalMart and so far every box has been just like the Red Rose of old I remember as a young man! I'm very happy with it!  Most of the time I drink either PG Tips or Brooke Bond Red Seal and love them to death; but I still love my old Red Rose of my youth and am glad I found it again.  I don't know how long this will last; could have been a fluke or a purchase from an over stock issue...you never know with WalMart, but as long as I can find the original/Canadian blend I'm buying it.  So check for which company makes/distributes it and if you find Unilever on the label buy that one!
summary: American vs. Canadian and how to tell...

reviewText: FOR THOSE OF U WHO ALREADY USE THIS MAGICAL SPICE, U KNOW WHAT I'M TALKIN ABOUT BUT I WANNA SPEAK 2 THE COOKS OUT THERE WHO PUT 2 DAYS OF PREPARATION + COOKING IN2 THEIR THANKSGIVING DINNER WITH JUST THE USUAL "that was great hon, gonna go watch the game now!". PLEASE, I'M BEGGING U, TRY THIS PRODUCT. AFTER RUBBING UR TURKEY ALLOVER WITH ROOM TEMP BUTTER, GENEROUSLY SPRINKLE McCORMACKS POULTRY SEASONING ALLOVER IT. WHEN MELTING UR BUTTER + BROTH TOGETHER 4 MOISTENING UR STUFFING, AGAIN SPRINKLE VERY GENEROUSLY IN2 THE BROTH. AND LASTLY, WHeN MAKING UR GRAvY OUT OF UR PAN DRIPPINGS, SPRINKE A LITTLE MORE 2 UR TASTE. I SWEAR ON EVERYTHING THATS HOLY LADIES THAT U WILL STILL BE HEARING COMPLIMENTS AS UR FINALLY THROWING AWAY UR BARE TURKEY BONES! U MAY EVEN HEAR UR HUSBAND BRAGGING ABOUT IT 2 PEOPLE WHO WERENT AT UR DINNER TABLE THAT DAY. AND U'LL GET AS MANY REQUESTS FOR UR RECIPES IN DIRECT RATIO 2 HOW MANY WOMAN JOINED U 4 THANKSGIVING DINNER. ...10 STAR RATING 4 THE PRODUCT, THE FAST DELIVERY + THE PRISTINE CONDITION OF PACKAGING + PRODUCT.
summary: IF U WANT 2 BASK IN THE GLOW OF RAVE REVIEWS OF UR THANKSGIVING DINNER THIS YEAR, LOOK NO FURTHER!!!

reviewText: I rub this powdered cloves on my toothache.  It works for me & the pain goes away.I'm not a Doctor & I'm not giving out medical advice. Just saying what I do for myself.

No matter where I am or what time of year it is, one whiff of poultry seasoning instantly transports meto Thanksgiving morning with my mom and Grandma. This herb-based blend is a classic this time ofyear, but you don't have to limit its use to Thanksgiving, or just to poultry.Though frequently used to season turkey, chicken, and stuffing, poultry seasoning may also be used toflavor meat or veggie burgers, pot pies, soups, and more. When we're short on time, we find that a dashof poultry seasoning is a great way to add a lot of flavor to marinades, rice dishes, and vegetable soups.I used this accidentally on some slow cooker pork chops one day and it turned out great!And BTW, poultry seasoning is vegetarian and vegan, its not made from poultry as some people think. LOL

We love the taste of cloves and especially the ground ones that we buy from McCormick.  While the container is slightly less than an ounce the bottle will last quite a while because a little goes a long way to adding flavor to the product we are cooking or preparing.  When I open the top of the jar the aroma just jumps out and says 'How do I smell?'  Anything less than a wonderful is a fabrication.

These were very handy, individually sealed little bottles so the cinnamon stays fresh.  We use a lot of cinnamon on homemade bread for breakfast toast, and this is tasty and convenient.  Simple cinnamon toast really takes you back to your childhood.
I now use it in place of cinnamon on everything: pie, oatmeal, toast, ice cream, you name it. I even like it better than pumpkin pie spice. It is my new go to.

This is good.  It's just cinnamon stick.  Not much to say, there.But, I've recently been delving into Indian food, since so many of the recipes can be made gluten-free; in that process, I became aware just how much I take McCormick's for granted; I don't even think about gluten-freeness in spices, because I usually just buy McCormick's, knowing they're gluten-free.Other spice manufacturers will hold your feet to the fire over price to find gluten-free spices.  The few things I had to buy from other manufacturers, to make Indian food, were incredibly expensive if they were gluten-free.So, a proposal:  McCormick's should have an Indian food spices line.  What do you think, guys?
summary: Gluten-Free!!!  All of McCormick's single-ingredient spices are gluten-free.

reviewText: My name never carried well across the neighborhood to the yard where I most often struck out at the plate. Sound, as is the case with many a young boy, was only one way to call me.Misty evenings, just as the sun committed to drop westward, an hour after my father would drive up in his Buick Special, I smelled Worcestershire sauce from our charcoal Webber. This meant the Whiffle ball game ended, and, win or lose, I had a different plate to step up to.The scent created a state of emergency. Bats, balls, and, if we used any, bases were gathered by their respective owners, and we all ran home like lovers impassioned in lustful want.His recipe for steak was simple. Get it from Jerry, a butcher he knew for years, dazzle it with ground pepper and the smallest sprinkle of Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce. Like smoke signals, the air became the messenger, or, for me, a siren seducing me homeward. No other sauce would do. His reasons had no merit for me at six years old, but I never had cause to question.Such as it will be for you. Big bottles of Worcestershire sauce will be what you need, but a small bottle will be inspiration enough.--Brockeim
summary: Signals Whiffle Ball Games Are Over and Dinner Begins

reviewText: There are a number of different Worcestershire Sauces to choose from on the market. Over the years, Lea & Perrins consistently has been of high quality. Even though it has been taken over by Heinz, I have seen no diminution in quality. And it's no longer made with high fructose corn syrup, which is an added benefit. We always keep a bottle of this worcestershire sauce on hand, since there are a number of recipes we use it in.

The true "original" is the UK version, which contains malt vinegar and spirit vinegar. This product is the US version, which contains distilled white vinegar instead. I've compared both versions side by side and found that it's even possible to _smell_ the difference. As you may well imagine, the difference in taste is considerable.Please note that this issue is entirely separate from the matter of the high-fructose corn syrup mentioned in so many other reviews. The US version no longer contains HFCS, but it's still not the "original" -- and it's not as pungent and strongly flavored as the true UK original.Use the UK version (with the orange label) and accept no substitutes. Especially when they lie and claim to be "original."

When I grew up in south Mississippi, we did not have all the seasonings I use now that I have become a Louisiana spice mouth.  We simply had the basics -- salt, pepper, a little sugar, vanilla, nutmeg, lemon juice, garlic, ketchup, mustard, homemade pepper sauce, and Lea & Perrins. For us bought sauce in a bottle was only Lea & Perrins.  Nothing else could be substituted. Less expensive brands never tasted quite right to us.We lovingly placed that bottle with its brown paper cover on the cabinet shelf.  I suppose it would have been fine to remove the paper, but with reverence we kept our "wooster" covered.On the special occasions when we ate grilled steak, we thought there was only one steak sauce - Lea & Perrins.  I have no reason to promote this product.  My comments are not in any way solicited.  I simply want to tell you what tastes good.When I married at a young age, my mother-in-law, Mary, led me into a new adventure of cooking and tasting the wonderful flavors of food.  She cooked the best okra and tomatoes in the world.  Like my family, she could use only one brand of Worcestershire sauce.Mom's Okra And Tomatoes2 medium onionsSome olive oil16 ounces frozen sliced okra2 small cans or 1 large can tomatoes2-3 teaspoons Lea & Perrins Worchestershire sauce cup Heinz ketchup1 teaspoon sugar or equivalent amount of sugar substitute2 teaspoons vinegarSeasoned saltBlack pepperCrushed red pepperChop the onions into big chunks. Sauté them in a little olive oil. If the tomatoes are whole, slice them. Add the tomatoes, okra, Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, sugar, and vinegar to the onions and olive oil.Bring the mix to a boil and season to taste with seasoned salt, black pepper, and crushed red pepper. Don't add extra sugar, which would ruin the taste; do add extra ketchup if you need it.Simmer the mixture until the okra is cooked enough. It should be firm, not mushy. Check the seasoning and add more as needed, but don't get started eating it. You won't have enough to serve.NOTE:  This recipe is copied from my cookbook, Flavored with Love: Mary Lou's Family and Friends Can Cook
summary: The One and Only Worcestershire Sauce Used by My Family for Generations

reviewText: HFCS - High Fructose Corn Syrup - is processed differently by your body than sugar and is considerably worse. Do not trust the propaganda of the subsidized Big Ag in America for your truthful info on food.You can get an organic version from Annie's.
summary: High Fructose Corn Syrup - NOT THE ORIGINAL

reviewText: Bought a bottle while in Key West and it lasted in the fridge for one year before I used it all up.... excellent product at a fantastic price
For the price I think this is a great deal. We buy those little green lime looking ones all the time and this is going to last a while! Very good lime flavor and have no complaints at all about it.

One of the advantages of living in Florida is that this stuff is cheap, andavailable just about everywhere for under $3.I see some complaints....OK well then tell me where you find REAL Key Limejuice commercially? Awright, now that we've solved that issue, this is a prettyversatile lime juice that works well in marinades, drinks and even Bloody Marys.But the icebox pies this stuff makes is just addictive.
summary: Crucial for homemade Key Lime Pie.

reviewText: Not all key lime juice is created equal. This one is REALLY awesome. It doesn't taste fake because it's not and it makes THE BEST key lime pie.  You won't be disspointed!
summary: Blue ribbon key lime pie here you come!

reviewText: I use this for cooking, flavoring, margaritas and key lime pies - this stuff is amazing - tastes fresh and can't be compared with other lime juices. This is the real deal. Flavorful, biting and no-one can tell the difference between this and real limes - especially with things like margaritas and key lime pie!
-makes a great glass of lime flavored Luzianne green iced tea.-taste is much more intense than RealLime juice.-used it to make one key lime pie and everybody loved it.
the title of this product is misleading, because you are NOT buying 100% key lime juice, but some mystery blend of juices.
summary: the bottle says 'key WEST lime juice', it is not pure key lime juice

reviewText: The best Key Lime Juice if you can't get them fresh.  I used it for pie and ice cream and the flavor was great.  Too bad our stores here in VT do not carry it, so I am forced to pay this primo price online.
summary: exactly what you think it is

reviewText: My brother lived in Key West for about a decade and we would visit him a couple times each year. On those trips we made sure to have local specialties like conch fritters and, of course, key lime pie.Over the years we have tried to replicate the great taste of those local pies, and have found that the Nellie & Joes 100% Key Lime Juice comes very close, while this N & J Key West Lime Juice is a very close second. Either product makes your Key Lime Pie taste as close to those traditional pies as one can get without buying the key limes and squeezing them yourself!Our favorite recipe is fairly traditional; we just like to top off each serving with two things -- a dollop of vanilla whipped cream (1/4 pint whipping cream, one tablespoon sugar and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla, all whipped together fairly stiffly) and a light coating of lime zest. It not only tastes great but it looks good too.Give Nellie and Joe's a try if you are in the mood for a delicious key lime pie.Go for it.
summary: Nellie and Joe's Key West Lime Juice - Great substitute for fresh squeezed (and much easier too)

reviewText: The bottle says in small letters to refrigerate "after purchase".  What kind of c..p is that?  The carton (yes, I was stupid enough to buy a dozen, does NOT say that.  Well, the contents turned brown and we did not dare to use them.Shame on you, Nellie and Joe!  Never, ever again will we buy from you.
Great lime juice. Authentic flavor.  Stores well.  This product offers a lot of flexibility where real lime juice is required.

We lived in Miami in the 80's and this was on the store shelves there but I could never get it when I traveled somewhere else. Now it is!Do not use plain old lime juice when a recipe calls for Key Lime, it is not the same. Nellie & Joe's is the best.Here's the best recipe ever for Key Lime Pie:2 egg yolks, beaten1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk1/2 cup key lime juicePour into a graham cracker crustThe recipe doesn't even call for baking it. The lime juice thickens the milk and eggs. But I do bake it for about 10-15 minutes at 350 just to be sure.Comment

This creamer is EXCELLENT!  Yeah, I know it's not as healty as real cream or half and half but i don't care.  It's absolutely DELICIOUS and I cut corners in so many other areas of my eating habits that I don't feel bad.I would buy this in a grocery or big box store though.  I've never paid more than $4.49 for it and I squabbled at that price.  I usually pay $3.99-$4.24; sometimes on sale for less than $3.  It's absolutely ridiculous, highway robbery that the vendors on this site have the nerve to charge $8+ with additional cost for shipping.  Don't they know their greed kills sales?  Outrageous.
summary: Excellent taste, Don't pay more than $4 something for it though.

reviewText: I love this stuff.  Goes great in coffee, oatmeal, homemade soy/almond/hemp milk.  It sweetens whatever you put it in, so it isn't just a creamer.  It also is your sweetener.  Check the ingredients; if you are a Stevia, Splenda or organic sugar fiend, good luck.

I try to eliminate sugar from my diet in any way that I can and I keep this one on my pantry shelf!  This is a tasty chocolate addition to your coffee, but like others have said, expect a "hot chocolate" type of flavor, rather than a mocha.  This, when combined with a packet of stevia in my coffee, is perfect for me.  It is also one of the few powder creamers that I can use at its recommended serving size and feel satisfied.  This is a keeper!

I like my coffee creamy not to the point where it turns white but just enough to lighten the darkness so that the dark liquid starts to look like caramel in color. Coffee mate is perfect because it does the job very effectively and it has a nice taste as well.  This is a good option for the lactose intolerant.The subscribe and save option brings the price down to 5.35, which I think is probably the cheapest for a container this size.There are certain things that I feel should be considered for people drinking this stuff.....One teaspoon has about 10 calories so if you are like me who puts a table spoon that is 30 calories. I mentioned this because I drink 3 cups of coffee every day- the calories can add up pretty fast.Coffee mate also contains trans fats - one of the ingredients is Mono- and diglycerides - these are agents used to extend the shelf life and we also see them in foods which have trans fats, which have been bad. It also contains hydrogenated fats which is linked to heart disease. Incidentally the European version is sold without this ingredient.Enjoy responsibly.Source: http://www.organicauthority.com/health/what-the-heck-is-coffee-mate-creamer.htmlhttp://www.cspinet.org/

I could eat this by the SPOONFUL!  This is unbelievable and will blow your mind.  I sprinkle this powder onto my oatmeal for an extra creamy (yet low calorie taste) as well as putting it into my coffee or even on my toast.  I highly recommend it and wish more flavors would come out in the sugar free like this one.

You're probably familiar with this product, right? So all I can tell you is that it's just like what you buy wherever you shop, except that there are six factory packed containers, like when you buy water, shipped to you instead of your normal purchase.I'll also say that my local Target quit stocking their cheaper Market Pantry brand and so purchasing this way saves me money. If I run out, I don't have to drive to the store just for this and that also saves me money. I've found myself ordering many items like this lately so I make fewer trips to the store.So I'm shopping for many common household items and if the price is the same or less, I have it delivered and save the cost of driving and save buying bulk. Recommended.
huuuuge! I will have coffee mate for the whole year! great product fabulous price. I didn't expect it to be so big.

We use Coffee-mate in our coco, so we always have some on hand.  While browsing Amazon for another item, I happened to see this.The pros:+ Costs less than buying the smaller size locally & it includes free shipping!The cons:- None, other than the container is "HUGE"! :)
summary: This is one HUGE can of Coffee-mate!

reviewText: I enjoy drinking my coffee more now since I have the real thing. Thanks for the super low price. I hope to find some neat bargains like this again soon.

I normally use cream in my coffee, but when I want a sweet change of pace I use this creamer. It has just the right amount of sweetnest per creamer ratio. The taste is so smooth and the aroma drives everyone around me crazy - it smells awesome and so yummy. TOo bad they don't sell it locally but I am so thankful I can get it on Amazon.
I cant stand milk, this powder coffee mate is great. I love my coffee in the morning using this product. Coffee mate is so good, I got 2 big cans,,,,,,,great for coffee.

I've never tasted a creamer I've enjoyed as much as the Coffee-Mate Vanilla Caramel Creamer. It makes every cup of coffee I drink seem like a special treat. It doesn't take a whole lot of this creamer to get a whole lot of flavor. I love it!

Bought it for a guest.Tried it, even after reading the label.Horrible.I mean partially hydrogenated oils AND corn syrup? Generally people who purchase a Sugar Free item expect the item to be at least someone healthier than the alternative. Regardless of the reasoning behind sugar avoidance, this actually has corn syrup, which is sugar! Making the serving size small enough so that all of the "negative nutritional information" does not need to be registered on the label doesn't mean that the average person who  is consuming more than 2 teaspoons of this can multiply what is on the label and get anything in the ballpark as far as accurate on the nutritional information.It is just sad... and I hope my friend stops using this. Real cream and cocoa would be much much yummier and healthier!
summary: Best place for this is in the trash.  Real cream and cocoa would be much much yummier and healthier!

reviewText: I love this creamer.  It gives your coffee a nice chocolate flavor.  I can't find it in any stores around me, so it was a great find on amazon.  Some of my friends think it has a weird "artificial sweetener" taste, but I do not feel that way.
Best taste, creamiest texture of all the powder creamers I've tried. I like to buy 3-packs here on Amazon for home, and the packets available on Amazon for work.

It is easy to use.  Just shake a little into your black coffee.  This creates a delicious drink without making your hot coffee cold!  The sugar-free is both low calorie and safe for diabetics when used in moderation.  It came quickly from Amazon.com.  This product is not so easily found in supermarkets.
A great deal and the best way for me to order it. I will be ordering it regularly from now on.
Not as good as it used to be. But still very good in coffee.  I am sure they had to change the formula for some stupid reason or another.

When my cousin was visitng from Europe....she fell crazy in love with Coffee-mate.They don't have it where she lives...so I surprised her by sending her this huge can...and when she receive it,.she called me and acted like she won the lottery!As long as they carry this huge container of it..I'll keep sending it to her.
I have tasted a creamer I like better but this is very good.  I have bought this in the past due to the packaging and the size choices.  It's a very good creamer, just not MY favorite.

I have to order a case of six of these at least every month at our office.  It is a very nice flavor, easily mixes with hot coffee and being sugar-free is just a bonus.  Coffee-Mate has got this formulation down to a science.  Highly recommend.
This has always been my favorite coffee creamer since I started drinking coffee years ago, and Im well into my adult years. Im hooked for life!!

I really like these flavored creamers from Coffee mate.  I do think this is one of my favorites, I have no had the sugar free before but wanted to try it as I always put a packet of Truvia in my coffee to sweetin it up a little.  Very good taist to any coffee.

I find myself craving sweets right now.  But they don't fit into my diet.  This stuff isn't calorie free but a little goes a long way and drinking coffee helps me suppress my appetite.  This stuff makes me feel like I'm drinking hot chocolate so it also keeps me from eating things like ice cream.  I'd buy it again for sure

commenting on coffee-mate is not at issue here.  it does not clump, dissolves instantly and makes your cafe taste good. what i like about and and buy for is the size.  we are a coffee family and this 56oz size last a month.  it is not used for hot cocoa or tea so i can't comment on that.  all up all size containers to eqal 56ozs and it comes to a heck of a lot of money at the supermarket.  this canister is the right size and price for me.  will keep coming back.

Whether you make a pot of regular for several people, or just for yourself, having flavored coffee mate makes it easy to change up that flavor. I love the chocolate alone, or even adding in peppermint or almond to it. Blends in great and smooth.
This is a terrible price $ 8.69 I can get this at my  little home town store for $ 7.49 which is still too high when you can get this at Walmart for $ 5.49....
I liek french vanilla creamer, and this is quite tasty.  It comes in a multi packs which means I don't run out often.

I bought this because my kids were doing a science project and needed it. We bought a lot though so I gave it away to friends and mailed some to Afghanistan to my husband. No complaints so far. In fact, I was quite impressed at how well it mails. It was sent in a package of other foods to Afghanistan. We got the box back a month later. It looked like it had been run over by truck, a train and a semi, was shot with a BB gun, dumped from the top of a building and then taped back together. I'm not even kidding. We had to rebox everything. The cans held up fine and so did the coffee-mate creamer packages. But anything else that was plastic or wrapped in a packaging box had fallen apart or was ripped... or a few things that were shot with shrapnel.I highly suggest this for flavor AND for sending to our troops. Nothing else in the box will make it (except the cans) but they'll have delicious coffee because it will make it JUST FINE!

My coworker had the Vanilla Caramel Sugar-Free Coffee-mate and we went through the two bottles and needed more.  Like regular Coffee-mate, this is creamy in the coffee.  However, it adds a nice Vanilla Caramel flavor without the added sugar of other flavored creamers.  As with most sugar-free items, it makes up for the lake of sugar with extra fat calories.  At 30 calories per tablespoon, it is not for dieters.  However, I rarely use a tablespoon, a teaspoon is usually enough for the occasional flavor boost to my morning cup of java.

CoffeeMate creamers consistently have great flavor and far outshine their competitors (in my book)!!! They are a little pricier sometimes, but they blen easily without a lot of clumping and do not seem to leave a bad after-taste!
summary: CoffeeMate creamers consistently have great flavor

reviewerName: eastbayrae "Sometimes you have to club a seal...
reviewText: I am on a low-cal diet so this product appealed to me since I drink coffee. The flavor is great, very chocolatey to say the least. It turns most any coffee into hot chocolate!

At the very least 4 Stars! Once the right amounts are figured out this coffee creamer is every bit as good as the fine amazon reviewers had mentioned. Might sound like I am a chemistry wannabee but it is imperative that the right amount is used, for too much is not half as good and too little also spells failure in the taste department. It probably deserves half a star more but the doctor is still out so for now 4 Stars, which is above average, stands in solid grounds. One thing I have found out that depending on the coffee I use (I use ground coffee in an old gevalia, cheap monkey that I am) the ratio changes. But once the right amounts are used this product elevates itself. Since sugar was a concern it is good that the free enterprisers of this beautiful country are seeing fit to consider the needs of those that wanna say bye bye to sugar (I use to go to the movies with a couple of pounds of See's Candies and with one or two avid chocolate lovers besides me, finish the whole thing! So is no wonder I seek sugar free as a norm) and cut down drastically on such a seriously unhealthy consumption. 4.5 Stars for Coffee-Mate Vanilla Caramel, Sugar-Free Powdered Coffee Creamer, 10.2-Ounce Units (Pack of 6). Yes!
This is very good coffee creamer. I have seen the other flavors in the store sugar free, but not chocolate.

Be warned: although the FDA label claims "0g trans fat" the ingredients tell a different story, as "partially hydrogenated coconut or palm kernel" is the first ingredient listed. This is a poison that is now outlawed in New York restaurants, and if you are careful about what you eat you want to make sure you stay away from this.As it turns out, they can claim "0g trans fat" because the content is less than 1g per serving, but it's a technicality: the product contains a significant amount of trans fat.Obviously, you're not going to drop dead from using a teaspoon in your coffee once, but regular, prolonged use is detrimental to your health. You're better off staying away altogether anyway, and you may want to do what I did and contact Nestle consumer service to complain about their deceptive practices. This product can and should be made with healthier ingredients.

The liquid in the grocery stores keeps climbing in price, the powder lasts longer, and in comparison to taste, they both come out as winners. However, there are disadvantages for me, with the Liquid Verses the Powder. I use much more of the Liquid per serving, sometimes the grocery stores only carry small containers with Increased prices, and I'm not comfortable placing it in my car that heats up like an oven during summer in AZ.I love the idea of ordering a pack of 6, and I found the price to be excellent for this purchase. I will be ordering again, before I run out. Highly recommended!

It just dawned on me that I like coffee mate in my coffee so I thought about using it as a milk substitute for my cereals.  I use just 1 teaspoon and mix with little hot water to get the powder dissolved and then put in ice cold water to make milk for my cereals.  Just 1 tsp makes the milk so creamy and delicious. Vanilla caramel flavored Coffee-mate makes for an excellent milk or cream substitute for people who want a cup of coffee, cocoa or even tea when they don't have access to a refrigerator to keep milk or cream on hand. Coffee-mate therefore comes in very handy in many workplaces, naturally, but it adds so much extra flavor to your beverage that you just might wind up using this instead of milk or cream even if you do have access to a refrigerator with milk or cream in it!Coffee-mate is easy enough to use--just add three or four teaspoons full of it into your cup of coffee, tea or whatever beverage you want to sweeten with this wonderful vanilla caramel taste.I would use vanilla caramel Coffee-mate by the expiration date on the bottom of the plastic container; and the container gives you simple instructions for turning this powdery substance into liquid just in case you want to do that.The nutrition label claims it contains no trans-fats but I notice that it contains partially hydrogenated oils. This may indicate that the trans-fats in Coffee-mate are present but very negligible.Have further questions? Just give them a call or surf on over to their website. They provide you with the website address and a toll free number if you have more questions about vanilla caramel flavored Coffee-mate.Overall, vanilla caramel flavored Coffee-mate provides an excellent, sweet tasting substitute for milk, cream and anything else that contains lactose. You may want to use it to sweeten your coffee, tea or cocoa even if you have access to fresh refrigerated milk that you can use. It's THAT good.Enjoy!!!

reviewText: I'm not sure what to make of Molasses since I'm not a Molasses drinker.  I bought a bottle of this, because it's cheaper than Maple syrup.  At first try, I found it odd, thick and dark, like some burnt-up honey.  I have only eaten it with wheat buns and it isn't bad but, nor is it particularly good either, also, I soaked a glazed doughnut in it and felt awful afterwards.  Go easy on it, since it'll wreak havoc on your egestion process.Up next I want to try it on Vanilla ice cream and pancakes.I won't be buying Molasses again since I got sick by trying it.  It just isn't for me, the product is fine though.

It's been around longer than I can remember, and it's quality is consistent.  I consider it the best molasses on the market.  I would not have bought it via Amazon, but for some bizarre reason I cannot find it locally.  Shipping was fast and efficient.
summary: Quick shipping, Grandma's Molasses - what needs to be said?

reviewText: Prices vary considerably on this brand, check before purchase.This is  NOT organic, it is conventional so a huge difference in the nutritional values organic vs. none organic. These are NOT grade A molasses either. One tbsp of organic molasses offers me 20% iron, 10% calcium which is more than milk's calcium since milk's calcium is fortified, molasses calcium is not, 20% potassium, 8% magnesium, and 10% copper. With 40~60 calories and 10~13gr sugar, I only use one tbsp a day in my green tea daily as well as when I am in need of fast energy, without any additives. Potassium stops cramps and this is a life saver. Once opened, I place some in a smaller tightly sealed container and keep it in refrigerator, refill as needed, but consume it in less than 6 months. I am into sports, diet and nutrition and blackstrap molasses' nutritional value varies depending on the quality of the sugar cane or beets from which it was extracted. For that reason organic and brand is extremely important to me. Honey loses its medicinal value when added to tea but since molasses is a by-product which is heated during the production so further heat does not impact the nutritional value. With all that said, you will still need to get used to the taste since the taste is somewhere around bitter, beet juice and changes the taste of the tea. Bravo.

Not only is Grandma's Molasses a classic, but it's gluten-free naturally making it a must have for any Celiac's pantry. This is also one of those products that a non-Celiac can enjoy as well making it a great buy.

special note:  This is a review of the product, not the offered price.I don't use a lot of molasses in my cooking but when I bake ginger snaps I love that the recipe I have calls for 1/4cup of molasses.  Why?  Because molasses have a lot of iron.  4% of the daily requirement per 1 tablespoon of Grandma's.  Not a fantastic amount per cookie, but every little bit helps with toddlers and growing big kids.That said, you can imagine my surprise when my husband brought home another brand -Golding Farms- where the iron percentage is double (2X!) Grandma's.Something to consider.Pam Teemom/foodieps--this is the 2nd best molasses advice I ever got --first is don't use sulpured:  Use a spray oil on measuring cups.  That way the molasses just slips out and you get all the goodness.

I use Molasses for making pumpernickel bread, so wanted to find a natural molasses to use in the bread. I was pleased to see that Grandma's original molasses has no preservatives or additives, the Ingredients label reads simply "Unsulphured Molasses". So, the product passes my first test of no ingredients that I can not pronounce. Now for the second test . . . I opened the jar and was pleased to immediately detect a deep rich aroma. Then I tasted it, and it was delicious. Deep rich flavor, and the product is very thick as you would want.Healthy, flavorful, thick and rich . . . what more could you ask for? Five Stars!

I'll likely try to buy this local next time, because it is pricey, but the cost is worth it.  I used to think all molasses was the same, but, like honey or peanut butter, there is a difference.  this has the best taste.  I use it for my shake (handful of almonds, an apple or banana, flaxseed, tablespoon of molasses and some whey protein powder and a little soy milk) for an after-workout snack, but plan to try it in cooked dishes as well.
summary: A bit pricey, but awesome flavor

reviewText: These remind me of my childhood, when Nabisco Ritz Crackers were a favorite treat...packaged well, fresh tasting and high quality... just what I was craving...

Ritz crackers by Nabisco have always been one of my favorites. I remember eating them in kindergarten at snack time--I always wanted a couple extra! These crackers have stood the test of time because they are very tasty and great to eat as a snack.Ritz crackers are rather low in fat (4.5 grams of fat per serving) and they have almost no carbohydrates. They are cholesterol free as well--hooray! In addition, this product is kosher if that matters to you. The nutrition label indicates that there are no trans-fats but I did notice a bit of partially hydrogenated ingredients on the label--it may be that the amount of trans-fats this generates is negligible.Ritz crackers can be eaten by themselves but feel free to get creative! They can help out when it's time to make snacks for company. Just put a bit of cheese (or melted cheese and ham) on them and you're serving up great appetizers or snack in no time! They go great with a little bit of butter on them, too.Overall, Ritz crackers really hit the spot when I crave a snack before bedtime. I simply take a slice of two of regular cheese and place little bits of the cheese on top of the crackers and with a small beverage it's awesome!I highly recommend Ritz crackers as one of the healthier crackers that will satisfy you, too. Great!

What is to say about any of the products McCormick sells. Here is one, true flavor of what is listed on the label.
Been using it for a while and it is a high quality spice. This amount should last a long time and a little goes a long way.

Lifetime supply of tasty, yummy garlic powder...  No matter the cuisine, this is an excellent value.  Non-clumped on arrival and has a nice garlicy taste.  If you're cooking with garlic, this is the choice for you.

I have accidentally used the completely open spoon side rather than the sprinkle side now twice.  It's kind of annoying because lots of garlic pours out quickly.  I eventually taped that side down so I wouldn't have any more unhappy accidents.The product taste is fine for cooking (I mean, it's powdered garlic we're talking about here not fresh - there is going to be a difference in flavor for sure).The size is very large and you may want to consider pouring this into a smaller container if you're using it a lot or have a limited spice area.
summary: Wish it didn't have the pouring side!

reviewText: TASTE: Okay. Tasted more flavorful brands, but acceptable.APPLICATION: It's true that this is finely ground. However, being careful and keeping the container close to the plate/pan , you can apply it in your desired amount without any mess.
Its always a good sign when you can see your seasonings without a microscope. This Garlic Pepper is wonderful and a great seasoning to mix with garlic salt, especially for pastas!
summary: Good thick pepper with more than a hint of Garlic.

reviewText: This McCormick Onion Powder is very good. I prefer using this over all other Onion powders because the other spices included within it helps by giving food a great flavor. I hope to continue ordering and using this spice regularly. It really can be used in almost any dish!

Really tasty, but it's a very small bottle. I season a lot of meat with onion powder, so the next time I ordered a bigger size of a different brand. If this were larger and the price was right, I'd order it again.If you only use it occasionally, it's a good choice.

The size and the flavor and the convenience of online ordering are so worth the price. This is so good and tenderizing when sprinkled on a center cut of petite sirloin and sautéed in my electric frying pan.
Great size, and a nice Garlic powder.  I will order this garlic powder again.  Always cooking here in Afghanistan. Gotta love it.
Put down the salt shaker and grab alternatives like this Lemon Pepper with Garlic and Onion.  It tastes great on meat, veggies and salads.

This tastes great for food, pizza, etc. but the smell is very potent even with the jar lid on.  I have mine triple bagged with small Ziploc bags and that contains it.  Just to be sure, I keep it in the bottom drawer with onions and raw veggies and have never had a problem.  I do love it and recommend it, just be careful and of course a littel goes a long way.
summary: Great taste but super strong smell  - use 3 Ziplocs

reviewText: Great flavor from such a small container! Easy to use 'sprinkle' top with flip cap and small enought to 'hide.' Perfect for salads, pasta and so much more.I dislike 'real' shopping and Amazon prime has beeen a good choice for me. The reviews certainly give one a range of opinions and I do find that helpful. I try to add a comment for others  . . . thank you for adding your reviews!
I LOVE this garlic salt. I use it on a lot of dishes i cook. My husband rolls his eyes when i reach for it :)
This has been great in seasoning meats and in eggs. My boyfriend noticed it as well in my cooking. When you can't use fresh onions and herbs, this is a great alternative.
Love the taste it gives when seasoning chicken and also sprinkled on veggies and yes those yummy maswhed potatoes,  Not a real garlic taste or lemon pepper taste but a great taste to me,

WOW...I LIKE THIS IN THE KITCHEN I COOK DAILY LIKE A GOOD COOK AND JUST A TAD OF THIS ON CHICKEN OR SALAD OR ANY FOOD PRETTY MUCH WITH GIVE IT SOME FLAVOR...ITS A GOOD DEAL A GOOD PRICE AND SHIPS RIGHT TO YOU...GET THIS
use in almost all my cooking, good rpice, quality product a bit different than ordinary onion powser. also comes in garlic powder.

This California Style Garlic Pepper is the seasoning I use most in the kitchen.  We eat very healthy with little to no salt, so need a spice to bring out the flavor of the foods.We found this spice and I use it in many dishes I cook.  For example, make roasted sweet potatoes instead of white potato french fries and I put a little olive oil, cumin and this garlic pepper on them.  Wow - don't miss french fries at all.Make a lot of chicken and vegetable and beef and vegetable soups.  I put some heaping tablespoons of this garlic pepper on them and it adds some great flavor.Love to saute chicken breasts on both sides for 5 minutes in olive oil and remove from pan; then saute onions and mushrooms in the olive oil with chicken drippings, add the chicken back in once the onions and mushrooms have browned and let the juices soak into chicken.  Add a tablespoon or more of this garlic pepper, some sliced zucchini and red pepper and mix gently.  Eat as is or cook some brown rice on the side and pour cooked rice into pan.  Very healthy meal of whole grains, lowfat protein, veggies and this spice.  Yum!I've been making my own balsamic vinaigrette dressing with extra-virgin olive oil, balsamic vinaigrette and this spice added in for extra flavor.  Very tasty and healthy.It's good on burgers and steak, too.  I would imagine it tastes good on most cooked meats.  It's my go-to spice for soups, salads, meats, veggies, gravy and rice.Right now I have the sweet potatoes roasting with this garlic pepper adorning them.  It makes healthy and tasty food taste even better.
summary: Delicious Seasoning for Soups, Veggies, Burgers, Chicken, Roasts, Salad Dressing and More

reviewText: I haven't used this mixture a lot yet, just on some wheat Italian Bread and it came out delicous. I also made a tomato sauce with it and it was just as good, I didn't use a lot just a few pinches and that seemed sufficient give it a zesty flavor. Will try more recipes with it!
Cheaper then buying in the stores!  Very good quality! You can always depend on McComrick! Stock up for the Summer BBQ's for the best prices!!
Nice! I like to add this garlic powder with parsley when cooking seafood especially shrimps, meat and stir frying vegetables.
I love this garlic powder with parsley. It arrived quickly, was well-packaged and is fresh. Use it as you would any garlic powder in your cooking. I will buy this again.

This garlic powder is good as far as garlic powders go. The blend makes quick work of adding flavor to a dish. If an intense onion flavor is preferred, this is not for you. Anyone new to cooking, will especially appreciate the blend for seasoning meats and vegetables.

I'm a bit of a hardcore chilehead, and I've tried many hot sauces; most are far hotter than Cholula's original.  But Cholula's original, while mild by my standards is an exceptionally great tasting hot sauce.  And my 8 year old son also agrees, so I make sure to keep some in stock for him too even if I'm using something much hotter.This is probably the best hot sauce that you can buy in a supermarket.

"Hey, just because this is a highly recognized, readily available brand doesn't mean it doesn't deliver the goods" according to Scott Roberts. Who is Scott Roberts? I didn't have a clue until a recent NPR show. It turns out that he is the unofficial head of the chili-heads, the hot sauce movement.On my own, I've been taste testing hot sauces, unaware of Roberts or an entire movement of "chili-heads". I've purchased about 40 hot sauces and began taste testing them - day after day - week after week - writing up notes. (Everyone needs a hobby)What I found is Cholula is one of the best and it is in my top tier! BTW: make sure you DON'T purchase one of the Cholula variants that add lime or garlic or chipotle to the mix - get the "Original".Taste: I'd call this sauce low to medium heat. You'll need a few heavy drops for a Bloody Mary and more for a family sized dish. But it is not so hot that a few extra drops will ruin a dish. It has a nice blend of tastes and as noted, low to medium heat. There is a bit of sweetness, some vinegar and overall this blend is quite good. However, unless you have taste tested a number of different hot sauces you may not appreciate how good this one is. It simply does its job nicely, adds some heat to a dish without adding any off-tastes. If you have taste tested a number of hot sauces you will detect some vinegar but no where near the overpowering presence of this stuff which ruins so many other hot sauces.There are a dizzying array of hot sauces available on the internet but most are difficult to find and expensive to purchase (given shipping costs). This sauce is readily available not just here on Amazon but also in your local grocery store too. That fact alone should encourage you to try it.My other four favorites are: the often recommended Huy Dong -  Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce (readily available on Amazon and in stores). Keep in mind  - it is MUCH hotter with a hint of garlic and no vinegar (a plus in my book). Next is Huichol Hot Sauce (hard to find but similar -- yet better - than Cholula), Tabasco's Chipotle (also fairly mild with the rich smoked taste of the Chipotle pepper) and finally El Yucatan Jalapeno Hot Sauce.ADVISORY: This sauce does its job quite nicely which is to add some heat to any dish. Does it magically make a mediocre dish better. No! What it does do is add some heat without introducing any off -tastes. Now, to many, that may seem to be "a given" but the truth is very few hot sauces actually do that.One last tip -  this sauce is sold in a 12 oz and a much larger size and these larger sizes are often the far better buy!And a final word of Warning: Watch out for sellers that get to the top of Amazon's sellers list by offering a low product cost and then make up for this with high shipping charges on a per bottle basis (regardless of how many bottles you order at one time). Check your shipping costs just prior to confirming your order. They may be much higher than you were lead to believe, even if the seller publishes a shipping chart.
summary: One of the Best. Low/Medium heat - great blend. Readily available and Top Rated

reviewText: ran into this at the local (new) Mexican restaurant the other day; very nice flavor for almost anything without burning out the taste buds; only strange thing was it shipped from London (England); but as long as shipping was free who cares

There is an authenticity in this hot sauce when paired with true Mexican cuisine. For the record the cuisine with which I am most familiar is Baja, but I have been served this sauce in restaurants all over the US, as well as some of the Mexican border towns.True, it is not very spicy. What it is, though, is flavorful. Also, unlike Tabasco, peppers dominate the flavor instead of vinegar. But the best thing is how it manages to enhance any dish from seafood to soups and main courses.I mentioned that this is not very spicy - that is a relative statement. One person's spicy is another person's bland. This is not as spicy as Tabasco, but is a little spicier than a pickled jalapeno pepper. If you want truly spicy sauce with a good flavor you will probably have to try an Asian sauce likeABC Indonesian Extra Hot Chili Sauce - Sambal Extra Pedasor a North African/Mediterranean sauce likeHarissa Paste. You will get the heat and flavor with those, but you will lose that ineffable flavoring that is truly a flavor of Mexico.The bottom line is if you love Mexican cuisine this sauce brings out the best in any dish with which you would use a hot sauce. It may not be the spiciest, but to my palate it's the best.
summary: I would not think of enjoying Mexican cuisine without this nearby

reviewText: For years, I have used that other hot sauce that is in every supermarket. That one has a lot of spice, but not much flavor. Then I discovered Cholula in a restaurant in Colorado.Cholula Hot Sauce is in a different class. It is hot, but has quite good flavor. I have found that it can be used to add spice to tomato juice. It also goes well on my home-made guacamole and enchiladas.
This is pretty much a powder. If you like it like that then get this for sure. Its a big bottle too which is awesome. It should last us awhile.
I prefer this brand over all others!  It's always fresh and usually cheaper than grocery-store pepper (and always better)!  Thank you for offering this, Amazon!

This is my favorite pepper because of the pungent flavor . . . add to just about anything you enjoy eating. The plastic bottle is easy to use and 'sprinkles' evenly.I do not like 'real' shopping so Amazon prime is a great choice for me!
Tastes good with pretty strong aroma..would prefer peppercorns..For single people its ok.Does not mention origin of pepper or expiry date

I don't know what the deal is but these small bottles don't taste good.The Larger size is a much better option.You can always fill the small container whenneeded.Got a 18oz from Amazon and it has much better flavor.
Laced with HFCS and no real flavor.  Outside of using this to maximum a subscribe and save discount, I have no idea why anyone would buy this.

This is a typical bbq sauce you find in stores... What I mean is, there is no flavor difference between kraft ones... Heck, this tastes just like bulls eye branded one. It's not a bad thing, but you shouldn't expect a nuanced chipotle flavor.
This is really good in my opinion.  I love it on baked chicken.  My kids think it is too spicy.  They are 4 and 6.

reviewText: This BBQ sauce isn't bad. I've had better but for the price, I can't complain. Kraft Thick and Spicy has more of an artificial smoked flavor with a slight sweetness. It is thick, not runny which is good. It all comes down to personal preference. I prefer a more traditional BBQ sauce flavor - no smoke, more tangy & sweet.

Yummy BBQ Sauce and very thick. I wished they used organic sugar instead of High Fructose Corn Syrup. Since I don't use a lot, I like the excellent price which is less expensive than grocery store. Even more savings using Amazon's Subscribe and Save Program. Also, this product is in a plastic container, not a glass jar.

I always like Kraft's Barbecue sauce, as it is reasonably priced and tastes great. The only complaint is on its consistency; it tends to be runnier than the likes of Baby Ray's, but overall Kraft is a good value.

reviewText: love the taste.  I love bbq and i love honey mustard so when i stumbled upon this it was no brainer.  I put on everything.
I like most all Kraft products and this one is very good. I bought it at  bargain price making this a great value.
I don't care for the culinary trend toward hot, spicy foods. I'm very happy Kraft's sauce with a touch of honey. The price was great using Amazon's Subscribe and Save program. Yum!

reviewText: Sometimes it seems a little less sweet. I just add a Splenda when that happens. My favorite use for these is to mix a chocolate Boost drink and make a "frosty" that's big and filling and delicious. Makes a great meal replacement for me, as I am on a very low carb diet. I am a repeat purchaser and will continue to purchase as long as they keep the price down. They are a little pricey, but worth it.

I ran into one six pack of Canfield's diet fudge in the local market and grabbed it; hadn't seen a can for years since it is no longer carried in my town. The market had no idea how it got on their shelf but the computer checkout system was able to generate a price. Yum! And nostalgia. Market had no way to order more so I checked Amazon and they had it. Not only that, it was less than three dollars per six pack and that included shipping. I am now the proud owner of sixteen six packs but the supply is diminishing rapidly.I chill the cans in the refrigerator and pour in a glass to drink. I put some heavy whipping cream (not yet whipped) in the glass first. It takes the fudge drink from superb to stellar. Of course it plays havoc with the idea of diet.I hope you all order this product and lots of it. We need to convince Canfield's to get six packs back on the shelves of local stores so we can grab some whenever we need to. The price is higher than when I bought it so I'm going to have to pace myself. I can only hope that my re-acquired addiction doesn't drive me to the poor house.

delivered well packaged and protected in easy to store flat.  gread choc. flavor not leaving any after taste. contains aspartane......and NO sodium. I am pleasantly suprised because i thought diet rite cola's were the only diet soda without sodium.  WW friendly for sure and takes the edge off for the chocolate taste. i will also try a ice cream float using sugar free ice cream. the can says low cal. the nutritional info on the can shows zero calories and of course zero nutritional value. will purchase again if the price is right.  i was also suprised the contents was fizzy and not flat. this is my 3rd can since delivery and i am still pleased with the purchase. MY DAUGHTER JUST TRIED A CAN AND GIVES IT THUMBS UP AS WELL.I'M GOING TO TRY AN EXPERIMENT AFTER READING MULTIPLE COMMENTS ABOUT ADD HALF AND HALF ECT.  I'M GOING TO ADD SOME FAT FREE OR SUGAR FREE COOL WHIP TO A COUPLE OUNCES OF SODA, MIX IT UP, THEN ADD THE REST OF THE SODA TO THE GLASS...DONT KNOW HOW IT WILL TURN OUT LOL

I was quite nervous about trying this soda. Not only because of the flavor, (I'm one serious chocoholic) but also because of the price.I can report that I'm quite pleased with the soda and I will purchase more in the future.The best way I can think to describe the flavor here is a liquid Tootsie Roll with a touch of fizz. It's absolutely great for satisfying a sweet tooth, chocolate tooth or anything in between.  It goes without saying that this isn't the soda you'd want to wash down your meal with, but it's great for afterwards.And in case you were wondering, they make wonderful floats.

I have type 2 diabetes and love chocolate but it's very hard to find a  reasonably priced chocolate that I can eat without feeling like I'm slowly killing myself.Awhile back I remembered that Shasta brand used to make a chocolate soda when I was a kid that I really liked so I looked around and found this brand.I like the taste of this cold from the can but add a half a cup of no sugar added vanilla ice cream and it's really delicious! Better to me than a rootbeer float.It's beyond wonderful to be able to indulge and not have my blood glucose spike or feel like I have to slog through an extra half hour on the treadmill.So long as I can get my hands on this, I'm going to keep buying.
summary: Diabetic Friendly + Makes a GREAT Ice Cream Float

reviewText: My neighbor and I were talking about the good ol days and she mentioned how she would love to find Canfields Chocolate Diet Soda  After checking Amazon I found it  What a treat

Grew up in the midwest where I took getting this for granted. Now Amazon makes it possible. Great chocolate taste as always. Very authentic chocolate-nothing fake about the flavor. My husband had never heard of it and was very negative. Then very shocked at how good the flavor was. It works plain on ice. I use it for a ice cream float and also as a mixer for Medifast in a blender with ice. Perfect way to get a chocolate fix without the calories.

Wish I could say something more positive about this cereal because it's healthful and high in fiber.  Unfortunately, getting it down is quite a trial since the taste and texture result in something awful. Putting in something extra-raisins, butter, cinnamon-helps.
