reviewText: Like many of you I struggle with my weight.And like many of you I've been looking for a shortcut.Ephedra.Caffeine.Hoodia.Acai Berry.African Mango.Ephedra worked but was too dangerous and was outlawed.Caffeine only has a mild thermogenic effect and keeps me up at night.Hoodia doesn't work.Acai Berry may have great antioxidant properties but is for the most part useless for weight loss.African Mango is the same as Acai.There are many others but all are the same, all hype and no results.Then I was reading a new diet book from France called "The Dukan Diet".The diet itself is ok but I have no intention of following it.I've already lost 20 lbs since January 1st of 2011 and I have about 20 more to go before I reach my goal weight just through some common sense approaches to everyday eating.Meaning, cutting out the junk food and soda.In "The Dukan Diet" the author suggest you eat one tablespoon of raw oat bran before every meal.This made me curious so I decided to try it.Now I realize that Quaker oats are rolled oats not oat bran.The only difference between the two are that bran has a slightly better nutritional profile.That's it.So for my experiment I just got the darn rolled oats.And.........take a tablespoon right before a meal with a huge glass of water and........baam........greatly reduced appetite.Why bother with expensive and ineffective hoodia when every grocery store has Quaker Oats?You want something that suppresses your appetite then this is really the Holy Grail you've been looking for.Try it; you'll be very happy with the results.Not only will it suppress your appetite but it has fiber and other goodies your body needs.It also keeps your blood sugar down which aids with preventing weight gain.Guess what?Mom was right, oatmeal IS good for you.So far I'm down another five pounds.Yayyyyyyyy.This is one "supplement" I can definitely stick with for the long haul.I know a lot of folks don't like the taste but I just let it dissolve in my mouth and it tastes like granola.Not gross, quite tasty actually.I can't believe I'm giving something I wouldn't go near as a child my highest recommendation but I am.Maybe we do get smarter as we get older.Too bad we get fat, bald, and wrinkly too.Oh well, I suppose everything has to have a trade off.Quaker Oats?Tasty.Nutritious.Good for weight loss.Recommended.September 14, 2013.I stopped taking this a while back....it helps but I didn't feel the need to do it long term.I'm presently at 180 lbs and fairly happy with my body size now....maybe another ten lbs tops.

make oatmeal with water, add a package of frozen spinach, add skim milk near the end of the cooking processmake oatmeal with ground beef, a spoonful of mushroom base, a dash of teff and slices of crushed ginger, add milk near the end of the cooking processThis costs about $2.50 in a store.

reviewerName: Mary M. Marty "seeker of spiritual growth"

reviewText: These oats doesnt taste as good as i thought it would, but hopefully i will get used to them though...
It is a small can.  It takes 4 tablespoons in milk to make an 8 oz. glass and it has an unpleasant aftertaste.

This is very good and tasty Hot Chocolate Mix.  It needs milk to make it which makes it especially tasty.  Mixes well and was complemented upon by guest that drank it.  Recommend this brand to others who seek GREAT tasting hot chocolate mix.

If you want heaven in a cup, try the Chocolate Mocha.  Great coffee taste with a giant slam of chocolate.  The best chocolate mocha I've ever tried, hands down.  I make mine with whole milk, and the result is a decadent, creamy, chocolaty almost-dessert.BEST EVER!!!

I used to make a Mocha Café au Lait on the stove with milk, melted chocolate, coffee, sugar, and seasonings. It was a delicious flavorful alternative to equally delicious homemade hot cocoa for special occasions. I have never been satisfied with easy or "instant" methods of making plain hot cocoa. They just can't compete with the richness of heavy cream and melted chocolate. But my Mocha Café au Lait met its match in Ghirardelli's Chocolate Mocha. This is a wonderful powdered mix of chocolate, vanilla, and coffee.The instructions tell you to mix 3 tablespoons of Ghirardelli's Chocolate Mocha with 8 oz (1 cup) of milk, heat, and serve. I find that 2 tablespoons with 2/3 cup of milk fills the average cup or mug. And I always use half-and-half instead of milk. Topped with sweetened whipped cream, this makes a decadent, filling dessert that rivals homemade and restaurant beverages and is attractive enough to serve to guests. Serve with a spoon for those who like to eat the whipped cream before it all melts into the chocolate.Ghirardelli provides microwave and stovetop directions. The microwave instructions advise heating the milk for 1-1 1/2 minutes before adding the Chocolate Mocha mix. I don't think the 2-step process is necessary, but if you've ever tried to heat milk or half-and-half in a microwave, you know how quickly it can get out of hand. One second nothing is happening; the next second the milk has bubbled all over the floor of your oven, leaving little in the cup. If you want to heat the hot chocolate in the microwave, you can add the Chocolate Mocha mix before you heat the milk, but don't take your eyes off of it once you start heating. If you see any bubbles, stop the microwave immediately, stir the drink, and heat more as necessary. Keep doing that until it's hot enough for you.
summary: Quick, Easy and Among the Most Delicious Dessert Drinks.

reviewText: Maybe its me, this is the first Ghiradelli oocoa I purchased anywhere that tastes almost chalky, lacks sweetness and is an all around disappointment. Again this is within its selling deadline albeit on sale, taste is unpleasant and not suggested.

Yes, it is expensive for not a huge amount of product but the taste is GREAT.  I love hot chocolate and this one does not have overwhelming coffee taste for a mocha mix.  It is well balanced flavor, easily stirred in, and you do  not need nearly as much as package says to use.  Would buy again.
I will NOT go back to regular hot cocoa mix.  This is heavenly.  Worth the price.  Buy it and indulge.  ymmmmm.

reviewText: Had to get a refund from Amazon. Received the item with no outer seal on container, and the inner seal was loose and not intact on the jar as required by safety regulations.Not safe to eat for me as potentially exposed to contaminents or tampering with.

From time to time my wife brings home a jar of Nutella. I like it, but only on rare occasion. The flavor is just too overpowering for me and I tire of it quickly. My wife loves the stuff on bread (toast) or crackers and she eats it with her afternoon or evening tea. Nutella is awesome. I can't say anything else. Perfect on toasted bread. Perfect on toast. Perfect addition to mocha and hot chocolate. 'nuff said.Also perfect in brownies, cookies, cake, NUTELLA IN THE RAW.Perfect for the college student budget. Why? It can go with a lot of things... like strawberries and bananas! ICE CREAM.

I could eat it with a spoon, it's so good.Being partial to hazel nut chocolates. I love this delicious spread on toast.I put it on a bun and it's just like a pastry and a more natural one , free of chemicals.Highly recommended, you'll love it if you haven't tied it yet.

i'm  68 years old and had never tasted nutella but i got this jar the other day and wow.  it tastes like a big giant melted cadbury chocolate bar.  i have physically restrained myself.  i  dont know how to use.  putting chocolate on bread does not appeal to me.  maybe i'll  make cupcakes with  nutella filling .  this stuff is great. wish there was  low calorie or low fat nutella

reviewText: It's nutella! What more could you ask for. Tastes great. Product came just as described. I like the smaller jars because there is less chance of the nutella separating (I don't use it that often).

This product is made in Canada. The ingredients listed on the label are: "Sugar, palm oil, hazelnuts, cocoa, skim milk, reduced minerals whey (milk), lecithin as emulsifier (soy), vanillin, an artificial flavor."The label also states: "Made with over 50 hazelnuts per jar. Contains no artificial colors. Contains no artificial preservatives. Do not refrigerate or microwave."It contains the same calories as peanut butter, 100 calories per tablespoon. It has 5.5 g. fat, 11 g carbs, and 1.5 g protein per tablespoon.Though this product tastes good, it is not a health food, and it is quite expensive. A 13 oz. jar sells for around $4.00 in a supermarket.In addition, if you are interested in buying sustainable products, palm oil is associated with the slashing and burning of pristine rainforest. Virtually all of the palm oil used in the world is produced in nonsustainable ways in Indonesia and Malaysia.
summary: Quite tasty, but not particularly nutritious

reviewerName: Kimberly J. Karas "a New England mom"
reviewText: I am in love with this hazelnut spread made with skim milk and cocoa.  Grownups and kids both enjoy and it's a nice way to get picky eaters to consume whole grain breads.  Don't let the healthy breakfast commercials fool you, there is a ton of sugar in the recommended serving size.  My answer to that is that I don't indulge in the recommended serving size of two tablespoons.  You can get by with less and it's still a tasty way to start the day.  I am hooked on this stuff and my local market doesn't always have it in stock.  I went to two stores that didn't have it and resolved to buy it here on Amazon.  Big jar, twice the size of the tiny ones at my local stores.  It should last me a while but next time I'm ordering double jar package!

I know the description talks more about nuts, etc., but this stuff is actually seriously CHOCOLATE!  It's a creamy fudgy chocolate spread with a hazelnut flavor (think fudge spiked with hazelnut liqueur).  It's incredibly rich -- a little really goes a long way.  I usually just spread it on graham crackers for a wonderful indulgent treat.I'm hooked -- this will be in my pantry from now on.  (No refrigeration necessary -- how convenient is that?)

This stuff is addictive! And thankfully a little goes a long way. The calorie count is a bit high, but it doesn't take much to make anything taste good. A nice marriage of chocolate and hazelnut that has the consistency of frosting, but isn't over the top in tasting cloyingly sweet. Good for an occasional treat, but hard to resist!

After eating a sample portion at a local breakfast cafe I found Nutella fascinating. We live in the south and its now well known here. In fact our Piggly Wiggly refused to stock it so I found it here for a good deal. I have ordered several jars and it now is a 'must have' in our house nowadays.It arrives quickly in plastic, not glass jars. I have heard of it being sold in plastic jars but I don't mind at all. We spread it on toast at breakfast or anytime for a delicious snack. I found that dipping the Pringles Sticks in Nutella and a bit of a sweet/salt taste. We enjoy it with vanilla ice cream as a topping. We even made very simple Nutella cookies with an egg, flour, sugar, cream and milk. I suppose it can be used in any method.Please buy a jar if you've never had Nutella. We live in the Peanut State and because of so many recent peanut butters being recalled here because of Coli contamination, we have stopped buying peanut butter. I recently read that 87 hazelnuts are in each small jar.I HIGHLY recommend Nutella to all my southern Neighbors.
Who even reviews this stuff anymore? It's chocolate hazelnut spread, and it's good on everything. Just don't kid yourself into believing that it's healthy because it's made with skim milk.

My son survives on this stuff. It's very chocolaty. I agree it is very sweet. I like the hint of hazelnut and I like it as a spread on crackers or toast. My son will eat it with peanut butter in a sandwich. It's good, especially for chocolate lovers._______________UPDATE: My son brought this to his childcare center and he was prevented from eating it because they are a peanut-free facility. When I told them it was hazelnut spread, they said it smelled like peanut and it was processed in a factory that may have processed peanuts and it's a nut. So, for those moms whose children go to schools where they are paranoid about nuts (not just peanuts but everything nuts and stuff processed at facilities which may have processed nuts), Nutella may not be acceptable.

It's amazing how many wonderful things can go on a simple piece of bread.  Peanut butter, hazlenut butter, almond butter...  Then don't forget the wonderful Marmite, a yeast extract.  Sigh...  But Marmite, Marmite is for eating toast while reading "Moby [...]", or perhaps "Barnaby Rudge". A bit hearty.  Nutella is for eating toast while reading "Remebrance Of Things Past" or "Dracula".  Rather luscious.  Like Marmite, Nutella goes a lot farther than the prescribed serving size.  Spread thinly.  Now, my children, go out and turn your whole wheat toast into a chocolate doughnut.  Marcel Proust would want you to.
My daughter loves this. This goes very well with bread, crepe or any sort of breakfast items. It is buttery smooth, and has a rich chocolate flavor. Be warned - It is addictive.

I could eat a jar of this stuff.  It's hard to believe it's good for me because it tastes like candy.  I think it's cheaper in the grocery store.  I am happy I purchased it to bring my order up to the free-shipping level in order to acquaint myself with this yummy product.
It's heaven in a jar. Nutella needs to get on the ball and make a hot cocoa that tastes like this.
summary: This is what pureed angels must taste like

reviewText: Been eating this for years.  It keeps well and requires no refrigeration.  My purchase as Amazon was for price and shipping convenience.  I finished this jar and will be looking for more

This is a must for those who love chocolate and hazelnut. Hazelnuts are not nearly as popular in the USA as they are in Europe. When I visited my family in Europe, I really loved all the chocolate and hazelnut desserts there and was sad to discover it's hard to find such things in the USA. This spread is delicious but after you have eaten a real chocolate hazelnut torte (a cake-like, layered brownie type thing I had) nothing is quite the same. Either way, this is great on crepes, cake, waffles and as one other reviewer mentioned, graham crackers! Another interesting treat is to have it on fruit or make a peanut butter and chocolate sandwich.
This adds plenty flavor without salt.  This product is good for those with high blood pressure and those who do not want to get high blood pressure in the future.  We love this on whitefish.
I love lemon pepper, and this is my favourite kind! It's great on all kinds of dishes but especially on popcorn with a little nutritional yeast.

I generally enjoy strong flavors but this spice mix ruined a seafood lasagna I made a few months ago. Perhaps it would be OK on chicken, but the lemon was overpowering and very unpleasant in the lasagna. For the first time in my 50 years of living I have thrown out a jar of spice as I cannot use it; the lemon is yucky and seems very artificial. Real lemon would not be anywhere near as intense. There are many much better spice mixes available, including other Mrs Dash products- but they are greatly overpriced.

I like very strong flavors.  The problem with many seasoning blends is that they contain salt, so if I add a whole lot of the seasoning to my food, it becomes way too salty.  I have tried some other salt-free seasoning blends and they were OK, but Mrs. Dash is outstanding, the flavors are delicious and perfectly blended, and the lemon flavor is very fresh and fragrant.
summary: Love it, and I'm not even on a low-sodium diet!

reviewText: I use many different blends from Mrs. Dash, and this is one of my favorites. Great with fish, chicken or vegetable dishes. Tastes really good sprinkled on salad, too.
Sugar Cubes stuck to one another as if exposed to high moisture and heat.  It was some effort to break them apart.
summary: Sugar Cubes stuck almost like glue to one another

reviewText: I like the old fashion sugar cubes to use in my crafts and they no longer carry them in the local stores anymore, so I am happy to find them here on amazon. They are just as I remember them....thanks!
Great pack of sugar cubes! Pretty self explanatory what it is. Makes a great treat. Also great for giving to horses, they love them!

What a perfect size for espresso! These cubes measure 2/3 an inch on each side, which makes them ideal for a two ounce espresso in a demitasse cup. The small size also works beautifully in a six ounce flute of moscato d'Asti.Each box contains one pound of cubes - 198 per box - and each cube is a scant 10 calories and 2 grams of carbs. This is an easy way to measure your calorie and carb intake with coffees and teas.If you tend to put too much sugar in those beverages, you can measure the nutritional impact of your normal usage, then scale back in precise increments. That is something you cannot easily do when measuring out by partial spoons.I'll confess that I preferLa Perruche White Sugar Cubeswhen I can afford them, but these are more than adequate and are a sweeter deal (if you will permit me the pun.)

I recently bought Domino 10 lb premium cane sugar from a local grocery for about $8 and that makes a one lb batch around $0.8. That is regular powder not cubes as this one but other than that it is exactly the same. In my book for a subtle difference in shape asking for 10x the price is a total rip off.
I love sugar cubes and always have them on hand when I have guests or when I make myself a cup of tea. They help me limit the use of sugar!

reviewerName: T. Lee "God has died lots of times, but someo...
reviewText: Sugar cubes are perhaps hard to mess up, but Domino does manage to get its box chock-full of them, all stacked in neat rows so that no space is wasted.  Indeed I actually had to do a little maneuvering to actually get the first cube out!  The cubes are small enough that you could pile for or five on a teaspoon, which makes it easy to decide just how much you want.  Quite satisfied with this.

I used to love it because it tasted great and it was reasonably priced. Now the price is astronomical and the taste is not as chokolaty and too sweet.I do not understand why it is so expensive now and why it is so sugary.

This is by far the best hot chocolate you can buy.  We are not big coffee drinkers and have tried all of the powders that you mix with water.  We finally gave up on those and started using Nestles Quik in hot milk or just making our own cocoa from scratch with the Hershey's cocoa.  Homemade is always the way to go when you have a crowd, but it takes a lot of time and you have to worry about burning it.When we discovered the Ghirardelli, we will never go back to Quik or try any of the powders.  The Double Chocolate has all the flavor or homemade without all the work.  My daughter-in-law likes the white chocolate mocha flavor and thinks it is better than Starbucks.The beauty of the Ghirardelli's cocoa is that you don't have to spend more than two minutes heating a cup of milk in the microwave.  We usually heat enough milk in a large pyrex measuring cup for the two of us, then we pour the hot milk into the cups, on top of the two heaping teaspoons of the cocoa mix.  It's great with a little whipped cream on the top.World Market sells the product for $4.99 a canister, but I have found it there on sale for $4.00, so Amazon does not have the best price.  It is very hard to find, if you don't have a World Market nearby, so Amazon may be the way to go.
summary: The best hot cocoa for those cool evenings by the fire

reviewText: Myself and my grand kids think this is the best.  Thick and creamy and oh so delicious.  We buy it again and again

I love Ghiradelli Hot Chocolate, Double Chocolate.  It's great in the mornings to get one going.  Just heat a mug of milk in the micro-wave for 2 minutes, add the Hot Chocolate to taste (I add two tablespoons) and you have a great hot drink.  Much better than the other brands like Swiss Miss or Nestles.

reviewerName: Heather L. Parisi "Robert and Heather Parisi"
reviewText: WHAT IT IS!The incredible thing about this stuff is that it is very, very chocolate-ee without a ton of added sugar and calories. It is much better tasting than the usual grocery store brands, but it is harder to find, though not much more expensive. Very full bodied, and ideal for adding to coffee to make your very own Hot Coffee/Chocolate treat, or just drink it by itself. It is about the best Hot Chocolate I have ever found.A great value actually, and it even has its share of iron and protein, a nice touch along with avoiding excessive sugar.IDEAL GIFT:This year, this will be a Christmas gift that alot of people will be getting from me. Buying this here at Amazon has really simplified matters and allows me to give away a rare treat that is easily purchased here though not usually at one's local grocery. The shipping and handling policy of this vendor makes the cost of additional items to be shipped, negligible, making it ideal to buy a bunch at a time. What more could one ask for?
summary: VERY CHOCOLATE-EE WITHOUT TONS OF ADDED SUGAR=DOUBLE CHOCOLATE

reviewText: I'm from California and have always loved this product.  Lately, I can't find it in my grocery stores and the price is WAY to high on Amazon.  I will have to find a substitute product.  Don't buy what looks like the same thing in 4 pound pouches.  It is not the same product.  The packaging makes it look the same, but it has milk solids and lots of chemicals I can't pronounce.Someone on this site suggested using pure 100% cocoa (the kind I use for baking - Nestle or Hershey) and mixing it with sugar.  It's the same ingredient on the Ghirardelli cans.  Voila!  The same great taste at a fraction of the cost.  I used granulated sugar - perfection.
summary: A solution for a fraction of the cost

reviewText: I bought this to use with my Back to Basics CM300BR Cocoa-Latte Chrome 32-Ounce Hot-Drink Maker and it makes a decent cup of hot chocolate.  Nice chocolate flavor without being too sweet.

Whoah! I just peeled myself off the ceiling after drinking a cup of this. This might be better named "Double Sugar" Flavor Hot Chocolate mix.First, the good stuff. There is no doubt in my mind that Ghirardelli continues to make a distinctive, excellent quality chocolate. The cocoa used in this mix is smooth, dark, fruity and aromatic. Nothing else like it that I've ever tasted.Now, the criticism. There is just too much sugar in the mix. The recommended proportion of mix to 8 oz milk is four tablespoons. (By the by, there is no powdered milk in here. You must add your own milk--or soymilk or rice milk--great option for lactose-intolerant types.)People, you are using a quarter cup of mix at 4 Tbs and most of the mix seems to be granulated sugar, which you can taste and crunch in your mouth if you sample the dry mix. Cutting down fifty percent on the mix gave me an acceptable cup of cocoa but...it was no longer double chocolate and it had naturally a poorer mouth feel and aroma.Double Chocolate Mix is some of the best cocoa I WOULD have had, if Ghirardelli could see their way to making a lower sugar version, and please, no sugar substitute, which I don't like to use.Summary; great chocolate flavor, unsurpassed. But overly sweet. If you don't like supersweet cocoa, pass this up. If you do love extremely sweet hot drinks, you will absolutely adore this mix.
summary: Great cocoa flavor like none other, but waaaaay tooo sweeeeet

reviewText: The double chocolate is to die for. Its not the absolute best chocolate I've ever had...have to go to switzerland for that where they "brew" the chocolate and its like drinking a chocolate bar. But for a powdered mix, its pretty dog gone good.

Compared to a national franchise that has a last syllable of "buck$" (cheap shot, I agree), this easy-to-make mix is just as rich, but perhaps not as overtly sweet. (Plus, you don't have to commute for your chocolate, you get a cool plastic container with "chocolat chaud" written on it, and you know the contents of what you're drinking!) Mr. Domingo Ghirardelli began his company more than a century ago, and today, Ghirardelli hot chocolate mix is made in the San Francisco Bay area (picturesque San Leandro--south of Oakland, north of Fremont). Of course, Ghirardelli Square in San Francisco is a well-known and loved attraction for native and visitor alike, where diners can watch as the giant Wonka-like mixer whips up the potion.At home, simply microwave milk or water for 3-4 minutes and add the mix, or put liquid and mix into a small pan, and stir until you've reached the desired heat. Whipped cream or marshmallows are traditional accoutrements, although drinking it straight is an experience just as beautiful. Ingredients are sweet ground chocolate and cocoa (the latter contains sugar, cocoa processed with alkali--they are very forthcoming about its manufacture--unsweetened chocolate (also process with alkali), soy lecithin--an emulsifier, and vanilla. C'est tout!Not counting the milk or water base, 3 tablespoons of chocolate mix has only 80 calories, 1.5 grams fat (0.5 g saturated), 19 g total carbohydrates (of which 1 g is dietary fiber and 17 g are sugar, not clear what happened to the other one gram), and there is even one whole gram of protein, and 2% of the recommended daily value of iron!OK, so it's not exactly a health drink. But it is relatively low fat, no or very little caffeine, and, most important of all,  makes a "bowl of soul," a creamy rich, closed-eyed dreamy experience of fragrance and flavor, that only reminds you of the good things and prepares you for the others. It may move you, as it does me, to rhapsodic heights. Twenty servings per can, give some to your sweetie.
I adore dark chocolate and I have never found anything as good as this.  I just wish the price allowed my to by it more often...(but then I'd really be spoiled!!!)

The good news is that although liquid smoke induces P53 and causes mutagenesis in a lymphocyte cell line, presumably because the water extraction procedure does not bring with polycyclic aromatic carcinogens, and the bad news is that smoked food, especially smoked fish, is full of these carcinogens.So, if you like the flavor (I do), go for it.  I checked it out here:http://nutritionfacts.org/video/is-liquid-smoke-flavoring-carcinogenic/
summary: Good flavor, little evidence for cancer risk.

reviewText: Great product.  I used just a few drops in a soup that seemed to be missing something and the whole family devoured the soup.  It adds a dimension to recipes, especially vegetarian and vegan, that would normally take a lot more work to achieve.
summary: Excellent addition to recipes, especially Vegan dishes

reviewText: It adds good smoking flavor to anything. Give it a try!

Great hickory flavor.  Used it to make pulled pork for 20 people.  It has a rich, natural flavor, no chemical aftertaste.  Made the pork with only Hawaiian sea salt (red), black pepper, a little onion, some garlic and the Colgin Liquid Smoke.  It was gone in less than 2 hours!
The taste of this stuff is sooooo unnatural; I don't know who said this would taste like hickory smoke; it went to the garbage within a minute. Not good :(

We use liquid smoke for flavoring when cooking vegetable stews, some egg dishes, baked beans, veggie burgers and any other food we think may benefit from a little smoked hickory flavor.  We’ve used different brands as they became available in the supermarket, but we’ve pretty much centered on Colgin for everything.  The flavor is intense and it only takes a dash or two to put a subtle, hickory smoke taste in most dishes so don’t overdo it  -  experiment first with just a few drops.The only ingredients are water and hickory smoke so this should be acceptable to everyone – vegetarians, piscatarians, vegans, omnivores, and anybody else with any other kind of diet restrictions.
Bought this to make my own BBQ sauce & it turned out great. Now my husband tries to add it to everything.

We love the smokey flavors in foods, and this LIquid Smoke makes a great addition to your foods.I have used it when making hamburgers and meatloaf, add a little to a crockpot meal,and even a few drops in pasta salad makes a really nice undertone.This is always in our pantry, and we love the product.
summary: One of our favorites to cook with

reviewText: This stuff smells wonderful, and gives a good, natural smoky taste to all kinds of foods. The jar is almost empty already because the kids want to put it on everything!

I used this to flavor vegan sausages and the first time, I used it according to directions - adding about an ounce to a big batch (about 3 lbs. after cooking).  Barely-noticeable smoke flavor.  Second time, I used twice as much which caused me to have to adjust the other liquid ingredients in the mix but I was going for that authentic smokehouse flavoring.  A bit better, but I'm going to have to move on and find something with a little more 'kick'.
summary: Not the Punch I was hoping for

reviewText: Good deal for the amount and I can use my NuWave oven more often which has fairly easy cleanup even from bacon in lieu of grease splattering.

I cook a batch of beans every week.  Often vegetarian, or just a touch of bacon or ham hock for flavor.  A spoonful of liquid smoke, and some molasses always guarantees a delicious dish.I roasted a supermarket chicken.  Not too much flavor in those.  I mixed together 1 teaspoon each of smoke, molasses (or brown sugar) and black bean sauce.  Rubbed the chicken, sprinkled with pepper. Yum.BBQ glaze.  In a small bowl, according to your personal taste, mix catsup, brown sugar, soy sauce, molasses, mustard a few drops of smoke, maybe some hot sauce.  Mix thoroughly. Brush on meat toward the end of grilling.Marinate meat in some soy sauce, brown sugar, and liquid smoke.  Dip onion halves in the marinade and grill.Mixed a few drops into some vegetable oil, brushed on potatoes and roasted them. yum.it's great stuff!
summary: One of my pantry staples!  A little bit goes a long way.

reviewText: Hi, I just wanna say I found this liquid smoke to be great.  It gave me exactly what I was looking for--that natural smoky flavor.  If you want to know, I didn't find it tasting synthetic or artificial.  It tastes very natural because it is natural.The only catch is you need to calibrate your quantity when using this product.  I recommend starting off conservative and adding more as you go.  If you put too much to start with, you may ruin your dish.  For a stew or chili, you can probably fix it by just adding more ingredients to make a bigger pot to reduce the smoke concentration.  Don't pour it directly on something your grilling.  Pour it into a small bowl or dish and brush it on evenly and lightly.  You can always brush on more as you grill.Anyway, it's a wonderful product and I recommend it highly.  I will be buying more once my 4oz bottle runs out.I hope my review has been helpful.Thanks!Scott

Skippy Peanut Butter has been around for the longest time. It is one of the few Peanut Butters that doesn't require refrigeration after it is opened. Nice big 40 Ounce perfectly fresh jar, wonderful creamy taste, easy to spread. Came on time during Hurricane Sandy for a family member. Will order from this Seller again.
summary: We love our Skippy Peanut Butter

reviewText: If you're looking for a reasonably priced commercial peanut butter with all the ingredients that make commercial peanut butter smooth and creamy, then this is it.If what you're looking for is natural peanut butter or something with no added sugars or oils, look elsewhere. This product is exactly what it is advertised to be. As far as commercial peanut butters go, Skippy is one of our favorites. Great product for what it is.
My kids love Skippy creamy peanut butter. This price is kind of high, however. And it's not eligible for Amazon Prime. Not such a good deal IMHO.

This is a 40 Ounce container of really good Skippy. It's quite a lot of product, for a good price. If a burglar breaks into your house, you'd also be able to hurl this at them and at least knock the wind outta' them.
If not for the celeries I would eat Peanut Butter all day long. It's a shame that some people miss the love of it.
I love peanut butter, this fits the bill. With subscribe and save, it's less expensive than buying individual jars at my local grocery store and it's delivered right to my doorstep.

PB&J; sandwich, peanut butter crackers, peanut butter on a spoon, peanut butter and banana sandwich, any way you like it -- Skippy is the best!It's got just the right amount of creaminess to it and I really like the consistency.  And then, of course, there's always the flavor, which is the best.
Got this because of a special sale, and it was an extremely good value. And, it was as good as the major brand peanut butters always are.
I think Skippy is the best tasting of the major brands of peanut butter.  I like the "natural" Skippy, but the original is excellent as well.

this is fantastic ......I think I will definitely order this product again in the future!  (I posted once about how I'm picky about what chocolate I eat & how hostess cupcakes & ding-dongs are maybe not the ideal thing to order through the mail, well after thinking about it I would now say this is much more of a 5 star product and not-so-much of a 2 star product .....the reason I was tempted to give it a two star rating is because I felt this was something I should be able to go out and buy at the market (or the convenience store across the street) ......anyhow I've now decided it's good in all cases)
summary: Amazon is good for small-food-product needs!

reviewText: These will be greatly missed.  I actually gave one each of these to some friends for Christmas and they were delighted.  I think most are saving them, hopefully not until they mold.

reviewerName: ChibiNeko "Sooo many books, so little time!"
reviewText: I, like so many others, picked up a box of the "new" cupcakes as soon as they hit the shelves of our grocery store. I had much of the same curiosity as others did, wondering if these improved on the previous recipe or not.No, no it doesn't. These are ultimately the exact same cupcakes that you could buy months ago. The only difference is that the box is branded with new slogans about Hostess's come back.These aren't bad, but they're just sort of middle of the road cupcake quality. They're nice and moist, as they were obviously made recently, but these just aren't really that exciting. The cupcake and icing are the best part of this, but the cream filling is where this falls short. It's just a little dab (not that any of you were expecting as much as there used to be) and it's so overly processed that I almost at times feel that the cupcake could have been a little better without it. If you've ever had one of these cupcakes or any of Hostess's cream filled products from about 10+ years ago, you'll know that the filling used to be much better- creamier and richer. These? Eh.If you've loved the previous formula of cupcakes from a year or so ago, you're in luck. These are pretty much the same recipe. I was just hoping that perhaps the company would take the time to tweak these a little to where they're more than just your standard run of the mill snack cake. I'll probably buy these again in the future, but I won't run out to get them.

Always the lunchbox stable, these chocolate cupcakes with their infamous white swirl down the middle are still one of my favorites.  No, they don't taste the same as they did in the 60s, but then again, WHAT does?  The cream is what I notice the most - not quite as creamy and lush as they used to be, but well, they're still great and taste great to the next generation.  They're also awesome frozen on a hot day.  They have to be considered an American staple - especially since Hallmark has turned them into a Christmas ornament!  Even though they do contain beef fat (weird, huh?), they're still good.  All cakes for the most part, unless you use applesauce, contain some sort of fat or oil to make them moist.  Just jump on the treadmill for a couple of minutes and well, there it goes!  Great product, been enjoying them for 40 years, highly recommend!
used label to cover the expiration date, but one bite told me that they were stale.  on a few of them the icing had turned white

reviewerName: Lonnie E. Holder "The Review's the Thing"
reviewText: Delicious Hostess Chocolate Cupcakes were the first Hostess Cupcakes.  You can now get orange flavored Hostess Cupcakes as well.  While homemade cupcakes are still the best, if you have too little time to whip up a batch of cupcakes, when these cupcakes are fresh they are hard to beat.  They have a soft, chocolate cake body with a creamy middle and chocolate icing on top.  The only problem with these cupcakes is that they are addictive, and those of us who spend too little time on the treadmill need to watch home many of these things that we eat, both at one time and altogether.Well, I hear a Hostess Cupcake calling my name...

Boohoo--everyone talks about how these really bring back memories. I thought they would invoke some of my yummy childhood days, but they were a letdown! The frosting actually peeled off in spots! The cake was a little crumbly too. My little girl tastebuds must have just had lower standards.

Hostess Chocolate CupCakes have a great chocolate flavor that mixes so well with the cream filling inside them. These cupcakes certainly aren't the healthiest for you; but they DO make for a great after school snack; and they are perfect for when you need a sugar kick burst of energy when you're on the go.The packaging is good; and they maintain their freshness so long as you eat them within a week or two of buying them. The cupcakes are relatively small and individually wrapped so they can fit in a small lunch box container for school kids, a lady's purse and even a briefcase for businessmen and businesswomen. Great!However, the fun may stop there. I would not eat these every day. These cupcakes are loaded with sugar; and sugar can turn into fat inside your body if you don't get enough exercise. They have a lot of carbohydrates, too. These cupcakes also contain partially hydrogenated ingredients; this means they DO have trans fats--and trans fats are very unhealthy for you. The frosting can sometimes get crusty so eat these while they're fresh.Overall, despite the health concerns, these cupcakes have several good uses that I couldn't ignore. They taste great; they are good for an after school snack or for adults on the run; and they come individually wrapped so they don't break and smear the chocolate cake or the cream filling all over your other things in your briefcase, purse or lunch box. Pick up a box of these cupcakes and enjoy one or two tonight!
summary: So good that you just might forget the oncoming diet debacle

reviewText: Hostess got a lot of free publicity when it declared bankruptcy and voided its obligations to pay its retired employees pensions' and healthcare obligations.  Of course the 'assets' - the factory and recipes - were quickly sold to venture capital; and employees who didn't care to be out of work along with their suddenly-evaporated non-pensions were rehired, so pretty much business as usual in the USA.This free publicity reminded me of Hostess Cup Cakes, my favorite in the 80's.  They used to come in packs of 2, so when I saw that this was a box of 8, I thought it was a box of 8 packs of two.  Nope, it's a box of 8 single cupcakes, each one individually wrapped.They're also about half the size they were in the 80s - if that - and they are not packaged in plastic cups any more, just sitting on a cardstock board, so they are sort of squashy and get molded roughly into a cube shape on their journey to your house.They tasted just like I remember 'em; moist cake, rich chocolate flavor, creamy icing, and of course that white foam, reminiscent of Chantilly cream, in the middle.  They arrived a few days before their sell-by date and freshness was not in question; they tasted fine.I am not sure I am really on board with a buck fifty apiece for such tiny morsels - I can get larger, fresher, less technologically engineered cupcakes at that price at the local bakery - but otherwise, these cakes deliver as expected.

Crazy Uncle Jester's Louisiana Firestorm is the best pure Louisiana style hot sauce, but Crystal is my favorite of the original style, milder Louisiana style hot sauces that I can buy in a supermarket.  It's about twice as hot as the original Louisiana style hot sauce, which still is not all that hot but the extra cayennes add a lot of flavor and are the difference between being 99% vinegar (like tabasco) and hot sauce IMO.I buy this one mainly for my 8 year old son, who hasn't yet migrated up to the hotter Louisiana style sauces and he loves it. I'll use it myself from time to time as well, although I usually opt for something hotter.  It's still good tasting.
summary: Greatest mild Louisiana style hot sauce

reviewText: As far as Louisiana style sauces go, this is one of the best and cheapest. Most any"local" type establishment you visit in and around New Orleans will have a bottle ofCrystal on the table. Its not hot at all, maybe a 3 on a 10 scale, but the flavorparticularly for your basic generic Cajun spread is fantastic.The best thing about Crystal is that its not only available at most retail outlets, butits cheap. Locally, this 12oz. bottle can be had for $1.39. Comparatively, the 2oz. bottleof Tabasco costs $1.59 at the local grocery so it pays to have a couple of bottles ofCrystal laying around. Its also a beautiful stunning red color that I've learned toappreciate over the years of sampling all the Louisiana style sauces. Next to Chef Paul'sMagic Pepper Sauce, this is my favorite.Good in stews, gumbos, on fish, chicken and pork when you want all the flavor withoutthe burn. If you're cooking for friends they wont mind you throwing in liberal dosesof this stuff. 5 Scovies

Crystal Hot Sauce is as basic to Louisiana Cajun cooking as Miracle Whip to church basement potlucks. It's not as salty as some hot sauces or as smokey as others, and it doesn't carry any aftertaste of powdered garlic. It's essentially a "table condiment", what you reach for when the gumbo is bland or the fried catfish muddy-tasting. It's the 'on the table' pick at Angeline's Restaurant in Berkeley, CA, the closest thing to authentic Cajun in the Bay Area. I used to carry a bottle of it in my instrument case whenever I flew to the UK or the Netherlands for gigs, but "them days is gone" in the age of airport security. Now I carry powdered Chipotle chilis, and hope some day a security guard will open the little bottle and take a good sniff ...

Crystal Hot Sauce Louisiana's Pure Hot Sauce - 12 ozis popular here in Louisiana.  We also likeTabasco Pepper Sauce Red - 2 oz, but we have both kinds and use them regularly.  Many of us prefer Crystal for cooking.  For example, my son-in-law prefers it for one of his special barbecue sauces.  I talked him into letting me put that sauce in Flavored with Love: Mary Lou's Family and Friends Can Cook, but he told me not to share it anywhere else.Paul uses it in his steak marinade.  I had a really hard time getting this recipe from him, but I spied until I found out what it was. (He wrote it on a little sheet of paper that got grubby, and I watched him hide the paper!) This one is also in Flavored with Love.  The Crystal Hot Sauce gives heat and flavor without dominating the flavor.--PAUL'S STEAK MARINADE2 ounces lemon juice2 ounces red wine vinegar4 ounces beer4 ounces soy sauce2 tablespoons basil1 tablespoon ground black pepper1 tablespoon Crystal hot sauce (or less if desired)Mix all the ingredients together thoroughly.  Use 1 time and discard.NotesPaul's marinades are splendid.  He mixes them with a whisk until all the flavors are thoroughly combined.  Then he adds the liquid to the food he is marinating.When possible he allows at least 4 hours for all the delicious flavors to be absorbed.  He turns the meat or fish occasionally.He adjusts the amounts as needed for the amount of food being prepared.--With the prices of everything going up, it is necessary to save money any way we can.  Making a variety of sauces from a few basic ingredients is helpful.Crystal is a basic sauce, including only aged red cayenne peppers, distilled vinegar, and salt.  It does not supply any vitiamins according to the label, but I suspect it does have some nutritional value that we just don't know about.  It is excellent on collard greens, and as the authors of The Collard Patch we use it on our collards.Here in Louisiana we can beat Amazon's price on this product.  I don't know whether Crystal is available throughout the country and how the prices compare.To us the bottle is a work of art, and we are delighted to serve it on our table.  We take Crystal with us sometimes if we eat in public places that do not have enough seasoning.  We are discreet about adding it because we would not want to offend a chef. We do realize that other people find Paul peculiar when he puts so much Crystal on his food.  We NEVER take it with us when we go to eat with friends.  We would not want to be rude. Maybe it would make a good gift for a hostess.I hope you find this review helpful.

For well over a year, I have been using different types of hot sauce on different types of food.  Before I started doing this, I only ever remember using hot sauce on barbeque sandwiches.  Even though I have tried numerous types of hot sauce during this period, Crystal Hot Sauce has set itself apart from the others.  This is a hot sauce that I like having around as a basic staple.  Neither is it too hot nor too mild, and it sports a gratifying flavor.  This is one of those kinds of hot sauce that I can use on various types of food.  It is a recommendable hot sauce.

Sponge cake with a creamy filling! These carefully scientifically designed treats stick to the original flavor as much as possible while increasing the shelf life considerably. The cream filling is actually shortening, because milk doesn't stay good on a warm shelf, the cake has all sorts of wonderful chemicals in it to keep it moist, fresh and light in texture. Corn syrup replaces sugar, soy lecithin is the most well known of the trace chemicals that help create that very smooth mouth feel- it's used in chocolate for the same reason.If there is ever an award offered to the scientists who find less expensive ways to chemically reproduce flavors, it should be a Golden Twinkie Award. You know they aren't healthy, but who can resist having one every so often? Even deep fat frying them when you're feeling completely decadent.Nothing tastes quite like a Twinkie. Best frozen and it's fun to dip frozen slices in chocolate and watch people try to figure out what they are eating.

I must admit I am so sad to see these possibly go, given the Hostess' company intent to go bankrupt as of the 20th of November, 2012.  Yes, I know it's possible that another large bakery may buy out the recipie for these or even most or all of the Hostess products, but there's always that chance that this doesn't happen.  So I'm forced to admit I am in a bit of a quandry.For instance, this is the best sponge cake for messy kitchen clean up.  When they say sponge cake, they MEAN sponge cake.  Spill some hot coffee?  Open up a Twinkie, coffee puddle no more!  Cat miss the litter box, again no more mess!  Baby just upchuck after being burped...need I say more?  And yet even after a hard day's cleaning the typical kitchen messes, they still stay moist and flavorful.  An added bonus is the filling.  It makes a wonderful floor wax, shaving cream, and if placed in a nail hole and then allowed to dry, a perfect patch!  Too bad there's not enough filling to use as foam insulation for a home, I suspect it would work wonders as that as well.So yes, I am almost depressed over this.  The substitutes out there just don't cut it.  Little Debbie treats made of sponge cake, last 2 or 3 spills, tops.  Store brands, even worse for messy spills.  So let's hope the Twinkie survives in some form after Hostess goes bankrupt.  Such a handy food and kitchen aide should not disappear!
summary: So sad to see these possibly go

reviewerName: Lonnie E. Holder "The Review's the Thing"
reviewText: Twinkies rank high on my list of pure junk foods.  The sugar and corn syrup in Twinkies help push the calorie count to around 150.  I do not care to think about what kind of fats and carbs go in to the 150 calories.On the other hand, I grew up with Twinkies.  I used to eat them as fast as I could get my hands on them.  Unfortunately, I am unable to do that any more.  You get older, you get smarter, I guess.  But I still like an occasional Twinkie.  Yes, they are sweet.  Yes, they have too many calories.  But, they taste good!  I wish they still offered banana creme Twinkies.More recently people have actually enhanced the calories in a Twinkie by deep frying them.  Cooking a Twinkie should be something you do only with great care.  There is a process to successfully making a deep fried Twinkie, and there are many processes that do not work.  To the best of my knowledge all of the processes yield even more calories, but even better flavor.  You get the general idea.  The better Twinkies taste, the more calories they have.  Go figure.Twinkies in their current form will never be mistaken for a health food.  But I will probably continue to indulge in one periodically for as long as I can.Enjoy!
summary: Disaster for Diet, but Tasty on Your Tongue

reviewText: Hostess Twinkies were all the rage back in the 1960s when I was a child growing up; and they still sell well today. They make for a delicious after school snack; and they are compact which makes them good for a sugar boost for adults on the run.Twinkies fit easily inside of lunch boxes, too. I would suggest, however, that anyone carrying these wrap them in something that will not allow Twinkie crumbs from the outer cake to spray all over the rest of whatever you are carrying.Twinkies are made of a golden cake filled with a creamy soft substance that is also delicious. Awesome!Of course, the fun just might stop there. These treats are loaded with sugar; and sugar turns to fat inside your body if you don't get enough exercise. Moreover, Twinkies have partially hydrogenated ingredients and this means that they DO have trans-fats even though the nutrition label says the opposite. Perhaps the trans-fat content is small; but you should know that trans-fats are VERY bad for you. I wouldn't eat these Twinkies every day.Overall, however, Twinkies make for a nice dessert treat, an occasional after school snack or a sugar boost for busy adults on the run. Be careful not to eat too many because of the fat and sugar content. Nevertheless, get a box and enjoy one or two tonight!
summary: Have a couple anyway and forget the oncoming diet debacle...

reviewText: And they're fun to eat.  I start at one end and eat the top off all the way to the other end, thus exposing the cream filling.  Then I lap up the filling with my tongue.  Afterward, I nibble on the remaining sponge cake to finish it off.  Fun and Delicious!!!  No studies have shown them to be anything but healthy.

Twinkies were once great but once they sold out to the big corporation, the quality went down the drain. It's too artificial tasting to be considered food. There are a ton of chemicals and additives added. You call this cake?
Love this sauce just very hard to find and finally found it. Great taste and spicy plus it's great on everything.

I stumbled onto this product years ago. I cant buy it here locally anymore at the grocery. It is delicious. Don't let the name fool you, it is not firey hot but just right with a hint of sweetness. Take a chance and buy a bottle, you will not be dissapointed.

reviewerName: philyodaddy "Say Hello to the Bad Guy"
reviewText: I have been using Tiger sauce for about 15 years. I am fairly certain that I am the number one consumer of the product in the entire world. I use it mainly for making delicious sandwiches and rice. I love rice, with some flavor of course. Tiger Sauce is my secret ingredient for my world famous sandwiches. Basically the sauce is like hot sauce mixed with worcestershire sauce (another philyodaddy fave) mixed with steak sauce. It is kind of hot and kind of sweet. It is delicious and that is all you need to know.  STRONG Recommendation.The one question mark is that it is produced by the "Try Me" Brand. That always weirded me out, I am not sure why. Try a little harder, "Try me"Also, usually costs like $3 at the super market (assuming you can find this in the gems aisle), so don't you dare pay double that.

...and that's a good thing.Worcestershire is the key ingredient here and it's also my secret ingredient for pea soup and clam chowdah... oops, secret's out. IMHO, a bit pricey at $3.99, which is what I paid locally. Here it's $6.90 - I mean "$1.95" plus shipping - which is madness.Good flavor, but it has limitations for me, as does Worcestershire.

I first tried TIGER SAUCE during Lent. On Fridays, I only eat fish and I usually use tartar sauce with my fish. While I was at the grocery store picking up some pollock, I saw a 5 oz. bottle of TIGER SAUCE and decided to give it a try instead. I love this stuff! It's got an almost perfect blend between hot and sweet. It won't burn your mouth, but there is a bit of a kick. At the same time, there is a sweety flavor that lingers in one's mouth after the hot sauce kick is gone. It has the roar of a jungle cat, mixed with the purr of a kitten. I'm going to start using TIGER SAUCE on all sorts of other foods from now on. Use it as a marinade for grilled chicken or pour it into a pot of chili. It's all good. Try it and you shouldn't be disappointed.
summary: The Roar of a Jungle Cat and the Purr of a Kitten

reviewText: ...and so so inexpensive, too.  I used some of it today in my Alessi split pea soup.  I ass taught that olive oil is good for people, especially us older people.  Thank you.

Yum!  Use this for everything and well, you'll have wonderful pizzas, breads, pastas, etc.  Plus, it's the perfect one to use if you just like to use it with fresh herbs as a dipping sauce for breads.  Golly I love this stuff.  Like Emeril Lagasse says, "You could put this stuff on a car bumper and make it taste amazing!"  Been using it for 20+ years and amazon's price is awesome.  Another reviewer mentioned that olive oil is best stored in a tin and I agree.  However, I store mine in a dark pantry, in the back so it definitely helps maintain the health benefits over storing it in an open, lighted area. HIGHLY recommend!

reviewerName: Heather L. Parisi "Robert and Heather Parisi"
reviewText: WHY THIS SIZE: About 1/2 LiterIf you are not going to use this everyday, this 1/2 liter size bottle, is more likely to stay fresh for its entire tenure, in a cool, dry place in your home than one of the super-size tins.WHAT IS "Filippo Berio Extra Virgin Olive Oil"?This is probably the most popular product from this revered time-honored Italian company. Their famous label on the large tin with the coins pictured on it is something I can recall for half a century. This is "Extra-Virgin Olive Oil,Imported from Italy and is stated to be "All Natural & Cold Pressed". Bear in mind that "All Natural" is not "Certified Organic", though they offer Certified Organic from their specialty oil department.SPECIFICS ABOUT EXTRA VIRGIN OLIVE OIL:This is not an oil for cooking, as it has a very low smoke point. It is excellent for salads and for marinating and boasts a pretty low acid level. For cooking try their "Extra Light" product as it has a much higher smoke point.They have a large number of specialty products and a useful website on the World Wide Web at [...]This and most of their conventional oils are available at most groceries and this exact product sells for about [...]. for a 17 ounces [about 1/2 liter]. However, it does vary regional and depending on the packaging [bottle or tin] may cost somewhat more or less by volume.[I AM NOT AFFILIATED WITH ANY PRODUCT OR COMPANY]
summary: THE GOLD STANDARD FOR OLIVE OIL - BUT NOT FOR COOKING

reviewText: I've used Filippo Berio extra virgin olive oil for years.  I've tried other, more costly EVOs to see if I found one I liked better but I didn't -- I like Berio best. It has great mouth feel and taste and that peppery bite one expects from a good EVO.

Filippo Berio Extra Virgin Olive Oil is a high quality product made from the first cold pressing of olives from Italy, Spain, Greece, and Tunisia.  This product is imported from Italy.  Here are the facts:Serving size: 1 tablespoonCalories: 120Fat calories: 120Total fat: 14 g (22% DV)Saturated fat: 2 g (10% DV)Trans fat: 0 gPolyunsaturated fat: 2 gMonounsaturated fat: 10 gCholesterol: 0 mg (0% DV)Sodium: 0 mg (0% DV)Total carbohydrates: 0 g (0% DV)Protein: 0 gOverall, a good product that I recommend.

If you have switched from cooking with butter to olive oil, this brand works great for that purpose. It has a light taste which is fine for cooking. I saute meats, onions, mushrooms, veggies and cook eggs and pancakes (whole grain, of course) in it.I also use it with a balsamic vinegar for a salad dressing with some seasoning - figure it's more healthy than most store bought dressings. It's great to toss vegetables in and roast them in the oven. I toss sweet potatoes in it and add cumin, sea salt and pepper. Delicious!If you're going to dip bread in it, you might want an olive oil with a heavier taste, but for the basics of cooking, roasting and salad dressings, have been very satisfied with this oil. 5 stars for a basic oil. If you're looking for something more gourmet, there may be better products out there for that purpose.
Excellent food for the heart & overall constitution. I throw it in the blender when juicing and making spaghetti sauce.
its olive oil.  cant go wrong with that.  the price I think was good.  I like the idea with sending more than one bottle at a time.
Happy to discover it's delicious and high in fiber.I'll have to order some when I finish my All-Bran.

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: I suffer from diarrhea and irritable bowel syndrome when I visit many countries in the world.  Usually I eat many exotic dishes that use animal parts or spices that disrupt the large intestine.When I am at home, I pick up a few old grain cereals, which are a good source of fiber.Spelt was an important grain in parts of Europe from the Bronze Age to medieval times.  It is an excellent source of vitamin B2, a very good source of manganse, and a good source of niacin, thiamin, and copper. This particular combination of nutrients provided by spelt may make it a particularly helpful food for persons with diarrhea, migraine headaches, atherosclerosis, or diabetes.It has a good natural taste free of anything artificial.  It may seem boring but I crunch it up alone or with milk.  It's really good.

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: I suffer from diarrhea and irritable bowel syndrome when I visit many countries in the world. Usually I eat many exotic dishes that use animal parts or spices that disrupt the large intestine.When I am at home, I pick up a few old grain cereals, which are a good source of fiber.Spelt was an important grain in parts of Europe from the Bronze Age to medieval times. It is an excellent source of vitamin B2, a very good source of manganse, and a good source of niacin, thiamin, and copper. This particular combination of nutrients provided by spelt may make it a particularly helpful food for persons with diarrhea, migraine headaches, atherosclerosis, or diabetes.It has a good natural taste free of anything artificial. It may seem boring but I crunch it up alone or with milk. It's really good.
I already knew I liked spelt crackers. This cereal is a great option for a healthy breakfast and tastes great.
I've been buying this cereal since I became sensative to wheat and I absolutely love it. I drizzle a little honey on them and sometimes add banana, but they are marvelous without either.
I'm trying to add more whole grains to our diet.  The spelt flakes aren't that much different than more usual Wheaties and I don't think justify the extra cost.
organic, pure oat flakes from a company i trust and buy several other products from. Arrowhead Mills has a vast array of food products for the healthy lifestyle

The price as I write this review is amazing! I bought these at $3.49 and bought 5 of them. Even though they are not in a can my order had a lot of drinks in it and the tomatoes come in milk like carton. Most of mine were smashed down to the point they could not even stand.I do love that they do not have a metallic taste to them. I was not as impressed with them since I had a lot of tomatoes that were not ripe yet or had the top part on it. They are great to cook with but I found myself picking out a lot of bad pieces.Healthy and handy and for he price they are at right now, you might want to pick up a few!
summary: Healthy but had to pick through mine

reviewText: Great taste and great price!  I bought this for making sauces over the winter and was pleasantly surprised!  I also love that it's BPA free and packaged in Italy!

Tasty tomatoes with no unnecessary additives or salt in BPA free packaging! Ordering this case on Amazon costs the same per ounce as buying organic canned tomatoes at my local grocer. BPA free tomatoes are more important to me than organic ones due to their acidity. These taste great and work beautifully in my recipes, but I wish they came in 15,5 oz containers to better fit my recipes. Their packaging says they have a shelf life of 10 days once opened and stored in the fridge so I can usually use them up, but since most of my recipes call for a can or about 2 cups I almost always have an open container in my fridge. I will absolutely reorder these again and again.
summary: Fantastic tomatoes! Fair price by the case!

reviewText: My household makes a lot of marinara sauce, chili, and tomato based sauces.  These tomatoes are so flavorful compared to anything in a can.  When I use things from a can I can taste the canned flavor which does not appeal to me.  I will never go back to buying canned tomatoes let alone anything else if I can get fresh, boxed, or jarred.  Do yourself a favor and buy these and stay away from anything canned.
Except for the one which exploded while shipping here I love these.  Let's put it this way, I will order more when I run out.  Puts canned tomatoes to shame

My local grocery store stopped stocking Pomi tomatoes and I want tomatoes in boxes, not cans!  I am so glad Amazon has these and they are wonderful.  I will order again, though it may take me a while to go through 12 boxes!  Great product!

I've been using this brand for a few yrs, so glad I discovered it.  I'm Italian-American so sauce is running through my veins, it's a very important food product to me. I love the ingredient label, one word, TOMATOES!  It is so fresh, and the color so 'real' for lack of a better word.  I love the chopped variety over their strained and pizza sauce, this one is truly my very fave. I love making shellfish cioppino with this, you need a fresh, marinara-type sauce for that, a sauce that isn't cooked that long and tastes fresh like you just cut up some ripe tomatoes.  I sometimes add a pinch of sugar to it; as with most tomatoes, this is a little trick that enhances the natural sweetness, the way salt enhances foods.  The current price of about $3.55 a container is a bit higher than I saw in my store just yesterday, about $2.79 there, but there are only a few bc they get snatched up so quickly. This 12-pack assures me a supply.  I don't mind spending a little more for something that I enjoy very much and is of superior quality.Unlike another reviewer, I have no complaint on the delivery. I am a PRIME member and got it exactly 2 days later ordering it, on time and punctual. The expiration date is Feb of 2016 (today is March 2014)...so all in all, I am pleased.  If you have a chance to pick up and sample one container of this at your local market, you can test it out yourself. You may end up buying the 12-pack too.  I had bought a 12-pack from an online store once, and with discounts and shipping, it still cost about what Amazon is charging now, about $42 for a 12-pack.All in all, as good as any higher-priced San Marzano can of tomatoes, and this is from Italy as well, contains no citric acid where basically all other canned tomatoes do.  You be the judge, that's the final word. WOrth a try.

I had been using Muir Glen Organic whole/diced tomatoes, but after having had cancer I read a lot of research publications indicating that BPA's estrogen mimicking effects can be quite dangerous. BPA found in cans with acidic foods are some of the worst since the chemical is leached out even more. The same is true of plastic containers with BPA -- acid, heat or surface abrasion lead to much greater leaching into the food.Although Muir Glen is promising to get rid of BPA in their can liners, they are replacing it with some unspecified 'vinyl-based substitute'. If you want to get their cans without BPA, look for a use-by date of around the summer of 2013. [This info is per a conversation with their customer service representative.]I had heard about Pomi Tetra-pak products before -- Mario Batali and other foodies/chefs have recommended them so I thought I would give them a try.The tomatoes are naturally grown in Italy without pesticides and have no salt added. I used them to create a wonderful marinara sauce. They taste great and I am very happy with the quality.

I love using these.  Good size box.  No BPA, wonderful fresh flavor.  The only thing that could make them the absolute best is if they were organic.  Aside from that, I am buying them here instead of the organic tomatoes now available in glass jars.  The glass jar version is just tomato paste with a little extra water in it.  I was not impressed.  The chunks of tomatoes in the Pomi are much better, I found I really missed them.

I ordered these tomatoes after deciding to stop buying canned products because of the BPA in the can lining.  Tomatoes, because they are acidic, leach more BPA from the can lining than other foods.  I am also trying to reduce or eliminate GMO foods from my families diet.  Because these tomatoes are from Italy, they are required to be labeled if they contain GMO.  It's nice to cook with these and be able to feel good about the food I'm feeding my family.

I am moving my family away from canned items that contain BPA.  Tomatoes in cans always contain BPA and the acidic nature of tomatoes leeches the BPA into the tomatoes pretty effectively.  One way to avoid this is to use tetra pack ( and to can your own tomatoes but I've run out for the year :).  I ordered a case of these and they are very good tomatoes. Great taste.  I will use these as a substitute for homemade canned tomatoes.

I have concerns about the chemicals in cans leeching into my tomatoes. There is a lot of research out there on the dangers of this. Pomi is one of the few that don't put their tomatoes in cans, but in a safer box. They are pricey, but in my view worth it.
summary: One of the few tomatoes on the market not in cans

reviewText: I was born in eastern WA where vine ripe tomatoes were the norm.Then, I moved to the Pacific Northwest. Vine ripened? No such thing.My first incentive to buy Pomi was to get away from tin canned tomatoes since they are considered really bad for you by experts in the field of hormonal technology. There's something about the coating inside tomato cans that is not good. I suffer autoimmune disease, so I'm going with the latest findings and trying to get healthy again.When I first used them, I was taken back to when I was 6 years old  in Walla Walla, WA. and my mom would go out and pick vine ripened tomatoes in the morning, chop them up and make spaghetti sauce. Pomi matches that. The flavor intensity is insane. I actually had to get used to it! REAL tomatoes!Looking forward to trying the strained tomatoes to replace canned, non organic tomato sauce.If you're a Prime member, it will take a week+ to get your shipment......well worth the wait, Trust me.

These are really great tomatoes. I hate the metalic taste canned tomatoes have and if they taste like the can chances are it has leached into the tomatoes, can't be healthy. These are very rich in flavor and not at all watery. Great as a sauce with just some virgin olive oil, fresh basil and garlic, s&p cook pasta firm and finish cooking in the sauce, simple and delicious! Love these tomatoes, wish I could find it locally but at least I can get it from amazon, what did we ever do without amazon?!

Perfect for all my uses. I used the tomatoes in soup and have also used it as a side dish with green vegetables. Does a nice job either way. I added lemon juice to make up for the salt-free aspect of the tomatoes, but that's healthier anyway.

If you're cooking with tomatoes, using packaged is actually a good move.  They're usually really flavorful, which can't always be said about the fresh that are available most places.  Pomi tomatoes are really excellent, some of the best I've ever tasted, and the packaging is BPA-free, which no canned tomatoes currently on the market can boast.  Quite simply, this is one of the best choices you can make for cooking tomatoes.
These are delicious. I wanted to change to box tomatoes to get away from BPH in regular canned tomatoes. This is a pricey alternative.

I'd been wanting to try this brand since it's BPA free, but it's been hard to find in town.  I recently purchased a few packages and used one in a vegetable soup the other night.  The tomatoes gave good color to the soup and greatly enhanced the flavor.  Last night I made chili from scratch, cooked the dried beans, the whole nine yards and added these tomatoes to the mix.  My chili turned out extra yummy.  I'm so glad I finally got to try the tomatoes.  I'm going to stock up so I don't run out.

This is standard against which I compare all other green teas. Now if you like your breakfast green tea strong, this is not for you. This is quite light on the "green" flavor. I like the strong green tea flavor also, but for breakfast this is fine!I have this straight, with honey, or with honey and lemon. It is a perfect match with lemon and honey. I never liked honey in green tea until I tried it with this! When I want my vitamin C, I squeeze an entire lemon into this brew! It takes a little more honey, but tastes wonderful.

Due to the recent 30% off special for select Lipton tea here on Amazon, I have been stocking up like crazy. The Lipton Green Tea Orange Passionfruit & Jasmine is in my opinion one of the better tasting flavors from Lipton's green tea lineup. The flavor is strong but not overpowering which is good because I don't want to feel like I'm drinking a fruit juice. I am a little disappointed in the actual green tea taste because there really isn't that much to begin with. However, to counter that, I do drink green tea for health benefits and not for its taste! This tea, like most of the Liptons I buy, I always drink cold. I do like to drink a hot cup or so whenever I can after a greasy meal but cold tea is much better in my opinion.Also, this tea is very similar to the pyramid bag shaped Mandarin Orange green tea from Lipton as well.

reviewerName: Captain Aaron "Captain Aaron of Her Majesty's...
reviewText: Green Tea, Orange, Passionfruit and Jasmine.  An excellent combination.  Reminds me of this one time..Twas the Summer of 1933, Sir Algernon Freeman-Mitford had requisitioned the H.M.S. Peregrine Caverdish for Privateering in the Lesser Antilles under a Letter of Marque and Reprisal ordered by King George V.  We had pushed through the Windward Islands, with a quick stop in Barbados to resupply.Again, our journey was filled with devious treachery.  Once the H.M.S. Peregrine Cavendish sailed from the protection of the Leeward Islands, controlled of course by His Majesty's Royal Navy (the finest Navy on all the high seas!), the waters of the Lesser Antilles were patrolled by a cacophony of Spanish Armada's and Dutch Privateers.  Just two weeks prior we had commandeered the Dutch ship Eendracht, and it's Captain, Lieutenant-Admiral Maarten Tromp, under legally sanctioned duress (we Englishman always operate within the law), told of a Dutch fort with an "embarrassment of riches" on the Dutch island of La Tortuga.  Long known for it's rich salt deposits, First Mate Tignor, a fine military tactician, drew up a brilliant assault plan upon the La Tortuga.We approached through the dense tropical jungle, with First Mate Tignor on point.  We made sure our muskets were loaded, for the assault had a high probability of bloodshed.  But prepared we all were.  "I never liked em Dutchies, a bunch of nancies them be", bellowed Midshipman Householder.  "Let me at em, Skipper, and I swear I'll make the King Proud."  We tipped further until they reached the base of the outer wall of the Dutch fort.  We threw our grappling hooks over the outer wall, and prepared for our siege.As soon as they descended the wall, they heard the distinct screams, of.... a damsel!"With your authority skipper, I call onesies on the damsel", First Mate Tignor asked."You have my authority First Mate Tignor, you will rescue her and meet us back here in thirty-six minutes", I responded."For England", called First Mate Tignor."For the King", I answered.And with that, First Mate Tignor took off.As he followed the sullen screams of the fair maiden's call, First Mate Tignor found his pathway blocked by six unsavory Dutch buccaneers."A filthy Englishman", gruffed the tall one, "we ought to slit his throat right here".Their leader, a unshaven, slightly portly fellow spoke next.  "My name is Lord Petr Laars Oxidant, of Rotterdam.  I'm the ranking officer of this outpost, and you have just unfairly angered me.  I'll gladly draw swords with an Englishman as filthy as you".  And with that, Captain Petr Laars Oxidant unsheathed his cutlass.First Mate Tignor was faster on the draw, as his cutlass, forged by pure Japanese steel, a gift from the Samurai King of Eto, flew out from his side and plunged deep within the chest of the gruff, tall Dutchman.  With the speed and precision of a bolt of lightning, First Mate Tignor dispatched three more of the Dutch.  One of the remaining Dutchman fled terrified, as all are well aware of the fear and cowardice of the Dutch.  All that stood between First Mate Tignor and the fair maiden was Lord Petr Laars Oxidant."It is a good day to die", exclaimed First Mate Tignor, as he volleyed a thrust of Lord Oxidant's cutlass.  Swish.  Miss.  Clink.  Blocked.  Whirrrrr.  Lord Oxidant's cutlass just barely missed First Mate Tignor's ear."You have skill, Englishman", Lord Oxidant growled, "but you still have much to learn.  You see, the Dutch are a proud nation, built upon the pillars of faith, country, honor, freedom and..."Before Lord Oxidant could finish his speech, First Mate Tignor thrust the cutlass deep through Lord Oxidant's callous heart.  At the very moment, a lost and confused Boson's Mate Micklegal stumbled upon the swashbuckling duo a half seconds time before the fatal blow.  Boson's Mate Micklegal knelt down next to Lord Oxidant's lifeless body and retrieved a pouch of green tea leaves from his coat.  "From henceforth", Boson's Mate Micklegal decreed, "let this tea be known as "Anti-Oxidant Green Tea".  Oh that clever Boson's Mate Micklegal.Boson's Mate Micklegal followed First Mate Tignor to the rear wall, and helped as First Mate Tignor cut the restraints above the fair maiden's hands."My hero", the fair maiden cried, "I owe you my life kind sir, for I am Lady Jasmine, of Port Royal, daughter of Lord Sydney Olivier, Governor of Jamaica.""Well my lady", First Mate Tignor said as he tipped his hat and kneeled, "First Mate Tignor, of Portsmouth, England, at your service".  First Mate Tignor thrust his arms around Lady Jasmine and tossed her over his shoulder as she giggled. "Welcome to the H.M.S. Peregrine Cavendish, my lady", he chuckled, a wink in his eye.The crew rejoiced upon the deck of the H.M.S. Peregrine Cavendish.  The treasure at the Dutch Fort, or, that that remained of the treasure were a barrel of oranges, a few spices, and an odd fruit unfamiliar to us.  Boson's Mate Micklegal, his trusty kettle in hand, decided tea would be most proper.  He placed the Anti Oxidant green tea leaves into the kettle, and added the zest of the orange.  But Boson's Mate Micklegal believed the tea was missing something.  He placed the spice and the essence of the strange fruit into the kettle as well."What do you call this type of tea Boson's Mate Micklegal?", I asked, "It surely cannot be Earl Grey".  (As all fine Englishman know, that Earl Grey Tea, "The Earl", is the finest tea in His Majesty's empire, truly the tea of Kings.)Boson's Mate Micklegal glanced over at First Mate Tignor and Lady Jasmine.  "Well Captain, the fruit is called 'The Fruit of Passion', in honor of that", pointing at First Mate Tignor and Lady Jasmine.  "And the spice, well, that's Jasmine Spice Captain."  I gave Boson's Mate Micklegal a courteous smile.That night, in a sleepwalk, Boson's Mate Micklegal found a bottle of fine Glen Fiddych, stowed away in the hold, consumed it, and then set the oranges, fruit of passion, and Jasmine spice ablaze on the aft deck so that he could toast his baguette.  Oh well, such is life in the Lesser Antilles.I had forgotten of this deep and fruit infused tea for many years, until a fellow of mine brewed me a fine cup of Green Tea with Orange, Passionfruit and Jasmine made by the hacks at Lipton, that was spot on.  A lovely memory!
summary: Swashbuckling Adventures in the Lesser Antilles!

reviewText: They really got all the flavors right to accompany this green tea. It's slightly sweet, slightly spicy, aromatic, and just plain delicious! If you like fruit teas, I highly recommend this one!

I love to drink green tea after my first cup of coffee, when I want something warm but without a lot of caffeine, in addition green tea is supposed to be good for you and increase your metabolism.  I don't know if that is proven, but it couldn't hurt, right?  I have not bought flavored lipton tea before, and was surprised that they had a whole line of green teas.  This one so far is my favorite one.  It has a delicate flavor from orange, passionfruit and jasmine.  Though I normally drink this with no sweetener with honey would be lovely.  I have also used it to make iced tea, but since it brews light, I would probably add in a couple of regular lipton bags to get a darker brew and a more balanced taste for ice tea.Overall, a really nice tea for everyday.  Relaxing and tastes as good as it smells!

It also makes a good iced tea by itself or with a little agave nectar. I'd recommend buying this if you're just starting out with green tea and you're not sure what you like.
