Don't hesitate to give NuNaturals NuStevia a try!
summary: Wonderful Alternative to Sugar or Splenda

reviewText: I've never tasted the Stevia powders and the drink recipe I made only called for half a pack in a cup of green tea. Sure wish I had not added it because the entire drink went down the drain. The taste was so strong that I just could not get past it. Takes some getting used to but not for me.
Best stevia product I've bought!  It's sweet, but I love sweet.:-). Best part, no after taste.  Would recommend if you are trying to use less sugar.

This is not pure stevia. Buying stevia for the benefits is not what this product does. MALTODEXTRIN is the number one main ingredient and, by the way, stevia was added to it. I have been using pure stevia products for 20+ years and always read my ingredients. I wish companies would stop fooling people into believing they now have the miracle sweetener. Its just like making donuts and adding a touch of stevia!revised review bc. I had mixed up 5 star rating of another stevia product WHICH IS PURE STEVIA (and accidentally gave it a one star rating)THIS DESERVES a zero rating bc. it a product with the main ingredients being SUGAR with stevia added to it
summary: NOT PURE STEVIA, THE NUMBER 1 INGREDIENT IS MALTODEXTRINA

reviewText: We get this product because it is the best one we've found for the small amount needed and the taste- not bitter. We recommend it to all our readers-- [...]

I have tried almost every brand of stevia powder there is, and this is one of the best. It is one of only two I have found that do not leave a bitter aftertaste (the other is KAL).I am not particularly happy with the maltodextrin used in it, given the lack of knowledge about the source of same, but at least it is a small amount.While I prefer the pure stevia powder from KAL, this comes in handy packets, and KAL does not.

I wanted to change to a natural sweetener and knew that stevia would be a good choice.  But I hadn't found a good tasting one until Nustevia.  I use it in coffee and tea(hot or cold), oatmeal, fruit, yogurt and it tastes great. NO BITTER aftertaste!!  But what is up with the increase in price; almost doubled!!  I will still buy it because I really use it every day.

This natural very healthy sweetener is absolutely delicious in my morning English breakfast tea.  It doesn't have the  awful  off taste many alternative sweeteners  have. It is a great product.  I read it even helps with blood pressure issues.  :)
summary: Pure sweetness with no unpleasant flavor or after taste - Wonderful product

reviewText: A nutritionist recommended this brand of natural sweetener.  I use about two packets in a cup of iced coffee each morning with 1 and 1/2 cup almond milk and a heaping tablespoon of dark cocoa.  It makes a tasty and healthy iced coffee mocha drink.  Stevia has zero calories and is made from a South American herb the nutritionist said.  The Japanese have been using stevia in tea for years with no ill effects.I keep packets of this stevia in my purse for when I go to Starbucks and get a tall iced coffee with room in a Venti cup and add the stevia, lowfat milk and a couple of shakes of the chocolate they have there.  It's a delicious treat for $2.00 and change.  It tastes like their 400 calorie iced coffee mocha, but this drink is only about 100 calories as the stevia adds no calories.  If you're looking for a natural sweetener, this stevia is easy to carry with you.  I don't notice an after-taste - the cocoa, coffee and almond milk each have distinct and strong flavors.  It's great with a flavored coffee like a French Vanilla coffee or Hazelnut coffee, too.I also put a little of this stevia on oatmeal to sweeten it. It is sweeter than sugar so add to taste.  It also has a powdery texture instead of a more granular texture.  It dissolves easily in drinks.
I am using my second container of Stevia. I use it in cereal and coffee. It takes very little and makes food and drink taste just sweet enough.

If you are looking for a sweetener that is delicious in tea, Stevia can be used to sweeten hot or cold tea. You can almost say goodbye to regular sugars in your drinks once you get a taste for the Stevia powder.Unlike artificial sweeteners, Stevia is never bitter and won't leave a nasty aftertaste in your mouth. The packets are easy to carry with you and you may even notice you have less cravings for sugary foods.By using a low calorie (0 Calories) sweetener with only 1 gram of carbs, you will be ahead of the game. Every single time you use one packet of Stevia, you are using less sugar and you won't even miss it.~The Rebecca Review

I don't like using artificial sweeteners because of the chemicals and because they don't taste good. I am a caregiver for my diabetic dad, and once I discovered this product I was hooked, except that it is hard to find where I live. When I found it at Amazon I put it on auto ship so I don't run out.  The price has gone up a lot since I first found it on Amazon, however, it still costs more in stores if and when I can find it there. I make limeade with this which I keep on hand at all times. In a gallon container of water I add 1 cup of lime juice and 2tbsp. of stevia powder. It is refreshing and almost no calories and no chemical aftertaste.  My dad uses the stevia in his coffee and his oatmeal. I haven't tried cooking with it although I know they make one designed for baking, which I'll possibly try this winter.

Something has changed drastically for the worse.  You need a lot more of this product to attain the same sweetness, plus now it is bitter.  All in my last couple of canisters.  Looks like from other reviews that the product has been changed.  Too bad!  Used to be a great product!----------------------------------------------------------OLD REVIEWHave tried a few stevia powders and liquids - this one seems to lack some of the bitterness that others left in my mouth.  The powder is convenient.  Price on amazon is cheaper than my local health food store which carries it for $23.99 and Wegman's which carries it for $19.99.  Despite liking this for cold drinks and sweetening yogurt and the such, I am still not a fan of this in warm drinks (coffee, tea, cocoa) and taste a bitterness there.  My husband doesn't have the same experience that I do with warm drinks and says it is just fine.
summary: Used to be My favorite stevia - Now blek!

reviewText: Great product. Pure stevia... not that stuff that is 50/50.Concentrated so use just a little.I buy it in bulk, 5 pounds at a time.

Quite some time back I did a 'taste test' of stevia products. This one won! A packet of this equals 2 of Truvia and tastes better. It is not bitter- we LOVE it! I get those packets to have in my purse at restaurants, or any time I'm away from home. I get this one for at home filling of our 'sugar bowl'. A little goes a long way and we recommend it to everyone! I can't imagine using anything else.

NuStevia's White Stevia powder is amazing!  I have been on a low-carb diet for the last year and have lost 27 lbs, and NuStevia products were a big help with the success of my diet.  I love sweet things, and without them I don't think I'd have been able to stay on the low-carb diet.  I have been unable to eat sugar for a long, long while.  I had previously switched to natural sweeteners like honey and agave, but when I discovered they were not on the low-carb diet I'd switched to, I had to find something else to use as a substitute.  NuStevia products are what I chose.  I tried several other types of stevia, but NuStevia products seem to be the best so far.  The bitter aftertaste associated with most stevia products is almost completely absent from NuStevia products.NuStevia white stevia powder is super sweet, so you'll have to use it sparingly, and one bottle lasts a very long time.I'm very happy with the product and will be buying it again and again.

I discovered this product a couple of years ago and really liked the taste in coffee , tea and on fruit and oatmeal.  It was a lot less expensive in the packets then, but I've switched to the large 12 oz. container and the price is very good. I don't use sugar and this helps me have the "sweet" and not the increased blood sugar-YEAH!!

I tasted this product at a friend's house. I had to use a lot more of it than I do with pure stevia, and I realized why when I examined the product label and researched information on the product on the NuNaturals website. This product is mostly maltodextrin. This is what is stated in the product information from NuNaturals: "Add NuStevia to sweeten your favorite food or beverage, 1/4 tsp is as sweet as 1 tsp of sugar. For recipes, 4 tbs [1/4 cup] is as sweet as 1 cup of sugar."Pure stevia powder is presumed to be 200 times as sweet as sugar. Individual perceptions of sweetness may vary, but I personally find the best brands of pure stevia to be about 40 times as sweet as sugar. Given that the stevia powder used in this product is at best, per the company's own admission, only about 4 times as sweet as sugar, that means that this product is only about one-tenth stevia.For my own consumption, I much prefer to purchase100% pure stevia powder. I'm not a fan of maltodextrin mixed with stevia, and certainly not of natural flavors added to any food I consume which are, for reasons unknown, added to this product. I explain what those ingredients are below.Ingredients: Maltodextrin, stevia extract and natural flavors. Free of soy, MSG, yeast, gluten, wheat, milk, synthetics, artificial colors or flavors, preservatives, saccharin, aspartame, sucralose, or artificial sweeteners.Maltodextrin: This is a food additive that is either without taste or slightly sweet. It is commonly used in the processed-food industry as a thickener or filler, to improve the texture and appearance in processed food. As a relatively cheap ingredient, it can also add more bulk to a given product, thereby increasing profits for the company using it. In the U.S., most of the time it is derived from rice, corn, or potato starch. Through a process called hydrolysis, the starch is reduced to its basic amino acids. Then an enzyme is used to break it down even further, resulting in a powder that instantly dissolves in water. Products such as jams and powdered substances which contain maltodextrin are required by law to say "wheat" in the the nutrition labeling if the maltodextrin is derived from wheat.Natural Flavor: The definition of natural flavor under the Code of Federal Regulations is: "The essential oil, oleoresin, essence or extractive, protein hydrolysate, distillate, or any product of roasting, heating or enzymolysis, which contains the flavoring constituents derived from a spice, fruit or fruit juice, vegetable or vegetable juice, edible yeast, herb, bark, bud, root, leaf or similar plant material, meat, seafood, poultry, eggs, dairy products, or fermentation products thereof, whose significant function in food is flavoring rather than nutritional" (21CFR101.22). That essentially means that natural flavor is derived from a real food, but the process by which it is derived is unexplained and there is no way to know how safe or healthy a natural flavoring is.

I keep buying this brand because it has no aftertaste, I use it everyday in coffee, tea, oatmeal....  I have a sweet tooth so I use it a lot. i really wanted the Pure Extract ($99.00 no fillers)  in this size but is out of stock everywhere I looked.  The pure extract would last me well over a year.  This version lasts me about 3 months.  As long as the price stays reasonable,  I'll continue to buy until I get my hands on the Pure Extract of this brand in this size.  I give 3 stars because I think fillers should mean cheap price.
I HAVE BEEN USING NUSTEVIA FOR OVER 10 YEARS AND I REALLY LIKE IT.  IT TASTES LIKE SUGAR BUT NO CALORIES AND NO AFTER TASTE.  IT IS A NATURAL HERB. I BUY IT FROM AMAZON.
I have tried all the different sugar substitutes and this one is the best tasting and the best for you.
This stevia is perfect. It's so sweet you only need a little bit, so the cannister lasts a long time. Tastes great, no aftertaste.
summary: Love this stuff- So much I ordered again

reviewText: This is a more concentrated form of stevia.  I love that it comes in this big of a size.  I put a little less than half a teaspoon on my oatmeal each morning and that is more than enough.  I've been experimenting with substituting it for sugar in dessert recipes.  It seems like if I use about 1/6 the amount of this stevia for the required sugar it is about right.
summary: Way better than what you can find in the supermarket

reviewText: I started using this stevia about a year ago and was really impressed.  I just finished my last bottle from the old formula and started this new one I had just ordered - YUK.  It has an aftertaste like aspartame (and I should know, I've used artificial sweeteners for 40 years).  The only thing I would recommend about this product is for Nunaturals to change back to their old formula.  I'm already looking for a new brand to try and won't wait until I finish this one which was a waste of good money.
This is a great sweetener for coffee and cereal. It takes very little. I have it in my monthly Subscribe and Save delivery.

I drink a lot of coffee and was using way too much sugar. Being pre-diabetic, I had to find a sugar-free sweetener.  Unfortunately most of them have chemicals in them that have attracted a lot of bad press.  What to do?  On the recommendation of one of my doctors I tried stevia, Nustevia in particular.  Once I learned the proper portion control (it just takes a little to imitate the sweetness of sugar) I was able to avoid the bitterness of trying to use too much.  Nustevia is all we use now.I have tried the store brands of stevia and can say with no reservation that even though they are cheaper, they lack the same potency as Nustevia.  In fact, I'm willing to bet that if you used the amount of store brand that it takes to equal the same taste as Nustevia provides, you would use so much of the store brand that it would actually cost you more.Caution:  Over time the potency tends to decrease. Be careful when opening a new container--it will only take a fraction of the sweetener that the old container required.
summary: Just Like Porsche--THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTE

reviewText: Really liked the taste of this sweetener and it dissolved instantly with no lumping what-so-ever.  However, I'm trying to stay away from maltodextrin which this product contains, so I switched to Truvia
So I think this salt is fine, but maybe my palate is terrible.  It is fine sea salt, but cannot tell the difference over other quality sea salts.

I ordered this because Martha Stewart spoke so highly of it.  I am reviewing it, not from its mineral component, but from it's application to my food.  My favorite, most practical form of natural salt is Pink Himalayan salt.  I think it is called a "finishing salt."  The Maldon Flaked Sea Salt would be useful  applying it to the tops of homemade rolls before baking them.  It holds up as well as Kosher salt but is smaller, flatter size.  I like that about it. I don't anticipate ever running out of this 8.5 oz. purchase.Martha and I don't always agree, I guess.

because of the shape of the crystals makes it is difficult to get a even spread. Some parts of your steak are saltier than others. It does have a nice crunch but the taste is not so special, to my buds anyway. I prefer French Grey Salt for taste and since it is a fine grain it can be 'applied' evenly. Not to mention the price 17 bucks for 5 lbs delivered.
This salt has given every dish that I finished it with an extra pop.  I was skeptical but it's worth the price.
summary: This salt was worth the price

reviewText: This item features large crystals of salt. When adding to this to any meal, it is best to pour the right amount because a normal intake of salt might be too much in this case. That said, this Sea Salt has nutritious value that rivalsSayulita Sea Salt - Organic Coarse - 16 oz - by RealGoodSalt.  You will be getting a lot of salt from this product, and you will find out that this item is long lasting.

I love Maldon salt. I discovered it when we visited England and had carefully hoarded my box until my daughter, when visiting England brought me back a box.Maldon salt is large square bowls of salt mixed with big broken chunks, perfect for on top of bread or vegetables.This box will last a very long time making it a very affordable luxury.

Crunch, mouth-watering, with just the right size and consistency of flakes. Turns simple bread and butter (and countless other things) into gourmet, in an instant. At least that's what my family says :DEither way, we love them and use them as often as we can. Highly recommended. Foodies, this is a must have if it's not already in your pantry.
summary: Hands down our favorite flaked sea salt

reviewText: These are soy sauce flavored rice crackers with a Nori (seaweed) wrap.  I did not care for them ( altho I like what its made of this just was not my kind of snack)  but my husband likes them a lot.  I gave them to him to take to work and snack on, he shared some with his employees to taste, the bag is resealable too which is nice to keep them fresh.  I would but these again for my husband!

When I was in cooking class a few years ago, my teacher, Chef (it was required that we call him that, or else we'd fail the class), brought these crackers to class to share with all the students. Since the majority of the class was of spanish decent, a few of the students had a hard time swallowing these down, me included.I was raised with mostly land critters in my diet, so eating these were kinda like being kicked in the mouth by a fish, even though these have no fish in them. They're strong and briny, and kinda sweet too...I do have to admit though, these are addicting, once you get over the "fishy" taste.

If you like Japanese rice crackers like I do, this is a must have. It's fat free, contains nutrition-rich seaweed, and is a crunchy, satisfying snack that will appeal to all but finicky kids. But it might be rather expensive for some.

I like the taste of seaweed, so this was a good snack to have. The rice crackers seem to be lightly coated with soy sauce or something; they were definitely savory.I had some of these with soup instead of traditional crackers, and they were a fun and delicious addition.The price is outrageous, though. I can't bring myself to buy these again just because you don't get much for the amount you pay.
The taste/flavor is some too strong and some people may not like them, make take some time to adjust to that. In all actuality I won't buy anymore but wanted to try them.
Somehow i didnt feel it was as good as the ones I had when I was in Taiwan. But still pretty good.
I love asian rice crackers and I love seaweed. This snack is a combination of both- great taste and flavor. Recommend !

I have never opened a bag of Nori Maki Arare without finishing it off in one sitting. High on carbs, higher on kick-butt texture (super crunchy, fresh & crisp) and flavor. Just enough soy sauce to season the crackers with roasted, crisp seaweat hugging each one. The flavor is to die for.

We just got back from our monthly visit to our local Japanese fish market that luckily carries a plethora of quality Japanese pre-prepared items, including this one.  On each trip we always get a couple of jars.  We sprinkle it on regular rice, soups, vegetables and cucumber salads to add a sou san of oceanic flavor.  There is not any fish in this product; just sesame seeds, salt, seaweed and a bit of sugar.  Certainly low fat with a lot of satisfying taste factor built in.  The cost of this at our market is $2.29.  If you don't have a Japanese market near you, this is a good source for you to purchase and enjoy this product.
summary: Seaweed Seasoning that can spice up all kinds of dishes, not just Japanese

reviewText: I sent this to my husband, who is deployed overseas, for his room. He says that he uses this all time for meal time when he's not at the chow hall. If he's happy then I'm happy.

I've been wanting to try Furikake (Rice Seasoning) and i'm glad I came across this one~It tastes so good, it's both sweet and salty and you can totally taste the seaweed. :DI can't eat my rice without it! I quickly finished off my bottle and had to order more. XDI can't wait to try the other kinds.
summary: Oh My Gosh I Love This Stuff~

reviewText: My kids are crazy about this stuff and sprinkle it on just about everything. It adds a nice taste to popcorn, rice, or tofu. I wouldn't be without it in my kitchen.

reviewerName: Lewis Bailey "I see what you did there."
reviewText: This product was fine quality-wise but I am writing this for other food-adventurers who like to try new things: this product is about 50% nori flakes.  Rather than a seasoning with just a hint of nori to it (what I was hoping for), this is nori with other seasonings (and all I could taste was the bitter nori).If you love nori (or sushi) then read other reviews to decide whether or not this is for you
summary: If you do not love Nori (seaweed), this is not for you

reviewText: Took a chance on this and am very happy with it.  Mix is excellent and smells great even before going in the food.

I love earl grey tea and enjoy the specialty earl grey teas but also like a plain earl grey without too much bitterness. This tea is perfect for that. Even if I make it strong it's not bitter. The only think against it is that there are lots of really small particles that don't get filtered in my tea maker and leave lots of little pieces in the bottom of my cup. Some of the premium brands have larger leaves and don't leave as many small pieces. The price was great compared to T...... and some other premium brands. I'll order this again.
summary: It's earl grey tea without any off flavors

reviewText: I'm so glad I found this tea, because it's one of the most enjoyable I've tried. It's smooth and bold taste is just to my liking.

I don't drink coffee and never have.  I enjoy trying new teas.  So to be honest I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but I took a chance and ordered it anyway.It arrived yesterday and I couldn't wait to try it.  I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED.  It has a wonderful flavor and has to be the smoothest tea I have ever tried.  Needless to say I will be ordering this again.
It's good. But, I didn't notice anything special but I suppose it's a good thing. I'll buy more when it's on sale again.

Since I hate teabags, I purchased a large tea ball from Amazon to make fresh tea. If you ever make tea from tea leaves, you never go bag to tea bags. I pitched my teabags. Being a immigrant, this tea reminds me of Europe.

Although I am primarily a coffee drinker, when I want a cup of tea Lapsong Souchong is my choice.  Taylors 4.41 ounce box is reasonably priced, and has the smoky flavor I want.  I am definitely a repeat customer of this product.

Let me start by saying that I'm a lifelong tea drinker, I love tea, I have the stained teeth to prove it, and I've tried all sorts.I started out years ago with Lipton's before all these different designer brands and flavors came along. Black Ceylon tea was what they called it. Then when all these designer brands and flavors came out I tried all the exotic flavors I could get my hands on, mango, vanilla, raspberry, chocoloate, peach, whatever. I tried different brands, I tried expensive teas, cheap teas, organic teas, the standards such as Earl Grey, Darjeeling, Assam, etc.Finally, I came back to this tea. It was like travelling around the world in a circle and coming back to the start. I love this tea because I've found all that other stuff, apple, peach, raspberry, just detracts from the true flavor of tea. This tea is just pure tea, without any other distracting flavors and that's what I love about it. A stong tea, a robust tea with full strong flavor, for a man (or a manly woman).When I make it just right, the right temperature, the right strength, this is what I imagine Homer's nectar of the gods to be like. It's like Zeus brews me a cup, hands it over and says "here, drink this".Sometimes, I drink Earl Grey, sometimes I drink other flavored teas, but when I want plain tea, I drink this. So far I have not been able to find another unadulterated tea with such a full and strong flavor. A 10/10.Another great thing about loose leaf tea is that you can drink as much or as little as you want. Recently, I found that I was drinking too much tea (blasphemy!) and cut back by drinking 1/2 cups each time. You can't really do that with tea bags, but you can do it with loose leaf.

I found this tea to very forgiving and didn't get bitter with overbrewing like some other teas which can have a bitter taste. Sometimes I don't have time to watch the time so then I choose this tea.Nice Flavor.
summary: This tea is very smooth. No Harshness

reviewText: Very good quality, clean strong flavor. 5 mins can be a bit strong for me. Love with milk and a biscuit.

...and I realized it's not weak; it's smooth. The farther into the cup I got, the more I was won over. This will be one of my most-consumed teas. It arrived today and already I'm on my second cup, with no slow down in sight. I recommend using two *heaping* teaspoons per cup.It would be nice if Amazon would offer this size as a stand-alone item that can be ordered without having to order it as an add-on. I am not a fan of the add-on restrictions, and I'd gladly pay shipping if Amazon would allow it.
summary: At first sip, I thought it was too weak...then, another sip...

reviewText: I am now using the slightly more costly Blend No. 2 which brews a bit more slowly.  I prefer it over the chopped tea that slips through my diffuser.

I love lime perrier but it is very expensive so I thought I would give this a shot. It is super- fizzy - more like Perrier than Poland or the Store Brand. Lime flavor is very subtle - not over-the-top and not artificial tasting at all. No weird aftertaste. I am not thrilled that it is in a can but it is very convenient - perfect size for single serving or to pack with your lunch. Price on amazon with the subscribe and save discount is insanely good. Will reorder.
summary: As sparkly as the more expensive brands

reviewText: Since I have lime and Meyer Lemon trees, I bought the "plain" unflavored cans.Don't waste your money!FD:  I spend a month a year in Italy; was married to a half Italiana for 28 years, and lived with a primera generacion Italiana for 8 years.
This is bascally like regular seltser water. the lemon taste is so sublime, that its barely noticable. Wish it came is glass bottles but very good product none-the-less.

Surprised that these eight packs are perfect for the fridge. They come in packs of three from Amazon and some of the best wrapped as well. The TASTE: no sodium. No calories. Great taste! I drink the plain and really enjoy the 'bubbles'.

We are new to Hansen's Sparkling Water, but we really love it.  Each flavor has a clean taste and a moderate amount of fizz.  That way, you don't feel like you're drinking soda, more like....well, natural sparkling water.  We love the flavor and love having a great way to pull away from the sugary sodas.  Having tasted a few of Hansen's flavors in the Sparkling Water, we are now big fans.  PS:  getting these delivered in auto shipments from Amazon is THE BEST!

I love this because it has no sweeteners whatsoever. It's difficult to find sparkling water that has no artificial flavors or sweeteners, so I settled on this one. It's really, really fizzy and doesn't quickly lose its fizz. If you leave it out for a few hours, then it will, but you can still drink it; it doesn't turn bad like some of them. I order five separate orders of these (not just 5 in one order) so that I can get the 15 percent subscribe and save discount. That makes them much cheaper than Sprouts at 2.99 a six pack. It's like getting five cans free. Good value.

Hansen's sparkling water is one of my favorites.  My local grocery stores do not carry it - very pleased to find it here.  I generally use the amount of sodium as a guide to whether I will probably like a particular brand of sparkling water. Talking Rain and Hansen's both have 0mg of sodium and they taste good to me.  Crystal Geyser and Trader Joe's sparkling water have 35mg of sodium and I don't like them. Hope that helps!
We use these for mixed drinks and Italian Sodas! They are perfect for both, and a great price. We put them on subscribe and save so we never run out!
summary: Delicious for a mixer, great price

reviewText: I love this sparkling water; sometimes I drink it as is, and sometimes I mix in a 1/4 cup of juice.  It has been perfect way to wean me of those sugar loaded drinks.  It has a lot of carbination that feels good in the mouth and throat.  I am hooked, that is why I bought more!.  I do buy it 2 cases at a time so there is no damage in shipping.
apparently i'm addicted to these little buggers. sucks. and, I hope no one finds out or they'll raise the prices.
Lemon flavor is not so good, too tangy.The Lime one is much better. Waiting for the Berry to come back in stock!
Arrived on time . I love the taste and will be ordering it again.Does not leave a after taste.I'm happy I tried it.
But the cans are very soft aluminum and they get beat up in transportation easily. I've had a number of cans that were without bubbles because of this denting.
Faint taste of lemon, not over powering.  Very refreshing and an over all enjoyable drink.  Price is what sold me though will buy again.

It's not spring water, not mineral water, just seltzer. I like to drink it because it gives me the same satisfaction as soda pop but without all the sugar and other bad ingredients. And recently there's been reports that it's at least not harmful, and maybe even beneficial, so . . . drink up!
This is my favorite natural sparkling water.  The taste is great, and no artificial favors.  If you are concerned by being organic or GMO free, then this is a good brand to try.

I figured sooner or later there would be a Tazo tea I did not like.  It has an overly sweet, artificial taste to it.  I got past the blood red color and really wanted to like this tea.  Will be giving this to a friend who may like it more.  Luckily, I only paid $2.99 for a box of 20 at my local Homegoods who had lots of Tazo, Mightly Leaf and other brands on display from 2.99 - 5.99.
summary: Will be givning this away - artificial taste

reviewText: This tea has a strong, artificial orange flavor.  It tastes like Tang seriously.  If you haven't tried Tang, take orange candy and dip it in a cup of water.  Tazo must have been very unmotivated when it created this flavor.  Maybe kids will like it.

Sharp orange flavor with a tolerable spearmint taste. I've tried many of the less expensive brands and haven't liked any other except this one and Good Seasons Tuscany. I'm not crazy about all of the Tazo drinks, but this one is nice. I love drinking this tea with chocolate. It comes in an orange package. You can also smell the other spices. Don't make the mistake I make, by adding too much water. As with many products, amazon is over charging.
Tazo Calm is tasty and soothing, the perfect ending to the day!  Individually packaged bags in a easy to open box

Zen brews up to an golden amber liquor.  The aroma is sweet spearmint.  The blending of this tea is excellent--spearmint could be overpowering but they use just the right amount of it.  Slightly sweet spearmint is the primary flavor, then you taste a hint of lemon.  The green tea provides an herbal base for these two flavors that makes the intial impression of zesty spearmint and lemon modulate into a substantial potion.  Very nice and satisfying with a clean spearmint aftertaste.Remember that this tea does have caffeine--however, it does not say how much on the box.  A good estimate might be 30 mg--compared to 90mg for the average cup of coffee.  Make sure you time how long you brew this tea because if you brew too long it becomes bitter.  Four minutes is ample.
summary: Zesty spearmint and lemon are modulated by green tea into a substantial potion!

reviewText: I made the mistake of thinking this product was minus SLS.  Otherwise, the product does as it states.  It definitely leaves my teeth clean, my tongue has become more pink since using it (I use inhalers for asthma which causes the surface to turn white - yeast).  Anyway, when this is gone I will try another Neem toothpaste when I find one without harmful chemicals.  Yeah, yeah, I know, I am using it.  I bought it and can't bring myself to toss it.

I am so happy to have discovered this toothpaste.  It contains neem, which, I heard, is a derivative from a certain type of tree, and that people in India and Africa chew on the tree bark for their dental hygiene, and don't have to worry about dental visits.  Of course, this is only what I heard; I have not been to India or Africa to witness this, but it does make sense.  I heard that neem naturally heals, protects, and takes care of dental needs.  I heard that it does both healing and preventive maintenace.  I used up the entire tube and I love it.This toothpaste is a product of India.  It says "Natural and nature derived ingredients", "Natural protection for strong teeth and healthy gums", "Complete Care" (but I still use floss), "Prevents cavities", "Long lasting freshness", "Strengthens teeth and gums", and "100% Vegetarian".I have paid a fortune in dental bills for both myself and my kids.  I've kept those dentists in business.  Therefore, I have paid my dues, and I deserve something that will possibly cut down on dental bills.I am a "natural" person, and I will never go back to regular toothpaste.

After reading other reviews, I decided to give this item a try. As other reviewers noted, it does help with the overall health of your gums and the tissue in the mouth. I get ulcers easily and this seems to help them heal quickly and I have even noticed I do not get ulcers as easily nor do I experience sensitivity to cold products like I usually do due to having several crowns. Also, my teeth feel cleaner after brushing than with any other toothpaste that I have ever used. I have not been using this product very long but so far, I have been very impressed with the almost immediate results that I have experienced. If there are any negatives in the future, I will update this post but so far I am thrilled with Neem Active Toothpaste.
summary: Wow! Neem toothpaste works great for me!

reviewText: You know you are getting the worst of worst when you see so many excellent reviews written about a product that when you visit their Internet site, instead of spelling out the ingredients, publishes ***Following content is provided by Henkel India Ltd. Henkel India Ltd. has become a Jyothy Laboratories Ltd company. Henkel does not assume any responsibility for the content of this page.***Read the side effects, Canadian warning link which is posted in the comment section. This toothpaste is from India. Everyone I know, takes US made toothpaste to Asia but Amazon is trying to sell us a toothpaste from India while Canada has issued a warning. What a joke. I use neem for killing bugs in my garden since it is a great pesticide in natural form but not for internal use and don't forget, produced in India.

I have a HEAVY history since childhood of dental problems with root canals and bleeding gums and currently gingivitis as my main problem. I don't brush everyday (yeah, like I actually want to admit it!) and have always brushed with mainstream brands like Crest, Colgate's, Aim, etc.One month, I had to go to the dentist to get my root canal cleaned and the dentist said I would likely have to come back in 3 months because of another root canal problem and would likely have to lose another tooth.  Then a week later while shopping for indian food in an indian grocery, they also had neem toothpaste (which I had never heard of) made in India for Indians with the Indian grocery owner SWEARING that Indians rarely go to dentists because their #1 protection is brushing with neem.  I've been brushing with neem toothpaste ever since then.  Well, it's been OVER 2 YEARS and I still haven't had to go back to the dentist.  Neem in the toothpaste certainly is my DENTAL SAVIOR.  The toothpaste has mint flavor added to freshen the breath but it has a garlicky taste/smell (because of the neem) but i'm more than willing to brush with it rather than having anymore wasteful painful/time-consuming/expensive dental visits.  I no longer use any of the mainstream toothpastes like Crest, Colgate, Aim, etc. and am either thinking of throwing them away or donating them to charity.  Toothpastes with neem are definitely worth the $$$'s!!  Neem is also used regularly in skin and hair products and give better results (with lotions, oils, soaps, shampoo, etc. for conditions such as lice, fleas, dandruff, eczema, etc.) compared to our American mainstream products.I don't know why our mainstream researchers and/or dental companies don't talk about neem.  At (...) is one link of research on neem for dentistry.  I guess it's more profitable for them to keep us hooked on putting our "dental lives" on fluoride and having to go back to pay $$$'s for more dental visits and more dental products than it is to let people know there are better foreign products out there used by other just as intelligent humans in far off lands. We Americans call our society advanced but when I compare our society with societies like India where the people have a LONG history for THOUSANDS of years of rarely needing dentists/doctors because they have learned through experience what herbs and other natural products will help them medically, then I begin to realize how greedy profit-driven, short-sighted, arrogant, blind, narcisstic and  more importantly FALLIBLE our society's mainstream "science" and "medicine" is.-------------UPDATE: I've been using the non-SLSHerbal Toothpaste Cardamon-Fennel 4.16 OuncesAT THE SAME TIME ON EVERY TOOTHBRUSHING withTrader Joe's Antiplaque Toothpaste with Fennel, Propolis & Myrrhfor over a month to increase my anti-cavity/anti-plaque/gum healing protection and I've got to say that my mouth has never tasted/felt fresher and cleaner and I FOR SURE know I don't need to go to any dentist (no gum bleeding, no pain in my gums/teeth) and the toothpastes together are not as abrasive as when I use Desert Essence Natural Tea Tree Oil and Neem Toothpaste with either one. The problem I had with Auromere's toothpaste was because it had no SLS, it was hard to spread it in all the corners of my mouth on every tooth but when I added Trader Joe's Myrrh propolis toothpaste, the spreading was better. So in the 2 combinations of toothpaste, everytime I brush my teeth, I know my teeth and gums are protected by:-neem (which helps prevent plaque with antimicrobial properties which can treat periodontal disease and reverse gingivitis)-and other healing herbsand from theTrader Joe's Antiplaque Toothpaste with Fennel, Propolis & Myrrh, I know my teeth and gums are protected by:-myrrh (which helps fight infection of mouth and gums. Has a stimulating effect on the gums)-and propolis which is a sticky substance gathered by bees from the leaf buds of trees and plastered over hives for strength which is also an antibiotic and antiseptic that helps fight infections of the throat and mouth and speeds healing of gums. It contains traces of minerals vital to teeth, bones and connective tissues.)
summary: no more dental visits for me!

reviewText: Just tried this Neem toothpaste for the first time.  Love the taste and how clean my mouth feels.  I have gum and bone decay issues which cause really bad breath.  This tastes so clean and it's a long lasting clean feeling.  I hope it slows the bacterial and decay issues and controls my bad breath too.  I will post an update after prolonged use.

It's hard to get excited about toothpaste, but I'm impressed with the taste, texture and performance of this product.  After only a couple days, I can tell this will be the toothpaste I use from now on.
The natural bacteria protection from Neem leaves my mouth and gum tissue feeling refreshed and healthy.  I reorder often and appreciate the natural ingredients without the toxic fluoride.

The taste of this coffee candy is terrific - not too sweet, not too strong, just perfect.The amount you get in this $5+ package is 32 candies. Each candy is the size of 3 nickels stacked on top of each other.  Total weight of all candies in this package is 4.23 oz (120 grams).The taste met my expectation, the amount of candies I received did not.Update: Kopiko candy inspired me to investigate other Asian Coffee Candies. If you like Kopiko I recommend that you also tryBali's Best Coffee Candy, 5.3-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12).Bali's Best has a slight stronger coffee taste compared to Kopiko Cappuccino flavor, and just slightly sweeter.  Both are fine candy, but Bali's Best is a much better deal.  See my review of Bali's Best Coffee Candy for details.
summary: Taste is fabulous, amount you get not so much

reviewText: Kopiko has a smooth feel with no hard edges or bubbles and excellent flavor until the very last little piece is left. That's somewhat rare in a hard candy. It isn't bitter or fruity or smokey or too sweet, just flavorful coffee and milk in perfect balance.I personally don't drink much coffee so this suits my tastes very well. I likeUnited - Coffee Candy (5.35 Oz.)as well, it has a nice balanced character.
I don't normally drink coffee, but I absolutely love this product! It's sweet, but with the bitter undertones of coffee, and I just can't get enough of it!

I love both these and the regular coffee flavor.  Absolutely delicious.  Best coffee candies I've found so far.  Tres yummy!Each candy is individually wrapped, so they stay fresh.  You might find them cheaper locally, but they are sometimes hard to find, so glad to see them here.
These candies are absolutly great. So why do I ask you not to buy them? It is a warning, these are addicting.
These are wonderful.  I wish the Cappuccino would come in a bigger container.  They have a great taste especially if you like Cappuccino coffee.
I love these they taste just like a cup of coffee, they go quick because of how small they are, and other people I gave them to actually liked them and said, "these are good"!
If you enjoy hard candy and love the taste of coffee this is the sweet for you.  Great tasting candy.

As per the reviews I bought one bag of the Cappuccino.  I'm pretty demanding when it comes to taste especially with coffee.  These have great taste rich and robust without being overly sweet or aggressive.  A new addition to my "must haves".

reviewerName: Patricia "A very happy grandmother of 4, who ...
reviewText: This style of Kopiko coffee candy was too sweet for me, but that's no surprise since I don't drint cappuccinos for the same reason.  If your tastes are like mine, try the Kopiko Coffee candy.  It's not as sweet.
I absolutely love these candies. I'd keep them on hand to share with friends always if only I knew where to buy them locally.

There are a lot of Chili Sauces that I like, and it really depends on what I want to use it for, but when it comes to cooking, this is the stuff. I add it to any meat to make stir-fry, chili con carne, Thai dishes, burritos, etc. It's wonderfully versatile and can be used anywhere that garlic and chilies are appropriate. One of the reasons it's so perfect for cooking is because it's not all heat. You can add a good tablespoon of this to a dish and really mix it in without killing it. With, say,Dave's Insanity Ghost Peppersauce you get lots of heat in a few drops, which can lead to uneven flavor in the dish.

This is got to be the most addicting sauce I have ever tried. Just the right balance of garlic and heat without being overpowering, and it goes well with just about everything. The flavor remains pleasantly on the lips.I have to buy two jars at a time just to make sure I don't run out.

Great stuff-great price-shipped right to my door.  If you dont live in a area where the stores are packed with options this one is worth a try for sure. Nice fresh flavor and convenience.  A real recipe changer with fresh zip and flavor-fresh fresh fresh.
summary: Yummy-dont know what else to add :)

reviewText: I grew up with this chili garlic sauce. My parents would usually use another familiar Huy Fong productSrirachafor our foods. This Chili Garlic sauce is a whole another level. It is like dog treats for humans. It adds a lot to any dish, whether it's rice, chicken, pork, noodles, etc. The ingredients are mostly natural, which is a plus.Pick a jar up if you haven't already. It is truly a spicy treat.
summary: Savory spicy sauce - a must have for any kitchen

reviewText: Was trying to figure out the difference between this and sriracha. The key differences are that the chili garlic sauce has no sugar and big, visible chili seeds, whereas sriracha is smooth like ketchup.  So I've made my decision.Really spicy.  Good stuff :)
summary: Better than sriracha because no sugar!

reviewText: Just tried this in a new soup recipe with the miracle noodles and it was soooo good! Use just 1 tsp on a serving, it is very hot!

If you like Asian food, and you like it HOT, this is just the ticket for you.Also good in curries and cajun dishes.Use it to stir fry shrimp, chicken, or beef, or just use it like you would anycondiment like salsa or Tabasco sauce. Amazing flavor, and trust me, this stuffis hot. About a 7 on a scale of 10. Tremendous garlic and hot chili flavor, willmake you discover cooking all over again! This will perk up any Chinese takeout,and its even good in Hot n' Sour Soup! Its very thick, almost like a paste so alittle bit goes a long way. Sells locally here for around $3. 5 Pods

I just tried this out for the first time, and I am going to make it a permanent part of my flavoring arsenal. It is strong/potent, so use it sparingly. This is a great option for anyone who wants to avoid the sugar content of the more famous 'Rooster Sauce'.
How did I ever live without this.  Between this, chipotle powder, and Cholula, I need not other hot seasonings.  Very handy.

Received this about a week ago and I have already used it in tacos, black beans and rice, salsa and Chinese stir fried chicken and vegetables. The primary ingredients are chili, salt, garlic and distilled vinegar. It does contain preservatives, namely potassium sulfate and sodium bisulfite so if you are allergic to sulfites you might want to avoid this sauce. Be forewarned that it is very potent so a little goes a long way. As with any spice, just add a little at a time until you reach the amount of heat that is right for you. I can't wait to mix a bit in with my pizza sauce. It is a five star sauce but I deducted a star because I think it is rather pricey.

I should have bought a gallon of this. I shared some with my 90 yr old mother and she likes it a lot too. Both of us cook, and like to play with our imaginations when we cook. Next time I buy I'll buy more... its a winner
This is a very tasty product but way overpriced on line.  The sauce is readily available at most markets at a much lower price (much lower).

Very tasty. Have been experimenting with it. Even basted pork chops on the grill with it.  Put some in the bottom of the frypan while making an omelet and was very surprised on the good flavor it gave the eggs. If you try the omelet thing remember that if the frypan is very hot it will cause a lot of spitting and such when it hits the pan, so be careful. Finding lots of ways to use this, glad I tried it out.  Not expensive either.

If you are going gluten free and you want to eat asain this is an EXCELLENT alternative! I think it tastes and cooks the same, and it is great that it isn't GMO. And the price is reasonable. Tamari sauce seems to be more expensive! We have also tried the coconut aminos and like those too. Great for those who are avoiding soy! Coconut aminos are more expensive though!

The product is wonderful, but I should have read the reviews first. My shipment came in the correct sized box with each bottle individually bubble-wrapped. However, all three bottles had broken seals and had leaked. Although it should be safe to consume, it seriously decreases its shelf life! I see now, I m not the only person that has experienced this.
this works great with Braggs Apple Cider Vinegar in my dressings. also use it as a marinade for veggies on the grill. I love all Braggs Products.
summary: best soy sauce alternative out there you can't go wrong with All Braggs Products. I use this a lot to make homemade salad.dress.

reviewerName: Clark Isaacs "Clark's Eye on Books by Clark I...
reviewText: We have been using this product in place of soy sauce for years.  We really love it since it is good for your health and at the same time good tasting.

reviewerName: Desert Gypsy "A Brooklyn Girl Out West"
reviewText: I had heard of the health benefits associated with Bragg's Amino Acids but should have done the research first;* is higher in sodium than my Lite Soy Sauce.* this contains MSG.* I prefer the taste of soy sauce to this product.TIP: if you are concerned about your sodium intake but still want to use soy sauce the *LITE* Kikkoman Soy Sauce actually has LESS sodium in it than their Lower Sodium Soy Sauce.For my tastes/purposes this product did not have any appreciable health benefits over my lite soy sauce and therefore I would probably not purchase this again.
I have used this for over 35 years and I will use it the rest of my life unless they stop making it. I guess that is the best product review I can make.

This is no joke, I use braggs on almost anything. My kids warn me if we are running low because it has such a great taste; especially on veggies. I usually buy several at the store to stock up and use it for cooking, grilling, spray on veggies, tofu, etc.If you like Soy Sauce or Tammari, you will love braggs, it's 100X better, seriously, try it and I'm sure you'll agree...Whoever thought this was a protien suplement for working out, well, seriously... Let's just say I had a laugh at your expense.Update Dec 17, 2011: Thats what I get for buying this online. The price has more than doubled here in less than 6 months! Fallen stars... :-(
This has a really savory aroma and interesting flavor. I use it as an alternative to soy sauce since it is wheat free.
My sister suggested this product to me for seasoning, etc. Wow was she right, it is all natural and the taste is great. Great price for the size and on time delivery a plus. I will order this again!
I am gluten Free and love soy sauce...this is THE product to give me the flavor I want and yet keep it GF. Well worth the price.
I have no idea if they are any good. Mine arrived opened and leaking all over the box. I just pitched it.
summary: Mine arrived opened and leaking all over the box.

reviewText: This is amazing stuff.  Good for you....read online about the benefits of the essential aminos!  I love using it to flavor rice, vegetables, quinoa.  I will never be without this in my kitchen!
good stuff -

I was recommended this product by a friend who had read several articles on it being a healthier option than soy sauce.  So, I tried it.  It tastes okay - not as good as traditional soy sauce, but a decent substitute in recipes calling for it.  I used it for a few weeks before finally looking more closely at the label.  Kikkoman Soy Sauce has 920mg of sodium per serving.  Low Sodium Kikkoman Soy Sauce has 575mg per serving.  Bragg's has 160mg per serving.  However, all the soy sauces I checked have a serving size of one tablespoon.  Bragg's serving size is HALF A TEASPOON!  This makes it 960mg in an equivalent serving - more than regular soy sauce!  I was shocked, and then angry.Every "substitute" product - whether low fat, low sodium, higher fiber, whatever - I have ever tried before now has the same serving size as the product it is recommended in place of.  Not only is this not equivalent, it is a ridiculous serving size. I could not find another liquid condiment of any type (ketchup, mustard, steak sauce, salad dressing, ginger sauce, etc.) that had a serving size smaller than one tablespoon, and many are two tablespoons.  Not only is regular soy sauce lower in sodium, but obviously the low sodium options from name brands like Kikkoman or La Choy are significantly lower.There are many other seasoning options that are lower in sodium than this.  If you like the taste, that is one thing.  However, if you are looking to lower your sodium intake this is not a good product.  Further, I feel that THE SERVING SIZE IS DESIGNED TO DECEIVE CUSTOMERS, and I will not be trying another Bragg product ever again.
summary: more sodium than regular soy sauce!

reviewText: I saw this stuff advertised on one of the popular heath shows, for people with HBP, on TV. This is my second bottle. I use it in place of Soy Sauce because it has MUCH less sodium. I certainly do not miss the salt, but more importantly, everyone who has tried it thins it is soy sauce. Bragg Liquid Aminos will be in my cupboard from now on!

Bragg Liquid Aminos has been a real find! I not only explored it because of the nutritional benefit but,because I wanted to find an alternative to the low sodium soy sauce or tamari which didn't accent the bases to soups or tofu marinated dishes I wanted to make. I haven't experienced the same notes many people may have in describing the taste of the liquid aminos as having to be "an acquired taste". To the contrary, I have discovered an umami-type epiphany! I would recommend those who would want to jazz up a soup base,marinade for a tofu steak, seitan burger, or the like with liquid aminos!
summary: I like it better than tamari or soy sauce

reviewText: This product was recommended to me by a group I belong to where we share recipe ideas. I had never heard of it so, of course, went straight to Amazon to check it out! Since we are now eating gluten free, wheat free, and doing nutritional cleansing, I bought this and we love it! A little goes a long way, you only need to use very little so this bottle will last a very long time! [...]

Bragg's makes a great seasoning for almost anything. I love that it is gluten free. All you need is a very small amount to season your food - a little goes a long way. You might even want to use a spray bottle for application. It is cheaper to buy this size and make your own spray bottle, as opposed to purchasing the Bragg's spray seasoning bottle. Despite what other reviewers say, this does make a good substitute for soy sauce. I have used it to make fried rice and used it for my sushi. When you have to eat GF, you make exceptions with food. But with Bragg's, you don't have to. It is delicious.

Well I bought this after seeing it on OZ and because I'm a salty taste lover I just had to try this.  Now I've replaced my shoyu sauces, garlic salt and buillon's with this. I love that tasty salt flavor when adding this to salads, cooking meals and every fruits. I add some lemon juice in it and it's a nice citrus ponzu like taste.
I bought it because the HCH Gormet Cookbook recommended it, and it was a good buy.  It adds a lot of flavor with few calories.
summary: It adds flavor to cooking without adding a lot of calories.

reviewText: I use Bragg's Liquid Amino on almost everything. I love the taste and even more, I love the fact that it is nutritious. It makes an excellent addition to soups, guacamole, you name it!
Liquid aminos are healthier than soy sauce and just as tasty. Once you give it a try, you won't go back!
I bought this at the advice of my son, who is very health conscious. Works great as a soy sauce substitute, cannot tell the difference.
summary: Healthy alternative to regular soy sauce

reviewText: With wheat allergies, high cholesterol, and high blood pressure - oh, and MSG gives me migraines - getting on the right track and cooking food that tastes great requires a touch of soy sauce - but all the good tasting soy sauce has wheat in it and is WAY too high in sodium.  This stuff is WONDERFUL!Tofu scramble for breakfast (and fruit), grilled summer squash and zucchini, red lentils with greens, peppers and onions  - everything just takes a few shakes of Braggs instead of salt and WOW - going low-fat, low-salt, no-grain vegan is actually easy and very tasty!Thank you Dr. Fuhrman!!

To begin with I am a big fan of Bragg products so I may be a bit biased.  With that said when I first bought this product last year I found that I no longer reached for the bottle of soy sauce.  The difference in taste between Bragg Liquid Aminos and traditional soy sauces available in stores.  The biggest benefit is it has a fraction of the sodium that soy sauce does.
summary: Great Alternative to Traditional Soy Sauce

reviewText: I bought this item through Amazon because I trust the Amazon website and they have never failed me.  The Bragg Apple Cider Vinegar was delivered as promised.  I just drink shots of the vinegar so I can get it over with.  It has helped with my bloat tremendously.  I'll have to wait until my next blood test to see if my cholosterol numbers have improved.  You can see the "Mother" in the bottle.  The first drink is a little tough.  But after a few days, I got used to it and have no problem with it now.  It's best to chase the shot with a drink of water to prevent acidic damage to teeth.

I have used Bragg's products since 1967.  Now I'm questioning their quality.  Feb 5 I received Bragg's Liquid Aminos 32oz All Purpose Seasoning (Best by Aug 23, 2016).  There was liquid inside the plastic bag.  The protective seal was on but when I opened the cap, there was an index shape puncture in the seal.  I called Bragg and was told none of their employees would do something like that!  They told me to talk to Amazon.  Amazon had another bottle (no date printed on bottle) shipped and received Feb 6. (You Rocks, Amazon!!!)  The seal on the new bottle was broken and about 1/4 cup of the liquid was inside the plastic and some had leaked into the box and left a large spot on the carpet in front of my door.
summary: Loyalty Lost! Never, Never, ever buy Braggs Again!

reviewText: This gets 5 stars for several reasons:The bottle is a nice size but not too fat to fit in a small refigerator doorThe product is strong but you don't need a lot to get the job doneI use it for the Cherry Lola treatment on my hair and also use it as an alternative to Soy or Tamari sauce.Bragg is a company that has plenty of Orgnaic and NonGMO products- they are a trustworthy company and worth spending money on.

If you are still committed to being healthy while enjoying the flavor of your food...if you are still a hippy in your heart (if not your affect), you already know Braggs. It us the best soy sauce replacement out there. Aminos, not salt. Get it.

Pro: I like the taste of this product and use it as a stock in soups as well as spray it on popcorn.Con: I believe that their claim of "no added salt" is misleading, because:The label on my bottle states: "160 mg sodium" in a 2.5 milliliter serving, and that translates to 8 kilograms of raw soy beans per serving (source: [...] impossible. Thus, the sodium MUST be coming from some other source than "vegetable protein from Soybeans and Purified Water" (ingredients stated on the label). I would prefer it if they were more forthcoming as to how the product is actually made...it's not just soybeans & water...it is vegetable protein DERIVED from soybeans...question is, how do they derive it??Conclusion: Useful, tasty additive to foods, but best used sparingly as you would any other flavoring...probably no better, or worse, than regular soy sauce chemically made from soybeans (which is probably cheaper, but then you don't know where the soybeans come from).I hope this helps anyone who may be as confused as I was!!
summary: Tastes good...but where does all the sodium come from?

reviewText: I have used this product for several years and love the taste in vegetables and stirfires.  However, the presence of soy is worrisome and the sodium is higher than I want.  All the amino acids are irrelevant as the human body can only utilize a very limited number (7?).
summary: Love the taste, bothered by the soy and sodium

reviewText: Great for adding flavor to soups, stews and other dishes.  It adds a little zip to whatever dish you make.  My only reservation is for my friends who are allergic to soy or can't have a lot of salt.

This is a great alternative to soy sauce.  It is full of nutrition and has a great taste.  This does not make me retain water like soy sauce does.  My granddaughter loves it too.  It's great on rice, pasta, soups and more.
It tastes just like soy sauce so if you like soy and you want a healthier option you will like this.
We love this stuff. The whole family uses this out of a sprayer on air pop popcorn. Very tasty ,kid approved.
I use this product along with flax seed oil on my salad.  You don't need to add salt.  Love this item. HIghly recommend you giving it a try.
I never knew amino existed until I found it in a cook book and so I tried it . I made some simple Veg soup and it was the best. I included Braggs Sprinkle in the soup and that was it . Taste great.

Here's the skinny. I have been eating soy sauce my whole life. Braggs is very similar to soy sauce...but less well defined soy sauce flavor.Braggs: thinner bodied sauce...but still very salty. Taste like it was filtered well ...may be do to the more watery texture. Goes flat after you taste it.Kikkoman soy sauce: thicker bodied sauce. Salty. Has that asian soy sauce taste. When you taste it, it reassures your senses that it has a flavor of its own.I love using this particular soy season liquid for soups and mock veggie meat. Plus I put it in my toddlers rice...just a splash.
summary: It's a more subtle soy sauce.

reviewText: I love liquid aminos.  To me it taste better than soy sauce but it's also saltier so if you are using it to replace soy sauce, taste as you go.

I buy these to store for a rainy day, whether that is a month when the money runs low or in case of bad weather and I cant get out. I wouldn't eat them just plain but they mix well and work great for cooking in recipes.

This is a big can - size of a regular 10 can.  It is something I have been looking for for a while and it is competitively priced.  I have just noticed our local grocer is carrying some of this stuff and their prices are similar but not quite.  My grocer has this item for 28 dollars and you can get it here for 25 dollars with prime shipping if you have it.  My grocer has cheap prices to so it is a fair comparison.  I havent broken into them yet but they will be eggs in an emergency.  I am not looking for super taste, I am looking for easy making survival stuff.  I have no reason to believe these will taste any better or worse then any other egg product out there.  It fits my needs exactly for a good price.

For those of you out there that are stocking up on emergency supplies, this is a really good purchase. I had purchased these eggs in a smaller bag in the past at my local camping store and when I saw them here I decided to get some for my emergency supply. They taste like what you would expect of powdered eggs but for some reason people want the 100% exact taste of freshly cracked eggs, which would make about as much sense as expecting powdered milk to taste 100% exactly like fresh dairy milk. Go figure!I have used these eggs in the past to make brownies, microwave brownies at that, and they came out OK. I personally love to make Tomato, Pepper and Onion Omelets with these eggs but to each their own I would say. Are these eggs tolerable enough to eat? Well, considering that one morning I made a Cheese and Tomato Omelet for my wife using these same eggs and she barely noticed the difference until I told her afterwards, I would say these eggs work out well in a pinch. And in an emergency situation these eggs will taste like gourmet food to those who are starving, so this product gets an A+ in my book.
summary: Great addition to an Emergency Pantry.

reviewText: Not quite as tasty as liquid egg whites, and some care needed to dissolve the powder in water or milk, but they cook up great and you can control the thickness and richness by the powder to water/milk ratio.  Never needs refrigeration, easily stored, great for camping or backpacking or when you run out of refrigerated liquid egg whites, as it is an extra hassle to drive to the store in the traffic, rain, or snow.

of course they are powdered eggs and do taste as much if you make scrambled eggs however when you add granulated onion and or garlic it helps with the flavor. this poduct shines best when you use it in recipes. shelf stable and i highly recommend.

I purchased this product so I could always have eggs available when I wanted to bake. These powdered eggs do the trick. I was using flax meal as an egg substitute, but I like having eggs in my baked goods. I still use flax meal for part of the flour, but that just makes the baked goods, tastier and healthier.Thanks, Honeyville for an excellent product.
summary: Don't need to always run to the store for eggs!

reviewText: I've not used these in a recipe yet, but good for scrambled eggs and omelets. Great for preppers, or to have on hand if you run out/are too lazy/forget to buy real eggs.

My favorite use for powdered eggs is in batters and doughs that the family would like to taste. It is fully pasteurized, so there is no danger of salmanila like with  raw eggs. Not the same as regular scrambled eggs, but a great substitute for camp outs so you don't have to refrigerate them, worry about breakage, or have the extra weight or bulk of whole eggs.
summary: I meant to order egg whites, but still a great product

reviewText: I use for any recipe calling for eggs. I go by the direction, 2 T. Egg powder to 6 T. Water for each egg called for. It is great to have on hand in the fridge and not having to worry about fresh eggs.
We bought this for our baking needs but have not used it yet.  This company is based out of Canada and they have good quality stuff.  I bought their powdered cheese too.  Good stuff.
You probably don't want to fix them for your guests but they are an excellent way to keep eggs on hand for baking or as part of your emergency food supply.
summary: They are powdered and they are eggs

reviewText: It's so nice to have eggs on hand when you run out, which I ususally do.  It is perfect for cakes and bread.  I add it to meatloaf and meatballs.  Anything I cook actually.  I even add an amount equal to 1 egg to 3 eggs for a 4 egg omelette for scrambled eggs.  I would not use it for breakfast eggs without adding herbs or cheese or something to disguise the powdered egg taste, though.
summary: Really handy to have on hand

reviewText: They are probably fine for baking; but were not what I was looking for.  We used to get powdered eggs from government surplusfoods for the low income when I was a kid up in New Hampshire.  I used to like the way they tasted as scrambled eggs; they hada unique taste I don't know how to describe, but I liked them.  These did not taste anything like I remembered those powdered eggstasting.  They probably don't make them anymore.

What bugout bag or backpackers pantry would be complete without powdered eggs. Don't let the big can put you off either. While the bigger can is ideal for you survivalist that are hording year of food that probably never get eaten in your life time, the can can be opened and you can repackage in to smaller mylar zip lock bags...and customize your packaging. I add powdered cheeze and milk along with freeze dried peppers and mushrooms and a pinch of garlic and pepper to my bags when I repackage for hunting and backpacking trips. with that being said, we do have provisions for a month in the event of a disaster. this is a lot of eggs for a month, so I took half of the mix and repackaged in a foodsaver bag. It is sealed up air tight, and once in the container with our other foods, it will not be exposed to light and its shelf life should remain essentially uneffected.I have personally ate the eggs...they mix up rather well. I have MY recipe for embellishing the powdered eggs down to a science. When a 16 year old boy can taste the difference between these and regular scrambled eggs, I must be doing something right.

Now I feel like I am linked to the military for sure with these wonderful eggs!  I use them to cook with, I make omlets with them and usually I just scramble them.  They are really special to me because when my son came home at Christmas 2012  for the first time in 14 years and I didn't even know if he was still alive I made him cheese egg omelets with these very eggs every morning!  He LOVED them too!  Thank you!

-- That the color of the egg product suffers a bit from being dried.I have uploaded some Product Images to illustrate.The images show 3 bowls:One with Honeyville Farms powder (HV)One with straight dry yolk powder from another vendor (Y) and...One with a fresh large egg (FRESH)The images pretty fairly represent the color issue -- the dry and mixed powders both are duller and browner than the fresh egg.The mixed powders were blended with bottled water as per the label directions, and allowed to stand for several minutes to fully hydrate.A third image shows a batch of scrambled eggs made from the illustrated egg products, with additional seasoning, dairy, spices and garnish. The eggs tasted fine, and looked OK, when lightened with dairy and camouflaged with chives, paprika and butter.What wouldn't?So if you are using the egg powder in dishes where the color is not particularly important, this product should be fine. But if you are depending on the bright cheery yellow of a fresh egg yolk, as in scrambled eggs or an omelet, you should probably stick to fresh. Or use camouflage, like Honeyville did on their package picture.

These are clearly great for taking on camping trips. The trick is always to reconstitute as directed, only whisking (no electric beater) the water/milk into the egg powder, starting with very little liquid to make a paste first, breaking up the lumps with the whisk. Otherwise they wont go into solution very well. They won't make as fluffy an omelet as fresh does, and some baking products really need fresh eggs, such as a souffle. Clearly they won't help you make a meringue.They are also great when you run out of eggs and cannot get to the grocery store. I keep them in the refrigerator in a few separate zip-lock bags. You can freeze them without any more loss in quality than dehydration does. I still have some left from the can I bought 15 months ago (but then I have not done much baking or eating of eggs since then).
summary: Honeyville Powdered Whole Eggs--Really a Great Buy!

reviewText: I'm stationed in Afghanistan and am lucky enough to have a table-top KitchenAid oven so I try to bake as often as possible for my troops. I found this product when searching for an egg substitute to use in cookie and cake mixes and am SO glad I found it! It works perfectly! I was concerned about the chemical consistency when baked, but I need not have even let it cross my mind! I've used it in cakes, cookies, brownies…. and all turned out perfectly!

I have an Indian (American) friend, that gets free whole powdered eggs from the gov commodity program. She has often made me "yummy/flavorfull" egg sandwiches (i.e. scrambled eggs...)!I decided to buy some Honeyville & try it? What a disappointment for scrambled eggs (don't know about baking...?)!1. Their is NO flavor, whatsoever!!!2. Sticks "hard" to oiled stainless frying pan (fried like a pancake. pre-heated to med/low)- Worked better when I mixed in 1tsp of Canola oil, per egg... (like waffles...).For 1 egg sandwich- I mix 1/4 cup water, to 1/4 cup mix (they say 2-1), which was a runny mess (maybe for baking?).Limited shelf life...- I store unused mix in the freezer!
I have always enjoyed powdered eggs. Great in a pinch, camping, or in recipes. PLUS free shipping, can't beat that at my local grocery store. Great item to have in a pinch.

We have chickens for fresh eggs but in storing up for long term food storage and for using in baking, this is an awesome idea.  Now, we are spoiled with our fresh eggs but if using these dry ones and if a person mixes something in with them for an egg scramble, they become 'okay'.  It's all in what you add and how you season and let's face it, they are dry so nothing will taste like the real thing.  Dry goods like this are awesome because you can make your own mixes ahead of time and just add liquid, which saves a lot of time if you are in a pinch.I recommend everyone have some on their shelf.
summary: Awesome product to have on hand.

reviewText: got this to make some pancake mix to send overseas to my husband. i tried a little bit before i sent it and it turned out really well.

This is a much better deal than buy freeze dried fruit from Whole Foods. The can came almost full to the top even with the settling due to shipping and stuff. The strawberries are super fresh. Nice and crisp. It does require a can opener though. Enjoy :)

I do know how to dry strawberries. These, however, are better- okay, MUCH better. However, I want to warn potential buyers of possible disappointment when you open the can. In my canister, the strawberries took up about 1/2 the can. It was not filled to the top.Now, take a look at the price. These are NOT cheap. However, I am ordering two more of these. Why? For several reasons. They keep indefinitely, even after being opened. However, they don't last long in our household so I need to have some hidden in our pantry.Also, what if the power went out. What if your frozen or fresh strawberries weren't available? These have plenty of Vitamin C per serving (60% of the DV which I believe is Daily Value) and only 15 calories per 1/4 cup. Those who have ALLERGIES (yes, I'm capping that) should be aware that they are made on equipment that could also be used to process soy, wheat, egg, peanut and tree nuts.Anyway, These are just perfect for snacks, eating directly from the can, reconstituting (add water) and using in baking, sprinkling over cereal or adding to recipes. The use is limited only by your imagination.Oh, yes - while I hope food prices don't continue to soar, you could possibly save money with these around.
summary: These are better than the dried strawberries I make (and those are good too)

reviewText: I'm kinda new to this. A total surprise i totally enjoyed. I will definitely order again and try some of the other items from these folks.
These are a little pricey, but for dried strawberries they are great. I like them for salads and both cold and hot cereal.
You'd do better by going to the Honeyville website and ordering from there. As of 01/03/08, the  8 oz can of strawberries is 15.49 and 4.99 ships your ENTIRE order.
summary: Very nice, but save your money.......

reviewText: Dehydrated Banana Chips - 2 Pound Can. Did not like it - could not fine a way to use them. Probable would be OK if you were really stuck living outside with not much to eat.

i felt the need to defend these banana chips, which i don't feel deserve a one star rating.  i got them in a #10can -case pack (6 different items) of various dehydrated fruits from honeyville farms, and i think they taste just like banana chips you buy at the supermarket in small packs, or mixed with trail mix.  they are not the freeze-dried kind, mind you, which honeyville also sells, but the dehydrated, slightly oily variety that are a bit crunchy.  i find i eat these by the cupful sometimes, and must remember to drink something!  they are very sweet and satisfying.  my kids really like them too.a yr. later-- i wanted to add that I continue to get these delish banana chips.  i also would like to explain that i don't eat many sweets (I think craisins are a bit too sweet to eat alone), so the "very sweet" comment for me is just kinda sweet for many people. I also use coconut oil extensively at home for the taste and health properties (along with olive oil and butter), so the coconut oil in these chips was just an added bonus.I highly recommend these chips.  Honeyville makes freeze dried banana chips as well, if you like that texture better. i just like these, because they remain crispy and tasty (vs. getting mushy faster with freeze-dried products you don't re-vacuum seal)

It's a great buy, but I like my banana chips to be just a tad sweeter. This is something I can put into a baggie and tuck a way in my purse, glove compartment or backpack. Something good to have in your 72+ hour emergency stash.

If you want a great tasting snack that is relatively healthy, I would highly recommend this product.  But beware, once you have eaten one, you will want more.  I leave a bowl of these chips on our kitchen island and we are constantly walking past the bowl grabbing one or two on our way to do chores.  They are slightly sweet.but the sweetness does not overpower the banana flavor.  I plan to order 2 more cans to store so that we can be sure we won't run out.  I will definitely reorder when we open the last can.

I was delighted to receive my Honeyville banana snacks. The taste is just like the ones you get in the bins in the grocery store, but these are available in bulk, and come in a sealed can for long shelf life. They really taste great, and make a healthy snack. The banana chips are crisp, and they are oily from the coconut oil. Do not fret, as the latest studies indicate that coconut oil is the healthiest oil available, and so much so they actually sell coconut oil capsules as a vitamin supplement. These banana chips are a delicious way to add the health benefits of coconut oil to your diet.Healthy, tasty, and long shelf life . . . what more could you want?

I never got around to trying to bake with these because I just used them as a snack rather than regular chips or sweets.  I think these would be great in trail mix or just plain as I've been eating them.  I don't eat massive quantities of them, so I'm not concerned about the coconut oil or the small amount of sugar added.  I just eat them to take the edge off hunger sometimes between meals.  Honeyville does sell freeze-dried bananas though if you're concerned about additives.

I used it once to bake bread in the bread machine just to see how it'd turn out.  This gluten additive seemed to change the taste of the bread, not in a tremendously bad way but enough to make me think I don't need to use it with the bread flour  (Great River Organic Milling) that I'm using.  I'll keep it for now just in case the recipe calls for additional gluten.
I've been buying this for a while now.  You simply can't make whole wheat bread without it.  Great product at a nice price.
summary: Can't make wheat bread without it!

reviewText: I have never had a problem with gluten and even read recently that the rate of gluten intolerance is not as high as previously thought. Anyway, my bread machine recipes often call for this and it give a great texture to the bread.

Being on a high-protein, low carb diet I really missed bread.  Having found a recipie for low-carb bread, I  found that Vital Wheat Gluten is almost impossible to find locally, and as usual, an Amazon merchant came through!
