It has a distinct raw cookie dough flavoring to it.  There doesn't seem to be much oatmeal taste.There are plenty of other bars out there with less fat (and FAR less saturated fat) that actually taste better.  This is a quality bar, no doubt, as are all Kashi products, but I would not care to use it as a meal replacement on a daily basis.
These are good in terms of protein and fiber.  They are horrid in terms of taste--coated with a sickly sweet icing and excessively flavored.

This is a super snack to grab when you're about to miss breakfast.  It's not a full breakfast replacement, but you can supplement it with a bit of fruit or yogurt an hour or so later and have a happy tummy.Even better... this is a great dessert... one that satisfies a crunchy sweet craving but doesn't make you feel too guilty.  A lot fewer calories than a typical donut, plus a good helping of fiber and all-natural ingredients.Kashi's done it again.  Tasty, reasonably nutritious.

Used to buy this at Costco, but they stopped carrying it.  Great taste, high fiber, and one bar is only 4 Weight Watcher points, yet very filling as a snack.  Sometimes, I just eat half a bar, and that does it.  Great, great, taste!!

Looks like all the Kashi Crisp reviews have been grouped together, irrespective of flavor, so I say (with respect) to the other reviewers, ALMOND IS THE BEST!  I've tried about 3 other flavors: chocolate-peanuts, chocolate-peanuts and caramel, and chocolate-pretzel (also not bad).  Of those however, the almond is (to me) by far the best.They all have a chewiness that's not like caramel chewiness, but rather a slightly-stale-Rice-Crispies chewiness.  They don't *taste* stale, and it isn't chewy enough to be off-putting, but it's enough for you to pehaps wish it were either crisper or chewier...hard to zero in on a good analogy, but nevermind that.  If you take the superior taste and combine it with the superior nutritional value (not to mention how well-proportioned the calories are with carb/fat/protein, etc. - another reviewer, a runner, mentioned that), you'll probably have to agree, it's going to be hard to find anything as good, much less better.I detract only for lack of availability, so hopefully more people will get on one of these new "subscriptions" Amazon offers (like I just did), and that'll show Kashi they have a solid base of business they can expand.  If you haven't tried one of the Almond flavor Kashi GoLean Crisp bars, do yourself a favor and try one.  If you don't like it, color me genuinely surprised.  The flavor of almond is faint, the chocolate tastes good, and the consistency is well worth the 5g of fiber...and let's face it, without these in my desk at work, I would miss breakfast altogether most days.Of all the "healthy" meal replacements/snacks I've tried (liquids, powders, bars, cups of fancy yogurt, you name it), these are far and away the best, and go nicely with a cup of coffee.
summary: TRY Almond GoLean Crisp - Green box!

reviewText: I love these more than any granola, energy, meal or any other bar I have ever tried... And I've probably tried them all. They're sweet, cinnamon-y, and remind me a little of spice cake; they've also got little pieces of hazlenut in them which adds a nice nutty flavor to the whole thing, and the frosting type substance is really good too. The texture is like a crispy rice cereal bar, but much better (to me anyway), and they're chewy, don't buy these expecting them to be like the crunchy Nautre Valley granola bars. These have got lots of fiber and protein, so they're quite filling, and they're low in fat, and the fats they do have are good fats. They're also made with healthy, natural ingredients that are really good for you. I would absolutely recommend giving these a try.

The nutrition profile on this line of bars was great!  High protein and fiber, low fat, not excessively sweet, very satisfying for the modest calories. It became my go-to breakfast and I haven't yet found a replacement.It was always hard to find them cheap, and right when Costco started offering them, Kashi decides to discontinue them.  Maybe the product would have done better with the word "protein" in the name.  Let's hope they will be adding something new that has a similar nutrition profile.
summary: Great easy nutrition that's being discontinued :(

reviewText: This a great energy bar.  The bar has a great chocolate/peanut butter taste, but it's not too sweet.  The bar has 210 calories so its better to snack on this than a bag of chips.  This has the texture of a rice crispy treat.
Pros:ProteinFiberFillingTastyEasy for travelCons:Very crunchyOverall:Delicious and a great fast breakfast

Very Tasty - Kashi did it yet again! Another tasty morsel that doesn't taste like Styrofoam! I am so glad that Kashi has taken away the bad stigma of healthy food tastes bland! This blend is very tasty!
summary: Very Tasty - Kashi has done it again

reviewText: Great for a pick me up between meals. Satisfying, crunchy, really tasty! Also good for that chocolate fix without a lot of calories.

I have found some kashi products to be really good and other to be just average.  Well, these are just average.  I was hoping they'd be far more, but like with a lot of kashi products, the best part is the advertising.  Sorry, these just aren't as good as they sound...

Like most people I don't always have time to cook up something tasty and healthy so I kinda' cheat by having a few of these in my desk or bag. The numbers are really good and it doesn't taste like other protein-fiber-board bars that I have had in the past. I was genuinely surprised how good the chocolate almond tasted.

Holy poop!! wish I would have checked that before I ordered them!! How exactly does adding 13 grams of sugar help your blood sugar level?? I checked that AFTER I tasted one because they taste like what I would imagine heavily salted wood chips to taste like!! What a hoax!!! I am found this HEALYH FOOD to be counter productive to blood sugar and high blood pressure..I threw them out!!!
summary: 250MG of salt and 13 grams of sugar????

reviewText: i like to refrigerate them as i like them cold and crunchy. i think when i tried these before they tasted better-maybe they were fresher. well, they do seem to help with appetite so that makes them a worthwhile snack.
The crunchy variety is a whole lot better than the chewy variety, if you ask me.  And this is my review, that's my story, and I'm sticking to it.
summary: Crunchy is much better than chewy.

reviewText: I LOVE these! Big, chewy, sweet, and only 170 calories. Good stuff in them too.

reviewerName: Modern Blue Argonaut "No I do not have a shoe...
reviewText: I recently purchased a case of these for myself, and was surprised to find out that my children prefer these to rice krispies treats. They love the chewy texture and sweet taste, and it makes a convenient breakfast on the go or after school snack. I like the fact that these are whole grain and convenient to take anywhere.
summary: Healthy, convenient, even kids like them!

reviewText: I've discovered that I really like the Kashi Go Lean Crunchy bars . They all seem to have good flavors, good ingredients, and they don't have as high of calories as some of the others do.Cinnamon Coffee Cake really did taste like a cinnamon coffee cake.  It was pleasantly sweet, with that hint of spice from the cinnamon, and there was a little bit of sweet frosting stuff drizzled on top too.  It definitely had the crunch as well from the different grains the bar was made up of.  And I liked the crunch, it really made it feel like you were biting into something substantial.The ingredients are good in this bar.  Not the best out of all the brands out there, but still reasonably decent.  The main sweetener is Brown Rice Syrup, but there is also crystalline fructose and evaporated can juice crystals.  The grains are the Kashi seven grain blend that they like to advertise and there's wheat bran and a few other things included as well.  There are some hard to pronounce ingredients, but these appear to be the vitamins.This bar has 160 calories in it.  Not as much as some but still not enough to justify eating these as a snack.  Use them for when you're exercising, or don't have enough time for a full breakfast.  There is 5 grams of fiber and 8 grams of protein as well.  Although there are 13 grams of sugar, which seems a little high.  I do have to say that eating one of these bars does not make me as full as other bars do.  I started getting hungry around ten am after eating the bar at 8 am.  But it still did ok in that aspect, and maybe I was just hungrier than usual.A great flavored bar, I'd definitely buy it again.  I can just see it being a good one to take on a bike trip or some other kind of event.Review by M. Reynard 2012
summary: Kashi Go Lean Crunchy Cinnamon Coffee Cake Bar

reviewText: If you're a former junk food junkie like me, then you'll get an idea of what these things taste like when I describe them as a more fibrous (chewy) version of rice kripy squares with a chocolate coating on the bottom.  They really are that delicious.  And at 170 calories with 4gm of fat (1.5gm saturated), 9gm of protein, and 5gm of fiber, they are a healthy alternative to many other types of snacks that one could indulge in (pastries, candy, etc).These are easily my favorite protein bar and I've tried over a dozen kinds.Edit on 9/27/07:  This review pertains to the chocolate peanut Go Lean flavor.  I just noticed that Amazon is grouping reviews for all of Kashi's bars together, so without specificity in the review it's impossible to know which product is being reviewed.
summary: a great tasting snack (small meal) substitute

reviewText: Another great Kashi product I can give my kids (and indulge in myself)!  We enjoy it as an afternoon snack or a healthful desert alternative. The coffee flavor is very faint, more like cinnamon cake with frosting. We'll try some other flavors next.
OK folks I use this mid morning and always I take one or two with me when we travel.  I love the flavor and the consistency.  I would split in half for small children.

I'm trying to get more fiber in my diet, and these are terrific. Real food, great taste (better than chocolate caramel variety of these bars which have a few kernels of embedded popcorn which are really inedible). I'm changing my subscribe & save to switch these for the chocolate caramel which I thought were good until I found these.
summary: Marvelous option to crush a hunger attack

reviewText: These bars are crunchy and have the chocolate plus the pretzel flavors so they taste sweet and salty and they are not dry like other protein bars. My son is a vegetarian, so getting protein is vital, and this is a delicious way to get it.
Good snack. More filling than other bars. Very nutritious. The flavors are very complementary. Still on the expensive side even though ordered in bulk.

I have reviewed a lot of these snack bars over the past couple of years, this is by far the most delicious. I would eat one every day.That's really not hyperbole. Yesterday I had a Pure Protein S'more. I thought. Oh that was good. Not really S'more flavoured, but I liked it. Today, I moved on to this one and it's just the right amount of sweet, chew, cinnamon...only 160 calories, 8g protein, 5g of fiber...ok so some of the other bars are a little more packed with fiber and protein, but they don't taste this good.Kashi, you done good! (Not that I am surprised)
summary: I think I have a new favorite food

reviewText: I really enjoy these bars, but they are a tad too sweet for me. Even so, they are an ideal light snack.

We normally brew a full pot of coffee in our home each morning as there are enough coffee drinkers to make it worthwhile. But in the afternoon, sometimes one of us wants a cup and it is not worthwhile to brew another pot or grind up the beans to make a smaller pot. That's what we have our Senseo for. We keep a couple different kinds of pods around to suit various tastes, and this one suits mine.These are a little stronger, and more full-bodied than the basic medium roast Senseo pods, yet the flavor is not quite as acidic as their dark roast pods. I use one pod for a "double" serving (the button with the 2 cups), which is (I know) not the recommended way, but I still seem to get good results. If I happen to be making one first thing in the morning and need a little more strength, I will use 2 pods and press the double first, and then the single to get a slightly larger and stronger cup.
summary: Nice, full-bodied flavor in these Sumatra pods

reviewText: My husband actually did not like this flavor, but he isn't that big into Vanilla.  However, my in-laws raved!  They may actually buy a Senseo based on trying ours.  They didn't want to drink all of our coffee, but we said go ahead since my husband didn't like it.  They must have had 3 cups each of this coffee, it was like they couldn't get enough.  I suggest that you actually try any Senseo flavor by buying one pack at the store first to see if you like the flavor.  If you do, come back to Amazon and order in bulk to save you money.  $3.84 at Walmart for a package of 10 pods = .38 each.  Here it is only .25 a cup of coffee at the current price.

Anyone who really loves a gourmet cup of coffee will HATE this! It's burnt, bitter, weak, battery-acid! And, as consequence, those coffee lovers may begin to hate their new Senseo -- but take heart! Many online coffee shops now offer decent to delectable coffees at prices that rival this cheap swill. I don't specifically want to endorse any one product or online retailer but do a google search for "senseo compatible pods" and you'll find several on the first page. Also, please note that while these may initially seem pricier, most third party pods work with JUST ONE to make an 8-ounce cup instead of the two pods that Senseo brand products demand. You do the math and it works out to be a comparable costing cup of joe.[...]
summary: I wish it could be ZERO stars!!!

reviewText: These are the greatest coffee pods ever! This flavor is the best I have found yet and I didn't have to go searching to find them in a store and it is really great that Amazon delivers them right to your door, saving lots of gas. I finally found out where to buy them here and it is 12 miles away!
Good for what it is, a quick cup of coffee with a slightly different flavor.  The 10% blend isn't quite enough to really make a huge impact on the taste.
Recently tried the Senseo hazelnut coffee pods. What a treat. My friends really enjoy having a cup of this coffee. With a dab of of whipped cream on the top, it is perfect.

I do not have a Senseo coffee pod maker.I use a 4cup small MR COFFEE pot and use2 pods for 4 cups of coffee.  Works perfectly.I like the SUMATRA coffee a lot...bold, darkand rich flavor.I add a little bit of BAILEYS IRISH CREAM toeach cup.I have tried the MELITTA coffee pods --  theyare weak and expensive... but,they do havesome very very interesting flavors.bette b praterokc ok  62 retired

I occasionally like to have a different flavor coffee - rather than just "coffee."  Hazelnut is one of my favorites, and this is a very good hazelnut.  I use it in my Keurig machine because it's about half the price of k-cups.
Senseo Paris French Vanilla Coffee pods are easy to use and easy to clean up. The pods brew a very flavorful cup of coffee. French Vanilla is one of my favorites.
summary: Senseo Paris French Vanilla Bistro Coffee Pods

reviewText: Now keep in mind that I'm kind of a coffee snob, but I rarely have time to grind and press my own coffee.  I use the Senseo pods simply for convenience sake.  And since they have different flavors, I figured I'd give them a try.Now Senseo coffee in general tends to be better than most any store pre-ground, canned, or mass produced brand, like Folgers or Maxwell House.  But that's not saying a whole lot.  I find these to be kind of bitter, but the one saving grace is that I like the frothy finish.My biggest complaint is the inconsistency.  When I initially wrote this review, I was drinking my first package that came in a four-pack.  It actually tasted kind of fresh, and I liked it.  However, the next two packages were quite stale.  I have now tried a different brand of coffee pod which really blows this one out of the water.One to help make better coffee with your Senseo coffee maker:  Don't brew as soon as the red light stops flashing.  Let it warm up a few more minutes before you hit the brew button.Also, there are some pretty good pods out there, and they are not expensive.  You can even get fair trade and organic blends along with single origin coffees.  Shop around.  The Senseo brand pods are about the worst pods I've tried, but since they are better than Folgiers, I give them two stars.
This is delicious coffee, and extremely quick and convenient to prepare.  In less than a minute, you have a brew that's fresh, aromatic, and rich in flavor.
I ordered this coffee once before and probably will order it again, this time I ordered a different flavor. Relatively good coffee.

I love Espresso.  So what is better than a $10,000 commercial machine??  PODS!  This Espresso is really good, even though it is from a Pod.  It doesn't give the Crema like an expensive Espresso machine does, of course, but it tastes great!

My pods arrived in good condition.Somewhat surprised they were shipped in the original packaging but seems to work out fine.This coffee is strong compared to most pods but I like stronger coffee.I do leave my pod in the maker and when I have drank about half my cup of coffee I go back and refresh it using the same pod.I add about 3 to 4 ozs and it taste great and reheats the coffee up a bit.I had no problem with broken pods so far and the expiration date is on each pack but due to the colors its almost impossible to see or read anything on the package.The date is clearly stated on the outside of the box the six packs come in though.Overall I am pleased with this coffee.
I don't have an espresso machine, and these pods are the next-best thing. Love 'em!

This is the BEST coffee for those who like flavored coffee. I was hooked on the first cup. But to my disappointed Amazon is out of stock now. So when will they get it back in stock? I ordered direct from Senseo but with shipping and their price it was not a savings. I will be first in line when Amazon decides to sell it again.
summary: Senseo Paris Vanilla Bistro Coffee Pods

reviewText: This is only okay. I prefer other pod coffees, but I usually buy coffee beans and grind my own coffee and use the CoffeeDuck, the Refillable Filter Senseo Pod Coffee Machines with my Senseo. It's a lot cheaper. But, if you like the froth on top of your coffee the CoffeeDuck doesn't give you any. And the cleanup is a little messier.
I enjoy the vanilla of the Senseo coffee pods.  It is just the right amount and the coffee is nice and rich.

Very good taste to this coffee, I love it, it has a rich aromatic flavor I don't think you would be disappointed if you like Senseo coffees. give it a try. Only thing don't buy for the price they show on this review, go to the Senseo web site, it's a lot cheaper there.

I'm a heavy coffee drinker, so this 6-bag box is ideal for a month's usage for me (I even supplement).  The Senseo Hazelnut is the best coffee I've tried, dollar for dollar, and I hope it continues to be produced!
summary: The best fresh coffee I've ever made.

reviewText: Love this coffee. What else can I say. Great coffee but expensive. Had two coffee pod makes, one at home and one at work because I love the coffee and foam. The expense has put me off. Down to one coffee maker using pods.
Senseo Paris French is one of my favorite senseo coffee's always a great cup of coffee. Great price from Amazon!

I was really happy to see this coffee for such a great price. I even got a better price using the additional Senseo coupon code.As soon as I got the pods I brewed my first cup of . . . "the weakest coffee ever except for when I forgot to add the coffee to the coffee maker." I was really disappointed.After reading the package I discovered I could use two pods to improve the flavor. Of course this also doubled the price making the deal not so good after all. Using two pods was a little too strong for my taste. Senseo rates the coffee as between mild and med. It was VERY, VERY mild!In all fairness to this product, I purchased these pods to use with my EZ-Cup in my Keurig. So perhaps they would make better tasting coffee in the Senseo pod coffee maker.

We use a lot of Senseo pods, we have a Amazon subscription to 5 different flavors.  Our favorite is the Senseo Paris French Vanilla Caramel Bistro flavor, they have a smooth flavor and are not bitter.
I use one 'Espresso' on top of one 'Dark Roast' for a great cup of coffee.

This Senseo espresso is not of the same quality as it's predecessor, but since the ECE pods are getting harder to find on the market, I buy it fairly often.  The Senseo system is a winner which is, oddly enough, losing to the slower-brewed, crema-free Keurig phenomena which is nearly ubiquitous and very adequate, even okay.  Go with the Senseo-- it's cheaper, better, and a no-brainer. This espresso is a little rough around the edges, and the darker roast fries out some of the subtleties that a better grade of coffee enhances.  It's good enough on its own, better for mixed coffee drinks.  If you're not a connoisseur, this will more than meet your needs.
summary: Not bad, but the dark roast is better

reviewText: Senseo recently released several flavored varieties. Having always been partial to hazelnut coffee and being the happy owner of a Senseo coffee maker, I just had to give this new flavor a try. Well, let me tell you... I'm hooked! There is so much rich flavor in this coffee it's hard to believe the drink is calorie-free. It has the complex, subtle, thick texture and flavor of a fat- and carb-laden drink. If you've been worrying lately about the effects of your daily Caramel Macchiato on your waistline (not to mention your wallet) you have to give this coffee a try. It's wonderful and guilt-free! The pods are a little more expensive than regular varieties (the package is the same price but there are slightly fewer pods per bag) but boy is it worth that little extra!This flavor was all I needed to decide me to buy a second Senseo machine for my office. It's very quiet and doesn't bother my cube neighbors, and it's already paid for itself because I no longer spend a fortune at the coffee shop for mediocre coffee: I have my "candy bar in a cup" (to quote Paula) right at my desk.Senseo has a winner with this one... Give it a try!
Use of the Senseo coffee machine has fallen off in favor of different format brewers.  Thus the Senseo pods have become expensive and difficult to find locally.

I was expecting a deep, rich dark blend, but found that this was not more robust than the dark blend from Senseo.  I think that I may have to go to make my own pods to really get what I am looking for.  Not bad if you like medium strength coffee though.

We love it for 3 o'clock coffee like we make in the Senseo now (we prefer Lipton green tea in the AM as less letdown, see my review forLipton Green Tea, Mandarin Orange, Premium Pyramid Tea Bags, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)for a nice recipe for a pot).  Really fantastic flavor that I can mix with the Philips 00704 SENSEO Coffee Pods Dark Roast orPhilips 00703 SENSEO Coffee Pods Medium Roast.  This one is only on Amazon as I can't find it in any of our local stores--too bad since it is the best one :-), but you get it here.  15% off if you subscribe and free 2-day delivery with Amazon Prime membership, don't forget.  I used to mess with the expensiveExclusive, Aloha Island, Kona-Hawaiian Coffee Pods! Our Fabulous 20% Pure Kona Coffee! ESTATE BLEND Medium Roast - 12 KONA-PODS!but much more expensive and the taste is no better.  Enjoy!

Some of the Senseo pods lack character and are, frankly, quite bland. However, the Sumatra Blend has a lot of character and tastes very good. It has a smokey, dark flavor to it, reminicent of darker chocolates. I've enjoyed drinking this coffee black, with cream and sweetener, and with flavored creamers. All of them tasted good and the undertones of the coffee even stood out with the flavored creamer, a characterist often lacking in the Senseo Pods. Bottom Line: this coffee tastes great ! ! !
Very good coffee. Gave Sumatra Blend only 4 stars as we like our coffee much stronger, like the Dark Roast ones from Senseo. If the latter is not available this is a favorable replacement for once
summary: Senseo Coffee Pods, Sumatra Blend, 16 Count (Pack of 6)

reviewText: I am using this indeed with a Senseo machine.On the directions, it is indicated that one should use one bag for a small coffee size and two for the large size.Although I like my coffee strong, I found out that one bag will easily provide for a large coffee size and one may even squeeze out a third small coffee out of it.Taste wise, I find little difference between the expresso and the French roast (dark).
summary: Good taste, more than one small size coffe out of one bag.

reviewText: It is only 10% Kona, so if you are expecting a true Kona taste you may be disappointed.  However, as a general blend, this is far smoother and has a more full flavored (but not full bodied), not burnt taste than most of the Senseo Coffee Blends.I wouldn't have minded if the coffee was a bit stronger or full bodied, but still, as it is, it is my go to blend for my Senseo.
summary: One of the best balanced Senseo Pod Blends

reviewText: I previously purchased this as a set with 3 other different kinds of pods. This and the breakfast blend I enjoyed the most. The Kona Blend has a little bit of sweetness to it, with bold flavor. It has quickly become my favorite flavor.
In a word, no Senseo coffees are great but Columbia and Sumatra (after many tries) are my two favorites and are recommended.

I previously tried Senseo's Kona Blend back in 2011 and was very disappointed. I didn't think I would ever try it again. After shopping for what was currently available, I decided to give this another try and I'm very glad I did so. This latest order received July 2013 is a great blend. The freshness date on my packages is 05-03-14. I highly recommend this, and the price through Amazon is excellent - especially considering that you really cannot find this in stores! I usually go with stronger/darker coffee, but since Senseo has been more difficult to find I had settled on a Melitta dark roast that really did not give me a satisfying flavor profile. It was just blah. This Senseo offering is very satisfying and compared to a cup of freshly ground beans I would favor the Kona Blend pod.

This coffee is pretty tasty.  Not too strong of a vanilla flavor, more of a "hint" of vanilla.  Better with a bit of milk and sugar.  A nice occasional change from the Sumarta (now that's a good cup of senseo joe!)
A FANTASTIC  DELICATE COFFEE!  NOT A NORMAL COFFEE  CONSUMER  BUT PURCHASED  THIS FOR FAMILY/GUESTS.  THIS IS SO DELICATE AND EASY TO PREPARE = HAVE IT ON AUTO DELIVERY AND YES I REALLY LIKE IT.
Flat coffee taste, artificial vanilla, blah.  Of all the pods I've tried in my Senseo, these are the worst.

I do like Kona coffee  and this filled my craving.  However, it is not near the Kona aroma and full body flavor you receive from a Kona fresh ground blend in drip coffee pot.  But is Ok and does demonstrate some Kona flavor
this coffee is a nice on the go pod for making either a strong coffee or lighter tasting depending on whether you use two pod or one in your maker.
Hawaii and Jamaica produce the world's best coffee.  Aren't we lucky that Senseo offers the Kona blend.  It's heavenly!

These coffee pods are very, very weak. I started with one pod, no flavor. 2 pods, a bit better but still weak and watery. 3 pods was all I get into my little Hamilton Beach but there was still no Hazelnut taste. I finally used 2 pods for just a half a cup and though it was somewhat stronger, there was still no taste. Very disappointed in this selection, looking around for some other brands.March 24, 20012I like to update this review and give it 5 stars because I think I was a bit hasty the first time around. I only tried it in a cheap little 1-cup pot and I think that was the problem. I now use the pods in a 4-cup Mr. Coffee and it comes out absolutely delicious. I love the smell when it perks and enjoy the of it taste every morning. In fact, I'm ready to send in my next oder!

Althouh I love Senseo coffees for the most part, I didn't care for this one at all.  It has a smokey, burnt flavor to me that tastes like coffee that's been sitting out for hours.  Plus I had the same problems others mentioned with torn pods that contaminated the rest of the bag and what a mess that was!  I won't be buying this kind again.
Excellent product.  In my opinion, the best of the Senso coffee blends.  I will continue to purchase this product as long as it's available.

I wanted to try a flavored coffee pod for my Senseo machine.  I purchased hazelnut and was disappointed that I couldn't taste any hazelnut flavor at all!  It doesn't taste bad, but it tastes just like regular coffee with no hint of hazelnut.  What's with that?

The brand of Senseo that came with my little coffee pod machine was stronger than I liked so I tried a four pack of Columbiacoffee and the first pod was so strong that it upset my stomach.  The next two were terrible and I dumped both cups.  Since then I have tried diluting  each pod with some water but the rotten taste persists.  I bought a large coffee at a popular drive in and it was really strong and would have been refused back in the WWII era.  NEEDLESS TO SAY, NEVER ANOTHER SENSEO COFFEE POD IN MY HOUSE, EVER AGAIN!I don't blame Amazon for my mistakes but it really irks me to throw out twenty some dollars worth of worthless SENSEO coffee pods.  Will keep the pod machine to heat water for tea.  My suggestion is for people to buy coffee and filters from your local stores, at least most of it is drinkable and so much cheaper!
I loved this coffee but the senseo pods got so hard to find and were so pricey, that I Bought a Keurig maker and now use that.
summary: LOVED this coffee but I am no longer able to order it

reviewText: This hubby's favorite brand of coffee as it's rich tasting and easy to use. He was delighted to find this at Amazon as this type of coffee filter/pod seems to have disappeared from local grocery shelves.Things he likes best:1.  Rich coffee flavor2.  Easy to use in the morning and it saves time. Good for when you are sleepy too and need a little extra help. :-)3.  Great for taking on vacation as this pod works in most hotel/motel coffee pots.Recommend.
summary: Hubby's favorite coffee as it's portable

reviewText: Really flavourful and tasty without being overpowering, or too strong. Faintly sweet too. Love it.
I'm Thankful Senseo brought these Sumatran coffee pods back.  They have a rich flavor and are my favorite of the Senseo coffees.

I have tried pods that aren't made for the Senseo machine and have often had steam blown out and  boiling water leaks. I'm addicted to the frothy cup that the Senseo machine makes and wouldn't switch to a Kcup brewer.(the pods are also more ecologic than plastic Kcups and can be preserved well in any jar with a tight fitting lid)This Kona is rich and flavorful, but not strong enough for my taste.  I supplement it with about a quarter tsp of instant coffee--sometimes decaf and sometimes espresso.
summary: It fits senseo Machine and brews a dark, tasty, frothy cup (with a little help from instant coffee)

reviewText: But I have a Senseo machine and I get the intended results (creama on top of the coffee) but I doubt the standard pod coffee makers will give you the same results. I also have a Keurig which has more options for coffee. Cost per cup with pods is lower but I've never tried these with any of the other machines that use pods.

I bought this thinking that the coffee was a blend of Sumatran coffee beans. It isn't. It is (it says) at least 50% Sumatran blended with other coffees. They don't mention what other coffees. Could be coffee grown in New Jersey for all one knows. It does have a good flavor but I think the label should clearly state 50% Sumatran Coffee Blend and not put it in small print on the side. I think it is kind of sneaky, but I am sure legal, to label it just Sumatra Blend. One has to wonder what the flavor would be like if it were all Sumatran coffee.update: I wind up using two pods in my Bunn MyCafe machine which says two things. First off, they are the only pods thin enough to place two into my Bunn so there is less coffee in them and secondly, that using only one pod makes for a weak cup of coffee. After I got these, I got Java One Sumatra pods and Wolfgang Puck Sumatra pods. Both are superior and only requires one pod to make a good cup of coffee. I do like the Puck pods the best.
i like to mix this with sumatra blend, makes nice with internationalcoffee creamer, hazelnut.

The only taste you will get from these pods are faint vanilla.  You need two pods to make a cup of coffee and even with the two pods it does not taste like coffee.  It tastes like watered down coffee with a fake vanilla flavoring.

If you are looking for a Kona blend that actually tastes like a Kona blend, pass this one by.  Maybe it sat next to a bag of Kona in the warehouse, but that's about as close as it comes.Kona is smooth, and never bitter.  This stuff just tastes like an ordinary slightly bitter medium roast coffee.  Won't be buying this again...
summary: Well, its coffee, but it sure ain't Kona

reviewText: This coffee is the best I have ever had.  My seller sent it perfectly packaged and very promptly.  5 Star treatment!!
the price is right it is strong enough but, not bitter my wife uses it also and is very fond of it

This is one of the better tasting Senseo pods out there, but it is not Kona coffee.  It contains only 10% Kona coffee, the other 90% is something else.  If you want Kona coffee, go buy Kona coffee.  This Kona "blend" won't taste anything like it.Names aside, as I stated this is one of the better tasting Senseo pods.  Four stars are based on rating Senseo coffee.  It would get less stars if I was just rating "coffee".
summary: Good coffee, but let's not pretend it's Kona coffee

reviewText: I bought this for my son, It's his favorite flavor and amazon is the only place I can get it. The price is right and I'll be buying it again

We wish coffee tasted as good as it smells but have never found any that does.  This smells delicious and is ok but a lot weaker than we're used to.  Since the little cup-pod type single cup makers coffee is way too strong for all of us this was a more sensible alternative.  We'll keep trying to figure a way of making it stronger without being too strong.  Two discs didn't work.  All in all, it's a better coffee than we get trying to make one cup in a 12-cup coffee maker.  ;)
These are okay, but I prefer Target's Archer Farms brand coffee pods much more.  They cost less, are bigger, individually wrapped and produce a much smoother coffee with real vanilla flavor.
Purchased this for my Nephew for Christmas, he is a bachlor and always on the run. The pods make a great quick cup of coffee.

The Sumatra blend are my favorite coffee pods, but unfortunately the price on Amazon is almost full retail price lately.Note: You are supposed to use 2 pods for a regular sized cup of coffee, that's still a good price for the convenience. The 1 pod setting is for smaller cups only, but if you like weak watered-down coffee you could use this for a regular sized cup.
They look good as well as taste good. I had no negative experience here. Chewy and neat in their wrapper.
This is great for baking or just plainsnacking with you have that sweet tooth.  This is a very large bag.

You have all heard of celery stalks that have negative calories because it takes so many calories to chew them.  Well, these are candies that work in a similar way.  It takes so much work and frustration to unwrap each little square that you can eat the piece without worrying about calories.  If this is what the manufacturers intended, I can only commend them, but I have a sneaky suspicion that the extreme difficulty of getting to the candy has been produced by incorrect storage during the hot summer months.Can't beat the taste, though.  Once out of the wrapper, they are wonderful!
Used along with other types of candy to toss to the crowd at our Electric Light Parade.  These caramels are very good.
The caramels are soft and chewy but quite small.  The are hardto unwrap but it is worth it.  Allow plenty of time if you're using quitea few.

I used to buy the bottle of cinnamon oil and soak toothpicks and paper in it, then sell them in junior high, I always had one in my mouth, the hotter the better. I always wondered what it did to my digestive track! After becoming wise to my little business, i was banned from selling these when a student who bought a bunch stabbed himself in the cheek, thanks alot dork i could have bought that Casio Keyboard I always wanted from the profits.

I found these Hot Cinnamon Toothpicks to be very strongly flavored, perhap too much so for some (like my wife), and to have a good bit of "heat" as well. I also like the size and solid feel of the toothpicks.These have been good for me to chew on while dieting, recommended!
summary: Very Good Cinnamon Flavor Toothpicks - Recommended

reviewerName: Heather L. Parisi "Robert and Heather Parisi"
reviewText: SOMETIMES A TOOTHPICK CAN BE FUN!50 packs of these seems like enough to keep you in the picks for a while. They taste like cinnamon and its a nice touch that they are sugar-free.Seeing these old standard-bearers among the after dinner set brings back the old days, and then I see all these plastic tooth picks that come with floss already attached and I think, "wow, so this is progress?!"THE BOTTOM LINE:Anyway, if you are looking for decent cinnamon tasting toothpicks that are a decent value, come in handy little packages and are sugar-free, you're in for a treat -- HERE THEY ARE!
summary: PERFECT RETRO TREAT AS LONG AS THEY DON'T GET STUCK IN YOUR TEETH

reviewText: Not only do these bring back memories but as I've gotten older, I've realized that they not only have that great cinnamon taste but that they are actually useful (after all, they are toothpicks). Not only are they great for a last minute touch up before going out in public, getting stubborn pieces of food from between the teeth, but they sweeten the breath. They are far above the average, run of the mill toothpick.Back in high school,  they were used by some of my friends as "weight loss aids" (spicy but with no calories). Also, there was the added allure of mild risk, courting the disapproval of adults (they were actually banned in my school, probably by fearful administators who had visions of kids falling while running and getting injured by the sharp points). Parents cautioned us not to "Drive with one of those in your mouth" . They were right but we did, anyway...hey, we were teens.But I digress....this is one time when taking a trip down memory lane is worth the price.
summary: A nod to nostalgia with a capital "N" - yay!

reviewText: I'm old-school in the toothpick department. We'd fill old Rx bottles with cinnamon oil that we bought at the drugstore and eat them on the bus. The hotter the better.Personally, I think these babies are great for everything from weight-control to quitting smoking. Sugar free too. Packs pop in your purse. Yes, I'm a lady but I still love me some cinnamon-picks!

Yeah. Toothpicks. For $7 no less. What a bargain!!! And they are flavored? No way. That's so cool. Why didn't anyone think of this - well besides Joe in Middle School - with flavoring for next to nothing. But still, a seven dollar tooth pick is my idea of fun. And even better - if you get sick of them you can sell them on ebay as pieces of the crucifix that Jesus was hanged on (or the guy that played him in The Passion)

I first had King Leo soft peppermint sticks about twenty years ago and fell in love. These are NOT hard candies, nor are they chewy. The consistency is somewhat similar to those small pastel after-dinner mints, although a bit harder. The peppermint flavor is nicely balanced with the sweetness of the candy, neither too sweet nor too minty. When first put in the mouth, they seem to be a hard candy, but after a few minutes, they begin dissolving into a smooth, softer-but-still-crunchy delicious treat. I love this particular style more than the sticks as instead of holding the stick, these are just popped into the mouth. These are individually wrapped so they are perfect for communal candy jars or for purse or pocket. A lovely little treat any time of the day.

Nice peppermint candies for when you want the lift that a mint can give you.  The fact that they are "soft" makes them easier to eat and you won't break a tooth filling on them if (when) you bite down.  Peppermint flavoring is strong and really peppermint, not the  cheap flavoring that might be as much spearmint as peppermint, and you probably know how disappointing it is to think you are getting peppermint and end up with a taste that is nothing like that except that it's "mint" of some kind.These are good.

I don't know why I'd never heard of these or tried them until now - I guess because I was never into peppermints.  Well, now that I'm older and having digestive issues, I decided to try some peppermint candies from the store.  They turned out to be 'Soft Peppermint'.  I never knew there was a hard or soft peppermint...I thought they were all hard.I looked on Amazon and here were soft peppermints.  I've been eating them since they arrived 2 days ago.  Just the right amount of peppermint.  I would say the texture is like a 'butter mint' or 'after dinner mint'.  It dissolves on your tongue or you can crunch them for a faster meltdown.  I just assumed all candy that was red and white were hard peppermints.  Twenty three dollars for five pounds...a better deal than buying them in my town.Addendum:  Back for more.
summary: I'm addicted to these darn things!

reviewText: Who doesn't like peppermint at holiday time.  The bag was in good shape and we tossed them to the crowd at our Electric Light Parade.

I bought these before in a tub for Christmas and everyone was asking me where did I get them because they were so good!  This year I bought little cardboard-like paper boxes (looked like little gingerbread houses) and filled them with these luscious mints for all my friends, neighbors and family as gifts and everyone LOVED them! I keep a medium sized candy dish in the living room and always find it getting low with all the company and passers by taking one or more. These mints melt in your mouth and are the first mints I've found that are delicious and just softly minty!
I bought this large bag to take into work. Everyone loves these King Leo mints. Can't be beat! (However, for purists, order the peppermint sticks.)

After receiving it we realized it was not a bread mix but a hard-to-find baking ingredient.  Thus far we have not risen to the challenge of baking our own rye bread from "scratch"'However, we do trust Amazon.com for the many selections we've chosen on-line.  We will use Arrowhead Mills rye flour...eventually.
This is a fabulous flour, and I use it often to make bread.  It also makes delicious pancakes, waffles, muffins, and cookies.

I bought pack of 6 since I do bake rye bread. I have not used them all yet since I bake other breads as well but I am quite pleased with the product. In these times of gas costing so much, I save money by having it delivered to me.

I live in a large metropolitan area, but can't find rye flour without driving all over town.  And when it do find it, the price is astronomical.  Buying from Amazon is a great solution for me.My rye bread recipe only calls for two cups of rye flour for five loaves, so it takes me a little while to go through a bag of rye, but I pour these bags into a plastic storage container like I do with all my other flours and grains.  That keeps the critters out of them and keeps the flour from getting too hot and rancid.I probably won't need any more rye flour until later this year, but when I do, I'll be glad to buy another six-pack from Amazon.Oh, and what about the product itself?  This rye flour is so incredibly delicious!  The flavor is really great and not overpowering.Recipe:6.5 cups warm water3.5 tablespoons yeast (heaping)3 tablespoons salt (level)3 tablespoons caraway seed (heaping) - plus a few generous pinches on top of the loaves at baking2 cups rye flour10 cups unbleached white flour (level)Mix the ingredients and let the dough sit overnight in the fridge in a 12qt plastic tub with a loose lid.  Then form the loaves the next day, let them sit for 30 minutes, and then bake at 450* for 30 minutes (longer for bigger loaves).It's the perfect deli rye.  Mmmm!
i combine it with seeds & other flour such as millet & spelt & the bread is amazing. Very good.
This product is very good quality. I trust this brand. I used to buy it all the time before I went gluten free. I totally recommend arrowhead mills.

It is surreal how difficult it is to get rye flour in hawaii; that is to say impossible, until Amazon started delivering it.  I have made something of a project of sourdough this year and have starters going from white, wheat and mixtures; however the best sourdough comes from rye... well, at least it is the easiest to culture, and is a natural (has a lot of wild yeast in the flour).  Sadly I was unable to get a starter going until now.  Thanks to Amazon I now have a wild yeast pure rye, as well as one started with a pinch of my wheat starter,  It says something about the freshness and quality that the starter was foaming after one day!  I have already made rye bread using a culture started from this flour, and no yeast was necessary :)Beyond that, I like that it is packed in small bags, as I have to store it in the freezer to combat the tropical humidity and pests.  I also like that it is 100% rye, not a mixture like so many others.Thank you Amazon :)  Without this service I would have the trappings of western civilization largely off limits but for when I travel.  i really appreciate having access to the foods I grew up with, and ingredients I need to cook what I like.... which is pretty much the only way to get those things here.  It is nice having fresh rye bread again :) (ah, the little things we take for granted, until they are out of reach)
I bought this to add to my sourdough starter. It seemed to do the trick, and make it grow! I wanted an affordable, organic rye flour, and that's what this is!
I have ordered it for the second time. I bake rye bread and this flour works just fine. I haven't tried the second order yet, but the first one is perfect. Bread turns out delicious

I bought these Nature's Hallow Sugar Free Bllueberry Jams last year and they were really delicious.  Plus they were sugar free with all natural and organic xylitol for sweetener.  BUT.....I just purchased a case of them and they were grossly spoiled.  One jar arrived opened and leaking all over the package so I threw it out.  The second and third jars I opened were thick with globs of fungus encrusted blueberry's and smelled awful.  Needless to say, I threw them out......that's thirty dollars wasted.  A fourth jar smelled ok and after tasting a little of it to make sure it wouldn't make me sick, it turned out to be ok....at least I am still hoping so.  I am actually afraid to open the remaining jars.  It's like the company had a few really old jars left and sent them to me to clean out their inventory.  Well, I can tell you that they have lost me as a customer.  I use to buy their cookies for my old uncle but NO MORE.  He is old and might not recognize if they are spoiled, loaded with fungus, or rancid.  I won't be responsible for his demise by buying from an unethical company.  I already told the company about the opened jar upon arrival but I hadn't opened any more at that time.  I don't expect to hear from them!  I definitely DO NOT recommend this company any more.  Beware!
This jam is free of additives other than xylitol, and it is simply delicious.  If there is someone in your life who is fond of blueberry jam -- and who isn't? -- but can't eat sugar, this works.
summary: A very successful gift for a diabetic

reviewText: This jam is amazing.  You would never know it is sugar free and the super bonus is that xylitol is so good for your teeth!  This jam, more than the other Nature's Hollow jams (which I also LOVE) seems to be packed with whole fruit.  The flavor is fantastic and worth every dime of the added expense!
I eat this jam with cream cheese on multi grain crackers.  Perfect with my morning coffee.  Just enough sweetness to get you going.

I'm probably being TOO picky, cause the truth is, I've never gotten a burst of true, full blueberry flavor in any preserve/jam of that fruit I've tried. I don't know if the heating lessens the flavor or what.So, while this wasn't as "true fruity" flavored as the apricot, it was very pleasant and I enjoyed it. It has the same semi-puree consistency as the other Nature's Hollow preserve I've tried. For sugar-free, this is really nice. Only 2 grams of effective carbs per tablespoon, with 20 calories per tbsp. Ingredients: blueberries, xylitol, spring water, fruit pectin, citric acid. I like that simple list of ingredients. :)I am eager to try the strawberry one, now. :D
summary: Lovely sugarfree preserves, but the blueberry flavor comes across lightly

reviewText: I love all of Natures Hollow productsYou can't tell they are sugar free.The kind I would buy in the store (sugar free) would give me a funny after taste.  This brand doesn't.
I love this product because it tastes like the high sugar variety, but without the calorie laden sugars!  I will not use any other product from now on.

Loved these preserves. Got both the strawberry and the blueberry. Both have a great taste. It is so good to know they are made with the healthy XYLITOL, which is said to be the only sweetener that does not feed Candida. Thank you, Nature's Hallow.
Great taste zero sugar!!  A bit runny - not as consistent as regular preserves, but very good just the same.

I've had a chance to try several of the Nature's Hollow products now: four of the jam/preserves and the maple flavored breakfast syrup. The syrup I wasn't wild about. But the jams are gonna be regular online purchases for me (I got mine through Netrition, which is a low carb supplier I've used since I tried low-carbing, and still use now that I'm not low-carbing, but do try to avoid sugar).My fave ended up being the apricot. The strawberry, like the others, has a more runny/spreadable/puree-ish consistency, like you  made a compote at home from fruit. It's very fruity and happily without sugar and without the sweeteners that cause gas and intestinal ickies. This has xylitol and it doesn't give me any tummy woes at all and sweetens excellently.I do find an odd faint aftertaste/undertone in the strawberry jam, which is why I took away a star. And I do think the price point seems high. But ya know, if you don't want sugar and want to enjoy some jam on your whole grain toast or low carb pancakes or homemade waffles or, as I enjoy, on your Greek yogurt (these jams are da bomb on Fage 2% plain yogurt), Nature's Hollow is really a great product. I will be reordering.Enjoy...
summary: Another tasty offering from Nature's Hollow that's a boon to dieters, low carb or otherwise, and diabetics

reviewText: You would never know this is a sugar free jam.  The taste is great.  I make peanut butter and jelly sandwiches all the time using this.
Yummy and healthy--we love it! The kids use it on their sandwiches and in their plain yogurt. So good for diabetics, low carb, or just  for lessening the amount of sugar in one's diet.

I should have paid closer attention to the product (jar) size, that's my fault. It is a tiny jar, ten ounces. This equates to somewhere close to 2 bucks for a tablespoon full. (I paid 14 dollars for the jar)As for the taste, The jam is VERY good, and I guess if you're a billionaire, or maybe a federal employee (joking) you could afford it. As for me, I guess I'll have to go back to the store brand. Yikes! I do wonder in an effort to be fair if I should reconsider the number of stars I gave the product, considering how good it is, what do you think?

Kashmir Spinach is the third Tasty Bite offering I have tried.The look and taste is quite unappealing.We would not consider buying it again.We had high hopes based on how much we loved other Tasty Bite items we tried, but no luck with this one.I encourage you to try Agra Peas or Jaipur Vegetables instead, two Tasty Bite items that are really fantastic.
summary: Kashmir Spinach isn't good, but other Tasty Bite items really are great

reviewText: I've skipped past this one a few times because of the negative reviews on here describing the color and texture of this dish.  Having had this for lunch today, I will say that the only thing gross about this dish are the few 'in poor taste' reviews (even our four year old has enough common sense to refrain from poopy jokes at the dinner table).  Simply put, it looks like a dark green, creamed spinach soup.  That is all.  The taste is amazing and the paneer cheese cubes add nice texture and a mellow contrasting flavor to this spicy, curried spinach and tomato dish.  I will definitely repurchase this one again.

Kashmir Spinach is not their best offering. I like spinach and I'm not bothered by the presentation of the product..It's just not one of their best. I would recommend Madras Lentils, Punjab Eggplant, Beans Masala & Basmati Rice Meal, Channa Masala and if you like hot and spicy try Bombay potatoes too. I wouldn't recommend the Jaipur Vegetables or the Vegetable Korma. (Or Kashmir Spinach)
summary: All Tasty Bites are good..This one is not their best.

reviewerName: Doris R. Kem "cat n' dog lover"
reviewText: I just received my case of Kashmir Spinach by Tasty Bite today.  I served it with brown rice and a salad.  I must say that the color of the spinach is brownish green (not the prettiest), but the flavor was great!  This dish has a little heat, but not too much.  And the spices made this a very enjoyable dish to eat.  Don't be turned off by the color.  It is a great tasting dish.
summary: Not So Pretty But Absolutely Delicious

reviewText: The paneer cheese cubes (soft, lightly flavored cheese cubes) are one of my favorite accents in a dish, and Tasty Bite does an amazing job of them. The spinach is blended into the curry sauce, so there are no actual leaves of spinach, it is like a thick saucy stew with the cheese being the only chunks.It is really delicious and well-flavored, but this dish kind of needs either a piece of bread (pita, french bread) or some rice to go with it to sop up the sauce. I eat them by themselves sometimes but the flavor is so highly concentrated that a little bit of starch to balance it out makes it a really perfect quick meal.
summary: One of my favorite Tasty Bites

reviewText: This is the least appetizing of the Tasty Bite entrees, in appearance. It tastes good. However, the texture is smoother than in the illustration, more like spinach baby food, and the color is a bit browner than depicted. It has a mild spiciness. There is usually somewhat less paneer than shown in the illustration.Bottom line, it tastes good, but it looks like baby poo.  That may be rude but it is the truth and it must be said.Nutrition information:Note that there are TWO servings in the package and this information is for ONE serving, so if you eat the whole box, double it.Calories 133Calories from fat 72Total fat 8gSaturated fat 3gSodium 693mg !!!Total carbs 8gDietary fiber 3gSugars 2gProtein 6gVitamin A 44%Vitamin C 5%Calcium 15%Iron 16%

In reading the reviews I am surprised that the appearance of this dish is repeatedly mentioned. I didn't notice what some other reviewers view as a disgusting appearance. Perhaps it is because my first experience with this product was a few years ago in a food sampling. Small cup, not a big plateful and I focused on the intense flavors, and the fact that the base is spinach -- something I love and don't consume enough.Everyone is entitled to their opinion, but I adore this dish. The smell is distinctive -- decidedly earthy --which I relish. The paneer cheese is very light and soft with a texture like silken tofu, but the flavor is of a mild cheese. The cheese serves as a perfect counterpoint to the spicy spinach. Going against tradition I sometimes add a small amount of cooked brown rice, but I prefer the dish undiluted. And, I found the cheese chunks plentiful.The ingredients -- spinach, water, tomatoes, paneer cheese, onions, sunflower oil, salt, garlic, cornstarch, chilies, cumin are startling in their simplicity. Where is the long list of chemicals? Grabbing a convenience meal often means sacrificing both flavor and health -- this gluten free, Kosher dish sacrifices nothing. I will buy this dish as long as Tasty Bite continues to produce it.

Tasty Bite Entrées are a real time saver.  The Kashmir Spinach is very good; however, my favorite is still the eggplant.  I never buy any of their Entrées that contain rice since almost anybody can make rice for a few cents.  The spinach is kind of mushed up so the only chunks are the Paneer.  You need some rice or Naan with this one.
This is my second favorite Tasty Bite meal so far, out of the 4 or so I've tried. It does have a strong spinach flavor, but I happen to like that flavor. Works well over rice, or with naan or pita.

In my experiences with Indian cuisine from patronizing local restaurants owned and operated by native Indian folks, this is quite comparable and the flavors are very similar.  It's nice to be able to open a package of Indian food to eat with some Basmati rice quickly. Recommended.Some of the flavors are spicy.
wonderful. it could only be improved if it came with a packet of rice like the other entrees do.

Perhaps I got a bad batch.  This wasn't at all like the madras lentils enjoyed at Indian restaurants.  It was watery, too salty, and there were not many lentils.  It was like a watery soup, and not like the picture on the package or like a lentil stew.

This is now one of my favorites.  Had it for lunch as a soup.  I do think that the Tasty Bite portions are on the small size for claiming two servings (unless you're serving it with other food items) but they're always just the right amount to fill me up.  This one in particular I found to be extremely filling.  Tastes just like a mildly spicy beef chili without the beef.  Tofu and an extra can of kidney beans stirred into the mix could easily make this a filling meal for four.

I came across this product at Costco when they were giving out samples.  I hate lentils (I thought), but the sample was free & I was hungry.  What a surprise!  This tastes a lot like really good chili!  It tastes like beef chili, though it doesn't have meat.  My husband likes it too, and he's not big on vegetarian meals.90 seconds in the microwave is perfect.  It doesn't seem like there are two servings in the pouch, but we poured it over slices of homemade bread, and it was very filling.  I'm looking forward to trying out more Tasty Bite flavors.  I hope they have a variety pack.
It's got a good flavor but it tastes nothing like Indian food.  It tastes exactly like coney dog sauce.

I'm a big fan of Tasty Bite and I've tried a lot of their offerings.  My absolute favorite is the Madras Lentils. (With or without rice) Than the Channa Masala and Punjab Eggplant. Beans Masala & Basmati Rice Ready Meal s also very good. The ones that I didn't like sooo much were the Jaipur Vegetables, Vegetable Korma, and Kashmir Spinach.  I really wanted to like the Bombay Potatoes but even over a generous helping of rice it's just too spicy, It has a good flavor but there's just too much heat in the mix. As a little side note, it looks like Tasty Bite is in the process of changing their packaging from envelopes in boxes to just envelopes. Good for the environment but WOW! the edges will cut you up. I'm still nursing a good size cut  from simply turning the package over to read ingredients. Hopefully they work on the design a bit more.
summary: Love it! Love it! Love it!

reviewText: With my daughters decision to eat vegetarian, it has become a small struggle to find healthy, filling foods to stock in the pantry for her after school.We recently had the chance to sampleTasty Bite Entree, Madras Lentils, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)and I was very surprised at how good it was. Unlike my daughter I do not normally care for any type of Indian cuisine, but I liked this. It can be best described as a meatless chili, but with better flavor and texture than most vegetarian chili. It also had a nice level of heat to it.  Enough to notice, but not enough to be unpleasant.Serving suggestions were to use as a filling for tacos or over basmati rice. So far my daughter prefers to just eat it by itself.Now that we have found Tasty Bite brand products, my daughter is looking forward to trying out some others.  I thinkTasty Bite Entree, Kashmir Spinach, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)will probably be next.
summary: Tasty Bite Madras Lentils are in fact tasty!

reviewerName: Doris R. Kem "cat n' dog lover"
reviewText: This is a great tasting product!  It's not too high in fat, either.  Does kind of taste like coney sauce--but not exactly.  I absolutely LOVE it!  My non-vegetarian husband also likes it.  You won't be disappointed if you order this.  I will definitely be reordering.

I buy these all the time.It's GREAT for office food. I heat up a container ofAnnie Chun's Rice Express Sprouted Brown Rice, 6.3-Ounce Microwavable Bowls (Pack of 6), combine it with the contents of the Madras Lentils in a deep microwaveable bowl, give it 2 more minutes in the microwave and I've got a hot tasty filling filling, low fat high fiber meal (filling enough in fact that I often end up eating 1/2 and saving the rest for later). Both of these products require NO refrigeration so they are perfect for keeping around the office, at ~$5.50/meal if you eat it all at once, $2.75 if you split it between two meals.I also eat it at home.From a Weight watchers standpoint, the rice and the lentals add up to 10 points total, but like I said its filling enough for 2 meals.I will say, this is Indian food Lite, as in its processed food, and the spicing is mild. But it's very tasty
summary: Great office food, tasty for what it is

reviewText: I bought this at Costco yesterday after trying a sample. This is something I will keep in my pantry. So good! Only 2 Weight Watchers points per serving. I don't like Indian food so I would have never tried this without sampling first. It just taste like a really good chili. My husband couldn't believe that there isn't any meat in it. I have friends on the Weight Watchers plan that also have to eat "gluten free" and I can't wait to tell them about this.

Madras Lentils may easily be eaten alone for a satisfying meal with little clean-up. When eating this as a family meal we like to add one can of pink beans, one can of finely diced tomatoes, and a little frozen/fresh spinach to two pouches of Madras Lentils. We serve it on top of rice. Easy, fast, no MSG too!!!!

These Indian-style Madras lentils have a little bit of a zing, but they're not spicy. One minute in the microwave and they're ready to enjoy. Not only do they taste great, but they're also very healthy. The only serious criticism I have is that the packaging is a little excessive and should be reduced; the food itself is nutritious and delicious.

Where a 4-pack of these tasty lentils & such is cheaper. A great flavor and not as pronounced a scent if you're eating at your desk and/or worried about affecting the microwave's essence in the staff cafe.

I tried a demo of Tasty Bite Entree Madras Lentils in a supermarket, and absolutely fell in love with it. Everything in it is healthy stuff, and it's a wonderful thing to use as a topping for baked potatoes or rice.Use your imagination! Add sliced chicken, top it with cheese, mix-in tofu -- the world is yours!Every Tasty Bite Entree I've purchased was really good and worth the price and can add amazing variety to your meals.
Reminds me of chili...without all the calories. I might add 1 oz. of some lean ground turkey next time.

This is my favorite Tasty Bite meal out of the 4 I've tried (I'm in the process of trying more). I take this to work a lot with some naan or pita, and rice works well, too. It's like Indian-spiced chili - yum! This is a very hardy and satisfying vegetarian meal. Another reviewer suggested adding kidney beans - I might try that.

I love tasty bite as a product.  I'm mostly vegetarian (I try to avoid as much meat as I can), and I love savory and spicy foods. I've tried at least 15 Tasty Bite varieties (mostly Indian varieties, a couple of the Thai ones), and Madras Lentils is my favorite by a long ways.- It is very flavorful - rich, savory- It is a satisfying comfort food- Good source of protein and not too high in fat or sodium- It is very versitile.  I usually eat it plain (almost like a soup/chili) but you could also serve it with rice or naan or even Tortilla chips.I once held a party where the attendance list surprisingly filled up as people brought more friends that I was expecting.  I took two boxes of Madras Lentils, microwaved them in a ceramic bowl, garnished with a little cilantro, and surrounded with tortilla chips.  My guests didn't quite know what it was ("some sort of lentil/chili dip") but it went FAST and received a lot of compliments (and helped me quickly extend my food offerings).You'll like this one!
summary: Absolutely Delicious - my favorite Tasty Bite

reviewText: Very nice. Not spicy, not too salty, lots of protein (12g for the whole packet), soft and mushy (in a good way). The balance between sauce and solid stuff (lentils and kidney beans) was good too.

I've tried many, though not all, of the Tasty Bite line of "1 Step - 1 minute" of products. This Madras Lentils ranks among the best. I think the spices are just right, with on major exception, detailed below, that applies to all their products that I've tried, the consistency is near perfect as the lentils are "al dente" (cooked to near perfection) IMHO. As with the entires Tasty Bite line up these are ideal for travel, quick lunches at work or home when you just don't have the time nor desire to spend preparing something. At current prices, they're a terrific value at less than $3 for a "two serving" package. Honestly though, unless you're on a near starvation diet, or half a package is being served as a very small side dish to a larger plate of food, I think most people will consume the entire package. I tend to, though I'm cutting back foe health purposes, and the whole package constitutes a full and with one major exception healthy meal; the exception being sodium.. If one is on a weight loss plan that focuses on high protein this is a near ideal product. The nutrition facts for the entire package are as follows:300 calories; 100 from fat . Broken down into detail and percentage IOC the recommended Daily Allowance based upon a 2,000 to 2,500 calories (not a weight loss level for mist people) per day diet, these are marked by the % sign in the details that follow:1. Total Fat 12 grams (18%), 5 grams of which are Saturated Fat (26%), 0 grams of which are Tran Fat2. Cholesterol is 20 mg (6%)3. Sodium: 1,020 mg or 42% of the RDA.  THIS IS EXTREMELY HIGH. Accordingly, if you've got a heart condition or are on a sodium restricted diet, or just don't want all that sodium in one meal then STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!4. Total Carbohydrates = 36 grams which = 12%. Of that, Dietary Fiber represents 10 grams (40%); a good thing for most people,while Sugars are a negligible 4 grams.5. You'll get 14 grams of Protein which will help you remain satiated for a good while.6. Finally, the vitamins and minerals content are:Vitamin A - 12%;Vitamin C - 8%;Calcium - 8% and;Iron - a handsome 28%.REMEMBER, THE ABOVE VALUES ARE FOR THE ENTIRE PACKAGE, WHICH IS TECHNICALLY CONSIDERED TWO SERVINGS. I feel this is a better representation to go by because based upon the percentage of reviews that address the portion size at the time of this review, most people I believe consume the entire package at or for one meal.In summary, with the exception of the sodium, this is a relatively healthy product, and one that is well-suited for a lot of weight loss programs. The sodium should not be taken lightly though. It's widely believed that Americans have much to much salt in their diets and if you read the nutritional value of the plethora of products consumed and add to that the amount of table salt people add to their food, you'll understand why I reach this conclusion.Without the sodium though, this us a "near perfect" product from a dietary health perspective. It's the sodium content that causes me to give this three stars instead of five. It's too bad that Tasty Bite didn't play around with adding some other herbs and spices that would have allowed them to reduce the sodium and still end up with a palatable and desirable food item.
summary: Tasty but BUYER BEWARE OF SERIOUS HEALTH ISSUE

reviewerName: R. W. Taylor "Wil O' The Wisp"
reviewText: I recently paid $4.80 for a 4-pack (same size packs, same product). The product is pretty good... kind of a dal-sort-of-thing, but I cannot see forking over such $$$ here for it. Look elsewhere!

I really like this product a LOT, and though for my taste it is a bit too spicy. I consider  this is my BEST "find" for this year!  I keep this stocked in my pantry all year-round!  I find this product is a great base for a very nourishing meal shortcut.  So, if you're not into spicy food like me, use two of the packets as a base and add one 14 oz. container of chicken stock, add a cup of cut potatoes (I use the plain Ore Ida hash brown cubed potatoes from the frozen food section of the market) and add one small can of kidney beans and finely chopped carrots and celery and slow simmer for about 45 minutes (or use a fuzzy logic rice cooker on the soup setting if you have one) and you'll have an incredibly easy & hearty meal good for 2 large or 4 smaller bowls.  Add to it a loaf of crusty bread, some wine, and Fontina or other favorite cheese and you'll be healthfully well-fed!

It s delicious but too much fat  not my favorite meal.It s not really healthy for our hearts  , i guess  ?...any cute female doctor on amazon.com and looking for buying grocery on amazon please tell me this. Thanks alot.

5 of us have tried this "Jaipur vegetables", and all 5 of us love it.  So full of flavor for something that comes out of a box.A single package is definitely enough to feed 2 people when served with rice, and I have stretched it to 3 for a smaller meal.  That makes this a really good value for something so easy and tasty.  Very highly recommended, I'm going to order more eventually myself.I have not tried any other Tatsy Bite item as of this writing so I can't compare to the others.  I might try the eggplant or spinach one next.Edit:  I have since tried many different Tasty Bite entrees and can tell you this is definitely the best of them all.Don't try the spinach one no matter what you read though trust me

I was recently introduced to Tasty Bite entrees and have stockpiled my office with a number of different varieties (so expect to see quite a few reviews).  I'm not one for instant meals but I've made an exception for Tasty Bite because I recognize all of the ingredients used, they're vegetarian (I'm not a vegetarian but I prefer to eat meat that's been just prepared), MSG and Preservative Free and the convenience can't be beat.  Since I eat these in the office when I haven't had the time to prepare anything else or go out for lunch, I mostly enjoy them as soups though I believe most are meant to be served on rice.  The Janipur Vegetables are very good and I love the Paneer Cheese cubes :).  I just wish that this dish were a little spicier to suit my taste.  I'll definitely be purchasing this one again.
summary: Very good but wish it were a little spicier

reviewText: Jaipur Vegetables is not their best offering. Instead I would recommend Madras Lentils, Punjab Eggplant, Beans Masala & Basmati Rice Meal, Channa Masala and if you like hot and spicy try Bombay potatoes too. I wouldn't recommend the Jaipur Vegetables or the Vegetable Korma or Kashmir Spinach.
good quick dinner. ok alone or w/kashi crackers, potatoes or sweet potatoes. I don't use rice but would guess its good w/that as well.

reviewerName: Doris R. Kem "cat n' dog lover"
reviewText: I do like this entree very much.  It has a little heat.  I would give it 5 stars if it had some type of legume in it to give it more protein and fiber.  I added a little chopped cilantro and served the Jaipur Vegetables over brown rice.  Very tasty!

This is the second Tasty Bite Indian entree I try and, just like the Madras Lentils, it's a winner. The taste is creamy, rich and flavorful, spicy but not too spicy. It's maybe a little more greasy than it needs to be, but the nutritional content breakdown reveals a fairly healthy entree.The portion is reasonable, but not large (fills up a small bowl).I wish Tasty Bite would make an effort and reduce the excessive packaging (each single portion is contained in a plasticized foil bag packaged inside a thick cardboard box), but as far as the food itself is concerned, this is a five star product. I can't wait to try the other Tasty Bite entrees now!

reviewerName: Fabulinus "To err is human. To forgive for no...
reviewText: Being a vegetarian and recently becoming aware that I am allergic to soy, I have had to really scrounge around for healthy, tasty and easily prepared foods.  The Tasty Bite line of Indian foods are literally some of the best Indian food I have ever tasted.  There are Indian resturaunts that do not prepare their foods as well.  These dishes come in a pouch that is tightly sealed, do not need refrigeration, have a long shelf life (but because of the way the food is sealed there is no need for unhealthy preservatives), can be poured into a bowl and microwaved for 2 mins tops, have very basic/simple ingredients and the ingredient list does not read like a chemistry class assignment.  They are kosher and most of the line is vegetarian (not vegan, though).  The flavor is second to none!  I have at least two of these dishes a week for either lunch or dinner usually serving them with jasmine or basmati rice or quinoa [...].They can be a bit expensive, but its worth buying a few for a treat if you are on a budget.  Healthy, tasty, Indian fast-food... can't beat it with a stick!** Addendum ** Dec 26, 2007:  Most of the Tasty Bite Line is Vegan!  Check em' out!  They're delicious!!
summary: Good Stuff in a Small Package

reviewText: This Tasty Bite meal has paneer soft cheese cubes, raisins, cashews, carrots and peas in a delicious yellow curry sauce. It is vegetarian. It would probably be good with rice or something, but unlike many of the other Tasty Bites, this one is actually fine as a stand-alone as well. It also isn't too heavy on the onions and garlic, so you can eat this before a meeting with no fear of bad breath.
summary: I never get tired of this one! The best Tasty Bite meal out there

reviewerName: Glenda Boozer "Live, live, live! Life is a ba...
reviewText: This was really yummy, mildly spicy so that I could add hot sauce as needed, and actually it was good hot or cold. I love this stuff with brown basmati rice cooked in my rice cooker, but I also like it with whole-grain crackers when I just don't feel like cooking.

I have always liked Indian food, but more recently have indulged more so. Looking for something quick and easy, I came across these on the internet. I have since tried various imports - which can and have been somewhat horrid and unreliable as far as good taste. This is possibly because Indians are used to different tastes than we in the states. Red chile, green chile, coriander, ginger, clove, and cumin are fine and excellent. But tamarind is questionable, and cardamom, for instance is absolutely nasty (tastes like incense smells), and found in MOST imported ready-to-eat entrees. Tasty Bite, however, located here in the states, so far as I have seen (I've tried about 9 or 10 different entrees) none of their recipes seems to include that distasteful product. Tasty Bite easily makes the tastiest (Parampara ready-to-eats were pretty excellent, but they no longer make them - only ready mixes) ready-to-eat products. And this one, Jaipur Vegetables, is my personal favorite. I order them 12-24 at a time. These are also good cold, for lunch time "brown bagging".

What a winner! So glad I tried this based on the reviews. I was looking for something a little different to serve for dinner and love good Indian food. I love that this has healthy ingredients and is shelf stable. This one comes in a sealed silver pouch, so you can immerse it in boiling water for 5 minutes and it is ready to eat. I served this last night over some Casbah cous cous (another quick, easy item - I heat the water in the microwave to make the cous cous while the water boiled on the stove to heat the Jaipur Vegetables). In 5 minutes we had dinner - very hearty and satisfying together. The sauce is spicy in a good, Indian-food way. The amazing thing was when our picky 9-year-old actually wanted more of the peas in it (and usually she loathes peas!) Yes, it is that good!! With the cous cous, one package is perfect as a meal for 2. Or serve as a side dish (over rice or cous cous) along with a piece of chicken or fish. A terrific lunch also ( you can empty the pouch into a bowl and nuke it!); keep one in your desk at work. If you like Indian cuisine, I recommend Tasty Bite Jaipur Vegetables without hesitation.
summary: So good, our 9-yr-old ate the peas! (and she hates peas!)

reviewText: I have absolutely no experience with Indian food, but when I saw these entrees in a local discount store, I decided to try them, because I needed a quick dinner that night.I microwaved them for myself and my partner that night, and, hey, they were GOOD! We were both surprised that we liked the flavor of the cheese, peas, etc., considering that this was "prepared" food.This was a good introduction to Indian cuisine, and now I'm ready to try other flavors of this brand. After that, maybe an Indian restaurant? ;)
summary: I don't know Indian Food, But I Know What I Like!

reviewText: Just perfect.  Light and filling.
summary: Delicious.  Had with go go rice thai flavor

reviewText: So I recently posted a review about the Tasy Bite Madras Lentils and how they were my favorite so far. And they were, until I tried this dish. DELICIOUS! Think of a  less tomato-y butter chicken-ish flavored sauce, but with vegetables and paneer instead. For a microwave dish, this meal is fantastic with naan or pita - which makes the perfect work lunch because no refrigeration is required.
