It's a little high in the fat content if you're like me and eat the whole packet (2 servings per packet), so I won't eat it every day, but I'll probably enjoy it once or twice a week. Definitely a new favorite.
This one is great. Lightly spicy; not too much. Lots of green beans, potatoes, peas and paneer. It tastes a little cinnomony to me.

Very delicious vegetarian entree. As with many prepared foods, this is kind of heavy on sauce and low on vegetable content. This works well if you are pouring over rice. If you are trying to stay low carb, this is an excellent entree - just add more cashews and some more steamed vegetables. Very low net carbs. Delicious.
I love many of the Tasty Bite products. This one is delicious, low fat, vegan and healthy.
after reading reviews ordered this at a great price - delicious, gluten free. low fat indian meal .. quick and easy to prepare, you cant go wrong with tasty bite!!

Tasty Bite has become my least favorite brand of shelf-stable retort-packaged Indian meals. The Bombay Potatoes are a pleasant surprise after some of the other meals such as the syrupy Thai entrees.  (TheTasty Bite Entree, Punjab Eggplant, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)is another one I like.)The potatoes and chickpeas have retained a sufficient amount of texture.  The sauce is thin but has a pleasant spiciness and there is plenty of it, which I don't mind because it is pretty good, especially compared to some of the other ones I have tried.  You can add leftover potato, chickpeas, or even green beans to this meal and I like to serve it with brown rice and garnish with diced chili peppers.The entire package is supposed to be two servings but is realistically one. The total contents have 820mg of sodium, 6g of dietary fiber, 8g of fat, and 1g of saturated fat. The meal is vegan and is certified kosher.
It looks very good.  Potatoes and some beans.  Delicious sauce.  I put over a chicken cutlet for dinner last night.  It was great.

I initially hesitated to buy any ready-to-eat product fearing that they might taste bad or how they could be preserved without preservatives.  But when shopping last week, I found it in the Indian cuisine aisle and decided to give it a try.  I just heated it and found it to be better tasting.  But you add lemon juice (enough to give it the sour tangy taste) and chopped cilantro.  I also added quarter teaspoon of chilli powder, rasam powder and salt accordingly to give it a fresh taste.  Try the above directions for a real good taste.
summary: Good.......but better to add your own ideas

reviewText: Vegan. All natural. Kosher. Chickpeas and potatoes in savory brown gravy. Reminds me of puri aloo (without the bread) from railway platforms or from street vendors across India, but higher quality and very hygienic. Convenient foil package. Heat & serve. Great with tortillas, pitas, puris, on toast, or over rice. Actually made in Maharastra, so its really the real thing.Tasty Bite Entrée, Punjab Eggplant, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12),Tasty Bite Entrée, Bengal Lentils, 10 Ounce Packet (Pack of 12), andTasty Bite Yellow Curry Vegetables & Jasmine Rice, 12-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)are also highly recommended. This review is out there for those for whom this makes a difference. See all of my reviews for more great choices. Check out "Vegan Grocery Favorites" and "Vegan Grocery Top Ten" in Listmania. Your "helpful" votes count and will be greatly appreciated to benefit the search of others. Thank you.
I couldn't finish it.  The flavor made me sick.  It just tastes wrong...

I know it is good for you and will give a really good try to get use to this taste. I love roasted seasoned seaweed, so that isn't  the reason, just so different then expected. Leaves little particles in your mouth, so the kelp flavor can linger, linger.
summary: Not the usual taste, but then it's really kelp.

reviewText: Ha Ha, yes I realize the title of this review is very cheesy but it's how I feel about this product. When I sprinkle (or dump) it on my meals, I never feel the least bit guilty (as I sometimes do when I pour regular ol' salt on) because I know I am adding iodine to my food which is an essential nutrient we all need! This product tastes "seaweedy" so if you're not a fan, I'd go else where or use very small amounts to get your iodine fix... but I happen to love the taste so it works well! It tastes great on fish and Asian-esque type meals too, just experiment, it's worth it!
Not a salt replacement IMHO. However they are delicious, I particularly like them in soup. I also like to use them when baking or broiling fish.

I got this thinking it will be a very fine powder like the Japanese organic kelp powder. Instead it's granules... and when I sprinkle it on top of food, I get the crunchies (did I just eat salt crystals or sand??)  Anyway, I'm only using it for cooking now, so it can somewhat dissolve.  But I prefer the Japanese organic kelp powder, which is EXTREMELY fine, and suitable for sprinkling on top of food.

Good for you, probably. But the shell debris in the product is over what I, in the food biz for many years, consider acceptable. The "mouthfeel" is untrusty, unless you like to chew tiny bits of shell. These bits are not sand, they can be chewed, but it's unpleasant, IMO.  For iodine I'll stick to natural liquid kelp. Sorry.

Glad to see it is available again.  I use this liberally in many foods, not much taste to it but it's health benefits are many.  I had my daughter in law taking it while pregnant with my grandson after reading that iodine can increase a child's IQ by 15 points.  I thought why not, a kid can use all the points he can get in today's world.  I'm also glad it comes from northern Atlantic waters since I feel that the Pacific waters are probably pretty 'nuclear' by now after the disaster at Fukushima.  Iodine was used for an unbelievable number of maladies in "the old days" and I think now the pharmaceutical companies, or prescription drugs, have replaced some pretty good remedies of old that were MUCH cheaper and probably better and with fewer side effects.
I really like this kelp because it doesn't have a very strong flavor but I feel good that I'm adding a little more to our diet. it mixes pretty easily in foods. I use in shakes, salads, etc...

This is a great product for natural iodine and salt…. it is from the sea, so it does have the "sea" taste of kelp, and nori… but if you don't mind that , it is a great flavor for anything you would put salt on…
How great do these taste. Reminds me of home. Yum scrum Piggy's bum.

One of our favorite candy bars from the UK,  harder to find here.  It's sweet and crunchy, with a delicious honeycomb center and yummy milk chocolate surrounds.  Hankering for the taste I ordered this box of 6 and found it very reasonably priced.  Would buy from them again.
summary: Delicious quite hard to find treat

reviewText: By far my favorite candy bar.  Crunchy and chewy and the honeycomb melts in your mouth. You must try these!
this UK product is about 1/3 the price of the australian Violet Crumble .. about 2/3 the pleasure .. you decide.
summary: will do, but australian Violet Crumble much better

reviewText: I bought these as a treat for my dad and he loves them! a little bit of home for him so that was great, they were in good condition when the arrived (i was a little worried because of the heat) it is so great to be able to send them straight to their house also! thanks to amazon

I received these in the mail today and tried one. It wasn't at all what I hoped for.Essentially this is a sort of solid sort of crunchy candy covered in chocolate. The "Honeycomb Center" is justair bubbles injected into the candy before it hardens. It's a bit too sweet for my tastes, I probably would not buy these again.
Fresh Quality, packaged well, good value, I would not hesitate to repurchase this product, one of my wife's favorite's sweets!
These are favourite. Can't buy them too often but they taste like a little bit of heaven.  My little bit of sin tucked away in the draw when nothing but candy will do
Crunchies are Hokey pokey covered in a generous amount of chocolate.  If that's what you want, that's what there are.  Enjoy.

Someone bought these for me by mistake. The first time I tried a bar, I thought it was a little too sweet. But by the second bar, I was hooked. There's only a little bit of chocolate on the outside, so you can hardly call this a chocolate bar. The magic is all in the honeycomb candy middle. It goes crunch, then it melts in your mouth like honey-butter. You really have to try it for yourself to understand how delicious it is.

I got my Crunchie at Fresh & Easy market not Amazon. With that said, this chocolate bar was actually pretty good. It has a sort of light brittle type center, very airy, has a mild caramel x honey flavor to it. I didn't see a honey comb pattern in the middle, but maybe that was something I imagined seeing and didn't happen. The crunchy center is covered in a thin chocolate coating which was great, not too sweet. At Fresh & Easy this bar cost me about $1.50, and it wasn't so filing like a Snickers bar which is 1/2 the price. I realize this stuff is imported so it adds to the cost, but still I can't imagine this costing the manufacturer more then $.10 to make. There's just not much to it, unlike say a Snickers bar which has chocolate, nougat, caramel, and peanuts. So don't look to this as a snack that will fill you up, but a nice treat from the Brits.
summary: The Brits know their food...i think

reviewText: I love this one but this one is not easily available in local stores though!!!! The honey comb in between the chocolate just melts when you bite it ..it gives you a crunchy yet melting effect at the end...A great product by cadbury...Highly recommended to try once if never tried...
summary: Honey comb center that just melts in your mouth:)

reviewText: Always the best... but if you order during summer and the mailman leaves them in your metal mailbox, expect them to be melted by the time you pick them up!
I just can't give the product a bad review as these chocolate bars are delicious and remind me of my childhood growing up in London.

One rule I always try to follow is to never go to the grocery store when I'm hungry. Well, I missed on this one tonight. All was well as I visited my nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market until I passed the baking chocolates. There sat a tray of Cadbury Crunchie bars. I couldn't help myself. The label said it was made in St. Bournville, Birmingham UK. It was 190 calories, but I'd been good all day. Into the cart a bar went, and I opened it first thing when I got home. Man, was this thing good! The outer chocolate cover was excellent but the best part was a crunchy caramel-like interior. I can't describe it. It tasted a bit like the inside of a Heath Bar, but it was better. It was part solid and part like a really stiff and crunchy foam. Did I mention that it was delicious? Mmmmm! One of the best bars I've had in years. To be honest, I don't consume many candy bars, but this one was certainly excellent!Gary Peterson
summary: One of the Best Bars I've Had in Years!

reviewText: Amazing how this has stood the test of time. Creamy delicious Cadburys m,ilk chocolate wrapped around sweet and crunchy honey comb - a taste sensation .This has been a favourite of sweet lovers for years.

When I was a kid I used to love Violet Crumble candy bars.  They are difficult to find and very expensive.  I found these in my suggested items and gave them a try.  This is a great replacement.  The chocolate is lovely.  The honeycomb center is perfectly crunchy without being hard.  What a treat.

I ordered these to try them because I heard they were really good. They arrived in about a week and I ate one. It was such a different experience than eating any other chocolate bar I had tried. It was soo good! I will be ordering again soon.
summary: One of the best chocolate bars EVER!

reviewText: I loves the chocolate bars. I do not like Cadbury USA chocolate, but the UK chocolate is great. I cannot find Violet Crumble anywhere so this is my go to replacement. The honeycomb is nice and the bars arrived fresh and unmelted.

1) these candy bars were apparently made for overseas distribution but never got there.  I ordered from a company in Mass. figuring that all the reviews talking about candy with asian/indian language on the wrapper might be avoided but it was not.  Seems you will get these "overseas" bars wherever you get them from.2) I wanted the VIOLET CRUMBLE but it is not available in the US anymore.  Some reviewed these and said these bars were close to if not better than the VC.  I disagree greatly.  Although they are both a form of "sponge" candy with a chocolate covering, this bar does not come close to the VIOLET CRUBMLE.  The "sponge" center only makes me think the word STALE, and the chocolate has something wrong with it.  Not even close to the quality of the chocolate used on the VC.  Indeed after just a small sampling from the first bar, I was so disappointed I tossed them all in the garbage.Too bad.  Guess I'll keep on looking for the VC.  Hail Flavius!
summary: tastes bad, tastes stale, obsolete inventory?

reviewText: I'm originally from England, though lived in the US most of my life. English sweets are WAY better than what's avalable in the US. This is a must-try. Love the honey/crunchy center!

I found these at my local grocery store and decided to try them. They where delicious and I could really taste the honey also they were quite crispy too. I plan to order them from here on Amazon because they're much cheaper than what I paid. Here they are around 71 cent for one bar but I ended up paying $1.69 without tax.

OK - i have now found THE best chocolate candy in the world - so disregard any other reviews where i had said other candies WERE the best candies...hehee...These candy bars are incredible.  And I am a chocolate candy connoisseur... and i dont meant that in a snobbish way.  I will eat a good, pure chocolate Hershey bar before i will eat an expensive candy bar that does not have a good flavor.The British chocolate is just better, to me.  (I live in the US.)  And the honeycomb crunch inside is just what i was looking for, it reminds me of our US honeycomb 'sponge' candy, but is lighter to the tooth (crunch-wise), and taste more like honey - to me.  Just very delicious.  I had no problem with it being hard to bite, mine came very fresh and perfectly tasty.  AND quickly delivered - but people reviewing have to remember the it depends on what company is shipping it.  You have to review your actual ORDER in that area of your account on Amazon - then the Seller will be able to know of your displeasure if something went wrong.So, i give this a top-rating of 5 stars - great chocolate and honeycomb crunch taste.  I will be ordering more.

First can I say that the seller of these candy bars is very thoughtful and they included and ice pack so the chocolates didn't melt in shipping. I grew up eating these candy bars in Africa so was delighted when I found them here at amazon. The honeycomb center is crunchy and melts in your mouth along with the milk chocolate coating. The only problem with these candy bars is they don't last long. They are that good and once others in your family find out about them they will disappear even more quickly. Maybe order 12!~The Rebecca Review

I was expecting something a little softer, like actual honeycomb.  Whatever the center was made of was hard as rocks, so either it was super stale, or not at all honeycomb.  The chocolate covering was so-so.  Overall, these were pretty meh.
Holy crap these babies are good. They're kind of like a Butterfinger except a billion times better and not nearly so messy.

I am so addicted to this candy from my childhood...imported from the UK because that is where it comes from...USA substitutes (called seafoam or honeycomb chocolate) do not taste the same! They never last more than a few days in my house =)

As someone else said- what are US manufacturers/distributers thinking????I believe See's does a similar luxury-cost product, but I doubt it's Crunchie-standard!When I was a child ( and no one was worried about lawsuits and kids handling lava-like fluids ) we made 'honeycomb' by boiling syrup and sugar then at the last minute adding bicarbonate of soda which whooshed it up and then you set it on parchment or greased pans quickly, then when set bashed it into pieces....if you had any you then dipped it in chocolate for the ultimate confection.Crunchie bars are the easier, safer, less-messy way to indulge in this tradition.
summary: probably the tastiest candy/chocolate product on the market...

reviewText: We saw a TV segment on Manodori Balsamic Vinegar....yummmmm...this is NOT the most expensive....but it way better than the dollar store's or your local grocery market's! Delicious!
This is the real deal.  If you want that thick almost syrupy rich traditional Balsamic to drizzle on your salad or cheese or to finish a meat dish, this is the stuff.

I love balsamic vinegar, and have tried several brands. I decided, since this one had such great reviews, to try it even though it is quite expensive.It blew my socks off!It is incredible balsamic vinegar. Actually perfect!When I dribbled it on a dinner salad I prepared, I felt like I was in Heaven.A few weeks after I purchased it from Amazon, I was visiting a local gourmet market and they had the same bottle  marked at twice the price!I cannot recommend this balsamic highly enough.Truly the best!
summary: The best balsamic vinegar I've ever tasted

reviewText: Okay, so I docked a star because of its price...I'm a poor college student after all. While some might not understand why I spend 40+ dollars on a bottle of balsamic vinegar, but just a little spoonful goes a long way and I'd rather spend money on healthy products like this than bottles of vodka and beer. I have used other aged balsamic vinegars before (4 years, 8 years, 16 years, etc), but I think this one has just the right acidity. Not too overpowering so I can really enjoy the taste of balsamic but at the same time reminding me that this still is a vinegar. I will never buy those runny, taste-less balsamic vinegars at a grocery store ever again. I really do make sure to be super careful when pouring because I don't want to waste any - it's THAT delicious. I pair this with almost all of my poultry dishes, pork tenderloins, and even strawberries (gotta try this - you will be amazed!). If price seems unreasonable to you, I seriously urge you to try it at least once and decide for yourself. Chances are that you will be coming back to buy more later just like me :)
summary: At last, I'm done with my balsamic vinegar searching...

reviewText: This is not your typical balsamic.  Rich and syrupy, deliciously sweet.  The bottle is not huge -- not like a wine bottle, so you're inclined to save it for drizzles and special things; this is not for your recipe that calls for 1/2 cup of vinegar.I served it on a simple salad of tomato, buffalo mozzarella and basil, and it was a real crowd pleaser.  I'll definitely keep buying this, I am completely hooked now.

At this pricepoint. I've tried about 5 around the same price and a lower and my family thinks this is sweet and smooth and yummy with salad. My six-year-old likes to dip his spinach leaves in it. Anything that makes him eat spinach is something I'll buy again!
summary: Best, sweetest balsamic vinegar I've found on Amazon

reviewText: There are countless balsamic vinegars out there, making all kinds of claims about origin, method, aging, and so on, for all different prices.  How to choose?  Well, if you just want to make standard salad dressing, you can buy a decent balsamic vinegar for a third or maybe even quarter of the cost of this one.  But if you want one that you can use by itself in very small quantities, to dip bread in, or drizzle on a lamb chop, or maybe even on vanilla ice cream, and want a sensational taste experience that you just can't get from the products available in the supermarket, this is an excellent choice.  This is an intensely flavorful, sweet balsamic vinegar that in my opinion is as good or better than any available in this price range, regardless of what claims are made about how long it's aged or whatnot.
the vinegar is thick and flavorful, like what a true balsamic should be. not the typical watery grocery store kind. this is one of the best i've had...amazing

The eternal quest goes on and on eternally: how to find a *true* Balsamic Vinegar that is affordable by non-criminals?  Well, this is a fine compromise.  It may not have all the oak leaves and certificates of some other brands, but it's the best quality I've found at a very human price point.  Sweet and rich, it won't leave you sour and poor.
summary: A Pax Romani to end the Aceti Wars

reviewText: Good natural solution when we want organic gelatin.  I use it with organic, unsweetened juices, and if necessary, use organic stevia to sweeten.
summary: Good natural solution when we want organic gelatin

reviewText: 3/13/14Let me start with my initial review since I just received this and I will update later on.  First they are pretty big so i hope they will last a while which makes it a good deal. The power reminds me of konsyl or any other fiber supplement. The smell, well smelling just the can doesn't smell like anything to me.  I decided to heat up water and mix it in. It mixes in great without any issues--wit hot water.  The smell.... well it does gross me out a little. It smells like if you burnt hairs off your arm by accident mixed with cow crap.  Thats really the best way I can describe it. I'm willing to try different things and I will continue using twice/daily and see if anything changes. I'm hoping for joint pain to lessen.
Love this stuff, it's great for making your own jello or gummy candy, and adding your own natural flavors. It's a lot of product, so I'll be using it for forever.
summary: Great for making your own gelatin or gummies

reviewText: I have a son who cannot tolerate artificial coloring, preservatives, or sweeteners, so this is awesome for making our own "Jello!"  I use it with organic fruit juice and just enough hot water to dissolve it, and it is a hit every time.  So much better for you and cheaper than the crud in the boxes in the stores.

.. using Oregon Fruit canned items. I use this gelatin along with the leftover juice to make a healthier version of Jello, which is an extremely easy process via following the directions on the can. Very grateful that the company makes using gelatin from grass fed cows a priority.

Ok so I gave this 3 stars because I know how healthy gelatin is. I tried using it to make fruit snacks with pureed fruit, stevia, and maple syrup...no matter how much fruit/sweetener I put in it I could not mask the nasty taste of this stuff. Plus whisking the gelatin into the fruit snack base was not easy and the fruit snacks turned out lumpy. The taste was so bad that I almost threw them away but my husband hates wasting food and ate them while plugging his nose. I'm on the GAPS diet and make lots of meat stocks, which are supposed to end up being pretty gelatinous. Sometimes a stock that I make doesn't turn out as gelatinous is it's supposed to, so I whisk this great lakes gelatin into the broth. I then have to plug my nose to drink the stock and then swish with ginger tea afterwards so as not to taste it. The taste is hard to explain...sort of like how urine smells. Yuck. But hey, I'm glad to have it for health purposes.

I really like some of the recipes I have made with this - especially the homemade marshmallows from Mommypatomous blog.  It's just gelatin and raw honey!  My son loves them with fruit and I'm happy for him to get the amino acids instead of just sugar.  I also love the natural Jello with lemon and lime juice.  That said, it tastes awful on it's own and leaves an aftertaste of shoe leather.I've had it in the evening by itself with cold water to gel, and then hot water to melt, and it's hard to get down.  BUT I do feel healthy when I have it, as does my mom who has been drinking it night and mornings and her hot flashes have decreased dramatically.  Even after brushing my teeth at night, I wake to the same aftertaste, and have to brush my teeth again.  I tried mixing it in my coffee, but it ruined my coffee.  I prefer to suck it up and drink it by itself and then move on with my day.I appreciate it's healthy benefits and I'm sure the taste will grow on me.  A little goes a long way and we have yet to finish one container, let alone two - so you get a lot for the price.
summary: Healthy, but the taste takes some getting used to

reviewText: So happy to find this; no more tearing little envelopes for me; no more running out of the little envelopes with this quantity package. I can easily measure just what I need through the opening in the top. Convenient and lasts a long time.
summary: I looked locally everywhere to no avail before I found this on Amazon!

reviewText: this is amazing. If only my Mother would try this.  If you are straddling the fence - go ahead :) this is what you need also for making those wonderful home made gummies-

I bought this product to help with leaky gut. I take this along with L-glutamine and colostrum. I started this to get a headstart on the healing before I started the GAPS diet. I've been dealing with recovering from a protracted withdrawal from long term benzodiazepine use and have some other health issues besides leaky gut. I noticed some relief from this using this already. I will continue to drink it in my daily shake along with the diet I am starting. I will definitely recommend it.
I have found myself putting this in coffee, soup, smoothies, and making gummies for my kids. This is so great. And filling. It is like breakfast in a cup when added to my coffee.

I have been using the gelatin it make fruit gummy bites with lemon juice, frozen fruit and stevia.  I'm still adjusting my amounts, I find it easy to warm my mixture up and add more gelatin if I haven't added enough.  I like the quality of this gelatin and will purchase it again.

I have been taking this for month, twice a day. Wondering if it was really helping, I stopped taking it for a week. Results are, yes it does help joint pain!  I would say I have 80- 90 percent relief. Being in the North East with one storm after another all winter, barometric pressure takes a toll on my joints , along with the bitter dampness being on the ocean. If I forget  even two doses, the joints let me know . The other plus is this Gelatin curbs my appetite!  I have been dropping lbs, back to my normal summer weight. I noticed I had more energy the first week.
summary: Bye bye joint pain, bye bye appetite

reviewText: I have a leaky gut. Who doesn't these days? I already make my own yummy bone broth (chicken soup anyone?), but read how gelatin can help heal a leaky gut, so I thought I'd try it, especially for those days when I don't have any broth handy. Or if I'm feeling run down, I add it to my herbal tea. I've read some folks add it to coffee! You MUST add it to cold liquid first to dissolve, then add that to the hot liquid, otherwise it will create clumps like gummy bears. It has a slight beefy taste if taken in plain water, but in a flavorful tea (like the Hibiscus loose leaf I recently ordered), it is not noticeable. It just makes the tea thick and satisfying. I'm really happy with this Kosher Gelatin by Great Lakes, and plan to re-order when I run low.Oh, you could make aspic, or use fresh fruit and make your own jello, without all of the chemicals or excessive sugar! Buy it now. You know you want it.
summary: Gelatin for your joints and collagen for your skin

reviewText: Love this stuff.  Very high quality.  Great for paleo desserts.  Has improved my hair and nails.  It will always be in my kitchen from now on.
Purchased to make my own Gummy candy. With the gelatin, however, the results were more on the line of Knox Blox. I will be making more as there is alot of gelatin in the container.
Good stuff...but will only be buying when necessary...can't afford such high priced items on a regular basis...maybe when it becomes more popular the price will come down.
summary: Good product but a bit pricey for me on a regular basis.

reviewText: I ordered this because I've been participating in a bone broth challenge, and we are encouraged to also use gelatin (which also naturally occurs in bone broth).If you're thinking about buying this, I recommend visiting the company's website; it has a lot of really good information, plus a couple dozen recipes for using gelatin.I was especially concerned about the MSG content, because I know that free glutamate typically occurs in gelatin.  Great Lakes has a whole page about MSG, though, including lab results indicating free glutamate content, etc.  It seems like a pretty safe product.So far I've been making homemade jello with my Great Lakes Gelatin.  Basically, what you do is heat up half a cup of fresh juice, add 2 Tablespoons of gelatin, and stir on low heat until it is totally dissolved.  Then let it cool, and add it into a bowl containing 1 1/2 more cups of fresh juice.  Stir until it is well combined, pour it into the container you want it in, and then let it set in the fridge for several hours.  I made this recipe with fresh cherries and lemon, and I left pieces of fruit in it, and added raw honey to sweeten it a little--it has been wonderful!Until I bought this I hadn't eaten jello in a long time because dessert jellos at the store usually have sweeteners, flavorings, colorings, etc that I avoid.  I'm really enjoying this Great Lakes gelatin, though.

I love this stuff.I've been using it in 2 ways:- I add this into my baking to make a more moist, cake-like texture- I use it with fresh juices to make real-juice jello from scratch.Wow.  Every time I use it, my body loves it.  Granted, this is a healing food for adrenal fatigue, which I have.  But each time I eat the gelatin / jello I prepared with this, my body craves more of it.For sure will re-order.  Highly recommended.

My mom has rheumatoid arthritis and so wanted to purchase this gelatin as a way of taking a gelatin supplement pleasantly. I purchased this for her, and ever since she got it, she has been using organic juices such as pomegranate or cherry juice and making the most amazing Jell-O jigglers with this stuff. I believe she found the recipe online for making Jell-O using gelatin, and even her first batch came out fantastic. The gelatin does not have any kind of strong flavor, so when used with a high quality juice it is truly a sublime and cooling snack. I would highly recommend this gelatin, which the website says is grass fed.

I began taking gelatin about 10 days ago in order to heal my gut.  I had been having major digestive issues for about 3 months, so I went online to do some research and found a site that outlined a diet which consisted of consuming gelatin with every meal.  There was no explanation as to why, so I did further research and discovered that gelatin is great for healing the gut!  Not only did it aid in digestion, but another exciting fact was that gelatin heals "leaky gut syndrome," which causes various food intolerances.  I have had intolerance to many common foods...especially eggs, which I love.As I continued my research, I saw that Great Lakes was recommended over the grocery store brands for its high quality of being hormone and antibiotic-free.  I could not find any locally, so in desperation of needing relief from my stomach troubles, I decided to get some immediately...I did not care what brand, until I could get my order placed on Amazon.So, I began Knox gelatin last Thursday evening.  I made some grape juice jello and I felt immediate relief in my stomach after eating it.  Very soothing.  So, I continued for the next few days.  I noticed that I felt tired every time after eating it.  I did sleep better.  By Sunday, I saw that the skin on my face was looking scaly.  The cysts in my breasts were becoming tender again...which, BTW, is a sign that I have ingested estrogen!  Hormones!!  Not good!!!I had placed my order on Amazon on Saturday, after deciding which form to buy.  I decided to order one of each, the green and the orange...both bovine...to see which one I would like to take.  I naturally love jello...so making jello was the fun and natural thing for me to do!My order arrived on Monday!!!  Wow!!  Very fast!!  So, I immediately flushed all of the remaining Knox jello down the drain and started on the Great Lakes!  I made some jello and also used the green can in my smoothies...the collagen hydrolysate.  I ate less jello due to using the green can as well.  Tuesday, I woke up feeling like my muscles had been pumped up ever so slightly....it's hard to explain, but I felt like I had a protective barrier over the surface of my body...and I felt refreshed!  Yes...I am VERY senstive to my body!  I slept very well and I did not feel tired upon awakening, like I did on the Knox brand.  Day 2...Wednesday....I woke up with a groggy headache, although I still had that body protected sensation.  Day 3 again, a headache.  I rarely ever get headaches.I would say that I took less than the 2 TBSP per day.  I don't know if I took too much for me...I am only 100 lbs. and was detoxing too quickly....thus the headache, or it does not agree with me.  So, for now, I have stopped taking the green can and am enjoying just the jello...Love it, with grape juice and black cherry juice concentrate.  I feel stronger already.  I noticed today, that the skin on my face looks slightly more glowy and dewey....hmmm....very fast results!AND BTW....the breast tenderness went away after a couple of days of taking the GL brand.  So, in addressing this person, who goes by "it's" I cannot believe that GL has hormones and antibiotics in it because my breasts are a great barometer in this regard.  We eat mostly organic foods and we eat no meat with any hormones or antibiotics so my body has stayed clean in this vein for many years, so I can tell when my hormones are disturbed.So, I feel quite confident of this product and feel very good about using it.  I do smell an odor when I pour the hot water to mix.  It is not very pleasant...kind of like animal hide...but once it is mixed and congeals, I do not taste what I smelled.  I tried mixing the green can with water one night and it had that same smell and taste to it, which I found unbearable...but I have been tested to be a super-taster (meaning I have high sense of taste).  So, when I did take it, I put it in my smoothies and I could not taste it at all.  I really loved cutting cubes of the jello and mixing it in my smoothies...soooo yummy!!!  A real dessert-like treat!!!My husband does not like jello, so he is using the green can daily in his tea.  He, who has been prone to frequent headaches...very severe at times, has had no problems with the green can...so, go figure!Too early to tell about joint issues, etc., but I highly recommend this brand over any other.  I will report back when more time has passed to give more results.  I can't wait to be able to eat more foods from my gut being healed!!Update: 4/12/14So, I have been taking gelatin for 2.5 weeks now.  I can't believe the changes!!!  My facial skin is plumper, so i look younger!  My hair has body so it's fluffier, so that I don't have to wash it as often as before when it went flat the next day after a shampoo.  My skin feels sooooooooo soft!!  And I do feel stronger!  Previously, I was not able to do push-ups on my palms...had to do them with my fists.  I just happened to try one, and my wrists felt stronger!!!  No pain when doing them!  I actually did not have much joint pain to speak of, so I guess I don't notice any changes in that department.  But, I surely to recommend this product, as it is certainly youthifying!!!I can't wait to see how I look and feel a month down the road, or even a year from now!!!  My youth is certainly being renewed like the eagle's!!  I must add, that I have been eating more brothy foods as well, since discovering that we need to be eating the whole animal for best nutritional balance, so it could also be adding to the mix, but on days when we just don't feel like soups...we can feel confident that we are getting what we need by eating gelatin in the form of jello with all our meals!
summary: Like night and day from the grocery store brand!!!!

reviewText: This came highly reccommended to me by a nutritionist, I put it in my smoothies, you don't even notice it.

I was happy to find a source of gelatin from grass-fed cows.  I've happily used this product for a few years.  Now I use the gelatin from the Bulletproof Executive because Dave said that other grass-fed gelatin isn't from consistently reliable sources.  Not that they are bad; it's that his standards are way up there, and that's good enough for me.  Nothing against this product.  Price is good for what you get and how long it lasts.
Excellent product, great price through Subscribe and Save; I use it every day with fresh squeezed orange juice before breakfast!

I purchased this brand due to recommendations from others in the paleo community.  I should be making bone broths for my source but just can't stomach the smell of it cooking at this time.  I am currently pregnant and want to make sure my body has plenty of the building blocks for healthy skin as my stomach grows.  I am also trying to heal my gut.  If I make soups I add some in and then any hot drinks get some added too.  I have been very pleased with this product so far and will order more when the time comes.

After having run through a container of the porcine gelatin from Great Lakes, I decided to give the beef version a try.  I am extremely pleased with it as well.  The only difference between the beef and porcine versions that I could detect was that I can taste the beef version slightly when I add it to my coffee.  With the porcine gelatin I can't really tell it's there.I first decided to try gelatin as a supplement because I'd heard it helps you sleep better. I started with a few boxes of Knox Unflavored gelatin from the grocery store, and although I didn't sleep any better, my joint pain improved remarkably! After reading other reviews of this product, I ordered a container of the porcine gelatin and gave it a try. I put a tablespoon in the bottom of my (large) coffee mug, poured in the coffee and all the fixin's, and stirred it well. The product dissolved easily and was virtually undetectable in the coffee. Since I started taking gelatin I find that I am bounding out of the bed the way I did when I was in my 30's, instead of crawling out and supporting my weight with my hands on my knees until I can straighten my back and get my legs in gear. This product dissolves better than the Knox did and I find the container easy to use and measure from.I am so pleased with the results that I have been making gelatin doggie treats for my senior Jack Russells. I heat a cup and a half of chicken broth (reduced sodium) in the microwave and stir in 4 teaspoons of gelatin. When the mixture cools a little I pour it into a plastic ice cube tray and stick it in the fridge.  Each morning and evening I split one of the cubes and gave half to each little monster, and they gobble it up.  Before that I was stirring a half-teaspoon into a quarter cup room-temperature chicken broth and letting them drink it, and they gobbled that up too. And now, darned if they don't seem to be moving a little better also. (What am I thinking!?? It took fourteen years for them to slow down, and here I go starting them up again. Sigh.)In short, I find that both the porcine and beef versions of this product are easy to use.  They both dissolve easily, and I can definitely tell when I've skipped it for a day or two.  I'll be ordering the porcine version in the future only because I can slightly taste the beef in my coffee, but let's be clear: I am putting a TABLESPOON of gelatin into a CUP of coffee.  I find it amazing that the taste is so slight, and even more amazing that the porcine version has almost no taste at all.  I'll continue with the beef if the porcine version becomes unavailable or a price difference develops.
summary: Excellent product; slightly more taste than the non-kosher variety.

reviewText: It's good to me made panna cotta and one of the main ingredients was the gelatin and it came out great would recommend even though I am going to try in other products.
The unflavored gelatin supposedly is a good source of a healthy joint comforting food supplement. I appreciate having it sent directly to my home.

I used this to bring up my placenta fluid when it was low. I had read in that it could possibly help. Well of course I'm going to try everything in my power to have a healthy baby. Took it twice a day in warm glass of juice. My levels tripled after a months use! The worst that can happen while taking it is healthier hair and skin. I have used it for baking and it works great.
I need to use about half as much of this gelatin to do the job as the gelatin I formerly used. Great product.

This product was recommended by many of my resources for adding gelatin into my diet. I tried using it in homemade gummies, but EEK, was that a strong, greasy, odd taste! I will not give up on it, but I think I'm going to use WAY LESS of this product to begin with until I get used to the texture of it, then I can begin to increase it. It wasn't as bad in homemade chicken soup or beef stew, though. So, I recommend going easy on it first until you get used to it.
summary: It's ok, but strong odd flavor when you're not used to it.

reviewText: I take gelatin for my skin and joints.  I have read it helps digestion also, really it is a super food in its own right.  I do add vitamin C, l lysine and proline, to make it work even better.  It does so much I hope to keep using it.  Right now I take two tablespoons a day, and if I weren't so lazy I would up it to four, but I make it in a tea and it does require preparation.  My daughter and I recommend things for our skin to each other and I told her about it and now she takes it too, she has gorgeous skin and wants to keep it that way
I use it in soups and to make homemade jello, great way to get calcium and protein!  I have gone thru 2 now
I bought this after getting a recipe for Beef Gelatin Cubes... it's AWESOME... hopefully giving me all the benefits of Bone Broth without actually having to make the bone broth ;)
summary: Make Beef Gelatin Cubes... Great Snack

reviewText: Great product, amazing results, all of us eat it every day and put it in smoothies and deserts and its very nice. I love my skin and my face for only using it only two months.
Just made some sour blueberry gummies using the Great Lakes gelatin. Kid loves them and it's a super easy way to add some much needed nutrients to your diet.
I use this gelatin every day for making my own jello and fruit snacks.  I also mix this in with a cup of tea for joint health!!  No problems, melts right in!!
I bought this to make healthier gelatin treats for my family using juice and stevia, it works great and tastes delicious.
summary: Mine is odorless and performs well

reviewText: I've had back pain off and on for some time .... sometimes severe and debilitating.  When the pain is at its worst, it can be excruciating, and can be difficult even to stand up.I went in for some X-rays a few months ago and was told that source of the problem was that the cartilage in my spine had worn away, leaving the bones grinding on each other.  Ouch.I tried various products including MSM and bone/cartilage strengthening supplements.  Most didn't seem to do much.  Then on impulse I decided to try gelatin. Some gelatins are full of toxic junk, so I searched online for a higher quality product. I ended up ordering Great Lakes kosher beef gelatin.I'm relieved to say that it does seem to be helping.  The first time I tried it, I had had several days of intense pain. Within a few hours of taking this gelatin, the pain was gone and I was able to move more freely.I found that the recommended dosage (a tablespoon in a cup of hot water) did not have much of an effect. Instead I take about 1/4 cup, dissolved in two cups of hot water.  It's thick and syrupy, and works much better for me.  I don't need to take it every day, but take it when my back pain starts flaring up and it always seems to help.What I like about this product:- It tastes fine. (Not good, not bad... just a bland nondescriptive taste.  But not like some bad tasting gelatins I've read about.)- Every time I take it, it seems to improve my back pain.What I don't like about it:- Dissolving it in water can take some work.  Cold water doesn't work at all; it gels almost instantly.  Trying to dissolve it in boiling water, poured boiling from a tea kettle, is also problematic, as it seems to "cook" into strands and not dissolve completely.  The best solution I've found is to put some gelatin in a coffee up, boil a kettle of water, leave it sitting for ten minutes or so, then add it to the gelatin stirring constantly.ADDENDUM:It's not just my back pain that has been helped by this gelatin.  When my back locks up, I can hardly bend over, much less touch my toes.  When I take this gelatin I can bend at the waist and touch my toes with no problem. It's not a miracle cure, and I don't know if it would help everyone, but it definitely helps me.
summary: This gelatin has helped with my lower back pain and flexibility.

reviewText: I bought this gelatin based on the reviews and to see if it would help with my psoriatic arthritis.  What I can tell you is that I saw an immediate reaction with my fingernails, which were somewhat yellowed from my illness and deeply ridged.  The ridges disappeared quite quickly, my nails got stronger, and the discoloration is growing out.  Crazy!  I'm seeing a return of thickness and body to my hair too.  My knees and hips, which are afflicted by my auto-immune disorder, feel better these days.It took me awhile to figure out the best way to take this stuff though.  To me it's really nasty.  But it seems to disappear into my morning green smoothie (as long as I drink it pretty quickly).  I have also made fruit jello with it and that worked well.

I used this with V8 fusion fruit juice and it made wonderful, healthy, yummy jello!  It was really easy...i followed the directions for the amount and put 1/4 of the juice in my pyrex pan and sprinkled the required gelatin on top and let it sit for a couple of minutes and stirred it in until dissolved, then I microwaved the remaining 3/4 juice until it was hot and poured it in the pyrex and stirred it in, it did not take long to dissolve...a couple of hours later I had very happy jello!I also love their hydrolyzed geatin, and use that in my smoothies :)
I ordered this for baking and it was a very good buy.  It works well and will continue to order as needed.
summary: Great Lakes Unflavored Gelatin, Kosher 16 oz

reviewText: I have been putting this in my morning smoothie. I am going to get the green can next time and I will be able to use it in water.
summary: Great Lakes Unflavored Gelatin, Kosher, 16-Ounce Can (Single)

reviewText: Great for building strong hair and nails.  Most commercial gelatin is porcine, this is all bovine.  It is also from all grass fed and organically raised cows.  That is important to me.
summary: All grass fed and all bovine

reviewText: I think the product works just as stated. I mix it with hot water and some beef bullion and drink a cup before bedtime.

You read reviews and suggestions on products and I'm pretty sure that you cannot go wrong with Gelatin.  BUT, after using this a couple of months in a row, I have noticed a difference.  My hair is getting thicker, it was thinning out and my nails are strong.  They were getting to a certain length and then would break, they were fragile. Now they are thick and hard to trim! Lastly, I noticed that my knees do not hurt.  I dance a lot and one knee really hurt, now that is gone.  I take one tablespoon a day.  I cannot take it just with water but usually mix it with cold juice.

I put a tsp or 2 in my hot tea. You want to add the mixture in and THEN pour the hot water over it since it will dissolve easier.  It helps with soothing your stomach and is good for join lubrication. If you're having an upset stomach, this stuff works wonders! No taste or odor.
I really love this gelatin. It is from grass fed beef, and I take it as a supplement (good for stomach, hair, nails, et cetera). It also makes really good homemade Jello, panna cotta, or Jigglers.
I use this mostly to thicken homemade yogurt, but it is delicious mixed into some broth for an extra boost of protein and collagen.  Supposedly from grass fed cows.

This makes the best jello I've ever had just really can't say enough about it.It's just something I use in everything and it really does make ur hair longer and stronger so happy.I lived in Germany for so long and while there I just loved the gelatin snacks and other treats I got.So ja I have been looking every where for good gelatin and recipes.So far I hit the mother load with this gelatin and some really good recipes from Wellness Mama's web site yay.But u can use it for hair, skin, stomach problems, and so much more.I like it as just a yummy snack. ^_^

I read about this gelatin in a recent blog. I've only been taking it for 4-5 days and it is helping me sleep more deeply, and it is  also suppressing my appetite! The only thing you must do is stir it completely in a beverage. I can't even taste it in my coffee, or in hot water.

This product and company are AWFUL!!!  I researched to make sure this product was GF and safe for our family with Celiac to ingest as a dietary supplement to help with leaky gut.  I could only order a 6-pack directly from the company, but figured that was fine as this product gets such rave reviews.  2 days into using 1 tsp a day per person in a hot lemonade drink---we were SICK with glutening symptoms.  Bad symptoms.  Within 2 days of not ingesting this product, we got better.  Not to mention the taste and smell of the gelatin itself is absolutely DISGUSTING---It literally tastes like eating smelly, boiled shoes.  I called the company to report our problems, and the woman on the phone was extremely rude and belligerent---insisting that there was NO way the gelatin made us sick and perhaps my kitchen was just dirty.  really?!  She would NOT refund my money unless I paid a 15% restocking fee---even though the product made us sick!!!  The gelatin is made from boiled cow hides from Argentina and made in Argentina also.  This product is horrible, this company is horrible and I wouldn't even let my worst enemy eat this toxic garbage!  I was SO angry after my phone conversation with this company--I can't even get myself to send the 6 cans back because I don't trust them.  Perhaps I can sell them online myself?

This i found after getting it is good for Joints, well it has not healed joints yet, but its for sure my body didn't get in the shape its in over nite, and sure as heck not gona get healed up over nite either. Great for jelling up homemade anything that need to be jelled, price is high, but good things normally are, Enjoy this works well

I love love love this stuff.  So many ways to use it and it is so good for you.  I make my own magnesium gummies with it, vitamin c gummies, I mix it with cinnamon and use in hot teas.  I even mix it in a dollop of shampoo and use to wash my hair.  Great benefits from this one product.5 stars for sure!

This mixes really well for drinks and has no odd taste to it for me.  The container makes serving/using super easy compared to the little paper packs of others.  I use it almost every night with lemon & honey as a tea to get gelatin in my diet, and help me rest better.  Definitely noticed the difference once I stopped for a few days.  My joints are also feeling better over time, so for me this has been very helpful.
summary: Great stuff and easy to mix for drinking

reviewText: This gelatin serves its purpose. I can't stop experimenting with different kind of gellos. I'd like to make my own marshmellows, too.
I know I could make truffles pretty easily-- however, when I bring these out to my guests, everyone groans with pleasure and anticipation--and all I had to do was open the package!

I sent these as a holiday gift to someone, and they RAVED about them. The price was right, and I got the reaction I wanted. I also got to sample some myself when I came across them at a local warehouse store, and they are in fact super delicious. Messy, melty, extremely chocolatey and rich, but super delicious! I liked this product because it gives a lot of bang for the buck, which is always a plus when giving a present. As for the candy, they are smooth and creamy, but extremely chocolatey, so make sure whoever you buy them for is a true chocoholic!
summary: A delicious, and very appreciated gift

reviewText: This is the third time I have ordered these and they are great everytime. Noone else comes close to this taste or this price! Order some!

At first I wasn't sure about ordering these, but decided to give it a try.  The weather here is getting warmer and I did not want a chocolate blob arriving, thankfully these are on prime and I was able to get them in 2 days. These arrived nicely packaged, there are 2 bags inside the box shown here. I was happy to see this is a nice amount of truffles for the price and they are pretty good.  Its hard to just eat one, or two, so thankfully there are 2 bags because in my house one bag already "walked off".  I have these ready when company comes to visit and for those occasions when I am craving chocolate.  The taste is of dark chocolate, and the consistency is like someone else said, a little oily when the truffle is all done.  Overall I do like these and so do my family members! I would recommend these to anyone who enjoys a piece of dark chocolate every now and then.

Platinum Sellers delivers!  These, by far are thevery best Dark Chocolate Truffles I've ever tasted!Description states these are only available on HolidaysI'm hoping I'll be able to order once more before Summer!Thumbs up, Chocolate Lovers ... = )

Ran out of time at Christmas to do all my baking, etc.  I decided to give these a try to replace my homemade truffles.  They taste great, and if you know your way around the kitchen, you can embellish these with crushed peppermint, nuts, sprinkles, or use a pastry bag and drizzle white chocolate on them.  No one will ever know you didn't make them, and they really do taste great.

THESE ARE GOOD, TO GOOD.  I BOUGHT FROM ANOTHER SELLER LAST TIME, THEY WERE CHEAPER BUT THE OTHER SELLER'S CANDY ARRIVED DAMAGED, WHICH MADE IT HARD TO GIVE AS A GIFT.IF YOU RALLY LIKE GOOD CHOCOLATE, THIS IS THE ONE TO GET.
summary: I LOVE THESE, I WISH I DIDN'T I PUTTING ON THE WEIGHT.

reviewText: These things are awesome.  If you are a chocolate addict you should stay away from these.  You won't be able to put them down and you will die of a chocolate overdose.

This is the type if candy you probably either hate or love, but I happen to love these truffles.  I find the taste perfect--not overly sweet and sickening because the chocolate is the tiniest bit bitter, but also smooth and rich. Just right.  I was never a truffle fan before I tried these, I always found them too sickeningly sweet or too bitter, but these truffles, for me, are just right.

I purchased these because of the good ratings on Amazon, but was pretty disappointed. First of all, I knew when buying that them these "truffles" are not the same kinds of creations that are named truffles by chocolate stores and other chocolate brands. These "French Truffles" are actually what I can only describe as soft pieces of chocolate with higher than average cocoa butter content dusted in cocoa.This is not to say that they're bad, which they're not. Plain old chocolate, not the bad-quality kind (like Hersheys), but not the good kind either. I also prefer the types of truffles with a shell and a ganache or other conventional truffle filling inside. And for ~$20, IMO this box of truffles is a bit overpriced and more of a quantity over quality item. This is coming from someone who has tried a LOT of chocolate, some gourmet/small-batch, some mass-produced, and others in the middle (like Godiva). I believe similar, if not identically branded, truffles can also be found in some warehouse stores like Sam's Club, likely at a lower price.In short, I would say that these truffles are probably a bit overrated and at least here on this site, overpriced. They're not that bad, but certainly not worth the price tag. For what you pay after shipping, you might as well go with Godiva or another dependable brand.
This is a chocoholic's dream at a very reasonable price. Surprisingly fresh. Comes in two bulk-size bags, so you need to find a resealable container to store the unused portion.

I thought I would get these truffles for a Christmas treat, I am so glad I did! They are spectacular! The chocolate is to die for, I couldn't stop eating them. Out of all the candy we had at Christmas time, my 3 boys enjoyed these the most. When their friends come over now I hear them asking for "those truffles. Do you guys have any more?" My kids don't eat a lot of sweets but they have commented several times to me on how good these truffles were. I will certainly buy them again as long as I can find them available to order. In fact, I am going to order a few boxes right now for Valentine's Day as gifts for my sons.
Not the offen too sweet American type but the high butter fat real thing.  The shipping charges were high but the price good averall.

These are the best value in high-quality cacao truffles I have ever tasted. Kept at a cool temperature, they last in pristine condition once opened for a couple of weeks. I liked them so much I ordered two boxes as a repeat customer. Truly an outstanding value for such a high-quality, ultra-rich and satisfying high-end dessert treat, the perfect small ending to a happy home-cooked dinner a deux.
summary: Sharp but just sweet enough high quality chocolate treat

reviewText: Maybe I'm different -- I expect candy to be sweet.  These truffles were not sweet at all, weren't light like a chocolate ganache, and were dusted with cocoa that came off  all over me.  With all the amazing reviews here, I expected something that was tasty, at least.  Instead I got two bitter bags of who-knows-what that I won't eat straight and can't use in anything else. Gee, thanks
i just really love these tasty chocolate melt in your mouth sweet treats. i'll be back to buy more very soon i bet.

Ate one Truffette and it tasted terrible, ate a second to make sure that the first wasn't a fluke, and the second tasted even worse.  They have the sickening taste of moldy bitter sweet chocolate used in making chocolate fudge.  They are not sweet nor tasty in any sense of the word.  They leave a bad taste in my mouth and an unpleasant feeling in my stomache.  I will never again pay any attention to the reviews on Amazon.  How anyone could report that this awfull concoction is good or great is far beyond me.  I may have received a bad lot, but I doubt it.  Obviously, a number of reviewers of this product who rated it four or five stars would rate cow dung as delicious.  Buy a fifty cent candy bar at your local food store instead of purchasing this awful concoction, at least they taste sweet and don't leave you rushing to the frig for something to kill the taste of Chocmod Truffettes.

I'm a serious chocoholic and had received some chocolate truffles as a gift for Christmas. They were from Europe but nothing was labeled as to the brand name or company that made them. They were incredibly good. I found these truffles and decided to try them. What luck! They had the same, supple flavor that I was looking for. The cocoa powder on the outside starts the taste out a bit bitter, but as you bite into them, the sweetness takes over. OMG. Just don't look at the side panel of nutritional info. Five of these little truffles will dominate your daily intake of saturated fat. Yes, only five.
These truffles were to die for - loved the dark chocolate.  Great price for this quality chocolate.  Will purchase again.
Who doesn't love chocolate?  These have a nice creamy surprise inside and are just enough of a sweet snack for the day.

I tried cocoa dusted chocolate truffles once and they were magnificent.  I don't remember the brand, but I was hoping these would be just as good.  Unfortunately, these are really mediocre.  There is no luscious chocolate flavor--very bland.  Even my 12 year old who loves chocolate said these were "just okay".I'll have to continue my search for delicious chocolate truffles elsewhere.

These chocolates are the best i have ever eaten.You can forget your diet,they are just too good to pass up.I bought several more as gifts.As with last year some may never have a chance to be gift wrapped!! 5 star rated.Thank you Stewart L 11/15/06
summary: These are chocolate heaven and beyond.They are the best ive ever eaten.Perfect for the holidays.

reviewText: These truffles are delicious and a great value; even more with free shipping [with additional purchase]! Not being individually wrapped saves waste; and one...or two...etc., certainly isn't enough! I didn't realize that the chocolate was covered with cocoa powder [and would've preferred without-which should be in big print]; but, as they say,'that is neither here nor there'[and, admittedly, once I saw 'truffles' I was totally distracted and filled with anticipation. They arrived within the timespan given, in fine shape and as delicious as anticipated. Vive La France!  In my previous review re: Kirkland Chocolates where I pointed out the ridiculous rise in price [despite the extraordinary deliciousness of the product]; I noticed that the price has been reduced somewhat. But it is still high...going from $19.99 to $49.99 within a few months! I will keep an eye on this item; it being another exceptionally delicious treat, with variety and wonderful tastes, within.
I love these, people are sometimes put off by the cocoa coating, not hard chocolate, just soft truffle 'kisses', my favorite with coffee or a liquor.

All the artificial sweeteners ending in "ol" are from alcohols resulting from processing of sugars,  They won't give you a buzz but do leave a slight boozy aftertaste, like putting a spoonful of mouthwash into your last sip of coffee.  Maltitol has less of this taste than other sugar alcohol-derived sweeteners but its price is a deterrent to everyday use beyond a cup of coffee or tea.

Buyer Beware Please!  This sweetner is not for everybody. Maltitol is an alcohol sugar and can be undigestible in the body. You will know a short time after consuming it if you are one of the unsuspecting many who cannot digest it by the extreme intestinal bloating and cramping and massive amounts of gas a person can experience. Nausea, diarrhea & headaches can also be experienced. I learned my lesson the hard way years ago when I fell in love with the sugar-free chocolates suzanne sommers used to sell. I thought I'd found sugar-free chocolate nirvana at first taste but the bliss was short lived when the terrible side effects of maltitol kicked in.  The discomfort was unlike anything I had ever felt before. I blew up like a balloon and had very painful abdominal cramping. As the symptoms passed, this too was very unpleasant. Though hard for me to believe a low calorie sweetner could be the culprit, all symptoms were gone when I stopped eating the chocolate. My hunch it had something to do with the maltitol were unfortunately confirmed for me about a year later when I purchased some delicious sugar-free popcorn at my local market. The taste was amazing and while I was looking at the label wondering what could possibly make this yummy, new sugarfree treat taste so good, my heart sank when I followed the little asterisk next to sugarfree sweetner* down to the very bottom of the label and read "maltitol" in tiny little letters! Thank goodness I'd eaten only a little.  I still ended up with all the same side-effects but for a much shorter duration. Some people can use maltitol to their heart's content but others, like me, can have a bad reaction to it. In case you're like me, ... it's not you ... it's the maltitol!

splenda type sweeteners wont work with chocolate; theyre not sweet enough. this stuff does the trick. its about as sweet as honey is, in my opinion. great stuff. but dont over do it... if you ever tried to make/bake anything sweet with splenda and it didnt taste right, you should try this stuff.
summary: sweet!! a must for artificially sweetening chocolate

reviewText: I first bought Joseph's Maltitol to use for Jorge Cruise's vanilla ice cream last year and have found many uses besides--sweetening drinks, making delicious, decadent brownies and of course, the ice cream. I've made dozens of batches of ice cream, all with fantastic results. In fact, we prefer the maltitol-sweetened ice cream to all others including commercial premium brands.Jorge recommends limiting your consumption of alcohol sweeteners to 100 gms to avoid flatulence. I have not found this to be a problem with the ice cream whereas it has occurred with xylitol sweetened iced tea.Give it a try. Jorge's ice cream recipe is available online and only takes five minutes to make.
summary: Can't tell it's not sugar syrup

reviewText: I love this product but use it sparely because it can cause gas.  Otherwise if you use just a little, it will sweetened your food without any side effects.

I have really enjoyed Hoisin sauce for years. There is a tremendous difference in the taste of various brands. Some have almost no 'Hoisin flavor' and some have a lot. Some are spicy and some not. To me this is non-spicy, which I like because I do not tolerate spicy (hot) foods. The 'Hoisin flavor' is mild. It tastes like sweet and sour sauce with some added 'Hoisin flavor'. I like it but wish the 'Hoisin flavor' was stronger.I first ordered the 3 smaller bottles and they arrived fine. 3 of the 6 larger bottles leaked in the box and made a big mess.
summary: Mild taste. 3 of the 6 bottles leaked in the box making a huge mess.

reviewText: I use hoisin sauce in many recipes as a key base ingredient. Mix in some garlic and  ginger and a good soy sauce like sempio 501s and you have a great flavor base or combination for any asian cooking application. Be aware the 36 ounce container is a net weight not a fluid ounce size. Hoisin sauce is heavy by natural weight of ingredients and if you use it frequently this size may not be as much as you think. There is approximately three 8 fluid ounce cups per 36 ounce bottle. I just used an entire bottle making a marinade and a dipping sauce at one shot. This sauce is very good tasting and fits the bill nicely. The price is not too expensive nor is it cheap, it is reasonable. The bottle is plastic and squeezable and much easier to deal with than those ubiquitous small overpriced supermarket glass jars. Since the sauce is so heavy and slow moving like heavy ketchup try upturning the bottle so the sauce sinks to the cap when it is upside down and you will get the last drop. Good sauce, good value....recommended

Just add this to your lo mein or other chinese recipe for authentic restaurant taste.  I use some soy, ground ginger, msg (yes I like the taste of it and my arms haven't dropped off yet) along with a little garlic and onion powder and of course some roasted sesame seed oil.  The starter mixture is the basis for quite a few fine chinese dishes and the amounts of each can be adjusted to suit your taste.  A few lo mein noodles, some shrimp or chicken or beef bits and you're quickly able to make a very tasty authentic lo mein.  I don't use this in my fried rice, though but it is good in stir fried vegies, etc.
summary: Authentic chinese out of the bottle

reviewText: This is a perfect balance for those who do not like, or would prefer a change of pace from actual barbeque sauce. While I love it all, this hoisin sauce will get people that don't like tomato based barbeque to eat without arguing. It's all about the piquant flavor.
This is the best Hoisin Sauce I've ever used. I have always had trouble duplicating the taste in restaurant food, but this is there folks!

Shoppers looking at this item will likely be asking themselves the same thing I did when I saw this on Amazon: "What on earth am I going to do with all of this sauce?"You cook like hell and get creative is what you do.  Once you taste it, you will find things to use it for.  While there are better, richer, and ultimately more expensive hoisin sauces out there, Lee Kum Kee brand's ultimate strength is in inexpensively lending itself to being a solid, yet mutable base for flavoring your dishes and soups.  Add some onion powder to make a great barbecue sauce alternative.  Some rice wine, ginger, and crushed red pepper flakes for a unique marinade that has punch.  With sesame oil for a great stir fry.  By itself as a dipping sauce for steamed buns.  You get the idea.I've made a lot of great dishes in the time I've had this sauce, from hoisin infused meatballs, hoisin+honey glazed slow roasted pork shoulder, to just being a simple flavoring for Vietnamese pho noodle broth.  You will find many great things to use it for too if you are adventurous and have the pantry space.  It's very easy to work with and modify to your taste.Six 36 ounce bottles is a lot of sauce. But it beats paying upwards of $5 a pop for small dinky and dusty bottles at the supermarket, particularly if you don't have any asian stores where you live.  Never cooked asian food before?  It's ok, this is where you begin.
summary: Why buy so much sauce?  Because hoisin.

reviewText: As with most sodas you can immediately tell the difference in a bottle vs. a can. Even the tactile feel of the bottle give one the same feel as a new haircut.  This also happens to be my favorite flavor. Let me qualify that; it is my favorite Izze flavor. I am afraid they would go out of business as I use this as a treat instead of a water substitute.When I am in a brick and mortar book store I purchase the Izze at any price and a cup of ice to sip as I peruse through potential purchases and discuss thing with other patrons.At home I keep some a few bottles handy for emergencies when I feel like setting back in a cushy chair and thinking over the remains of the day. Of course the sparking liquid is date sensitive so I am sure to consume it before it goes out of date. Also be aware that the bottle contains two servings, so occasionally I put a stopper in the open bottle. Looking at the ingredients makes me fee ecologically responsible. I am not against refined sugar mind you but I abhor corn in my drinks.
I love this Izze flavor, clementine - just enough orange flavor.  The carbonation is just right.  It is sweetened with other fruit juices and not sugar.

As a gourmet soda lover and shameless glutton, I've dropped a good amount of coin at my local Wholefoods trying out different beverages... well.. at least the ones that don't cost $5 or more per bottle. On sale, one bottle of Izze is about $1.50.It's fabulous! The soda does taste like clementine. It's all natural, sparkly, and so refreshing. I remembered trying the canned version of this (IZZE Fortified Sparkling Juice, Clementine, 8.4-Ounce Cans) and not being impressed. The bottled version tastes much better. It's got different ingredient ratios and a different formulation: sparkling water, white grape juice concentrate, orange juice concentrate, lemon juice concentrate, natural flavor, gum, acacia, ester gum, beta carotene. Drink it ice cold though, otherwise it doesn't taste that great.Sugar is a bit high, with 120 calories per bottle. 70% juice. One bottle is very high in Vitamin A and gives you 100% of your daily needs. Both are astoundingly good. Highly highly recommended.

Several weeks ago I discovered Izze fruit drinks starting with the Blackberry variety. It was so good I tried the Pomegranate. That was good too, so now I have a four-pack of the Clementine variety. It tastes like a weak orange soda with a good sharp tartness. I like it much better than the typical orange soda pop and it's made with 70% fruit juices and no added sugars. It's just like having a slightly carbonated fruit juice rather than darkly-colored sugar water. That's my kind of drink. Excellent.Gary Peterson

Izze Sparkling Clementine Soda is like a bite into fresh fruit! It's made of a mixture of different juices including grape, lemon, orange and apple. Somehow, the combination comes out to be like a section of the freshest clementine bursting with flavor.This is certainly a nutritional step-up from regular soda, but be aware that this does have sugar in it -- of course, there's sugar in all fruits. Enjoy Izze's great flavor and refreshment, but enjoy it in moderation.Excellent product!

The label on  Frank's Hot Sauce says "The Perfect Blend of Flavor and Heat" and I must say this is an accurate description of the product.Frank's Hot Sauce is outstanding.  It's a Cheyenne Pepper based hot sauce that is not too hot, not too sweet, but has just a perfect blend of "flavor and heat."  It's not like Tobasco sauce which is very hot and you sprinkle on items.  It's a different kind of sauce (I love Tobasco).  Frank's is a hot sauce you can use more liberally to your liking because, while it's hot, it's not so hot you can't really dig into it and enjoy the rich flavor and spices.I like to use this sauce to dip chicken tenders in, but you can also use it too cook buffalo wings, put it on eggs, French fries, burgers, whatever you like.I like this size because I use a lot of it and it goes fast at smaller sizes.I highly recommend this hot sauce.

I've always liked hot sauces, salsas and spicey foods . Tabasco was my first choice in hot sauces originally and I still enjoy it now and then. But then I discovered several different wonderful brands of Louisiana Pepper sauces and I grew to like them better than Tabasco. Then one day when a store didn't have any Louisiana brands available, I picked up a small bottle of Frank's Red Hot Cayenne Pepper sauce as a temporary substitute. It was made in New Jersey. New Jersey? I thought all hot sauces of any quality came from the Gulf Coast States. This stuff just couldn't be any good!Well, surprise! This stuff is a very good hot sauce. In fact, it is better than most of the Louisiana hot sauces I have tried, and it is less expensive. It'll brighten up any number of dishes, especially things that come with tomato sauce. I use it along with ketchup anywhere I'd use ketchup alone. Delicious!Gary Peterson

This is a mild hot sauce. That means you can apply it liberally and it's unlikely you will make any dish too hot. So it is user friendly.Ingredients (as copied from the label): Aged cayenne peppers, distilled vinegar, water, salt - etcWhy 2 stars? This sauce lacks any character beyond a heavy dose of vinegar. If you happen to like a lot of vinegar in your hot sauce - then you'll love this sauce and my 2 star rating is way off base. I don't like anywhere near this much vinegar. I've blind taste tested over 30 hot sauces and there are many better ones.What is interesting is that the original Tabasco sauce has a near identical taste to Franks once it is diluted.You will find mention that this sauce was top rated by Cooks Illustrated. That is absolutely true but what these pundits fail to mention is this was a casual test, done in 2005, comparing only three hot sauces!Suggestion: Since tastes vary and if you happen to like this sauce - then buy it in one of its larger sizes - at least 23 oz and consider the gallon size. They cost little more than the smaller sizes.I'd encourage others to experiment with a sauce that is not so heavily laden with vinegar - you just might prefer any of these:a) Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce - This sauce has considerable heat but it is nicely balanced against a bit of sweetness combined with a hint of garlic. Virtually every supermarket carries it - look in the Asian section! No vinegar.b) Cholula Original Hot Sauce - features a fine blend of peppers - medium hot and readily available - look in the Mexican section. It has a hint of vinegar.c) Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Extra Hot Sauce - a great blend with more vinegar than the above but not too much. Another great blend.d) Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Hot Sauce - a decent blend but with a lot of vinegar. Still it is much better than Franks.e) Tapatio Hot Salsa Picanta - another widely distributed and excellent Mexican Hot sauce. A lot of vinegar but far less than Franks. Once again you will find this in your Mexican isle.In my opinion, all of the above are far superior to Franks.If you like Franks and are at the least bit curious, you should try any of these other hot saucesUPDATE (August, 2013) America's Test Kitchen which is a TV program on PBS recently rated hot sauces. Tabasco came in last, Franks came in the middle and top rated was Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili SaucePPS: Bon Appetit magazine recently rated Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce as "ingredient of the year"
summary: Mild heat combined with too much (?)  vinegar. I've listed a few other hot sauces to consider

reviewText: I live in China, and this is a product I am unable to find where I live. Whenever we travel to the States or my in-laws pay us a visit, Frank's RedHot Hot Sauce makes it to over to the Middle Kingdom. I prefer this product in their 1 gallon plastic containers because of the sheer size. My wife uses Frank's Hot Sauce when making me some mean buffalo wings, and I've also enjoyed the sauce mixed with rice. My wife has laughed at me, but I think it's absolutely delicious! We haven't used the sauce with a lot of other recipes, however I feel it would go well with many dishes. I almost want to drink the stuff. My eight-year-old is not big on spicy food, but she actually likes this hot sauce in small quantities. Although I don't find Frank's RedHot Hot Sauce to be very hot, I feel it has just the right amount of kick. If you are looking for something hotter, I recommend Frank's RedHot Xtra Hot Sauce.
summary: Wish They Had it Where I Live

reviewText: This sauce is a perfect mixture of spice, sour, and salt.  I would describe it as a mild refined premium Tabasco sauce.  It is premium and the taste is very fresh, especially out of the refrigerator.  I personally like a spicier sauce, but the balanced taste is really great, I just add some cayenne pepper to make it hotter and it suits me perfect.  If you like hot sauces and haven't tried this, you are definitely missing out on the premium stuff.

reviewerName: philyodaddy "Say Hello to the Bad Guy"
reviewText: Frank's Red Hot is the standard bearer of the hot sauce world.  As I noted in my review ofHuy Fong, Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce, 17 Ounce Bottle, Tobasco is yesterday's news.  Frank's is just a far superior product.  Tobasco is your grandfather's hot sauce, just because he Frankly didn't know better.  Not the grandfather you liked, the a-hole one.  I prefer Frank's along with Louisiana-based hot sauces like Crystal for my every day use.  AND I DO USE IT EVERY DAY.
