Served with a side salad it is a good, quick meal that really satifies and tastes great.
summary: Like to keep this on hand...

reviewText: Betty Crocker Homestyle Reds, 100% Real Mashed Potatoes, 3.3-Ounce Packages. these taste off even with milk and butter added. I like the ones in the box more they taste like real potatoes. these stink big time
summary: Betty Crocker Homestyle Reds, 100% Real Mashed Potatoes, 3.3-Ounce Packages

reviewText: Very good flavor and texture. The recipe took a slight adjustment though. They call out 2 cups of water for stove-top cooking. That leaves them too runny. Using 1 3/4 cup of water seems to come out just about perfect. Letting them stand for a minimum of 5 minutes also helps greatly.Not much more to say other than they are very good.

I am sorry I bought a dozen. The product tastes good the first time but then it becomes boring the second time. And by the third preparation the smell all over the house becomes objectional. I was hoping we would eat a box a week, but the onion taste and smell is so strong it stinks up our whole house for the day when we prepare the item.I bought on a subscription order basis but cancelled because of the overly strong seasoning.I also bought the Skillet Fries and am really sorry I did. They have the same seasoning and just as strong. I fixed half a box and after re-hydrating tried to rinse off a lot of the season but it didn't work.It will take a year or more for us to get rid of these. Probably give some to the postal workers homeless food collection at Thanksgiving.I wrote the company regarding reducing the seasoning but have had no response as yet.
Pretty tasty stuff, definitely comes better in the over than on the stove, but I guess thats just my personal preference.

I thrive on these mashed potatoes, and also the equally excellent Betty Crocker Loaded Mashed Potatoes. I think I can hear an inner voice of my mother telling me 60 years ago that I shouldn't like prepared foods, but I ignore that voice a lot. These are extremely easy to make (I heat my water for four minutes in an 1100 watt microwave), and they taste pretty good just as they are.Of course, I rarely leave things just as they are. I sometimes add in some milk with my water. It gives the potatoes a richer taste. I also dice various versions of Spam, mix in some canned string beans and pitted black olives, heat everything up, and mix it in with the potatoes. That way it becomes a quick and easy entree.I suppose homemade mashed potatoes have their points. Just try making them when you're over 60. This product starts looking pretty attractive at that point. And the texture is actually better than the best homemade potatoes I've had (most homemade versions usually just end up lumpy, though).Anyway, I recommend these. Don't pay attention to those inner voices telling you otherwise. This is a winner.
summary: Fix it up with Spam and REALLY go to town

reviewText: I love this quick and easy potatoes. Sometimes I open a package and add to hot milk about 2 cups or desired thickness as a potatoe soup. Add diced ham, cheese or what ever combination you can be creative with for other kinds of potatoe soup.

either put up own in Freezer for years - or used the canned which are way too sweet!  Used as topping for a favorite variation of a 'Shepard's Pie' dish -LIGHTLY OIL bottom of deep dish pie [Glass or metal] or 8 or 9 inch square [glass or metal]Using Stovetop* bottom/Stove Top Stuffing Mix, Savory Herb, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)Layer favorite 'cooked' veggies/cook If frozen as in the Italian green beans we use/ or own preferred well drained canned- [if canned - just drain - no pre-cook needed] / then layer a can of HamHormel Lean Smoked Ham, 5-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)Or leftover cubed Ham/Turkey/ Chicken/ pork roast/ or even browned and drained well, Sausage or ground Chuck pre-cooked.  Top all with this Sweet Potato Blend.Betty Crocker Mashed Potatoes - Sweet Potato, 6.3-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)-If glass - Micro on MED power 8-10 until heated through - or Flavorwave* Oven approx. 25-30 min. OR if regular oven - COVER and heat through about 350 temp.  Recipe can be doubled in a Micro TUBE pan [ordinarily designated for cakes] or 13X9  metal for oven.If oven - Cvr - then un-cvr last 5 minute depending if one wants any browning.Cool few minutes - cut into servings - Round dish - slices - Square or oblong into squares [as cake]Side of Cranberry sauce brings that Holiday goodness all summer.  If using sausage or beef/ serve w/applesauce or fruit slices.Also TV chef had a 'tip' where you put leftover squares into crockpotand simmer in can of low sodium broth. Did this and it is very tasty soup as all thickens and flavors the broth.
summary: Not bad at all - from one who has

reviewText: These are so good without doctoring it up.  It is amazing that the potatoes look like potato chips before cooked and after baking, they are so creamy, tasty and tender.One thing I do when I have it is I increase the milk to 1-cup and decrease the water.  Add an extra tablespoon or so of butter.  This makes the dish more rich and creamy (yet they are still good following the box instructions).Finally, if you have cheese on hand (I use Velveeta) add some to the dish before baking.  About 1/3 cup hunks of Velveeta, or 2-3 slices of American cheese, or a big handful of shredded cheese.  Yummy.You could probably use these to make a nice potato soup.  Add cubed ham to it and it becomes a complete meal.

reviewerName: Stacy at Mom in Training blog
reviewText: These are wonderful. I have now purchased two different flavors of the Betty Crocker instant potatoes. They are simple to make and perfect when you don't have time to mash your own.
If you don't mind instant mashed potatoes than these are pretty good. Has a nice flavor yet isn't over powering.
Boy I love these, taste just like KFC with a can of Franco-American gravy on top of them.  MMMMMM MMMMM good
II WAS SO HAPPY TO FINALY GET THEM AND TRY THEM WONDEERFUL TASTE EASY TO MAKE STOVE TOP OR MIROWAVE
I love this stuff.  Seriously.  I wish I had a water fountain at my house that dispensed sweet potatoey goodness.

If I didn't know better, I'd think I cooked and mashed them by myself. I thought I'd need to add something to them - like butter, sour cream, cream cheese or something - but no, these are good to go...I make one envelope and it makes enough for four meals for me. Love it. Hm. I wonder if I could add chocolate and create a dessert. Nah. I love potatoes and these are the best.

I don't like sweet potatoes on their own and this mix is perfect for me because it is a blend of white + sweet potato.  Seasoning is great and each box contains 2 pouches so you can have your choice of how many servings you want to make!  Honestly will make people like sweet potatoes..easy holiday dish!

I mix this with Stevia to make homemade "TRUVIA".  It's so much less expensive.  Tastes perfectly wonderful. I use it to sweeten everything from my homemade coffee creamers to baked goodies.  HIGHLY recommend.  It will be a staple in my house.  I am a fan of NOW foods.  Good price! Good products!
This product was a good price for the product. Very clean taste, not much aftertaste. Mixed with coconut sugar and stevia and cut calories in half for tea.

"Erythritol" has become our sugar substitute of choice since I became diabetic a few months ago. In crystal form, it seems about 70% as sweet as regular sugar. My wife uses a little bit of added sugar to bring the sweetness up for the rest of the family in things that need it, but I am happy with it as a one-to-one replacement for sugar in most things.I have not noticed any glycemic impact to my blood sugar or "laxative" effects seen with other sugar alcohol sweeteners (which is a very important consideration :-)Highly recommended!
summary: Really Good Sugar Substitute - Highly Recommended!

reviewText: This is a good topper for some low carb sugar cookies. It has a good flavor and is nice for giving you that real sugar texture.

I have been using erythritol in baking for about a year now.  After trying nearly every kind of sugar replacement, I have finally settled on this one.  It measures cup-for-cup like sugar, making it easy to adapt recipes and it acts just like sugar when it is baked.  Other artificial sweeteners turn baked goods dry or cakey or crumbly, but this stuff is PERFECT.It does have a slight "cooling" taste; not exactly minty.  I don't mind it, but it does make it difficult to use with some flavors.
I bought this for my daughter who complain that it was really grainy and gritty.  I won't be buying it again.  It isn't available at the local health food store.
I mostly use sugar for sweetening oatmeal & smoothies, so I don't know how it works for baking, but it's _great_  for my needs!

I have to take away a star because it doesn't dissolve well in some things.  Crunchy GF fudge isn't fun unless it's the nuts that you're crunching on.  As for taste, I love it.  It is much less sweet than sugar, which is great for me since I haven't been a fan of real sweet since I was a kid.  I think I got burned out on sugar-too much of it!  I will stick to Stevia though because I love it's taste and it's much cheaper.  The pure Stevia will last me a long, long time and the Erythritol has only lasted a few weeks.

We'd had some trouble before buying Erythritol.  We tried buying from EmeraldForestXylitol but they were unprofessional and abusive when we returned their product.  Their erythritol had an absolutely AWFUL smell.  It was manufactured in China, so we were concerned about contamination.I'm glad to have found this company.  Their erythritol smells nice and has a great taste.  Not sure why it is so different, since both are reported to come from corn.  In any case, we've been very happy with this item and will continue to order more.Everyone in the family's blood sugar has been much more stable as a result of replacing sugar with it.  Baking works well with this product, too.  Tastes great in smoothies, coffee, tea, etc.  Dissolves a bit slower than sugar, although the powder form is better than granular.  Not quite as sweet as sugar, either.  None of the digestive problems with erythritol that one has with xylitol.  Plus, erythritol is not toxic to dogs or other animals the way xylitol is.Note that although this product says "powder" it is really just a very fine grained version of the granular.  It is not like powdered sugar.
I've found Erthritol to be the best sweetener substitute for me, it's natural and causes no digestive distress. This was a good value for the price. I will order it again!

Good substitute for sugar, I like it much better than stevia, which to me has an awful after-taste.I did notice though that the Erythritol isn't quite as sweet as sugar which can make it just a little expensive.

This tastes almost as same as another branded sweetener I had ordered on amazon before-”Zsweet All Natural Zero Calorie Sweetener, 1.5-Pound Pouches (Pack of 2) ”，this one‘s price is much cheaper though.I am considering reorder this one in the future since the flavour has no big difference and they are both naturally made.But if want use for beverages I still recommend “Splenda” products in small packs,those are the best choices...I only use this for cooking.
summary: Less sweet than the real sugar but still tastes good

reviewText: This is a great natural alternative to sugar! Erythritol is natural occurring sugar alcohol. It can be found in small amounts in plant foods such as: grapes, melons, etc. I find it great, because it doesn't cause me stomach issues like other sugar-free sweeteners. It doesn't have an impact on blood sugar, or cause tooth decay either. I use it on its own in recipes, drinks, etc.I also mix it with stevia extract to make my own "Truvia" out of it, because it is less expensive to do so. I basically mix one cup of Now Foods Erythritol and 2 teaspoons Now Foods Better Stevia Extract on low a blender. A 2.5 lb. package erythritol will yeild 6 plus cups of "Truvia" for just over $20.00. I think it tastes better and I get more bang for my buck with my erythritol, since it is more expensive than sugar and only 70% as sweet.Here are the pros and cons from my standpoint:Pros:1. Very low calorie - almost no calories.2. Natural - it usually derived from fruit.3. Less likely to cause gastro distress than other sugar substitutes.4. Doesn't impact blood sugar.5. Doesn't promote tooth decay.6. Can be mixed with stevia to make "Truvia."7. Erythritol on its own tastes very similar to sugar with no after taste.Cons:1. More expensive than sugar.2. 70% as sweet as sugar.3. Doesn't dissolve as fast and as easily as sugar.4. Has cooling sensation if eaten directly out of the bag. This doesn't matter if it is used in or with other foods.5. Can in some cases cause GI distress, although I have never experienced this.I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who wants to decrease their sugar intake. I also recommend the Now Brand in general, because I have never been disappointed with any of the many products I have purchased from them.

This would be a 5 out of 5 if only they hadn't mislabeled it as powder. This is definitely granulated. But aside from that it's a good low calorie sweetener. It doesn't have the same... um, gastrointestinal side effects as other sugar alcohols which is great. But if you're looking for a substitute for powdered sugar in recipes, know that you are going to have to take this and run it through a magic bullet or a coffee grinder or something. I used a magic bullet and made sugar free royal icing and it was great.

Just tried this product for the first time.  Since I find I'm so sensitive to sugar (almost any tiny amount sends me into cravings mode), I have been trying to find one that barely spikes your glycemic index and has no calories, etc.  True to reviews, it's not quite as sweet as regular sugar but as suggested, you can mix it with Stevia to get a good balance.  I have done that and pre-mixed it in an airtight container and I am very happy with the results for my baking needs.
Use in my spice grinder to make powdered sugar and it worked great!!
summary: ... spice grinder to make powdered sugar and it worked great!!

reviewText: It is granular, like sugar. It glistens a bit, as sugar does.  Although it will not bake like sugar, there is an abundance of recipes on-line using this.  This looks and tastes like sugar!  I put it in the canister, my husband uses it on fresh  berries, in coffee and tea.  He has not noticed!  And he is a picky eater and will NOT use anything that reduces sugar.  I will tell him in about 6 months.  I have only bought this brand, but I have seen brands that the customers stated it had a foul after taste.  I will stick with this- it really does, taste like sugar!
summary: Perfect! Glistens Like Sugar-Fooled My Husband!

reviewText: I follow a low glycemic diet and after years of trying all of the sweeteners out there I can attest that this product is the best for my needs.No after tasteBaker friendlyDelicious!I bought one 2.5 # package and am very pleased.Today I am purchasing two 2.5# packages - 2 single bags are less $ than the 2-pack.Erythritol Natural Sweetener Now Foods 1 lbs GranualI will leave one in it's original granular state and place the 2nd one in the food processor and turn it into a fine powder.This product is not quite as sweet as sugar, so for a recipe calling for 1 cup sugar, substitute  with 1 1/4 cup of Erythritol.
summary: Eureka!  I finally found the PERFECT sweeetner :-)

reviewText: I love using this in a mix with natural dried sugar cane juice and powdered stevia. This works well for my family.
Bottom line: No gastro  distress and tastes great in anything I sweeten with it.  It does not mess with my blood sugar either. Also, no GMO's. This one is a no brainier, get it!
summary: Yeah a sweetener I can have!

reviewText: This seems to be about 60% as strong as normal sugar.  I prefer this over other alternatives because it actually tastes like sugar just not as strong. It doesn't have that "diet" sugar sweetener taste.  My stomach does get upset if I eat too much in one sitting but it's nothing horrible and goes away w/in the hour.  That's a price I'm willing to pay.

Not sure why, but I'm surprised more grocery stores don't carry this stuff.  No unpleasant aftertaste, and very low calorie.  Although it's only 70% as sweet as sugar, I started mixing it with some Nectresse (monk fruit and erythritol).  Nectresse is a lot sweeter than sugar, but it doesn't have any aftertaste either.  1 packet to about 2-3 tablespoons of erythritol makes it pretty much 1:1 sweetness of sugar.  I'll be getting more of this stuff.

I have been just trying out different sweeteners (low or no calorie kind) and I just wanted to try this one out as well.  I haven't been disappointed but not really impressed either.  The amount is not really enough to economically use for baking except for just an occasional treat. I guess I will jus stick to liquid stevia.
summary: Okay, not much better than liquid stevia.

reviewText: I've been drinking detox tea for almost a year now. While I cannot say that I can FEEL the effects of this tea, it's because I do many, many wellness techniques. I.E. oil pulling, dry body brushing, hot body scrub, juicing, rebounding, etc. So it would be impossible for me to narrow down the specific ways that this tea has helped me. But what I can say is that I feel like I am doing something good for my body when I drink this tea. It is a great addition to my wellness routine.I drink this at night about an hour after I've finished eating my last meal of the day, and I feel like it boosts  my liver's ability to detox and process the days meals. I feel that by doing this I can allow my body to get a more restful and rejuvenating nights sleep. As far as the taste, I won't lie. I HATED the taste at first, it's got a licorice sort of flavor and I was and still am not a licorice fan. However, drinking this tea daily, i quickly adjusted to the taste and it no longer bothers me, nor do I even notice the taste.Drink this tea, and do your body good.

I've been drinking the dandelion root tea by traditional medicinals for a while, but switched to the detox because it was included in Subscribe and Save and seemed similar. It is fairly similar, although it has a much more floral (and somewhat strange) taste. I've been drinking it for a while, so I've gotten used to it, but I prefer the taste of the dandelion root. Seems to have the same sort of health benefits though!

I love this tea.  I bought it through Amazon after trying it from the grocery store.This has a sweet, spicy, earthy taste to it that I love.  You do have to steep it for 10-15 minutes, though, to get the full flavors out of it.
summary: Great detox tea, complex and unique taste

reviewText: Did not buy this tea from Amazon, but did purchase at local Target store. Though I love anise and licorice flavors, and found the tea quite tasty I had the issue crop up of bleeding gums. The day I bought it I had 16oz over the course of 6+ hours. At bedtime I brushed my teeth only to experience bleeding gums and canker sores. The following morning I had not decided that the tea was the culprit and had another 8oz. After that cup was partially gone I decided that the tea was to blame and discontinued using the tea. Within 48 hours my gums stopped bleeding when I brushed and the canker sores cleared up. Went for my regular cleaning nearly 2 weeks later and they could still how inflamed my guns were and evidence of the canker sores.I contacted the company and was told that the batch I bought was fine by their standards, discontinue use, and follow up with my doctor. My dentist looked over the tea ingredient list and told me to toss it because it could have been any of the ingredients. I had the dentist toss it. I will never buy this tea again, and am leery of trying their other teas. Just beware of possible side effects like this.

I'd ordered this because of the detox label thinking that it was going to have a different effect (i.e., I was going to be living in the bathroom for a couple of weeks). Since getting it, and doing some additional reading, I now realize that it's a bit more subtle than that.I'd ordered this on June 27th and got it in time to start drinking it over the weekend so I haven't been drinking it long so I don't expect that I'm going to have any immediate health benefits from it.Right now, I have a cup at night before I go to bed. Today, being a holiday and off work I had a cup before lunch. I haven't worked my way up to drinking it in the morning before work since I'm currently too attached to my coffee/caffeine.  I'll increase up to the suggested 3 cups a day starting tomorrow and see what happens.Regarding the licorice taste, yup, it tastes like black licorice.. I mean really tastes like it.  I'd never been a fan of licorice but for the sake of health I can gulp an 8 oz cup or two of this down. When it's cooled down a bit I can just drink it down. If it's hot I sweeten mine with a small amount of stevia.  I've found that I can tolerate a lot if it's sweet.

Don't let the almost clinical look of the packaging fool you.  This is NOT some sort of strictly medicinal tea.  The flavor is awesome!  If sweet and spicy ginger is what you are looking for, buy this product.  While it does offer some medicinal benefits, I buy it for the flavor.  There is so much ginger, that you will find little pieces of the stuff collected at the bottom of your cup.  When I brew large amounts of chai tea, I always include a few bags of this for some added kick.
The stevia in the tea gives it a little sweetness that is great for after dinner.  Everyone in our family likes this tea.

I can't speak of the benefits yet, but I'll comment on the taste. It doesn't really taste like ginger, it tastes like the spiciness left behind after you've eaten a sliver of it. It doesn't taste good, it's drinkable, but not pleasant. It's really spicy. All I taste is spice. It's not "strong" per say though. It also has stevia in it, and I can taste it, and I HATE STEVIA. Leaves a bad aftertaste. I will only buy this again if I notice any benefits, but I'm only on my second cup.Edit: I was drinking it regularly and it had no effect on me. I can't down a cup anymore, it's disgusting.
Great for the tummy.

Recently, I've been searching for a good ginger tea.  Preferably, something that captures the awesome spiciness and flavor of ginger.  Well, I picked up this tea in a store because it clearly listed ginger as one of the top ingredients and you can even smell the spiciness in the tea bag.  However, once you brew it (and I let it steep a long time) you can't even taste any of the ginger.  What happened to all the spiciness?  I don't know, but it doesn't make a good ginger tea.  Furthermore, it doesn't even taste good otherwise, as it is really bland in flavor.I suppose that there are still some health benefits to drinking this tea, and it would be really good for someone who wants the benefits of ginger but cannot stand its taste.  Personally, though, I was really let down by this tea, hence the 2-star rating.I discovered that you can make tea by directly boiling some slices of fresh ginger root.  This produces a much more satisfying ginger taste and spiciness, and is a whole lot cheaper.  So, if you are searching for spicy ginger tea, just use a fresh root and skip expensive dried teas all together.
summary: Not good for those who actually like the taste of ginger...

reviewText: This tea packs a real punch, yet it is soothing at the same time. I love a big cup of it after dinner. I have a IBS and this helps to sooth the bloating. It mixes well with other teas. This with green tea is a great tea to drink first thing in the morning. I like to mix it with herbal teas in the evening.

My naturopath recommended organic ginger tea for my digestion.  I bought this one because I trust the Traditional Medicinals label - have always liked their products.  I was surprised at how good this ginger tea tastes and I don't add anything to it.

If you follow the directions on the box, steeping your tea, you will have a delicious, spicy cup of ginger tea.  This is real ginger taste, not an artificial one.I could not remember what brand of ginger tea I'd bought previously.  By reading the product description and consumer reviews, Traditional Medicinals Organic Ginger Aid seemed like a decent choice.  I am very happy with my selection.  I served it to a friend who loved it and shared half of my six boxes with her.  We'll be ordering more, I'm certain.

reviewerName: terzap "aka I Love my Quaker Parrot"
reviewText: This is a favorite Ginger Tea not only for medicinal purposes, but for warming up after a cold day, for any time.  It has a wonderful aroma. I generally use 2-3 teabags in a large (16 - 20oz) mug.  My family likes it so much we have it on a subscription so we never run out (plus, we're always dosing our friends and coworkers with it and turning them into believers, too!)This tea is good for so much more than nausea. I find it starts to settle any kind of intestinal disturbance in about fifteen minutes. Indigestion, gas, mild food poisoning cramps, helps settle motion sickness, even helps colds, flu, and sinus issues.  It's one of the first remedies I turn to for anyone who is feeling unsettled "down below".  It even mitigates -- lessens some of the cramping and gas -- the effects of "dumping" (anyone who has had gastric bypass should be familiar with this when we cheat and ingest something too sweet for our altered digestive systems to handle).I like this tea with a bit of sweetener and milk when I'm enjoying it for "any time".  Medicinally, perhaps with a little sweetener (I use stevia) and also, I use two or three bags at once and make sure it's very strong--steeped at least five or more minutes.Get this and a case of Gypsy Cold Care and Throat Coat, and you'll have a great start on some very effective and good tasting remedies for cold and flu season.
summary: It works. It tastes great. I wish it came in a loose pack!

reviewText: Seems to get rid of stomach acid coming up my throat. forgot what that's called. May just be the placebo effect.I put a tea bag in a 20 oz container with reverse osmosis water before I go to bed. I then drink it in the morning with my breakfast.
We love this tea.  I purchased this product after reading Food Babe's article on pesticides in non-organic teas.  This brand was highly reccomended.

There are few beverages that can rival a good herbal tea. We have ordered this Traditional Medicinals Organic, Peppermint tea from Amazon for years. We love it. Has a great flavor and is organic. Well recommended!

I've recently begun drinking peppermint tea as I've read about it's wonderful ability to aid in digestion and stomach discomfort. It did not disappoint and has lived to my expectations. It's a very soothing, lively tea. Perfect for any time of the day.
summary: Great for digestion, even better price, awesome quality

reviewText: I bought this tea after much research. I loved the Twinnings brand, but decided to try something organic. This tea is pretty minty, but it has a somewhat "weird" smell that takes a little getting used to. I was used to a more soothing and calming scent having grown up drinking mint tea. I think I might get used to this after a few more uses. If not, I'll definitely go back to Twinnings.
I really like this brand of organic tea, and as far as effectiveness goes the peppermint is one of the company's best products.  Very soothing on the stomach.

While I haven't tried every peppermint tea available, I have tried a half dozen or so of the ones I can readily get, and have found this one to be the best.I have tried other teas from Traditional Medicinals, and consider them to be one of the very best tea vendors in the market. I have never been disappointed in any of their products,and always look for them first if I am trying to find an herbal tea.Peppermint has many beneficial effects, and this is a great way to get that into your diet. Add a little steviaRecommended.
I love this tea, It has flavor, and zaz.you should try it.

Traditional Medicinals makes some really nice tea, and their organic peppermint is one of the best. It is strong; none of that weak fare you get at your local grocery store. You can really taste the peppermint oil on your tongue, almost as if it were brewed from fresh peppermint. It is not sweet; add some honey or raw sugar if you like it that way. Excellent for your digestive track and memory, peppermint tea is a wonderful study aid and will help you stay focused without getting the jitters of caffeine.A first class tea, and easy to recommend to anyone who enjoys herbals.

reviewerName: Paula "Avid reader and listener, of both fict...
reviewText: What can I say about peppermint tea?  It hits the spot, whether hot or iced (my favorite).  I also like like combining this with green tea, or red vanilla tea.  This tea has a nice fresh flavor, and the product is made even better by being organic--so important when you are consuming something (such as a leaf) with a large surface area where contaminants reside.  Price on this product is good too.
summary: great flavor even better when organic

reviewText: I love this tea, it tells you on the package on how to prepare it. It helps when I have an upset stomach or  a headache. I will buying this tea again and again.
If you want mint, then this is the product. I was very surprised at the bold flavor, which I like. This is the product for you if you want flavor.

I was drinking Twinnings peppermint tea and others, but nothing compares to this one! It is very strong, has a nice aroma and works great for relieving a headache, sore throat, upset stomach, and IBS. It is naturally sweet in taste so no need to add any sweeteners. It also seems to wake me up which is huge plus.
Best flavor of the peppermint teas I've tried.  This is a full flavor tea.  If you like peppermint it is a great tea!
summary: My preferred brand of Peppermint Tea

reviewText: I bought these for my wife and she loves them this tea .Every night she has tea in her new tea cup.

I got a box for just over a buck on sale to try. I don't have problems going but there are days where I barely do and it's hard so I decided to try this on one of those days. I drank before bed just like the box said, let it sit in boiling water for 15 minutes. Not even an hour after drinking the cramps started. I spent the next hour, maybe longer on the toilet. It was not fun and I was exhausted, I just wanted to sleep. Finally after going more than I ever have in my whole life. I was able to go to bed. Thankfully I did not wake up due to cramping. The next day I felt okay, then I was out shopping and lo and behold the cramps started again. I ended up going back home just to be safe. I went, and went and went throughout the afternoon, wondering when I would ever stop. I didn't stop going until in the evening.So, the reason for the two stars is the cramps. They were bad. Maybe not as bad as some I have had  before. The instructions are not exactly honest, especially how I drank the tea and not even an hour later was going. So clearly it is different for everyone, I will only drink this again if I am so constipated I haven't gone in days, that probably won't happen, but it's there, just in case. The product clearly works but the cramps just aren't worth it too me. Next time I will probably try brewing for only 5 minutes to see if this lessens the side effects. The fact that it cleans you out, is 5 stars.

I've been using this tea for several years now, with my physician's blessing, and can't say too many good things about it.  Some herbal laxatives are harsh and cause cramping and diarrhea.  This tea is gentle and very soothing but works well if you have chronic constipation.The packing is good and convenient with a six pack in a small box without unnecessary packaging materials.  The price is good and this product is a natural fit for the Subscription and Save program.
summary: The best herbal tea for what ails your digestive system

reviewText: I'm not sure if I like it, the taste is a little weird to me. I think I'll stick with magnesium.
I did the Master Cleanse for 33 days and used this tea at night.This product works. I still plan to use this tea now and then.

This tea works much better than pill laxatives/stool softeners. I found taking it a few nights a week keeps things good.i don't get the cramping , bloat and dehydration one encounters without pill products.

I love this stuff. Never having regular BM's I started with 1 tea bag and by the next morning I would go. then I started to see that 1 tea bag wasn't doing anything, so I upped it to 2 tea bags..bam! Got the results I wanted...sometimes if I got really backed up or ate a ton of crap over the weekend or something and needed to clear out, I do 3 bags. I am also 6ft tall and weight 230lbs. I wouldn't suggest 3 teabags to my tiny friends unless you wanted to really punish somebody!

Can't find another product better than this and have tried everything.  No cramps, bloating, unexpected runs to the toilet, just a brewed cup of tea before bed and the next morning you will be back to your old self and feel great.
Works great when taken at night before bed and doesn't hurt the tummy. I've been taking this for years and always buy it at amazon.

This product works well. However, I thought I was ordering the chocolate version, because the packaging was very similar. I prefer the chocolate flavor, but this works the same. This one's flavor tastes more like licorice. I recommend this, because it doesn't have a bunch of chemicals and is relatively gentle.

Years ago I wrote a review singing the praises of Smooth Move, which I'd drunk for years. But two different doctors told me it probably wasn't a good idea to drink it. One reason is that it stains your colon. So when you have a colonoscopy, it's more difficult for the doctor to see what's going on in there. Also, it's a stimulant laxative, which can cause problems with regular use. I now take Miralax, which works perfectly, and the doctor says I can take as much of that as I want.

I originally purchased only one box of this tea in the chocolate to see how it worked. If I was not pleased, I did not want to be stuck with 6 boxes. I was so surprised, it works very well without side effects. I'm a 51 year old female near menopause with a very erratic digestive system, despite lots of fiber and good diet. I have been using this tea for almost two weeks now and my body is very fine tuned now each morning. I have this tea each night about and hour before bed. Even if I am out in the evening and have it later, it still works. Im so pleased, I did order the regular herbal flavor for six boxes. The herbal has a much better taste than the chocolate. Also, if you buy in bulk, it comes out to around $3 a box. I first read about this tea in a raw food cookbook. I personally do not have any side affects. I was off one morning, so I had the tea in the afternoon as well as evening. It is caffeine free, but does not make you tired, so ok to drink during the day. I will continue to order this product.
does what it says it will and tastes ok with a little sweetening.  NO bad effects, nothing harsh.  Just works.  So few things, these days, work the way they say they will.
summary: does what it says, no grief

reviewText: My husband was using a very strong medical laxative medicine to help nature to do its thing and was having stomach ache because of it. Our DR. told us that some of the Doctors and nurses were speaking highly of the Smooth Move Laxative Tea so I ordered it for him to try.  Well, it is great, no more stomach aches and he is having smooth moves!!!  And he says is a good tasting tea.  Two for the price of one, what a deal!
summary: does indeed live up to its name

reviewText: My mom and I both used this and between the 2 of us we've finished 1 box.This is more effective than prune juice and kefir but not as fast actingas Swedish bitters. Took off 1 star since it contains senna -- which shouldbe avoided according to natural health books and according to a pharmacistfriend. But I would guess it's still less toxic than conventional laxatives.I'm ordering mom another box for her upcoming overseas trip. Travel can induceconstipation and I trust "Smooth Move" to do the job. For long term solution toconstipation I use fresh aloe vera gel (home-grown) and green vegetable juice.
Tastes great, but not sure how well it worked. Will keep on using it as needed but hard to say when that will be!
summary: Tastes great, not sure how well it worked

reviewText: Starting to feel a cold coming on?  Don't feel like or have time to go to the doc?  Keep a box of Echinacea Plus in the house for just those times.  It's got a soothing taste, a soothing smell and it a great beverage anytime, not just when you are sick or on the way.Some people think this stuff works to help head off a cold, some don't.  It has worked well for me since the Pitt Student Health Clinic Suggested it years ago.  Sometimes it succeeds 100% in heading off a cold at the onset of symptoms when consumed as soon as the scratchy throat and runny nose start but sometimes it still takes a little extra help.Traditional Medicinals makes great products.  They are kinda pricey but generally worth it (especially this one).  Go buy this at the local grocery or health food store.  You'll be able to buy it one box a time and the bulk price on Amazon is equal to or more expensive than the single unit price in a store.
summary: Fantastic Product as Are All Thier Products!

reviewText: My wife and I love Traditional Medicinals Teas. They are high quality and a great price. This tea has a great flavor and a very high echinacea content. I highly recommend this tea.

First, I love the tea.  I like the taste and I like how each teabag is sealed in an airtight wrapper.  When I'm not feeling well I like to use a teabag of echinacea and bag of Organic Throat Coat [...]Second I really appreciate that they will tell you the country of origin for each ingredient in their teas.  So many companies these days are not transparent about that kind of thing.  I have not yet had the opportunity to request certificates of analysis but they do claim to adhere to "pharmacopoeial grade" teas.  This means that they SHOULD be testing to be in compliance with, probably, the European Pharmacopoeia .
summary: Hard to go wrong with Traditional Medicinals

reviewText: I could write a book just talking about this great tea. LOL!!! This tea is an essential for me especially during winter. The teas came in great condition and I like the new box design. This is great value for 6 boxes compared to what I pay for in the store.
THIS IS A GREAT TASTING TEA... AND EXTREMELY HEALTHFUL!TASTE AND GOOD HEALTH ALL IN ONE LITTLE TEA BAG!HERE'S TO YOU!
summary: I HAVE TO JOIN IN WITH EVERYONE ELSE!

reviewText: I decided to try this, looking for something a little less caloric than hot chocolate.  It definitely works for me--I take melatonin every night too, so perhaps that helps.  It is a great tasting tea, so just that makes it enjoyable to drink in the evening.

I put 2 of these along with 2 or 3 decaffeinated Tetley's or PG Tips in a 20-oz mug and make tea every night, usually have 2 of them, and sleep like a baby.  Very soothing.  One thing I have noticed about THIS brand compared to OTHER brands, is that it IS TRULY medicinal.  So, don't overdo it on the Traditional Medicinals (especially the Smooth Move, lol - ain't nothing smooth about that stuff!)  This has a beautiful, fresh/minty but not too minty taste, very soothing.  Have bought more than once.
I take medication that doesn't always let me sleep. Two cups of this 1/2 hour apart and 1/2 hour before bed have really helped.  It's better than more medication, that is for sure...

At least one of the ingredients in this tea has clinical evidence that it can help with anxiety.  You can look it up online, it is the passionflower.  Chamomile also has some clinical evidence but not as strong as passionflower.  So this isn't just a "feel good" tea--it is actually medicinal even though Traditional Medicinals can't say that or the FDA would land on them like a ton of bricks.  That's fine, just type passionflower in your favorite search engine.Beyond that this tea is a perfect addition to your nighttime ritual.  Having a bedtime ritual can help you fall asleep faster even if the tea itself does nothing at all.  I like to use the tea as a signal to my body and mind that the day is over and it is time now to relax and go to sleep.But please don't expect this tea to knock you out like an Ambien--it doesn't work that way.

My mind is almost always active and even when I was in bed sometimes it took me a hour or more to fall asleep even if I was tired. This tea is not as strong as a melatonin pill but my experience with them are the over the counter type which were non-organic and probably full of unhealthy things. My belief is that our brain is supposed to make its own melatonin and that using a melatonin pill bypasses this method and can be unhealthy. I am not a doctor but I do study things. This Tea does relax me and does seem to keep me asleep longer and better. I used t owake up alot at night and I still wake up sometimes, but this tea has helped me to get a bit more sleep. So, in conlusion, do not expect to be nocked out like drugs would, but realize this is a healthy and seemingly non-addictive way to improve sleep at least by a small or moderate measure. It also seems that it takes a few weeks or a month after you first start using it to really notice its full effect. I dont use this tea on the weekends, only on work nights. When I sue it on work nights I can feel the extra sleepiness and need to sleep.
summary: Not like a melatonin pill but works ok.

reviewText: I have been drinking and using this for year. I gave it my grandson who has ADD and to my gramma who has insomnia. Works well

Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile  Tea Bags  make delicious, soothing cups of tea.  From the very first time I tried this product I was convinced that it was not necessary to look for chamomile tea anywhere else.  The tea is exactly as described, and I make certain that Traditional Medicinal Organic Tea is well stocked in my pantry. It does not  cause drowsiness in any way whatsoever. It relieves stomach discomfort and as a result  it helps one to feel better.The great feature about this tea is that one can drink it  at any time.  It is not solely for the purpose of calming a digestive discomfort, but the fact that it helps in this way is an added plus.

I LOVE THIS BRAND TEA. STRONG FLAVOR, ORGANIC INGREDIENTS, TEA BAG NOT MADE OF SOMETHING BAD, HEALTH WARNING. BEFORE THE HEALTH WARNINGS SCARED ME, BUT NOW I'VE SEEN SOME OF THE SAME INGREDIENTS THAT WERE IN OTHER TEAS, BUT JUST DIDN'T CARE ENOUGH TO PUT THE HEALTH WARNING. ALL NATURAL ORGANIC, BUT THEY TOOK THE TIME TO WARN AGAINST HOW THE NATURAL INGREDIENTS CAN EFFECT SOMEONE'S PREEXISTING HEALTH CONDITIONS.
High quality, good flavor, well packaged product and priced competetively. Around my house, the price of tea is starting to become prohibitive and I think I may start growing it. Maybe.
I like to dring this tea because of its known medical effect. It helps with digestion and also anxiety. For digestion, I mix it with vinegar and honey and it works wonders.
I drink Chamomile tea before bed to relax me and help me get a good nights sleep,  It works for me and I try to buy everything organic that I do not grow myself.

I drink this w/another tea for easing digestion and the combo is working. Sometimes I have the Chamomile by itself, so can say the taste is very mild, really close to bland, but it is soothing...well, I haven't blown a cork while drinking anyway.The tea bag floats, which may not bother other people; but, I do prefer my tea bags to sink into the water...so I know I'm getting maximum brew.

I prefer black and green teas for everyday drinking, but when I need a nice smooth calming herbal tea, I go right for chamomile.  Not only does it soothe digestive issues, but it helps relax you--which is why chamomile is in some teas sold to make you have a good nighty-night.  Some brands mix their chamomile with other flavorings, but I prefer just the chamomile.  It has a nice floral quality to it and you don't need add anything to make it sweet unless you want to.  I tend to add a touch of honey, since honey is also so good for you.Please do follow the directions, though, and let this one steep for a good while so you will get the most quality and benefit out of the flowers.This is one of the better brands out there for chamomile tea, even besides the fact that its organic.  Well worth a little extra money to get.
I drink this tea to relax and for stomach and digestive problems. It works every time. Very calming and a good all-around tea time.
The tea was very sweet and the tea bags full.  Other tea companies make it difficult to get even a small cup after a lot of steeping so I'm a loyal Traditional Medicinals customer.
Very good Traditional Medicinals Organic, Chamomile tea, 16-Count Boxes (Pack of 6).  And very good price. Will buy it again.
summary: Traditional Medicinals Organic, Chamomile, 16-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)

reviewText: I like many of the Traditional Medicinals brand teas.  The chamomile has a wonderful flavor and doesn't taste or smell "dusty" as some do.
I use this in my humidifyier when I'm suffering with a bad cold & simply adore it. Great stuff to keep on hand!!!

The aroma that comes from this pouches is to die for. It is so real and intense, that speaks itself for the quality of a product. I drink those anytime of the day,this kind of tea might calm you a little. I have also the ginger and chamomile combination it is just as good. The package of the product is well designed as result  the product will stay fresh longer.
summary: You have to smell it to get it

reviewText: Soothing camomile and lavender tea with great flavor. Well-priced compared with local gourmet shop's offering of imported product of same ingredients.
I am grateful for this Chamomile Lavender Tea has helped me with acid reflux and an nervous stomach and it is a wonderful flavor and tasteand I love it so very much ... J
I don't really love chamomile tea, but my naturopath wants me to drink more chamomile tea. So, I thought perhaps a little lavendar would help.  It does.  It's bit less "grassy" tasting to me.

I bought this on a whim, thinking how can you go wrong with a combination of lavender and chamomile???This tea is simply amazing...from the first whiff you get before it hits the water, to the aroma that permeates the room after it hits the water, right up to the whiff your nose gets before that first sip!While I love a good cup of tea, I don't usually get this excited about teas, nor do I write reviews about them.I imagine I probably have at least 30+ varieties of "teas" (herbal, black, green, white, red) in my home at all times.  Very few are repeat purchases.  This is one that will ALWAYS be in our home.I bring boxes of it with me on women's retreats and it is a hit with just about everybody.  I also provide my massage therapist with boxes of this for myself and his other clients to enjoy!I have no idea how much of this relaxation response is psychological/emotional and how much is physiological, or if it even matters since the purpose of the tea is to calm!I can't imagine anyone not being pleased with this purchase.
Love it. best night tea ever. tastes good, and I'm glad to find out they don't use some common carcinogens in the packagings, the paper tea bags, (as far as my research showed me).
Smells great and tastes good.  I am very pleased with this tea.  Very calming, great purchase.  So glad I purchased the tea.
I this tea is ok, the lavender is different so I just put some honey in it and it is ok from there.
This tea is great.  It is perfect for relaxing, the price is right for 6 boxes.  It arrived very quickly and I use it daily to de-stress.... works wonders.

Picked this tea up at Target today. It is a blend of chamomile, lavender, and lemon balm, all of which are known for their relaxing & stress relieving qualities. I used one tea bag, not 2 as the directions state, and it was plenty strong. It has a very strong lavender scent & is very relaxing & soothing without putting me to sleep. I am very happy with the effects and about to brew another cup :)
summary: This tea really helps me unwind

reviewText: I love Traditional Medicinals teas!!  The Echinacea and Gypsy Cold care are the absolute best for making me feel better when I feel a cold coming on.

Edit to original review:I just noticed the warning not to use while pregnant or breast feeding. I have no idea if this applies to all the teas or only one of them, but you will want to take note of that. I'm not in that group, but don't want anyone buying this if they are and use my recommendation as the basis for buying it.Original review:I originally purchased this because they were out of the plain 'throat coat' and I couldn't find it locally.I was suprised to find that the sampler is actually quite good.Now, keep in mind that this is MEDICINAL herbal tea, it's not made for taste, but it works amazingly well.I bought it in a rush when my husband had a miserable cold and was out driving every day in 40-degree weather. He was really suffering.I made him the throat coat and the cold remedy versions, heavily laced with honey so it was palatable and put them in his Oxo Travel Mugs.They really reduced his suffering and made his long days a little less tedious.Throat Coat is by far the best product. Be sure to steep it quite a while as recommended. The name says it all. You'll feel as if your throat is lined with velvet.And there are no chemicals or drugs to interfere with the ability to drive or even think (antihistamines make me a whirling dervish & make the hubby pass out cold).I sent a box of this over to my sister in law when she came down with a bug and she raved about it for weeks.6 of them is a lot, but if you have a lot of family and especially kids who tend to get colds a lot, you'll use them.
summary: Hard to find product, excellent herbal remedies

reviewText: We buy this tea like it's going out of style and usually pay whatever price our local grocery stores ask. It's a way better deal on Amazon, so we are switching yet another thing we buy to Subscribe & Save through Amazon. It's such a no-brainer.

So I know there is a warning that you should not drink these teas if you are pregnant or breastfeeding but I want to remind you that just about every product out there has that warning on it for legal reasons. Even their Mother's Milk tea has that warning and it is made specifically to help women increase their breast milk supply while breastfeeding. With that said...I am breastfeeding and have been for a long time. Before I found these teas I would suffer through a sore throat, stuffy nose, cold, etc with out taking medication because I didn't want my baby/toddler to get any through my breast milk. Herbal remedies are much gentler on your body so I feel very comfortable knowing that these herbs will be passed to my child instead of a strong chemical remedy like DayQuil. I make my teas very strong and add some local raw honey for even more health benefits, and it makes the teas taste even better. I do enjoy the taste of the teas much more than I thought I would since they are after all medical remedies. The teas are not miracle cures but they really do help and you don't get a doped up feeling like you do from a lot of the OTC meds out there. I'm not sure I have a favorite, I find they are all really nice to have on hand when you need them. I also enjoy just drinking them, mainly the Cold Care and Echinacea, as a nice cup of tea on a cold day.Buy one box and see what you think, I don't think you'll be disappointed.***EDIT***I just wanted to add that while in general herbs are pretty safe when breastfeeding you do not want to take them as supplements or eat/drink extremely large amounts of them with out first making sure they are safe. You would probably have to drink an entire box of this stuff in one day for it to really cause any problems with breastfeeding so if you drink the typical 1-6 cups (using 1 tea bag per cup, 6 cups steeped with 2 tea bags each might be a little much) you should be fine.***EDIT***Just found out from my midwife that although these teas are safe to drink while breastfeeding they are not safe to drink while pregnant, except for the Echinacea which is safe to drink while pregnant. Bummer! I guess my 6 boxes will be sitting in the pantry for the next 9 months.
summary: Can't Live With Out This Stuff.

reviewText: i like this one. especially the throat coat. seems to help a lot when you have a cold and sinus drainage and sore throat.

I love these teas, especially when I'm feeling a little under the weather. I will drink them anytime though since they have great flavor. I especially like the echinacea blend which has a somewhat minty flavor.

This sampler variety has several teas geared towards sick people, ranging from a cold, to a sore throat to a stuffy nose.I firmly beleive the teas (also Good Earth tea for colds) help alleviate some of the symptoms. So I give both 5 stars for the benefits.I just wish that they tasted better.
summary: Helps with a cold or sore throat.

reviewText: worked well during winter

Traditional Medicinals makes some very comforting teas. I keep a box of this tea sampler handy in case I get a cold. The "Throat Coat" tea is good to use when you first start feeling pain in your throat. The "Gypsy Cold Care" has hyssop in it which is antibacterial and antiviral. The "Echinacea Plus" tea also has echinacea which helps with sinus infections. When you are congested you can drink the "Breathe Easy" tea which has peppermint and eucalyptus in it. Some of the other ingredients in the teas include: licorice root, calendula flowers, ginger root, slippery elm, marshmallow root, wild cherry bark, fennel fruit, cinnamon bark, sweet orange peel, lemongrass leaf, elder flower, yarrow flower, rose hips, safflower petal and cloves. The teas all taste good and are very soothing.~The Rebecca Review

A friend/co-worker recommended this tea to me when I was sick recently. She said she and her family have been using this tea for many, many years when sick. She said even her grown children (with families of their own now) still drink this tea when sick. She gave me several tea bags. That night, I was at work, and I was so miserable, I did not know how I was going to get through the night. I couldn't even hold my arms up when sitting, I was so weak. I figured I had nothing to lose, so I tried it.The box recommended several cups of tea. After I drank the first cup, I still felt awful. Then I drank a second cup. I still felt terrible. Then, about an hour and a half after the second cup, I felt like I had got my second wind! I had my strength back, and I felt pretty good. It was no problem for me to finish my shift. That was downright amazing! I continued to drink two tea bags per day, for about two days. It made me feel so much better, that I no longer needed to drink it. I am SOLD on this stuff! So much so, that I bought a pack of six boxes on the subscribe and save program. I'm going to give a few boxes to my family. The next time I get sick, I will start slamming this stuff.Luckily, my friend left the box of tea at work for others to use, since so many people were sick. I personally recommended it to several sick co-workers, explaining how it had helped me. Two co-workers drank the tea, and they told me later that it had made them feel better too. In fact, they were thinking of buying some themselves.
summary: Tastes good, and helped my feel better! Cold care? It should be called GOLD CARE!

reviewText: I keep this tea in my in my pantry year round to help for when U start to feel that icky sluggish feeling coming on & I drink it until I feel better....There is also the Gypsy Cold Care PM that is excellent for nite !!
My wife and I enjoy this tea. It a has a mild flavor and works well to soothe a sore throat, upset stomach and help the body heal from an illness.
summary: Traditional Medicinals Gypsy Cold Care Tea

reviewText: I have no idea what it is about this tea that makes it AMAZING, but there's something in there.  I've started buying 6-packs of it to give out boxes when my coworkers and family get sick.  Seriously.I highly, highly recommend this tea when you're feeling under the weather.  Somehow, it will miraculously make you feel healthy again.Just try it. Really.  (Bonus = the Amazon 6-pack price is really, really good!)

I don't go in for herbal remedies. When I'm sick, I grab some Robitussin or Sudafed, and that's that. If this has any legitimate medicinal value, it's just a nice bonus. From my standpoint, this is just a Damned Good Tea!It's got an unlikely minty licorice taste to it, which has really grown on me. I haven't found this taste in any other tea. The aroma is wonderful, and it cools the nose like a subtle eucalyptus, though that's not present in the taste. While it makes a great hot tea, it really shines for iced tea. I use one bag per 18oz or so, rather than the one bag per 12oz I'd normally use for iced tea brewing, and this works quite well. In addition to the refreshing taste, that coolness in the nose and the throat makes a great hot weather refreshment.

I was sick for quite a few days before I could get back to the store and get myself some of this tea. I tried a few packets in another sampler box and was impressed.Once I realized this tea had hyssop in it I was sold on it. Hyssop is known for helping you overcome colds. The deal is hyssop has antiviral properties. For this reason you should not drink this tea on a regular basis but rather save it for when you get a cold. Hyssop should not be used for extended periods of time and should not be taken by pregnant women as it can cause miscarriage. So says one of my herbal books.This tea also contains Elder which is a known gypsy cure for colds. That is probably the reason this is called GYPSY cold care!The other ingredients in this tea include yarrow flower, peppermint leaf, rose hips, Saigon cinnamon bark, ginger, safflower petals, cloves and licorice. It is a good tasting tea and seems to be very healing.Three days after I started drinking about three cups a day my cold went away. I will now keep this on hand and start drinking it the minute I get a sore throat! I'm very convinced that this tea helped me get well.Please consult with your doctor before taking herbal remedies!~The Rebecca Review

reviewerName: these pretzels r making me thirsty
reviewText: Traditional Medicinals is the best tasting herbal tea out there that I have tried. I have tried the Yogi teas before and did not care for them. I bought the Traditionals Breathe Easy and the Gypsy Cold Care. I take the breathe easy whenever I feel congested or like now when I had a coughing attack from some scent. My throat felt irritated and my chest felt achey and wheezy. Brewed a cup of this tea with some honey and it was so delicious and soothing. I don't know if its the way it makes you feel when you drink it because it tastes so good, or if the herbs really do help but I do feel better, a sense of calm. I use the Gypsy Cold Care for whenever I feel like I am catching a cold.  Nip it in the bud so to speak and boy does this tea help.  I took it last year when I felt like I was catching a cold and the next day I felt like the cold had gone away.  Maybe it would have done that on it's own, I don't know.  But I believe this tea really helps.  I highly recommend both the Breathe Easy and the Gypsy Cold Care.
summary: Delicious and I think it works!

reviewText: This tea is great for a soar throat. One thing I noticed is that this company has two different types of Throat Coat with different ingredients. Becareful when buying. It seems that the throat coat I like only comes in there sampler package. I get it at Target...  I have no idea why the ingredients are different but if you compare you will see what I mean.

I was introduced to Throat Coat tea several years ago by a friend. I've never been without it since. I'm lucky enough that I don't get many colds or sore throats, but when I do, I crave this tea. I should work for these people because I've sold tons of it to friends by giving them a cup when they're not feeling well.When you have a cold or sore throat, nothing feels better than this fabulous tea. It's very aptly named. I think it feels like my throat has been covered in velvet. You can definitely feel the 'coating' after just a few sips. When I get sick, I'll ususally drink about 3 cups per day. The soothing effects last quite a while and it's heaven when you're trying to sleep with a nasty cold. I've had friends who sing that swear by this tea before a performance, but I don't sing outside the shower myself. :DNothing else on the market works as well, especially when sweetened with a little honey.  I depend so much upon this tea that I even brought it back with me to Mexico, where I live now. It's sitting in a canister, ready. I've stored this tea for as much as a year with no problem.  Knock wood, I haven't needed it yet this year, but it's comforting to know it will be there when I need it. :D
summary: Like Pouring Liquid Velvet onto Your Sore Throat

reviewText: So many suffer from sore throats - due to allergy, common cold, overuse and other conditions. When you step in the drugstore or natural food store, there are many lozenges, tinctures, syrups and pills to chose from. Yes, some of them will nip your symptoms in the bud, or temporarily suppress them. For me, when I am feeling under the weather, I want a tea that not only gives me sweet relief, but, helps me heal. That is why I drink Traditional Medicinals Throat Coat. It is made with great ingredients, like organic licorice root, slippery elm bark, marshmallow root, cherry bark, bitter fennel fruit, cinnamon bark and sweet orange peel. The tea tastes delicious and really coats my throat in gentle herbal goodness.
summary: Great tasting tea and also does the job....

reviewText: My entire family loves this for when we get sore throats.  Great to have around during the cold season.  We add a couple packets ofWholesome Sweeteners Fair Trade Organic Sugar, Individual Packets (Pack of 1000).  I keep a box at work to share as well.  I also enjoyTraditional Medicinals Organic, Peppermint, 16-Count (Pack of 6).

Having completed radiation treatment for cancer of the throat I wound up with "Dry Mouth" the result of fried saliva glands, also a sore throat. My ENT Doctor recommended this to me. It has worked wonders for the dry mouth and has lubricated my throat. I can't say that it has helped the sore throat at all but my sore throat has a different cause than most.

Every year I make up a Christmas present box of alternative medicines for my son, who is prone to colds and hacky coughs.  This year I included a variety of Traditional Medicinals teas.  I was quite surprised to receive an unexpected phone call from him raving about Throat Coat's wonderful taste and soothing qualities.  I couldn't agree more.Usually I get feedback (good & bad) about some alternative I've given him, but never that quickly. Throat Coat's ingredients are a winning combination.  I notice they make organic Lemon Echinacea Throat Coat too--that may go in next year's Christmas care box.
summary: The Best Of Traditional Medicinals Teas

reviewText: I have had vocal cord issues for nearly a year and this tea with neck and vocal exercises have worked wonders.

I got this for my daughter when she complained that her sore throat was keeping her up at night. I had been giving her ibuprofen, but she said that this tea was the only thing that made a difference at night. There are only six bags per box, which wasn't taking her long to run through, so I don't mind getting the pack of six so I will have this tea on hand.
I drink this with some agave syrup.It tastes great and it definitely helped increase my milk supply!

Bought for our daughter who just gave birth.This tea is suppose to increase mothers milk for breast feeding.Our daughter really didn't have any issues producing milk,we thought it could not hurt.Well she loves the taste of the tea and if produces more milk,then she have no problem going back to work filling those containers for our grandson

I drink this tea 2-5 times a day, and noticed a steady supply of milk. It could be because of my increased water intake because of the tea, but I like to think that it's the tea itself. You have to let the tea steep for 10 minutes, which can be a bit bothersome because often times I find myself forgetting it. The taste is okay, I prefer a sweet tea, so adding some honey makes the tea taste a million times better than if you were to add sugar. I could hardly get over the smell (it smells like black licorice), but after a while it doesn't phase you. A huge plus is how CHEAP this is for 6 boxes. The grocery store I bought these at sells them for 5-6 bucks a box. Will definitely buy this again!

I am not into homeopathic methods for anything really. Like most everyone I grew up going to a Dr. And getting prescriptions when something was wrong with my health. I have hypoplasia...breast constriction,  and my Dr.s wouldn't prescribe me metformin which is a medication that promotes lactation because apparently breastfeeding isn't a high priority for him. I was told to give up breastfeeding...that it was too much for me to be doing (pumping and supplementing via a sns) especially with all the contributing factors (my son had tongue tie and bit me until i looked like a burn victim and therefore transferred almost no milk which made him frustrated and bite more) and that I'd b stuck with my low supply... 4 oz a day. Well I got a hospital grade pump, got this tea and more milk plus special blend capsules and in a month I am at 17 oz and climbing. I stared taking the recommended doasages of both; but now I drink the tea at least 5 times a day and I take the mothers.milk capsules 4-5 times a day. My breast tissue is expanding and growing...I am making more than half of.my sons food... don't hesitate to try this. Don't give up breastfeeding. I was told to give up even by the hospital lactation consultants... but with lots of work this tea, a stubborn personality and my mothers milk special blend capsules I quadrupled my supply so far.  I am so happy that my initial pessimism toward this herbal tea proved totally unfounded. Can you beloved a tea can help you lactate? Amazing.Aanother note on the company; I'm so impressed by the box that contains the tea,  I read it like a book,  what a fantastic company and what interesting information and encouragement they include on their packaging.

It's hard to tell if these really helped with milk production but it made me feel like was doing everything I could. I like to make an iced tea out of these but the taste isn't that great so I would use 2 or 3 bags of this tea along with 1 or 2 bags of a fruity tea to make a big pitcher.

I cannot drink a lot of strong tea while nursing. My metabolism is all messed up. This tea is strong tasting enough that it feels like a good cup of tea. It does seem to increase supply, so I do not use if engorged. There is an anisette flavor in it. Not a flavor I am normally fond of, but I don't mind it in this tea.

Ran out of another brand of breast milk tea for my girlfriend so I ordered this product.  After using the tea for a few days, I can comment that the tea works based on my gf's opinion.  Milk production has increased based on an increase in usage as our son is growing and requires more food.Would recommend to other mothers.

This really helped to increase my milk supply.  The taste wasn't so great for me, kind of a black licorice flavor but you get used to it. Also, it changes your body odor (might sound strange), but it makes it sweet smelling---kind of like maple syrup. One thing I did not like though was that it increased my appetite.  I mean DRASTICALLY increased my appetite.  I believe fenugreek was the culprit for the appetite increase, and I am positive it was for the body odor change.  Anyway, I used this tea for about 8 months, worked pretty well for its main purpose of milk production.

I've been using Mother's Milk Tea for a little over a month now & it seems to be working quite well.  Before I started drinking the tea, I would only be able to pump a couple ounces at a time, creating a problem of not having a decent supply of breastmilk built up in my freezer.  After drinking the tea, I can now pump about 4 ounces at a time.  I noticed a difference after just a couple cups of this tea.  They say that when you return to work that your milk supply is bound to go down but, I think this tea has counter-acted that theory because I haven't noticed much of a difference in my milk supply since I've been back to work.  There may have been a slight decrease but, not much in my case.  This seems to be an easy option to increase your milk supply.  I'm glad I tried this tea because I did not want to have to supplement my son with formula.  The taste isn't too bad either.  It has a anise or licorice taste.  I add a little honey to it & it tastes just fine.  I don't always drink 5 cups a day of this tea but even when I don't, I still notice a difference in my supply.  I sometimes brew a couple tea bags in a mug & let it sit and get really strong before drinking it.  Seems to do the trick for me. Amazon also seems to have the best price that I could fine for the tea.
summary: An easy option to increase your milk supply

reviewText: Fenugreek, thistle seed and a cup or two of mother's milk has really done the trick.1st she was just taking the fenugreek and we noticed an increase in milk supply.2nd she was taking the fenugreek and thistle seed, again noticed an increase in milk supply3rd she had 1 cup of this tea in the morning, and one in the afternoon, in addition to the fenugreek and thistle seed and it has made a world of difference. We went from averaging 4-8oz added in the freezer each week to putting away on average 20-30oz. I can't attest to how having just mother's milk will increase milk supply but I know adding Mother's milk to her regiment added another 5-7oz a week. She feeds out son, and also pumps each day so while 3-4oz more may not seem like a lot it sure adds up. On the days when our son is going to day care, she is able to pump extra and can get 20oz (What he drinks at day care) in about 3 days. That way we don't have to take any out of the freezer when he goes to daycare.Bought the 16 box case as with anything breast milk related, you need to keep it in your system 4-7 days until you notice a difference. It was about day 5 when she told me she felt like she was pumping out more.

I went back to work a few weeks ago after having my third baby.  I am full time but only really pump 2 times a day while in the office.  Prior to starting this tea, I was getting aound 14 oz- somewhere around 7 oz each pumping session.  I was also pumping in the morning before work and getting around 5 oz if I didn't also nurse but less if I nursed (around 3 oz).  That seems good - except my baby drank 18 oz one day and she won't start solids for another 2 months at least.  So, I realized that I needed to increase my supply since I only have 30 oz stored in the freezer.  I started drinking this tea - 2-3 cups a day for the past 3 days.  Today, I pumped 4 oz in the morning (I also nursed in the morning), then 16 oz at work.  So I got a total of 20 oz in addition to nursing.I was worried about the taste, as I don't like licorice, but this tea is actually pretty tasty.  I drink it plain.

This is a review for 2 types of nursing tea - Mother's Milk and Ypgi Nursing Tea, I prefer Mother's Milk because it tastes much better and is a lot cheaper on Amazon.  I am really not sure how well either of them work - I think the extra water you drink with the tea helps too.  I also take some supplements and have tried the tincture.Mother's Milk tea seems to work pretty well although I think a lot of it has to do with drinking extra water with the tea.  It has a really great (but strong) fennel taste and has a ton of other good stuff in it.  I am not really sure how well it works, my milk supply is so variant because I am generally not a very disciplined pumper (I work A LOT as an Ob resident.)  It definitely doesn't hurt and it tastes pretty good, so it gets my vote.Yogi Nursing Tea tastes terrible, it is almost yeasty and smells aweful too.  It is also a lot more expensive.  I can't imagine that either of them actually works better than the other so I would go with the Traditional Medicinals Mother's Milk.
summary: Seems to work and tastes good (and it's cheap!)

reviewText: I bought the 6 pack and followed the direction. The tea tastes great but it didn't increase my breast milk. I didn't have any luck with this product!

reviewerName: Nicki Heskin "Editor, Early Childhood and Bre...
reviewText: Mother's Milk Tea, by Traditional Medicinals, is a common drink of nursing moms wanting to maintain a healthy milk supply. The tea relies on the herbs fennel, aniseed, and coriander, believed to increase milk production. I like that Traditional Medicinals uses organic, vegan, non-GMO, pharmacopoeial-grade herbs (at least in the organic version of the tea, which is the only one that I have seen sold for some time now).To use the tea properly, it needs to be steeped, which can be a minor inconvenience, but necessary to get the full effect. The teabag should be added to 8 oz. of boiled water and steeped covered for 10 minutes. If you plan to drink a lot of medicinal teas like this, it's probably worth investing in a teacup with a cover - otherwise, covering the cup with a flat coaster, plate or saucer works just fine. Once uncovered, it will probably take between 5 and 20 minutes before it's cool enough to drink.I think the tea is really delicious, with the caveat, that in order to enjoy it, you must like the flavor of black licorice due to the aniseed. If you don't *like* licorice, you need to at least be able to tolerate it, or you'll never get this tea down! I drink it with nothing added, but it could also be lightly sweetened with some honey or agave nectar if it's too bitter for you.So the big question is...does it work? As with anything medicinal or herbal, in the western or eastern tradition, some things will work for some and not for others. I can tell you that I personally do see a direct effect from this tea. At the beginning, I would drink a cup and quickly notice the increase. As nursing has gone on, the effect is more subtle, but definitely noticeable. I drink one cup a night simply because I believe this is a healthy herbal preparation to support milk supply, and it supports my supply through night nursing. I usually increase that to two a day while menstruating, because my supply drops slightly during that time. When my baby is sick or going through some other increased nursing period, or if I cave in to an illness and take a decongestant, I will increase it to three or more.If you are having (or think you might be having) true milk supply issues, though, this tea alone will probably not have enough of an effect to correct the problem.Amazon's subscribe and save program offers as good a price as I have seen on it anywhere.

This did nothing for me, as far as I could tell...  and I was drinking 5 bags a day.  But on the plus side, the flavor wasn't too bad - I wouldn't pick it over one of my favorite teas just for drinking, but with a little turbinado sugar and milk, it was quite tolerable - unlike some medicinal teas I've had!  I am not a fan of licorace and feared this would be nasty to drink but it wasn't bad.  Worth a shot - great if it works for you, but if it doesn't, there are other things to try.  (Motherlove tintures seemed to boost my supply very well when this tea and fenugreek capsules didn't work)
summary: Didn't work for me but worth a shot

reviewText: I think that the only reason why this works for some people is because they are adding more liquid to their diet when they add this tea.  I was already a seriously lengthy water drinker and this made no difference to my milk production.  I am convinced that my epidural screwed my chances of breastfeeding easily.  I used pumps, which obviously work better than baby... but, even then my milk wasn't what it should have been.  My mother, grandmother, and aunts were all pretty surprised at the lack of milk I was producing, considering my healthy organic lifestyle and my large water and liquid intake.Oh well.  I tried this stuff for 3 months to no avail.
summary: Sometimes it worked, sometimes it didn't.

reviewText: I didn't notice a huge increase in milk unless I drank a lot, which I think can be atrributed to more fluids going in than the ingredients themselves. The taste wasn't bad, though some co-workers didn't like the smell (liquorice like). I put a good amount of honey in it and drank it pretty hot. To me that tasted best.
summary: Taste is ok with honey, results so-so

reviewText: I'm giving it four stars instead of five because i don't like fennel or licorice, and it smells strongly of both. The taste isn't bad, i have no trouble drinking it, but i have to let it cool a fair bit so i can't smell it as much.

i have tried a few different types of milk tea and found this brand to be1. great tasting2. nicely priced3. effective - my milk definitely seemed to come in more when drinking this and as long as i continued to take it at least once or twice a day i had more milk and a better quality milk (thicker and milky instead of watery as it was before).

Everyone wants to know if it works, right?  Well for me it foes and there is one BIG BUT, you must drink a lot of it. Here's my experience.I've been using it for 5 months now, first 3 months I took it 1-2 times a day and wasn't sure if it was helping. I was also taking Fenugreek supplements but when that gave my baby gas I stopped and just stuck with the tea. I don't like any type of flavored tea and at first I was sure I'd dislike it but I actually love the flavor and it wasn't causing any harm so I kept drinking it.  Then winter came and I was cold and wanted some tea with dinner at nights. I'd take 2 tea bags put it in a big tea pot and have it at nights on top of having some in the day all of a sudden in just a few days I was in pain with oversupply. I couldn't believe it but suspected the tea. So I stopped taking it a for 2 days and noticed my supply went to back to its normal level which was always enough for my daughter.  Started taking about 4-5 tea bags again and BAM supply was  back up. I was feeding my dragsters constantly and in just 1 hour I'd be engorged again, couldn't believe what an effect the tea had.Still using and loving it today after 5 months of breastfeeding.  Would recommend to friends and family.

A friend of mine recommended this item my first month and thank goodness for getting good recommendations. First it works within a hour or so you got more milk production. I normally drink a cup towards the evening hours when I fall short.
