Also helps when you go through a milk clog and the production slows down it helps a lot to get you back to where you need to be for your baby. The milk tea as my husband describes it smells like liqurious candy and it kind a does. As a devoted tea drinker it was also nice to have something to drink besides camomile tea. So the Subscription deal comes pretty handy.

Mothers Milk tea does help me. I've noticed an increase but I have to take it consistently (two or three times a day for two or three days) and then I coast until I notice a decrease. Some women may notice an immediate change, others may notice no change. However, the taste may not be for everyone. I, for one, enjoy the taste but I also enjoy black licorice; which is what I think it tastes like.

I ordered this due to all the reviews.  I tried the women's formula first but was not thrilled with the taste.  This has helped my menstrual cycle.  I started getting very heavy periods and this helped them normalize.  I try to drink at least one cup a day.  I really like the Traditional Medicinal tea.

After lots of research about the appropriate time to start drinking raspberry leaf tea during pregnancy, at 32 weeks I started drinking one cup a day. Gradually I increased it to 2 cups, and at the end of my pregnancy I was drinking 4 cups a day. I actually reused teabags to make 2 cups with each bag which was perfectly fine. Sometimes I drank it hot and other times cold and sweetened with stevia.I give it such a glowing recommendation because of my quick labor. My doctor had threatened to induce me if my baby wasn't due by her due date, and I ended up going into labor 3 days before my due date. My labor was fast, fast, fast!!! From the time contractions started until my baby was born it was 5 hours, and though contractions were painful, my labor was efficient and I credit a lot to this tea! I also drank it for a few days after my baby was born (until I ran out) because I read that it can help for your uterus to shrink back to regular size faster.I will definitely be drinking this tea during my next pregnancy!
summary: Fantastic during 3rd trimester of pregnancy! Would absolutely recommend!

reviewText: This has a bit more bitter taste than other raspberry teas that I've tried but overall satisfied with performance and would buy again for a good price.

I drink this tea because it is supposed to be great to boost the female reproductive system.  I drink it daily with no sweetener and I really like it.  I haven't noticed any huge differences with my hormones or cramps yet but I think I will keep drinking this tea for a long time.  I have heard it is also good for strengthening the uterus during pregnancy (but I think you are supposed to be careful and maybe wait until the 2nd trimester to drink it).  Check out MamaNatural for more info on that topic.

This tea is so much like black tea.  I'm pregnant now and drink 2-4 tea bags a day.  I'll use two tea bags per cup for a nice, strong cup of tea.  I do add milk and a little sugar.  It reminds me of a nice cup of black tea.  A great alternative if you are trying to avoid caffeine.  I'm pretty sure that adding milk and sugar takes away from the medicinal benefits, so I do drink it plain once and a while, but as far as it goes I'm sure it is much more healthy than black tea.  It's nice to be able to enjoy simple pleasures--guilt free (or nearly!) while pregnant!Oh, and I almost forgot.  I purchase this from Amazon.com via subscribe and save.  It costs less than half as much per box compared to what I was paying for it in the store.  This enables me to drink up to 4 tea bags worth of tea daily without breaking the bank.
I drink this everyday.  Though not as bitter as black coffee/tea I still like steeping a Chamomile or Spearmint/Peppermint tea bag with it.  It's great to feel better and stay well.
Very good Traditional Medicinals Organic, Raspberry Leaf Tea, 16-Count Boxes. very good price for the amount. Will definitely buy again.
summary: Traditional Medicinals Organic, Raspberry Leaf, 16-Count Boxes

reviewText: Love this brand and type of tea.  Use it for breast milk support and well women support.  It's a treat to drink with a little honey.  :)

I have a long history (if not a bit sporadic at times) of a variety of herbal use over the years & I remember squeezing my face in a grimace when I had to take certain ones, such as dong quai or some herbal tea that was deathly bitter & vapid.I drank Red Raspberry Leaf tea in my 20's & liked the mellow flavor so much that I continued to drink it for several years. I found it not to be bitter or strong but also not weak & didn't have a foul aroma. Overall a very pleasant & enjoyable herbal tea, even if I don't remember why I was taking it back then (maybe for menstrual cramps?). Well nothing ever aleviated my menstrual cramps except pain killers, but I would drink this tea again just for the enjoyment of it. I'm currently on green tea for the past number of years & I'm tired of the bitterness (albeit it's excellent in antioxidants, which is why I'm drinking it).I don't find Red Raspberry Leaf to be dark like black tea but more like a urine-yellow color (medium to deep yellow, depending on steep timing), similar to green tea. Generally I drank it plain with a little sweetener, though it was pleasant enough to take without any sweetener.

I drink this tea whenever I have severe cramps during my cycle. I am yet to find out Raspberry Leaf's mechanism of action but it helps a lot with my cramps, two tea bags in an 8oz cup of hot water and I am a happy girl ;-). The tea came in good condition and I got the 6 tea bags for a good price.

I've always had about a cup a day. Personally, I found that this helped reduce the cramping and intensity menstrual cycle. After losing a lot of weight that needed to be lost and starting my raspberry leaf cup of tea a day habit , I became pregnant after eight to nine years of absolutely nothing after a bad miscarriage. I'm sure the weight loss helped immensely, but considering what the tea did for my menstrual cycle beforehand, I'm sure it played a part ; however small.

I was sick for a period of time when someone suggested this to me.It was better than the hot toddy drinks I made.They have a strong taste of licorice and I thought I would not like it, but ... I was wrong.

This tea has a delightful flavor. Lightly sweet and just lemony enough to be refreshing. I added a little bit of honey and it was like candy. Despite being scrumptious I feel no effect on the soreness of my throat. I spent time with my boyfriend over the weekend and apparently caught whatever bug he was carrying. He's been home sick with a fever and sore throat for two days and my symptoms have just started. I was hoping to head off this cold at the pass by loading up on some herbal teas (which usually does the trick) but I'm half way through my second consecutive cup with no change what-so-ever. I may just have a super bug that requires something stronger than tea but I was hoping for at least SOME improvement. Back to Halls it is!

I have a respiratory infection, my throat has been sore and I lost my voice.  Drinking this tea has decreased the soreness of my throat, and my voice is slowly coming back.  It works better and tastes better than the Yogi Throat Comfort.  I will keep a box at home and work.
summary: Throat Coat is a throat saver

reviewText: My ENT Doc recommended this to me for my "Dry Mouth" condition which is the result of Radiation treatment of my throat. I bought this and the other variety, "Organic Throat Coat". The other tea worked wonders, this had no affect on the Dry Mouth or the sore throat that I also have as a side effect.
Pros: Couging a lot? This helps to calm the cough and perhaps the moisture is a bit of an expectorant... Works well for me.Great flavor with the lemon, don't have to add anything.Cons: Cost?

I talk on the phone all day long on my internet/phone sales job.  Calls back to back were leaving me hoarse and coughing.  Throat Coat tea came just in time to save my voice.  I keep my tea cup sitting on a cup heater on my desk.  It's really a must have for my job.

This tea is nice.  It is relaxing but will not put you to sleep.  I wish it were a little more relaxing like kava kava tea but it is nice tea.  I like this company, I have a few of their other teas.  This is a good price.
This is the perfect tea for a cold winter night.  I love to have it before going to bed.  I purchased several Traditional medicinals after reading Food Babe's report on tea.
This is amazing tea. I drink it most every night. I also add this to gift baskets I make when my friends are stressed out. It's yummy and makes a great gift.

been taking this for years. helps when detoxing from anything. helps to calm nerves. it helps get you to sleep but it's not as good as melatonin. . let is steep for ten minutes, you can drink it every day with no side effects. never had any problems with it. taste is sort of minty nothing special but i just use it medicinally.  also good for pms cramps.

Soothing, tasty. Both the aroma & flavor are very good. It has a "sweet minty flavor" that is not overpowering. Definitely relaxes me.Too much mint and other potent herbs can flair up my reflux. Having GERD, i need to be careful about that and with this tea I don't notice any problems in that way.I have been a huge Yogi tea fan for years, but i don't i don't think their stress relief tea is as effective as this brand's.  This is my go-to.

I made a container of tea to ice, with this.  It's a wonderful little treat in the afternoon - relaxing and tasty.  The only problem?  I have a new 12 week old Siamese kitten and she thinks it's for her!

I bought this locally and had a cup tonight.....I found that it did indeed relax me, so that impressed me immediately!  Sadly, though, I must be allergic to one or more ingredients as i began feeling some mild wheezing and had to take an allergy pill.  I think it may be the lavender but I'm not sure if it is anything more.  If you have seasonal allergies, be careful with the herbs that are in the same family as seasonal weeds.  I wish I wasn't allergic...it seems like an awesome blend.
I started drinking this because I was told it would help me get well.Well, it may have made me well but I discovered I like drinking it.  It is a comforting relaxing hot beverage.

I got this becuase it didn't have peppermint and also becuase it has green tea.  I like tea, but I need my caffeine pick me up and this tea has both the herbal component and the green tea.  It is very tasty.
summary: Great taste, with echinacea and green tea

reviewText: There's a lot of talk about echinacea being a lot of hooey when it comes to helping cure or reduce a cold and it's probably true, except this tea contains a lot of organic kombucha, spearmint leaf, lemongrass as well as green tea -- in addition to echinacea, with a nice tangerine tang to it, so you really feel you're getting relief for your cold with this tea. You don't have to rely upon the mythical effects of echinacea to receive benefits from this tea and enjoy it.And it is enjoyable to sip and it's sumptuous when raw unfiltered honey is added to it.It smells and tastes good and it warms the throat like a good brandy. I really do feel that it supports the immune system.The only problem I have with this tea is the Yogi tea company that provides the product. It thinks extortion is somehow proper, so it colludes with the kosher mafia to put a damn "U" with a circle around it as a symbol on the box, an icon the cost for which is passed off onto the unsuspecting consumer in order to support an organization of rabbis who also do not provide a health service to the individual consumer. That's really a raw deal for us. This costly symbol conveys no help benefits and simply comprises an involuntary kosher tax.Non-Jewish Americans need no rabbi's ratings.  This company needs to find a better way. Maybe put a "W" for White people or a "C" for Christians. And an "M" for Muslims. And get other races and other religions to pay for the symbol. Until then, only  a boycott will fix the problem.Check out double you double you double you dot checkthelabel dot com dot uk
summary: There Ought To Be No "U" (or "K") in Yogi

reviewerName: Kimberly J. Karas "a New England mom"
reviewText: I am nuts about tea.  I drink it morning, noon and night and currently have about ten varieties including this one.  I bought it because I wanted something with Echinacea.  It tastes great and I am glad I have a good supply of six boxes.  It's nice with a little honey also.
summary: Happy addition to my tea stash

reviewText: This is a great tea to sip during the cold season. The taste is very mild and soothing with an uplifting spearmint flavor. The caffeine content of this tea is only about 29mg as compared to 90mg in a cup of coffee, so it won't keep you up at night if you drink it in the evening. I usually drink about 3-5 cups a day when I feel a cold coming on and I swear it keeps me from getting sick.

I am very pleased with the quality of this herbal tea.  In my opinion, there is nothing that even compares to this tea as far as quality, taste, and benefits enjoyed. I like ordering this by the 6-pack from Amazon because it is more economical than buying it a pack at a time from the local health food store.
This is a nice tea.  Not bitter, I don't need any honey or sweetner at all.  I'll be getting more of this for sure.

Yogi Kava Stress Relief is one of the best relaxation teas on the market. It's a three-way with kava,Alvita Herbal Teas, Valerian Mint (Peppermint), 24-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)andCelestial Seasonings Herb Tea, Sleepytime, 40-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6). Valerian, kava, and chamomile are natural stress relievers and relaxants. I was first introduced to kava kava tea in New Mexico, when a hippie was carting it around the dorms. It looked like dirty water, and he gushed about its healing properties. Kava is traditionally served in the Pacific/Oceania, so drinking this is perfectly accompanied bySouth Pacific Islands.Kava Kava Stress Relief has a pleasant, spicy cinnamon flavor slightly sweetened with stevia. It has the flavor of a black tea, not so much as an Earl Grey but a Hippie Grey. It's almost like chai... but more relaxing. Chai tends to be caffeinated, after all! Kava is reverse caffeine. With the second cup, one's lips might feel slightly numb. Kava is NOT to be combined with alcohol. Be careful when you're drinking it. The warning label is there for a reason. Kava is STRONG. It is NOT FOR THE WEAK. Kava is a delicious Pacific cup for a pacific sleep.

This is by far my favorate tea!! I love it- the taste is amazing and it does calm you down- I would love to have it in pill form for emergencies :) EVERYONE I shared this with LOVED it and they all have different tastes in tea- some don't even like tea..

Because I believed the other reviewers claiming it was week and because I wanted a good nights sleep I put 2 bags in 1.5 cups of boiling water.  Added a lil sugar and when it cooled I sipped it - it smelled the whole kitchen up like cinnamon and spice - so whoever thinks this stuff is week is smoking crack!  I had to add another half cup of water just to drink it and yes I did get a slight tingle on my tounge.  Not sure if it helped me sleep or not. I used to drink Cammomile teas and have several I LOVE - but I finally found out that it was causing an allergy issue because I'm allergic to Ragweed (which almost everyone is) - and Cammomile is related - so I switched to Kava.  I made another cup tonight - 1 tea bag and it was much better - A lil spicy for me so I gave it 4 stars - I'm not a BIG tea drinker - only for medicinal purposes lol - so don't go by my judgement - but trust me it is strong. I'm going to try a few other sleep tea's that don't have cammomile in them - so while looking I felt I should set the record straight on this one's strength.
summary: Don't believe the reveiws that claim its week. Very Cinnamony flavor and 2 teabags in 1 cup was WAY TOO STRONG

reviewText: I would not wait to get home to try this tea. I've been researching herbal remedies and read about Kavas' anti-anxiolytic properties and thought I'd give it a shot. As one reviewer stated, it does remind me of drinking a coffee cake. It has a nice nutty/spice scent that goes wonderfully with the holiday season. I feel so cozy and wrapped in blanket, I kinda want to lie down and read. Very relaxing :)
works well, but has only a small amount of kava. for the full effect, use 2 tea bags. the aftertaste is horrible but it is better when mixed with a little honey or ginger.

This tea has a very strong taste, but is a very nice blend of spices. My boyfriend who suffers from anxiety problems drinks this before bed, it seems to help him slighlty.  Either way, we both enjoy the taste of the tea itself.
I drink all types of teas, but this is one of the worst tasting teas, in my opinion.

I enjoy many teas and Kava is one of my favorites.  It has a pleasant taste and it actually sweet so you don't need to add anything to it.  It does have a nice calming effect which is also nice at times.

I discovered this in my basket as I was checking out at the store.  It seems one of my little darlings saw this and thought he would help mommy.  The ingredients were acceptable so I tried it.  I love it.  It tasted great and I have started sleeping through the night.

This stuff is pure bliss. I am able to focus in the games I play with significantly less frustration. When somebody is verbally harassing me, it hardly bothers me.It smells amazing and tastes amazing. Licorice root is my favorite.

I love Kava tea by Yogi. I used to purchase this in the local health food store, but they stopped carrying it after negative publicity of possible liver problems from Kava. I was pleased to find it on Amazon. Free shipping and the discount for "subscribing" makes it a deal too good to pass up.As far as the product itself, I love the taste of this Kava tea. I have a cup in the evening, and it is really soothing and relaxing. I could not imagine winding down in the evening without this tea.

I LOVE the fact that Yogi did NOT add any type of mint herb again which just makes it taste bitter and makes me think i'm drinking wrigley's mint chewing gum rather than a tasty mild herbal drink.  I like the malted, carob creamy taste with pleasantly fragrant sarsparilla, cinnamon and ginger and hazelnut flavoring.I usually use rooibos tea for my anxiety to calm my nerves but when I saw this at my local Safeway and saw the ingredients, I knew I had to try it. It IS very calming such that I'm not so nervous or anxious and I can actually sleep well at night.  The kava root in it helps me think more clearly and less anxiously.  Usually, I use yerba mate for stress, but this tea does a great job helping me with stress as well as tastes much better than bitter yerba mate.I usually make an herbal concoction iced drink of rooibosDavidson's Organic Tea South African Rooibos, 100-Count Tea Bags(high # of teabags for the price) orTwinings Rooibos Organic, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6 )(great taste for the price) and this tea, andJoint Flexor Herbal Teato maintain my joints against arthritis, hawthornTraditional Medicinals Heart Tea with Hawthorn, 16-Count Tea Bags, 1.13 oz,  (Pack of 6)also to help stabilize against arthritis as well as help with my body's blood circulation, and bilberry herbs for better vision and lately, passionflower tea for a more relaxed mood,Tadin Tea, Pasiflora (Passion Flower) Tea, 24-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 12).  I'll make a large quantity of this drink each morning, cool it in the refrigerator, maybe add organic raw honeyHeavenly Organics Organic Wild Forest Raw Honey Unheated -- 12 ozwhen the tea cools (heat inactivates honey enzymes), and when I come home in the afternoon or night, I've got an instant healthy cold refreshing drink without needing to resort to unhealthy acidy oversugared soda or corn fructose drinks.  The concoction has helped me resist serious sneezing allergies and I get less colds and they're less severe than usual as well as help me with my anxiety.However, because the kava kava is very strong and potent (and too much can toxify the liver), I only add it to my concoction a couple of times a week.  Rooibos is a lot less strong and doesn't get my mind as cloudy as adding the kava kava.Note: if you have any loose herbs, muslin bags such asCotton Muslin Bags 4x6 Inches 25 Count Packare great to pack them in wihout having to deal with trying to remove loose herbs in your teas.
summary: TASTY and a truly calming to my nerves!!

reviewText: I love this stuff. Tastes great, I find it calming. I offer it to guests who have given it positive reviews as well. Yogi makes great teas and this is one of my favorites.

When it comes to tea, I really can't get enough flavor. I love the various spices, so I was thrilled when I found this tea. It is intensely ginger, but also amped up with several other spices (Ginger Root, Lemongrass, Licorice Root, Peppermint Leaf, Black Pepper). Trust me, it isn't for the faint of heart.Though there are only 16 bags (less than the usual 20 for most brands) per box, each bag lasts two full (large) mugs without becoming weak. So I find it worth the money. Though I frequently buy tea on Amazon, I actually buy the Yogi Ginger tea from Trader Joe's as it is typically quite a bit less expensive there ($2.29 in my area at this time).

yeah yeah...it says it's ginger so why hold back stars for strong taste?...because it's a biting, bitter ginger taste. I have to brew it w/add'l tea bag of other flavor to lighten the intensity...but w/theYogi Stomach Ease, Herbal Tea Supplement, 16-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)orOrganic Chamomile Tea 16 Bags(chamomile is more bland than stomach ease) the ginger is tolerable.Ginger DOES work for nausea but a quicker, less offensive relief can be had when eating a small piece of dried (sugared?) ginger. The tea I use for maintenance for a particular problem.
summary: Works good w/nausea but strong ginger taste

reviewText: Yogi Ginger Tea is great for soothing stomachaches, but I can't say much about the taste. Pepper is the overwhelming flavor in this tea, and I wish the tea were sweeter. It tastes exactly as if you soaked ginger slices in water.
I love the ginger taste so I may biased towards this product. I usually let it steep for 7-10 minutes and drink it. It does help digestion a lot!!!!

After reading some of the reviews here, I decided to try a single box from the grocery store before investing in 6 boxes of 16 bags.  Next time, I'll buy in bulk!  I love ginger, and find that I don't need to sweeten this tea (unusual for me).  I don't find it intense, as some reviewers do; but if I did, it would be easy to tone it down by simply adding additional water or steeping for less time.  This delicious tea, which incidentally soothes my persistent heartburn, has become a nightly routine for me.

My husband always prefers to make fresh ginger tea by boiling fresh ginger in water. Yogi Ginger Tea is the next best thing to that and I like to pack a few with us while we travel and take it with me to work.

Based on the name of the product, I was under the impression that the tea bags contained ginger root.  Period.  It turns out, however, that they also contain lemongrass, licorice root, peppermint leaf, and black pepper.  I still like the tea, but I would have liked to know before buying it that it contained ingredients aside from ginger root.
summary: Good tea...but more than just ginger

reviewText: This is my favorite Yogi tea so far. I've tried two of the detoxes and the Relaxation one. I've also tried other ginger teas. But I always come back to Yogi Ginger. (Twinnings has a good one too but I can never find it).I love this tea. It's gingery, spicy, and sweet with a hint of other complementary herbs. This tea is so relaxing and soothes my stomach after not-so-great menu choices. I love ginger so I like to let it steep for a long time with hot hot water to get it extra spicy. It can also be made for very light and delicate flavor if that is what you like. Just adjust the steeping time.Ginger is good for the body but I don't always have time to buy and boil fresh ginger to make myself tea that way. And honestly I'll only take time to do that when I'm sick. Also, I doubt anyone wants to bring a bag of fresh ginger root to work to make tea at the office. So this tea is perfect. It has great flavor--you can really taste the ginger. It's totally portable so it nice way to get my ginger any time, any where.Try it. If you're not sure whether you'll like it or not, try steeping it for only a short while and gradually amping it up until you decide how intense you like to take your ginger tea.

This is the best ginger tea I have ever had.  The ingredients are very fresh.  It is a wonderful addition to my collection of Yogi teas.This is not a bland or tasteless tea.  If you don't care for strong ginger, I suggest adding only one tea bag to a large tea cup and giving it less time to brew.  This tea is invigorating...not a tea to drink right before bed as it perks you up.

I was looking for a strong ginger tea and purchased the Yogi brand based on its reputation. I am certain Yogi offers many delicious teas; however, I just don't like the taste of this one. It tastes of licorice and just feels murky in my mouth. I have a hard time getting it down and can't taste the ginger unless I let the bag sit in the cup for a long period of time. The spicy kick of ginger I sought was totally lacking. Unfortunately, I purchased two boxes at a time. It's going to take a while to get it all down, but I guess I will eventually do so.-Update: 5/17/13 - Generally I drink my teas unsweetened, which resulted in my atrocious experiences with this particular tea. Since I had such a good quantity in supply and couldn't bear to throw it all away, I made a cup today sweetened with Splenda. That made a mountain of difference. I still won't say it is my favorite tea, but the sweetness took the disgusting edge off what I found initially unpalatable and nauseating. Although it was my intent to steer clear of artificial sweeteners, it's what's available at work. Now, I can give the tea an extra star!
summary: Don't Like it, Not What I Expected at All...

reviewText: I drink this every day.  My ayurvedic teacher recommended it.  One small teaspoon of raw honey and it's the perfect tonic for whatever ails, or doesn't ail, you.  Yogi teas are always good.

*****This Organic Ginger Tea from Yogi Tea is ideal as a digestive aid, and it also purportedly enhances circulation. It's a lovely, intense, all natural herbal tea made from organic ginger root, organic lemon grass, orgnaic licorice root, organic peppermint leaf, and organic black pepper. The taste is exactly like ginger, spicy and peppery, with sweet overtones. It's very nice anytime, but especially after a meal.Note that this review is for the six pack of Organic Ginger Teas, an amazing savings on Amazon by buying in bulk!I am definitely impressed with this tea and with Yogi Teas in general. Ginger Organic Tea comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site has a helpful glossary of tea ingredients and is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.Yogi Tea writes this on the box about the tea's benefits: "Our 100% Organic Ginger tea has something to offer to anyone who wants to get or stay healthy. For millennia, herbalists from all over the world have known of the healing, soothing and energizing qualities of this root, considered the "universal medicine."  Organic Ginger (Zingiber officinale) has been used worldwide as a safe and mild home remedy for a variety of conditions, including motion sickness, occasional upset stomach and intestinal gas, as well as minor menstrual cramps. Ayurvedic practitioners have used Ginger for years as a way of activating the body's fire element (Agni), which burns up Ama (the body's toxins, comprised of both undigested food and naturally occurring toxins). When Ama is decreased, the body gains strength, balance and harmony. As a natural warming energizer, Ginger is also known to support the immune system, promote rapid and complete digestion and increase intestinal tone and peristalsis.  Furthermore, it works as an antioxidant and has been shown to safely and effectively relieve nausea associated with motion. Our 100% Organic Ginger tea tastes delicious and provides the highest quality of a timeless remedy."There is a warning on the box that if you have indigestion or heartburn that persists you should see a doctor. There are no other cautions or warnings on the box except the standard disclaimer that the tea is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.Highly recommended.*****
summary: Intense Ginger Experience and Digestive Aid

reviewText: I use this as an additive to green tea or oolong.  It's a soothing addition that takes it up a notch.
I have tried both Ginger and Lemon Ginger teas and my favorite is Lemon Ginger.
summary: Lemon ginger taste is much more nicer

reviewText: I love all things ginger, so my opinion may be a bit biased. Fresh ginger is a favorite of mine because of the spicy, astringent bite it has. This tea reminds me of that, although the spicy bite is probably due to the black pepper added. I've tried other ginger teas, lemon ginger teas, green ginger teas - they all seem to have a dry/dull ginger flavor, and I always come back to this one. I love this tea with a dash of honey. It's sweet and spicy and gingery goodness.

I know what Ginger tastes like and this is NOT Ginger. The only things I found pleasant about this tea is that it came in a beautiful box and the individual packs were nicely packaged, I don't care whether this is organic or not, the flavor of Ginger is absolutely absent. If you appreciate the aroma and strong flavor of good cup of Ginger tea then try "Prince of Peace" Honey Ginger Crystals. The aroma lights up the room, the flavor is strong and authentic and since they are crystals, there are no tea bags to deal with and the result is a good clean cup of genuine Ginger tea.

Not bad taste, I just wish it was mor gingery. You can taste the heat which I think is from the black pepper. A little disappointed but I have 6 boxes to get through! I should have tried a pack before I bought bulk. Ugh
summary: I wish you could taste more ginger

reviewText: Yogi brand Ginger tea has the spice and zip of a true and flavorful ginger tea. It has a sharp pepper kick that I love. No weakness with this tea. I trusted the reviews on this tea and they were accurate. I've mixed the Yogi Peppermint and Ginger together and they go great together.
Yogi Ginger Tea is the best tea ever made. Drink a lot of this on a daily basis so the great pricing on here is important. Too expensive to buy locally.

I tried different ginger herbal tea brands but came back immediately to the Yogi one. Its taste is un-comparable because in fact it contains other very interesting herbs (peppermint/licorice/lemongrass) which makes it not so spicy as if it were pure ginger. I take this tea mostly for its digestive function and cannot start my day without my cup of hot and delicious ginger herbal tea ! It "cleans up" my digestive track.Should you have any digestive issues during the day, take a cup and you will see how effective it is as long of course as you do NOT add any sugar or syrup or milk in this tea. And we are talking about the herbal ginger tea, not a black tea which has ginger in it.
summary: My truly favorite ginger herbal tea

reviewText: Tummy troubles?  This tea is a pleasant tasting way to settle things down. And it's organic and a good value.

I discovered this product a couple of years ago and I've been hooked.  I get the worst cramps every month, so bad that I have to take advil even though I hate taking anything for pain.As long as I start drinking this tea 3-4 days before my period, all is good!  My period arrives on time and the pain is gone or tolerable enough that I don't have to take advil.  I go through a whole box that time of the month b/c you have to drink it all day for a few days before/during your period to make sure you stay ahead of the pain.If you get horrible PMS, bloating, cramps or headaches before/during your period, I highly recommend you try this product before taking pain killers.

The older I get the more painful my periods are with severe cramping and bloating. I love drinking tea when I'm at work so I thought I'd give this a try and I haven't noticed a change in my cramping/bloating. The taste isn't "bad" but it's not "good" either. Basically, what I mean is it's not bad-tasting but I'd only drink it if it worked well. Some people said they started taking it days before their period and it helped so maybe that's what you need to do. I only drank it during my period. Everyday of it; and I didn't notice a difference.

I used to take the maximum dosage of naproxen and/or ibuprofen to deal with terrible menstrual cramps and associated backache. Despite the medication, there were many months that I'd be writhing on the floor in terrible pain. When the pain was at it worst, I couldn't even keep down pills. Hot baths were the only thing that would make the pain more tolerable but as much as I would've loved to, I couldn't just stay in the bath tub all day.I start drinking this tea when I start PMSing--snapping at people over nothing and just generally being grouchy. Just a cup or two a day is enough to calm my mood. As soon as my period starts I brew a double bag cup, and then single bag cups throughout the day. I frequently reuse the tea bags too. On the first and second days of my period, I probably drink 4-6 cups of tea a day. Keeps me pain-free or very close to it and hydrated as a bonus.I have found that plain chamomile, which is an ingredient in this tea, also works extremely well for menstrual cramps but causes more drowsiness and doesn't help with mood or heavy bleeding as much.If you want to get off of pharmaceuticals and try a natural approach, this tea is excellent and very effective. I like the taste and don't usually add any sweetener.

I've been taking this tea on and off for the past 6 months. If I don't take this tea I'm irritable, have severe mood swings, cramps and sometimes even fever during the days leading up to my cycle. Taking this tea daily 1 1/2 weeks before my scheduled time eliminates the moods, the headache/fever, the cramps, everything! It also helps in the cleansing process itself. No side effects and no harm to your system make this tea a MUST. I'm buying another box :)

I don't know how this tea can be sooo amazing, I use to experience a lot of cramps when I get the period and I alway have to take the day off from work. But no more, this tea make me feel so energetic and great

This herbal tea is huge aid in reducing symptoms of pms.  I started using this years ago and was buying it from the local health food store for about five dollars per box.  I used it a week before my cycle and then every day during.  It made an immediate and very noticeable improvement.  My husband bought it for me when I started running low.  He noticed that I wasn't the witch I used to be when I drank the tea.  I make sure to keep this stuff on hand all of the time now.  Another thing I also drink is fresh lemon balm tea which also helps very much.

I must say that for prepackaged tea, Yogi Tea is my favorite tea.  High quality ingredients, unique flavor blends, that seem to offer some aide.  While I personally prefer Calming or their Bedtime tea to the Woman's Moon Cycle, I must say that drinking this tea does help lift the spirit.  I do like the flavors better of Calming and Bedtime, but this has an execellent flavor as well.
I suggest starting this tea a few days before your cycle, and continue a few days afterward. The taste is not awesome, but it did seem to help.

I bought this tea because of the wonderful reviews on Amazon.  I love reading up before purchasing.  I tried it from my local health food store first to make sure I liked the taste.  I really enjoyed it so I purchased from Amazon when I couldn't find it at the stores.  Imagine my surprise that it was cheaper to purchase it off amazon.  This is not always the case but happily for me this time it worked out.  I got six boxes so I can clean my liver to my hearts content!

I know several people find this stuff to be unbearable without some type of sweetener, but I drink it straight.  Occasionally, I'll add a half packet of stevia, but I'm not one for super-sweet stuff anyway.  I think this is a really great tea for liver health.  I don't have many digestive issues, but I notice even less of a problem when I drink this regularly.
This stuff works to get rid of bloating but the taste is horrible. It is very bitter so I would use stevia or honey to help with the taste.
I like it.  The nuttiness comes through the most.  You don't need cream with this, as it is mild.  It is a good substitute for coffee.
summary: Has a nice nutty sweet flavor

reviewText: I love this roasted flavor. It helps me to reduce coffee cravings. I never get tired of this taste, so I'm glad that I can purchase this in bulk on Amazon. My wife had this during her pregnancy and while she was breastfeeding.  She loves it so much that she still drinks it. Although this is a good coffee alternative, I still drink coffee every now and then.  I still love coffee:)
summary: I don't get tired of it

reviewText: I originally got this tea as it was recommended as a helpful liver tonic.  With the thought of dandelion, I imagined a bitter tea but was pleasantly surprised at its nice light, toasted flavor.  It is almost like a roasted barley tea.  I drink this everyday now in place of plain water.  The price on Amazon was almost half of what I purchased it at the grocery store.

For those of you that have never tried dandelion tea, it's very very bitter.  It's not something you drink to relax and enjoy.  However, the health effects can't be overemphasized.  This is very soothing to the stomach and cleansing.
I really enjoy this tea.  Odd, but does have a coffee flavor.  That's OK with me as I am a coffee lover.

In all fairness and full disclosure, I've never tried dandelion root tea before this, so I have no basis for comparison. That being said, this stuff is delicious! Has a very mild, smooth, faintly sweet nutty taste (which I assume is from the roasting of the root); pleasant and totally calming. Especially tasty when steeped together w/kukicha twig tea. In Ayurvedic and Chinese medicine, dandelion root is often used to purify the blood and soothe indigestion. There's also some evidence pointing to its effectiveness in helping treat hypoglycemia and hypertension. But therapeutic applications aside, I really love this tea and will definitely be buying more.

Treating gallstones and no longer drink soda or coffee or regular tea. I buy this by the case. drink it room temp all during the day. Probably drink more of this than water. My integrative dietitian likes this product as well. No surgery for this customer...lol..
I liked this tea because it is good to help your liver and I used this in my tea diet and contiue to use it

I have this every morning with a few ounces of Silk Organic Soymilk added.  It makes a nice "latte" substitute and is reported to lower uric acid in the blood that can lead to painful arthritis.  Gout runs in my family so a little prevention goes far!

In researching dandelion root, I came across a lot of different, sometimes contradictory claims, none of which seem to be backed up by any serious research. I believe it does have a diuretic and possibly laxative effect, and it is supposedly good for the liver. Again, those claims may be dubious, but I could see this as a good coffee substitute if you had to cut down for some reason (caffeine, acid). It tasted terrible to me at first, but after about 4 cups I really started to like it. I brew it with two teabags and steep for 15 minutes. Now it basically tastes like coffee to me (note that I'm more of a tea drinker, however).
summary: Taste really does grow on you

reviewText: I like earthy wines and the grassy tasting teas and this is a good fit for me. I didn't find it bitter at all but a little earthy for some.

I drink this tea twice a day for it's benefits. I just drink it straight with nothing added and I actually enjoy it! With this and my breakfast smoothie, I no longer drink coffee.  And best of all, with this tea and my twice dailyBragg Apple Cider Vinegar Organic Raw -- 32 fl oz, I have no more inflammation in my body!! I always had inflammation, especially abdominal, and I'm so amazed at how great life is without inflammation. The combination of those two products has also helped my whole gastro-intestinal environment as well as peristalsis, I am so pleased!
I like it alot but be VERY careful if you have hypoglycemia (low blood sugar).  This can make is worse and leave you wondering why you're blood sugar is a mess.

I was looking for tea to get me off of my highly caffeinated ones.  I saw this on sale at a decent price at my local grocery and decided to give it a whirl it was so cheap.  I really liked it.  I don't have any liver problems but I'm sure my liver could use a good cleaning.  My health conscious friend kept telling me I need to eat foods or do a cleanse that releases the bile of the liver so I don't get a liver stone build-up.  I told him I was drinking this tea and he said it's a start.  I did the subscribe 'n' save to save a little on the bulk teas.  Also the directions on the box say to use it for 4 - 6 weeks and you can't do that drinking it 3 times a day with just one box.  Amazon has a good deal here.
I drink this tea daily, and it's great. I feel like my body is being cleansed, and it is refreshing and light…

Good for your liver. My past couple blood tests for my physicals were showing borderline elevated levels of liver enzymes and CRP, so I was in search for some natural cleansing remedies. I believe this tea helped me. I have not yet recieved another blood test to confirm, but I do feel more energy at work. Whether or not its psychological, it works in my favor. As for CRP levels, it was a sign of inflammation in the body and I knew exactly where the pain was (my hands and feet). I have also been drinking Moringa tea (also recommended) but as far as I know the painful inflammation is almost gone. Before the tea, I was using prescription anti-inflammatory painkillers but now have put a hold on the medicine since I am feeling better. Was it the tea? Maybe, but the good part is that I'm not relying on meds. Only time will tell, but for those in doubt, this is a tea very well worth the investment if you are looking for a natural remedy of sorts.The taste and aroma is best described as nutty, kind of like roasted peanut brittle with hints of tahini or sesame. What I like about this tea is that the longer you let it brew the more robust the flavor and nutrients extracted. This way, I can just leave the tea bag in the kettle as I boil the water and also in my tea pot, unlike other teas like green tea which gets real bitter if you steep it too long.UPDATE 3.29.2012 ***********Since my first purchase, I have tried another brand,Alvita Tea Bags, Dandelion Root (Roasted), Caffeine Free, 30 tea bags (Pack of 3)and have found Traditional Medicinals better to my liking. It provides a more richer flavor and a smoother aftertaste in my experience. Plus, each tea bag is individually wrapped for freshness and includes the draw string.I find the best time to enjoy this tea is early in the day. The bold, robust flavor of this tea seems to trick my body into thinking its coffee. I can drink to my heart's desire (or perhaps liver) and not have to worry about caffeine. It's a greay way to get that invigorating fresh brew without the jitters.

Tried my first cup today and would like to point out what is noted on the package: Dandelion teas should be used for periods of up to 4-6 weeks, followed by a break before resuming.I urge anyone considering Dandelion tea to do their own research. It's easy to do and you can make your own informaed decision. I will say Dandelion tea has excellent health benefits and good for many ailments. I am not a physician so can only speak for myself. I started drinking a high quality loose dandelion which was very tasty and provided the benefits it claimed. All that aside, secondarily I would like to take a break from coffee and as a java junkie I was pleasantly surprised by my first cup today. I take low fat low sugar in my strong dark roast but this only needs a packet of stevia and no cream. It tastes like a weak coffee. It also smells like coffee! This may well help me take a real break from coffee. With all its health benefits it's worth learning to love this for anyone needing it for good health. Enjoy~Update: I've been drinking this tea 3x day and I absolutely love it. I am  a big coffee drinker even though I only drink coffee before 11am.  I've tried the other brand of roasted dandelion and there is no comparison. This brand is the tastiest and I love the smokey flavor. If you have HBP that has no relatable cause and is being managed by a prescription diuretic, ask your doc if you can try this for 2-3 weeks. I refused a prescription and tried this and it works amazingly well for me. Has several amazing health benefits so a real no-brainer for me and a fortunate find.
The tea is similar to  coffee flavor but not as good as the real cup of coffee.  I like the benefits of drinking the tea because I do feel better.

This is a mild-tasting tea (not bitter as stated on package) whichstimulated my digestion the 1st time I drank it. However effect lessensover time. Another reviewer said it tastes like coffee but mine was muchweaker. I won't purchase dandelion tea again as switched to BRAGG ACV forits cleansing properties. Plus ACV is cheaper and is a product of USA.
summary: stimulated liver 1st time I took it

reviewText: Dandelion root is supposed to be good for your digestion, and act as a natural dietetic.  By itself, Dandelion Root is almost too earthy for my tastes.  I try to mix up my teas, to add variety.  I like mixing this with Rooibos and/or Decaf Green Tea, honey and a dash of cinnamon.
summary: Healthy alternative to add variety to your tea-drinking.

reviewText: I have at least one cup of this every day.. Someone said it would help clean out your liver.. I hope so, though I do not know.. But, on faith, I am trying it.. And, so far, so good, no issues.. But, what is an issue is that I have to plan further ahead.. The brewing time for a bag of this is fifteen minutes.. So, if you are interested, I think this is a good choice, but it does take extra time to brew...

I drink this daily for liver support. It does taste a bit bitter, but I really enjoy it in the evenings after dinner. I steep one bag in a very large mug of water for up to 30 minutes (I don't like really hot tea, and my cup is somewhat insulated). I purchase this regularly on subscribe and save, so it's the best price around.

I took this as a liver detox and I believe it helped.The taste takes a little getting used to, and this is coming from someone who drinks green tea without any sugar.Dandelion root has been used as a medicinal supplement for a long time.Give it a shot.

Not sure why, but this is way milder than the non-organic. I bought this because it said it was "spicy" which is how the non-organic is, but this is barely gingery. It's still ok - doesn't taste bad - but lacks the strong gingery taste of the other type by this same company.

I have tried other brands of herbal ginger teas and this one is definitely the best one by far! Other brands had funny tastes and I had to force myself to finish the box up. Traditional Medicinals organic ginger tea tastes great all by itself, which is how I drink it every day now. I also mix it with my favorite organic green tea every day. It really gives it a nice "bite"! I find green tea too bland when it is not mixed with something else. The health benefits of ginger are well known and it is great to be able to consume it every day in tea form!

I've tried many ginger teas and this one is by far the best tasting.  I add a little agave to sweeten it and it's just perfect.  Not too weak, not too strong.UPDATE AS OF FEB. 1, 2014:  THIS TEA HAS CHANGED AND IS NOW ONE OF THE MOST TERRIBLE TEAS I'VE EVER TASTED.I have been drinking this tea almost everyday for many months now, but today I got my second bad order of it. So, it will have to be sent back, or thrown away, or whatever. But it is now TERRIBLE. TERRIBLE!!!!! I was so loyal to this brand and this flavor but I cannot drink it anymore. The smell is different, the taste is absolutely awful. I'm going to e-mail the company but in the meantime, if you drink this tea, stop. It has changed and the change IS NOT for the better. BOOO.

Tea comes out rather weak for my taste - usually have to use 2 bags for one cup.  However, it does greatly help to ease the stomach when strong enough.  Still gets 4 stars as it's the best option short of boiling actual ginger root.

This tea takes some "gettin' used to"... It is basically straight ginger with nothing else. If you have stomach problems then this is the "tea" for you. Brew some of this up, add honey to taste for sweetness and go... It will help your tummy feel better. It is not the pleasant earl grey or green teas I'm used to sippin' on just relaxin'... it is certainly best suited for medicinal usage.

I went through these 6 boxes very quickly.  It is definitely good tea, & helps me every day.  I mix the tea with peppermint tea bags, & sometimes double spice chia - it has a surprising flavor when you make this tea in a light apple juice with a double chia spice tea for the fluid instead of water.  The product arrived in a timely manner.
summary: Traditional Medicinals Organic Ginger, 16-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)

reviewText: Does the job it is intended to do for me. Doctor prescribe this for my digestive system and I use it religiously.
been drinking it for years.  Great for health.  Plain Ginger but still good.  Not an overwhelming ginger taste.  Very drinkable and best of all organic!

If you love the peppery flavor of ginger, this tea is for you.  The longer the tea bag sits, the stronger the ginger taste.  What I like best about it is the true ginger flavor.  I've tried other brands and they just aren't as potent.Whether you drink it strictly for taste or use it to soothe your stomach, this one's a great choice.  If you're drinking it just for enjoyment, try this:  steep your tea, allowing the bag to sit in the water until it's cool.  Add honey, stir, and pour over ice.  Delicious!

Last year an internet search on home remedies for nausea/indigestion lead me to try simmering peeled, minced fresh ginger.  I was thrilled with how well it worked and how quickly.  Always happy to find a natural alternative to drugstore potions whenever possible, so yay! and buh-bye, nasty pink liquid and gross, hard-to-choke-down chalky tablets.  Personally, I love the slightly lemony, peppery 'bite' of ginger so that's a bonus as well.The problem with the fresh ginger is that it's not something I use every day and therefore a lot goes to waste and I've found that the quality of the roots available in local stores can vary a great deal from store to store and from one shopping trip to the next and - unfortunately - I can't always tell the good from the bad and the ugly until AFTER I've gotten it home and peeled, minced, and even sometimes tasted. The time/labor element of peeling, mincing and simmering for 15 minutes and the subsequent clean up of cookware and utensils is also something nice to avoid when not feeling well.Having been happy with other varieties of Traditional Medicinals tea in the past, I picked up a box of this at the store fully expecting it to be much inferior to the fresh but was very pleasantly surprised to find that not the case at all.  I love this tea!  Brewed covered for 13-15 minutes in a pre-warmed mug, it comes out still warm.  Not exactly the same peppery intensity of the fresh and sadly lacking any real hint of lemon, it's still very good-tasting in its own right.  Plus, it's always handy, don't have to worry about spoilage and it's portable.  It also works very, very quickly to relieve the occasional nausea and to aid digestion when I've overeaten or eaten something a little too greasy/spicy for me.  It also seems to work well in heading off potential problems when consumed shortly before a meal.  So happy when I can get relief from the pantry instead of the medicine cabinet.The price for the six pack here represents a considerable saving from my grocer's occasional sale price, too, so what's not to love?

I'm going to make this review short and sweet....While it isn't the best tasting tea (especially when you drink it without adding anything to it like I do), but it works wonders for settling my stomach when compared to other forms of ginger such as ground ginger, ginger ale, or ginger capsules.Also, I use the same tea bag at least two times, but you might be able to get away with 3 or more.
I love this tea, I'm dring 2 cups a night and I feel relaxed.The taste is very good and soothing.

This is a wonderful, relaxing tea that tastes great on its own (slightly sweet) or sweetened with a few drops of stevia.  A single tea bag works for me, but you can brew a slightly stronger cup with two bags, if needed.  I only use one and probably drink this about 3 nights a week, since I takeSource Naturals L-Tryptophan 500mg, 120 Tablets,Country Life - Chelated Magnesium, 250 mg, 180 tablets, andSource Naturals Melatonin 2.5mg, Peppermint, 240 Tabletsas part of my healthy sleep regimen.I find this tea relaxing and calming, but not necessarily sleep-inducing.  Everyone's biochemistry is different, so you'll need to experiment.  I wouldn't however, recommend this for daytime use.  If you need some daytime relaxation & you're not on prescription medications, try this:Yogi St. John's Wort Blues Away, Herbal Tea Supplement, 16-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6).Yogi's Bedtime Tea is one of my favorites; highly recommended by an enthusiastic tea fan!
summary: One of My Favorite Yogi Teas

reviewText: I tend to drink tea earlier in the day. I don't tend to purchase bedtime teas, but this one was on sale as the weather was getting warmer, so I decided to give it a shot. I love this blend of herbs! Licorice root is the first ingredient, and you can definitely taste it, although it's not overpowering. I drink this at the start of my work day sometimes. It doesn't put me to sleep, but it does make me feel mellow.
...that I feel very relaxed after drinking this which helps me fall asleep. I love that this product is natural with no added stuff.

My daughter got me to sample. I thought, tea? Before bed? No way. But I do listen to my daughter, and did try when a burst pipe disaster led to super stress. Love this tea. But given I find it widely available, I won't buy it here. Too bad it's not at a reasonable price like the lavender bedtime tea...with Subscribe choice.
summary: Love the tea, but overpriced here

reviewText: Not strong enough, so I use two bags instead of one but I really like this tea, tastes like licorice, anyway it does promote sleep very well, and unlike the other guys, Yogi left the scullcap in.

I am a night owl, not by choice but because my mind is so full of information, stress, memories, etc I cannot just fall asleep. I have stopped drinking caffeine but still was having trouble. I usually would just pop a tylenol PM, and off I went, but wanted to break that habit and try to find some alternative natural way of relaxing and getting to sleep.A friend gave me a box of Yogi Bedtime tea, and I was skeptical. I knew that it wouldnt have the same effects as taking a pill, but I didnt think it would relax me to the point where I could stop taking the pills all together. I WAS WRONG.This tea of course didnt knock me out, but it for sure relaxed my mind, calmed me down, slowly nestled me into its aromatic comfort and I was in bed asleep quicker than quick! Its consistent, reliable and all natural and that is all I wanted out of this product.AND its delicious by the way, just keep it away from your cats, valarian root has the same effects on kitties as catnip.

When I have trouble winding down, I make myself this tea. It has stevia in it, so once I weaned myself off of needing REALLY SWEET tea, I realized that I don't need to add anything to it. The longer it steeps, the better it tastes. This is what started my love affair with Yogi teas. It's usually about $4.50 a box in the grocery stores (DC area, so your mileage may vary), so the subscribe and save option on here, or even just getting one six pack, is a HUGE savings. Highly recommended.
summary: Tastes great and does what it's supposed to

reviewText: I enjoy this tea, and one or two cups before bed does help settle me down. It worked best when I first started using it, but since I now drink it nightly, I find i'm not as sleepy when I go to bed. I think the effect now is mostly a placebo. It tastes decent, so I go with it.
I've ordered this twice now.  For those of you who like sweet herbal teas, you may find this one enjoyable.
Tastey and straong for a bag tea. It really works as a sleep aid. It does have ingredents that may aggravate sensitive people.
Yogi have the best tie on earth, it has like a 3D taste, this specific one is a little to sweet for me but it works wonder, it make me sleep like a baby.  Love it

As someone who has issues with a racing mind & thus gets very little sleep, but is very opposed to medication, I've been through a few relaxation techniques and supplements including:-Late-night runs-Melatonin-Sleepytime Tea (for Keurig)-Background sounds-Late-night writingThis tea is hands down the best thing I've done for my sleep. It helps relax my mind and make me comfortable, but not groggy or drowsy. The flavor is amazing, and has a quick honey aftertaste - I have debated looking for one without valerian to drink during the day!This product is so good that despite having a very expensive Keurig coffee machine (which I do use in the mornings/day), I still buy this tea as opposed to other types of bedtime tea. I use the keurig to produce hot water only, and drop the tea bag into the cup.
Did not do a thing to relax and just needed to get up in the night.  It was not a great taste either.
I didn't find the taste strong enough for my taste...it's got good flavor but very mild. Buy one box and try it... I bought a case!
It's bedtime tea, made to relax you and that it does.  I even give it to my children and it's fine.
summary: I love all yogi products, but this one actually does what it says.

reviewText: This is one of my most favorite teas. I brew a cup of this almost every night and add a little bit of half and half. It has a nice light licorice flavor and the stevia in it adds the perfect amount of sweetness. Everyone I've made it for loves it, too. Even my sister in law who hates anise flavored things. And it really does seem to work. :) Also this is a great value. Especially if you get it on subscribe and save with enough stuff for 15% off.
This tea works. It's relaxing and helps me to nod off quicker. I like to use 2 bags for a stronger taste
My husband and I have this tea every night before bed.  It is very relaxing and we like the taste.  It's sweet enough that we don't need to add sweetener.

This tea is so mild that it has no real effect on me or my husband.  Tastes okay though.  I guess it may help you to relax a bit but as far as making you sleepy,  it just doesn't.Edit(08/24/2012):  This tea needs to age before it gains full strength.  When we first got it, seems it had no effect on either of us.  Now, a few weeks later, it has gained potency and when I tried it again, it definitely does pack a punch...it puts me to sleep.  We must have gotten a freshly made batch.  I have never had a bad experience with the Yogi teas but this Bedtime tea is the first one that did not live up to its claims at first.  I would order this again. I put honey and hazelnut creamer in it and it tastes very exotic and good that way. I do the same for the Yogi Triple Ecinachea tea also but I also add lemon balm tincture (15 drops) which really boosts the healing power of the tea to new levels!!!  It even heals cold sores overnight prepared with the lemon balm tincture(homeade with fresh lemon balm leaves steeped in 100-proof vodka). At my age, you need all the help you can get lol.
summary: Must Age to Gain Full Strength

reviewText: I bought 5 different varieties of Yogi tea and find that this blend is the most tolerable of the Yogi teas I have had so far.  I don't care for the stevia at all, there is a taste that really turns me off and I believe it is the stevia but ... they use so many ingredients in their teas that it is hard to pinpoint the actual villian.  We use stevia at home but it seems that stevia in processed products takes on a weirder flavour - to me anyways.  I do not find that this tea relaxes me either but something in it feels like a stimulant.  I will go back to my valerian, stinky but simple, clean and relaxing.
summary: Best Yogi tea I have tried so far

reviewText: *****This Bedtime Tea from Yogi Tea is an caffeine-free herbal tea that is relaxing and a natural sleep aid. Bedtime Tea is made from organic licorice root, organic spearmint leaf, organic chamomile flower, organic skullcap leaf, organic cardamom seed, organic cinnamon bark, organic St. John's Wort leaf & flower, organic rose hips, natural orange flavor, valerian root extract, organic raspberry leaf, organic English lavender flower, stevia leaf, and passion flower extract. The taste is mild, delicious, herb-y, and very slightly sweet. It is subtle and lovely.I am definitely impressed with this tea and with Yogi Teas in general. Bedtime Tea comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site has a helpful glossary of tea ingredients and is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.There is a warning on the box that this tea is not to be used during pregnancy or while nursing. If you are taking MAO inhibitors or other prescription drugs, you should consult your physician or health care professional before use. There are no other cautions or warnings on the box except the standard disclaimer that the tea is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.Best of all, it works...I love drinking it before bed to relax and drift off into blissful sleep. This is a great tea that I highly recommend.*****

I was having trouble winding down at night, so I shopped around and found this Yogi Bedtime tea. I loved it right off the bat because it smelled so wonderful. I was surprised by the licorice flavor because it wasn't overpowering at all. It was ever so mild in the back of my throat. Overall, the flavor was delicate and smooth. Although this didn't help me fall asleep, it was still a good tea that helped me relax and calm down after a long day.
summary: Try this when you need to relax.

reviewText: Taste like cough syrup! It's kind of sugary but has a very plastic and unnatural taste, and a slightly bittersweet after-taste.Wait, no, it's not exactly sweet. It's just slightly bitter. And leaves a very, very strange, chemical-like, unnatural sensation on your tongue... Yup, taste like cough syrup!

This is my favorite bedtime tea. I used to use Sleepytime, then Sleepytime Extra, but this product is better tasting and more effective for making me drowsy. The ingredients also appear to be higher quality. It has a pleasant flavor similar to chamomile but with other herbs added.

i've tried many calming & bedtime teas & none of them work for me, this is no exception. maybe i'm just immune to the ingredients???  i don't know. or perhaps i am just WAY too high strung & i need a triple dose or something.  all i know is it didn't help me fall asleep the two or three times i tried it.  and i don't like the taste of valerian, so while this blend really isn't that bad compared to some others i've tried it is "not my cup of tea".
summary: i love YOGI teas, but this one doesn't work for me......

reviewText: I have not always been a serious tea lover, but this tea has really changed my mind about how wonderful tea can make you feel.  This bedtime tea has a much more rich and complex flavor than other sleepy time teas.  It does contain natural ingredients that may affect medications that you are currently taking, so please read the box.  I enjoy this tea in the evening.  It has a very rich flavor that does not need to be sweetened.I love the packaging so you can take some with you if you are traveling.  Included on every tea bag is an uplifting fortune.  The price here is so much cheaper than my natural health store.  I can buy the package of six here for what three boxes of tea cost at my local store.  All in all I really enjoy this tea, and have given away several packages as I find this tea relaxing and tasty.  If you are looking for a new bedtime tea, I would highly recommend this tea for you.

This is the best of the "bedtime" teas.  I don't love all the yogi products, but i must have this in my cabinets at all times.  And it's become more challenging to find in my grocery stores, AND it's about $4 a box.  Amazon is cheaper and they bring it to my door!This tea offers both chamomille and valerian root.  the latter is similar to melatonin, in that it is a subtle herb and it builds up in your system over time.  I have a cup of Bedtime every evening around 8 or 9, and it helps me unwind.  I believe that part of the unwinding is the ritual of having tea everynight, but this tea does seem head and shoulders above the others i've tried.  and i like it.  What more could you ask?

I have had insomnia all my life.  I take Unisom sometimes, but I don't like taking a pill to help me sleep.  I have been drinking this tea every night for a week and it really helps me to relax and sleep.  I have had some intense dreams after drinking this tea, but at least I am sleeping for once in my life. The taste is not unpleasant to me.  I love tea and this is not one I would drink for the taste, but it isn't bad.

This is the polar opposite of Sleepytime tea. I had one cup last night, and I laid in bed and didn't fall asleep till well after midnight, and then kept waking up every few minutes after that. Worst sleep I have gotten in my entire life! I'm going back to Sleepytime tea. At least that stuff works.

I have been a yogi tea lover for years and have purchased countless boxes here on Amazon. While I was looking intosome new blends I came across a few reviews that made me angry at myself because I stopped closely monitoring their labels because I had developed a trust for this brand.This is what I found when I started digging#1 almost none of the ingredients are Organic like they used to be#2 The company had a hostile takeover in 2010 where the widow of the of the founder was defrauded by forged documentsresulting in several lawsuits. (source wikipedia)#3 They are now using so called natural flavors. If you watch Dr. Oz you will know there is nothing natural about what they can doto your body, they pose many health concerns and there are now scientific studies to show this.#4  Gross out alert !  those with religious & ethical food concerns such as Kosher, Halal, & Vegetarians should know alongwith the rest of us that beaver anal ( yes a beaver BUTT) secretions are used as Vanilla, Strawberry and Raspberry naturalflavoring called  Castoreum. Source FDA
summary: Yogi brand is now a fraud

reviewText: I rarely have trouble sleeping, but when I do I drink this tea.  It really does work, though not sure how effective it would be if one were to drink it all the time.  My significant other, who does frequently have trouble sleeping, tried it and was really turned off by what he called the 'oily' taste.  It DOES have a certain viscous taste probably from the essential oils and herbs in the tea but it didn't bother me at all.  I found it to be an interesting difference from most teas, though I would not want to drink it often.  He did admit it might've had a positive effect on his sleep, yet still wont drink it because of the 'oiliness' so... so much for that.I'll be drinking it, and sleeping soundly.  I'm not sure I'd recommend it based on taste alone.  It's a somewhat pleasant herbal taste but nothing delicious.  For deliciousness alone, I HIGHLY recommendYogi Egyptian Licorice Mintwhich I drink all the time and find to be the most soothing and tasty of all the Yogi teas.

I have a lot of pain issues and have a very hard time getting to sleep, don't want to take drugs to go to sleep and with this tea I don't have to.  It really works, one bag relaxes me enough to drift off to sleep and on those nights I'm having a lot of problems two bags just knocks me out.  It has a lot of really potent herbal extracts that are strong such as Valerian, Skullcap and those two together will really relax you.  Highly recommend.
summary: Puts me to sleep, knocks me out!

reviewText: Not sure of its detoxifying effect.  Definitely don't feel differently after using it.  But it has a ton of good stuff in it, including black pepper extract, which enhances other nutrients.  Tastes yummy too.
great tea has a plesent taste and is good for you too!! it is a win win situation. I will repurchase

I really love this tea. I have been on quite a tea kick lately, and I like to have a detox blend on hand. I love the slightly spicy taste of this tea. It does not require any sweetener. I am not quite sure if it is in fact detoxing me, but I really need a flavored drink instead of drinking water all the time. A great Yogi tea :)

I wanted this tea for the detoxification properties but was wary of what the taste would be like. I really despise licorice and was concerned that this may be overly strong due to all the herbs. This is a very sweet, very balanced and smooth tea. I'm not crazy about the taste but I can drink it every day with ease. The licorice is more of a sweetness than it is a flavor. It starts out a little peppery and is backed by strong sweetness and light floral notes. It tastes better warm than cold.
Flavor is good, aromatic and spicy,  no unhappy side effects. Only needs a touch of sweetening or none at all.

I love this tea! It is herbal(non-caffeinated), so I can drink it day or night. Usually I choose to drink it at night, because I Yogi Blueberry Slim Life (Green Tea) during the day. I tastes pretty good. At first I was unsure about the flavor, but it really grew on me. I think it does do some mild detoxing to the body, because I feel like I have more energy when I use it. I do not use every day - more like a month on and then a month off. I think it helps with food cravings when I am trying to cut back and loose a little weight. I highly recommend. The benefits are great with a healthy lifestyle.

nice taste, if not a little strong.  it does it's job well but it is not a detox that replaces fiber.  it is more of a detox for your entire system.  one thing to make note of is that it states not to use for more than one month at a time
and good for you. A very good tea but there should be a way of making "good for you" tea taste better!

I am drinking this right now and am kind of undecided how I feel about it.  The licorice flavor is strong, and it's not a flavor I'm normally fond of when I find it in tea.  But it's not as bad here as in other teas I've had.  I can taste a hint of spice (clove, cardamom, cinnamon) and that may be improving the flavor for me.  I'm not familiar with all of the other ingredients, but I don't notice any odd or unrecognizable flavors, so I guess the overall blend works well (if you can stand the licorice).The licorice root likely does have some effect on the liver.  Please see the comments below for a link to a web page from the National Institutes of Health regarding the safety of licorice.  Probably in small amounts and/or for only a few weeks at a time, this ingredient will not cause problems.  However, if you have hypertension or are pregnant, you will want to avoid this tea.  It also may interfere with the action of some prescription drugs (many of which are processed by the liver).My main criticism is that there isn't any documented medical or scientific need to do any kind of detox.  Please see the comments below for a link from the Mayo Clinic about detox diets.  Your liver and kidneys are already optimized for removing dangerous substances from the body and if you think your liver or kidneys are not functioning optimally, it's probably best to consult a medical doctor.  Additionally, because this is a tea, the amounts of the active ingredients may vary from cup to cup, depending on the temperature of the water, how many bags you brew at once, and how long you steep the tea.  So you may be getting different amounts of the ingredients at different times.In the end, whether or not to consume this tea is up to you.  If this is something you're interested in, I encourage you to investigate the ingredients further.  Personally, I don't believe detox is necessary and will probably not drink this tea frequently, for that reason.  Also, I am not a fan of licorice in tea, although, as I said earlier, this is one of the more tolerable licorice-containing teas I've tried.  2.5 stars.
yep, it is okay- no big deal.  be careful of the taste because it can be rather strong at times.

I drink this 2 times a week and feel it is helping strengthen my immune system, I do recommend this.I'm also drinking the womens energy tea to balance my hormones.I recommend both of these teas by Yogi
This stuff is wonderful!  As soon as I start getting any kind of tickle in my throat or sniffle.  I start drinking.  It clears it up within a day or two.  Highly recommend.  Tastes nice as well.
I'm not a huge fan of the minty taste, Some honey covers it well. Otherwise this is a great product.

*****This Echinacea Immune Support herbal tea from Yogi Tea is for the natural boosting of the immune system. It's an all natural tea made from organic peppermint leaf, organic ;lemon grass, organic Echinacea root (angustifolia, purprea, pallida), organic licorice root, organic cinnamon bark, organic spearmint leaf, organic fennel seed, organic lemon flavor, Echinacea purpurea root extract (phenols 12%), organic cardamom seed, organic rose hips, organic ginger root, organic burdock root, stevia leaf, organic mullein leaf, organic clove bud, astragalus root extract, organic black pepper, European elder berry extract (30% anthocyanins), natural cinnamon oil, natural cardamom oil, natural ginger oil. Whew! Lots of good ingredients!The taste is unusual and hard to define, probably because there are so many interesting ingredients. It is slightly tonic-y but very pleasant. I love all the things that these herbs are purported to do!I am definitely impressed with Echinacea Immune Support and with Yogi Teas in general. Echinacea Immune Support comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site has a helpful glossary of tea ingredients and is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.Yogi Tea writes this on the box about the tea's benefits: "Echinacea Immune Support tea is a superior blend of several species of Organic Echinacea Root (Echinacea angustifolia, purpurea, pallida) designed to boost your immune system. Each tea bag is made with organic Echinacea Root and Echinacea Root extract, containing the equivalent of 1,400 mg of Echinacea. Health practitioners for centuries have respected the powers of Echinacea, an herb that supports the body's natural defense system by stimulating production of immune system proteins, interferons, that regulate normal immune response. Furthermore, Echinacea supplies certain naturally-occurring plant compounds known as caffeic acid derivatives, including cichoric acid, alkylamides and polysaccharides. These work together to stimulate the body's immune system. The blend is complemented with Astragalus, a stamina-enhancing tonic that also boosts long-term immune function, and European Elder Berry, which is immune-enhancing and supports respiratory function. To support sinus function and promote clear breathing passages, Organic Peppermint and Organic Lemon Grass are included.* Finally, Organic Cinnamon , Organic Fennel, Organic Spearmint, and Organic Rose Hips add a wonderful fragrant essence to this delicious herbal supplement."There are no cautions or warnings on the box except the standard disclaimer that the tea is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. The box says, "When your immune system seems a bit down, drink 2 to 3 cups per day. For increased immune stimulation, drink 4 to 5 cups per day."This tea has no caffeine and is entirely herbal. Note that this review is for the six-pack of 16-count boxes, an excellent value overall. Compare it to other six-packs of this same tea on Amazon to make sure it's the best value, though, as they are always cheaper than buying the single boxes, but some are better deals than others.Highly recommended.*****
summary: Great Immune Booster, Yummy and Unusual Tasting Tea

reviewText: I guess it's a matter of tastebuds but unless this healed me for good I wouldn't drink another sip if I was paid to drink it. Okay - there might be a price that would make me drink it everyday but only one cup and the price is pretty high :-) I've tried several yogi teas and this one as well as the others are just absolutely horrible.  If I don't like something or I have an allergic reaction (which I frequently have from foods or preservatives) I usually pass it on to my mother or sister so the money isn't wasted but this, I threw away, every last package.  Another good reason for Amazon to sell food in smaller quantities. YUCK!

This tea is fantastic, I use it usually around mid-day when I'm wanting a snack and it shuts those cravings right up. It seriously is like having a little meal; it's extremely satisfying and a very good way to manage food cravings. The taste and smell is just the best, it's mostly savory with a little bit of sweet. For me the most prominant flavors are the fennel seed (love it), licorice root, clove, ginger, pepper, and cardamom. It has the same sort of effect on me as eating a few crackers or handful of chips, it's just very satisfying. I highly recommend this to any and everyone.
summary: Sooo good, and at a great price!
