If they ever produce a version with stevia or xylitol to make it less unhealthy, I'll give it ten stars.In the meantime, you might also want to check outHigh Concentrated Milk Hard Candy (Japanese Import). The hard candy consistency takes some of the addictiveness away.
hard candy with a smooth creamy milk taste i love having these on hand for when you want something sweet
I waited a long time to write this review I did not get one mushroom from this patch. I will never waste my money again!

We're in the process of doing our shitake growing kit right now.  After a week or so, we're starting to see the mushrooms taking form.  It's been really easy to do and fascinating to watch.  We have it out on our kitchen counter where we can spray it every day with water and are excitedly watching as our mushrooms sprout.  My husband and I are both serious cooks and shitake mushrooms are always a welcome addition to many dishes.  Having them fresh, instead of dried, is something we're looking forward to, although dried are very good too and some say better.  We may try drying these ourselves, too, as it looks like there will be an abundance!
summary: Fun to watch, great to eat, easy to use

reviewText: It was awkward to grow...there wasn't any room to put it, we ended up putting it by the kitchen sink so we could water it daily...We harvested a couple of handfuls of delicious mushrooms before the whole thin started to turn black, so we threw it out. We did not get enough mushrooms to pay for the kit...It was an experiment, for fun, so now we know that growing mushrooms is not for us!

My log developed mold spots on it (due to excess humidity?). I wrote to the seller to ask for advice and to see if I could salvage it(at the email address that came with the log) and never heard back. I ended up tossing out the whole thing. A waste of money. :-(The log did grow a large amount of mushrooms (though, again, inedible because contaminated by mold.)
summary: Problems: seller never got backto me

reviewText: I gave this kit as a gift so I only have information from the recipient. I am told that the box tells you the date that the kit was packaged. I read from another review that if the kit not activated for too long, the spores die and you don't get any mushrooms.I told my friend this so she activated the kit within 43 days even though shipping time to my friend was about a week. After a week after activation, little mushrooms have already emerged! We'll see whether they grow into big mushrooms and whether those mushrooms taste good. I will add to this review if I have more information.Oh, I docked this item one star because when I ordered this kit, the Amazon checkout process did not let me 'check the box' that said this was a gift. It did not show any gift options including a free message. I had to send an email to the recipient to let her know that I sent it, and that I'm sorry she saw the price, and that she should activate it right away. Is there a cut-rate checkout for vendors who don't want to pay for the 'regular' Amazon checkout?
I like this stuff much better than extra virgin olive oil.  It cooks better.  It tastes better.  It is all around healthy for you and requires less fuss than the oil.  I love this stuff actually.

Excellent I grew up with coconut oil and learned of its benefits from my mom.  It's smooth and atomic and I used it to cook with and as a skin moisturizer.  It feels and taste organic.  Highly recommend.
Coconut oil is a healthy fat. I love cooking with it and Nutiva has a very good oil at a good price.

I use coconut oil a lot now that it has been proved that it is a healthy fat that also helps to burn fat and lower cholesterol.  Mild coconut flavor. Use for sauté stir fry, in Actifry, in smoothies, on home made bread, on hair and skin.... love it
This is such a great product. You can use it from head to toe AND eat it! I use it on my hair and skin. I even give my dog some as a treat and he loves it too.

Great tasting Coconut Oil....use it everyday...does not make food taste like coconuts.....best I have found so far...I just wish Amazon wouldn't take so long to ship...never used to take so long.....oh well, great prices and products, keep me coming back.....

I never used Coconut Oil of any kind, I like Coconut but not a Big Fan. I was surprised to see that "Nutiva Organic Coconut Oil" is congealed into a Thick White Paste with the aroma of Coconut. An Oil that is Good for just about everything, 1 Tablespoon has 130 Calories. I have used in Baking and Cooking instead of Butter with excellent results and the taste of Coconut is not that noticeable. I have also applied it to my Face, made it Nice and Soft...Next I want to try it on my Scalp I want to see if it will Grow Thicker Hair...Coconut Oil is Recommended as a Supplement, Take 1 Tablespoon 1 to 4 times daily, maybe use it as a Spread or added to Salad Dressings and SmoothiesFOR COOKING: Use it in Place of Butter, Margarine, Shortening or other Cooking Oils, for Baking or Frying in Temperatures up to 350F degreesFOR SKIN CARE: Use it as a Moisturizing Lotion, Place Jar in warm water to Liquefy, Massage small amounts onto the SkinFOR HAIR CARE: Use it as a Conditioner, Place Jar in warm water to Liquefy, then apply 2 teaspoons to the Hair 1 to 2 Hours before WashingCoconut Oil is a Natural Energy Source. it contains High levels of Healthy type of Fat called MCTs "Medium Chain Triglycerides" Pure Form of Coconut Oil, MCTs are different from other Fats primarily because they are digested much more easily and efficiently. This makes them an extremely efficient Energy Source much more than Sugar. Also MCTs don't add to Fat Cells or form Artery Hardening Plaque as readily as other Fats. Coconut Oil is a Good Addition to Physical Activity Exercise and Weight Loss Programs. I like the Pure Extra Virgin Coconut Oil to the point that has become a Staple in my Kitchen! ...Thank you D.D.

And healthy too.  And surprisingly it's also very tasty, though to be honest, it wasn't love at first taste for me.  But after trying it several times and a few cups later, the taste is rather good.  So don't judge this tea too harshly after only one cup.  You should give it a chance and try several cups before you decide whether you like it or not.  Brown rice tea has been around a very long time and generations of people have enjoyed it and today we know that it provides a very healthy alternative to other types of drinks offered on the market.  Try it, I'm sure you'll like it.
This is great tea, has a nice nutty flavor and I find I can reuse the bag to make a second cup no problem. I drink this almost every day, highly recommend!

I had been drinking this brand's green tea (sushi bar style) and I got curious about this one.  Very interesting flavor.  It tastes exactly like toasted brown rice, which I wasn't sure that i would like in a tea, but I do.  A nice addition to my rotation of teas flavors.
Brown Rice Tea has that earthly taste to it and it's unique in that way. This tea makes a great gift.
So good to relax with or have with sashimi. Love the flavor and aroma would suggest this for any tea lover.

I use the 30 second water decaf method to remove most of the caffeine from this tea. (Just immerse it in a small amount of boiling water for 30 seconds and then make your tea.)It has a super rich, satisfying flavor and the value can't be beat.
Very happy that Yamamotoyama manufactures Genmai Cha in bags!  Toasted brown rice with medium taste green tea is YUM in my tea cup.  May you feel the same way, too.
summary: My Favorite Manufacturer Makes a Tea Bag Form of My Favorite Tea!

reviewText: I am not someone who normally eats health bars and was expecting a horrible, "healthy" tasting bar.  I got a great tasting bar that did not taste "healthy" at all.  It brought my PH level back to acceptable levels and makes a good on the go breakfast.  I like the bar better if it is refrigerated (but I'm a texture person)
summary: so much better than I thought it would be

reviewText: I'm a serious athlete who can look back a decade or more at that one choice we used to have of nutrition bars - the old Power Bar.Now every joker who can snatch an oat from a horse's feed bag can manufacture a "health" or "nutrition" bar.The Organic Protein bar is the only bar worth eating. The company is NOT  trying to fool you into feeling good, by jacking you up with sugar. This is what almost all bars on the market now do.Isn't it ironic that parents complain about all the sugar in foods that do this, boost energy, in kids? Mom and dad then buy junk nutrition bars to feel better about their own eating habits.Stop playing with your health.Go for protein, instead of carbs, and buy the Organic Protein bar, if you're truly concerned about your health.
summary: 99% of "Nutrition" Bars are Garbage Bars (but not this!)

reviewText: I have finally found the bar that I have searched for. I eat at least one food bar a day and I have tried every brand out there. This bar is a dream come true for me. Organic, 80% raw, and lots of protein! I really never imagined such a complete and DELICIOUS bar existed.  I am now stocking my pantry with these bars. Great!!

I love sugar and chocolate, but these bars are too sweet.  I bought them based on the reviews, but I gave them away since they are too sugary.  They could get away with using a third less sugar and still be sweet.  I was looking forward to a healthy bar, but these aren't the ones for me.  Bummer.

Being primarily raw, we finally see a healthy raw food bar on the market. Well,  it's been out a few years, but I'm just reviewing it now. :)This bar tastes pretty good.  The texture is a little weird, but I can look past it, for the nutritional benefits, and the taste really isn't all too bad.  It doesn't taste like a snickers bar, but it's also not rock-hard and crunchy, like many other raw food bars.All in all, good bar.  I recommend them to any health conscious athlete.

It's simple, if you're running late and you don't have time to pack lunch, You Grab 2 organic food bars!It does the job for 8 hours... It's not the best taste in the world but its enjoyable, Definitely The best food snacks on the planet!I'll order monthly like I have a membership with ORGANIC FOOD BAR...

This bar is one of my favorites.  I switch between this and 2 other "organic greens" bars before my morning run every a.m.  It's almost too sweet for me but I've gotten used to it and the belgium chocolate makes it so rich.  You get these little chunks of fabulous chocolate in every bite along with all the goodness of healthy, organic greens and ingredients and it tastes too good to be healthy.  Some days I can't help but eat more than one throughout the day..they are that good!I am getting ready for another order before my other 2 bar flavors are even out just because I don't like being without this flavor.  I crave it and so does my hub who has to have bites out of every one of these he sees me with. :D (Yeah, I give him his very own whole one occasionally....)

This is an excellent product.  Over the past few years, I have become very discerning about my nutrition, looking for the right balance of protein/carbs/fat, low processed food, low sugar, high fruits/veg/fiber, etc.  This bar is by far the best!  When I can't get a meal, this is what I grab."All Star Health" is also an excellent business and provider for this product.  Always immediate and flat rate shipping.In case you haven't found the specs for this bar elsewhere online, here they are:80% raw, 22g organic protein, 9g dietary fiber, alkaline forming, no soy, non-GMO, no trans fats, no refined sugars, no dairy, gluten-free.  Also, the nutrients ratio is:  22g protein, 33g carbs, 13g fat."Certified Organic Ingredients: Organic Almond Butter, Organic Brown Rice Protein, Organic Dates, Organic Agave Nectar, Organic Bio Sprouts - Flax, Organic Biodynamic (Demeter) Raisins, Organic Sesame Seeds and Lots of Love!"

I was a little disappointed in this product.  I bought it for my husband who has diabetes but who loves dark chocolate.  It tasted bland to both of us.  For the price I was expecting a bit of a "gourmet" taste, a chocolate with a smooth, creamy melt.  This chocolate tasted a bit gritty and was neither smooth nor creamy.What I did like was that the vendor enclosed a chemical pack with the shipment that kept the chocolate cool enough despite the summer heat.  This chemical pack prevented the chocolate from arriving in a brown, mushy package.

Ross diabetic friendly No Sugar Added Dark Chocolate Bars taste the closest to "real" candy bars of any other product I have tried. With 180 Calories and 2 Net Carbs, these are a great treat to curb the chocolate cravings brought on when your insensitive family is eating candy in front of you.I do have to eat these in moderation since too much Maltitol does cause me some "gastric distress".Highly Recommended! I also likeBox of 12 No Sugar Added White Chocolate Bars - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates.CFH
summary: Really Good Diabetic Friendly Candy - Highly Recommended

reviewText: I don't have to lose weight. However, I am fighting chronic candidiasis and I have to stay away from sugar, all refined carbs and dairy products. When I found these chocolate bars,(which taste great to me!) I wrongly believed I had finally found the chocolates that wouldn't feed my Candida. I was wrong because Maltitol does feed Candida. I found out that XYLITOL is the **only** sweetener that does not feed the yeast. Fortunately, I managed to find delicious dark chocolate bars sweetened with Xylitol on the Internet and I am going to stick to those. Being that Xylitol is so healthy, why isn't it used on more products? Unfortunately, many of us already know the answer. :(
summary: Maltitol is not what I need

reviewerName: Joe Bruno Sr. "Fiction and Non Fiction author"
reviewText: After being on the Atkins Diet for a few months, I thought I'd try Ross' Low Carb Chocolate Bars, to satisfy my sweet tooth. I selected the Dark Chocolate ones, and was pleasantly surprised how great they tasted. It's hard to believe they're are not regular Chocolate Bars.I've ordered three more boxes since, but not on Amazon.com. I found them to be cheaper on the carbsmart.com website.[...]
summary: Low Carb Ross Chocolates Fit the Bill!!

reviewText: I don't know, maybe it's because dark chocolate isn't as sweet as regular chocolate anyway, but I found these sugar-free dark chocolate bars absolutely satisfying and delicious.  As someone following the Atkins diet (with considerable success), it's always great to find a successful low-carb, sugar-free version of the foods and snacks formally crossed off the "okay to eat" list.  I'm certainly going to re-order another supply.By the way, although I purchased these bars via Amazon, they were actually shipped directly from CarbSmart, a retailer specializing in low-carb and other restricted-diet foods.  Yes, both the product and the shipping are a little pricey, and the shipping isn't as lightning fast as Amazon's well-oiled operation, but those are quibbles when considering that I can again happily eat candy- and good candy, too- at the movies again!
summary: Tasty chocolate that's perfectly permissable for low-carb followers

reviewText: Very nice taste , pouches , unfortunately are not good at all for keurig , I actually haveto use the the insert for ground fresh ,ol and that is a hassle :(... so they will be utilized onlywhen I run out of my Fog Chaser ...

I bought this to try an alternative ti the Illy pods we use at the office. The Lavazza pods are far superior, producing a flavorful and smooth expreesso with a delicious crema. the flavor is not too acid nor over reasted like Starbucks, you could say it is almost sweet.A number of people have thanked me for buying these. If you have an E.S.E. expresso machine you should try them.
summary: Probably the best ESE pods you can buy

reviewText: Just great. Strong and mellow. You will want more that just one cup of Espresso. I like a strong Espresso in the morning and this Lavazza hits the spot.

Better than other ese pods and cheaper than Illy pods. Smooth tasting with no after taste burn. I substituted Nespresso capsules and saved some money. Highly recommended. These pods needs a good machine to get the best out of them.
summary: Lavazza Gran Crema Espresso Pods 20 pack

reviewText: This pod if for an 'E.S.E.' adapter handle. 'Easy Serve Espresso'.And it is!Try a regular filter handle and you wind up with weak, mostly water, undrinkable liquid. Used correctly, it is the perfect amount for perfect shot.If ILLY is a bit too toasty, try the more mellow Lavazza. Rich and flavorful without too much acidity. Also produces excellent caramel-y crema.If you like to keep regular or decaf on hand for guests, single wrap ESE pods are perfect, no big can to use up quickly.
summary: For an espresso machine with an ESE handle ONLY

reviewText: Ne of the few things I clicked 'buy again' on Amazon. This is fantastic. I used it with shredded Parmesan cheese and knew I had to buy again. Has a nice but not too strong garlic smell and taste. I recommend this

A few years ago, I tried McCormick Garlic Salt to save money and it tasted great but just too salty. So I decided to purchase the McCormick Garlic Salt to have an INSTANT GARLIC TASTE and seasoning as I hate to smash or chop garlic! And for me, I use this Garlic Powder in so many dishes and found many uses for it:1) Use it for Italian cooking (all types).2) Use it when I saute onions (just sprinkle the powder on top of the onions).3) When I am ill or have a bad cold, I add quite a bit of this to my chicken soup. And I do this because I researched that garlic has been helpful in years past before antibiotics were around or many of the modern day pharmaceuticals, garlic was used to treat bronchitis, tuberculosis, liver problems, flatulence, colic, fevers and more. For me, I cannot say for sure, but it seems to help me when I have a fever or bad cold when I add it to my chicken soup. It may be just the soothing effect and the great taste, but it seems to do the trick.One more thing, I have tried other brands of garlic powder, but they do not taste as garlicky as the McCormick, so I will continue to use McCormick Garlic Powder.
summary: A Must Have In A Spice Rack Or Spice Cabinet! Superb Flavor!

reviewText: I have been buying this brand of garlic salt forever.  It's my favorite brand because it's fine and not course and it's not overpowering.  Highly recommend.
This is something that I always have on hand to toast garlic bread.  Has the BEST flavor of any that I have tried.  Have used for years

I use so much of this stuff I got tired of buying the small jars at the supermarket.  This package saves money.  Spices get old if you do no use them in a year but I use this much and more in a year so saving a lot of cash

reviewerName: philyodaddy "Say Hello to the Bad Guy"
reviewText: As stated above, the folks at McCormick have yet to perfect the non-garlic breath smell.  We're cloning sheep and exploring Mars but I still can't apply copious amounts of garlic powder without getting weird looks from my domestic partner.Down to business, this is standard garlic powder.  If you are not familiar with the taste or product, you probably should not be shopping for spices in bulk.  6 bottles of a random spice may seem like an odd purchase, but not for us GP enthusiasts.  The only problem is between this my 6 extra large hot curry powder, my 6 spicy mrs dash (sneaky excellent combo), etc. there isn't too much room on the old spice rack.  I might need a spice closet.  Love this crap though.  Supermarkets charge $5.50-$7, especially in New York City for McCormick spices so I'd probably buy 200 bottles of GP at the per unit price of $2.56 if necessary.  Look at those savings!  If you aren't down with per unit spice savings, get the f out of my review.
summary: Does not improve smell of breath, otherwise good.

reviewText: I do like to eat, but... I am a combination of busy/lazy. Mashing fresh garlic can be messy, smelly and time consuming. Therefore, I believe I am a perfect consumer for this minced garlic product. The garlic bits are big enough to be noticed in soups and stews, but small enough to provide gentle taste for home made garlic bread and salads. In fact, last weekend I used it in olive oil for bread dipping (I made the mix a few hours ahead in order for the garlic taste to soak thru the olive oil, and then added freshly ground parmesan directly before serving; tasted yum!).BTW: Buying this product in bulk (the package contains six shakers), I was concerned about its freshness. However, I needn't have worried. The expiry date was Nov 29, 2012. Secondly, the price of the product on Amazon was excellent, particularly as I purchased it under the Subscribe and Save program. I highly recommend it!
summary: Dried garlic bits: excellent product, for what it is!

reviewText: I use garlic a lot when I cook (not only does garlic add a nicer taste to dishes, it is also a pretty healthy addition to one's diet). When I'm motivated, I use the real deal, chop it, crush it, etc. However, sometimes I prefer to take a shortcut. When that is the case, McCormick Minced Garlic does the trick.When I make my broccoli salad, using this product saves me some time, adds a nice taste to the salad, and, I hate to admit it, is awfully easy on me!So, if one is a bit lazy, this is a useful product. It's not the same, of course, as fresh garlic, but it does the job!

I've read that rice bran oil has health benefits most other oils don't have so that's a good thing, but it also has virtually no taste so it doesn't affect the flavor of what you're making.  For delicately flavored dressings, that's a real advantage.The fact that it has a very high smoke point is a joy when sautéing something--no more smoky kitchen--and if you're a fan of deep fryers there's no lingering odor after cooking as there is with peanut oil.  I still love olive oil some things, but this is my new favorite for everything where that isn't the appropriate choice.

I was not sure how I would like this oil, especially since, with a high initial cost, plus high shipping, it's pretty expensive.  However, rice bran oil is much more nutritious and better for you, so, I reasoned that since I don't really use all that much oil, it wouldn't be that big a deal.  I think that I will look around and try to find a source in my area, to save the shipping charges (I live in a highly rural area and there aren't too many health food stores nearby) but if I can't, I'll probably go ahead and order this.  The taste is slightly different, but you get used to it quickly and it's a very lightweight oil, which I found very pleasant.  It also has to get very hot before it will start smoking, so it doesn't make as much odor in your house, if you're cooking something for a long time.  It seems to me that it held a constant temperature better, too.  All in all, I really like it and I like that it's a healthier choice for the few times that I fry something.  Even though it was expensive, I feel that it's worth it, and it's also worth the trouble of looking for a closer sourse.
This oil is virtually odorless and tasteless. Health experts recommend it as a means to raise HDL cholesterol levels. It's great for frying.
Too pricey will not go here again.  I am health conscious, but now a  daysbudget conscious takes precedent.  Thanks, but no thanks.

No kidding.  My wife has been asking me for 40 years why french fried potatoes and other vegetables never turned out right.This Tophe Rice Bran Oil is the answer!  French fries that are brown and crispy on the outside and soft and perfect on the inside.  And no greasy mess. No sagging. And the paper towel you use to absorb excess ends up perfectly clean and dry.This oil is a chef's dream.  I only wish I had discovered it 40 years ago!  If you appreciate vegetables and meats that are perfectly fried - look no further.Don't take my word for it.  You have to try it just once - and you will never settle for anything less.Outstanding oil in every respect and super healthy to boot!
summary: It only took me 40 years to discover this fantastic oil!

reviewText: this is a nice mild flavored oil.  It has a mild flavor and does not overpower food that is cooked in it.
This rice bran oil is just great. Fresh, not rancid or off-tasting, perfect for sauteeing and deep frying. LOVE IT.
Recommended by Dr. Oz.  I switched to rice bran oil for my health.  It's done wonders for my cholesterol levels and it doesn't have any kind of funny after taste.

I got my order yesterday (prompt delivery) 2/8/2012 and I could not wait to try the oil. So this morning I decided to have an omelette for breakfast. Boy, was I impressed and I am not exaggerating.First, the oil is light and it did not have an after taste. After discovering the blood type diet, I found out that certain oils are not good for my blood type.To add to what other customers have said, this is a great cooking oil with health benefits. I will save my olive oil for cold dressings. Although this half gallon is cheaper(I think its' due to the packaging), I plan to keep the rice bran oil in a dark space until I get a dark bottle to preserve the oil since the shelf life is considered 6-12 months.Cheers to good health!

I can't remove stars for something that is probably a positive to most people.  I got this oil to wok with because I like to wok really hot, just above 400 degrees.  This oil tastes very high quality, I like it quite a bit more than refined coconut oil which I was using before, but because it is less filtered it is cloudy which is from a health perspective a good thing, it probably leaves in a lot more good stuff and doesn't get processed as much.  I do like that aspect however you can tell it lowers the smoking point a bit (the more refined an oil the higher the smoking point).  I can still get it to about 400 before it smokes but its hard to go much higher (with a pan having hot spots and all somewhere will start smoking) compared to more processed clearer rice bran oils I've used.  I do love it though, I feel like it's probably a healthier choice than the others if I tune down the heat  a little so I'm going to do that and enjoy this fine oil.
summary: Great oil, for the most part....

reviewText: The McCormick Thick and Zesty used to be available in large containers, not just individual packets, but I have not seen that size in years. Perhaps it is not available in Alaska. The only other choice was to buy the individual packets (pack of 12). Probably not the most cost efficient when making sauce but at least they are quick to prepare on days when time does not allow for homemade.

We eat so many of these McCormick Salad Toppins that it is much easier, more convenient and less expensive for us to purchase them online.  They are excellent to snack on, top salads with and put on baked or mashed potatoes.  YUM!
summary: Online price is right for Salad Toppins!

reviewText: Edited 11/13:  Evidently the ingredients for McCormick's Pesto have been reformulated and they have removed the MSG and Nitrites that were in the old formulation.  I've very pleased to say that the new ingredients are:"Basil, Salt, Parmesan Cheese (Part-Skim Milk, Cheese Culture, Salt, And Enzymes), Garlic, Disodium Phosphate, Natural Flavor, And Extractives Of Basil."  Disodium phosphate is added to foods as a texturizer and emulsifier - it helps thicken the sauce and keeps the oil from separating.We love pesto sauce on pasta and even on homemade pizza, and on nights when I can't make my own from scratch I love having a package of the mix waiting for me.  It's ready in just a couple of minutes, and adds a savory, creamy taste to any dish.  I'll be looking for this product again, now that the nasty ingredients have been removed (see below).The OLD ingredients list was: "Beef, Mechanically Separated Chicken Water, Salt, Corn Syrup, Flavorings, Dextrose, Paprika, Hydrolyzed Corn Gluten (MSG), Soy and Wheat Gluten Proteins, Sodium Nitrite, Lactic Acid Starter Culture." Hydrolyzed corn gluten is a fancy name for MSG It also has 480 mg of salt in each serving - each package having 3+ servings.
summary: Reformulated, redeemed and I'll buy it again!

reviewText: No it is not like fresh made from all natural ingredients.  I have had that before but this is much better than most Alfredo sauces most of us are used to. Most of us are eating pre-packed or bottled sauce.  We just don't know it, until you have whipped it up yourself then you realize what is fresh and not.  NOW this product is prepackaged powdered sauce and easy to make. I used Rice Milk instead of regular milk or cream.  IT CAME OUT WONDERFUL I thought it might ruin it but no it was delicious.  I simmered it mixed it had my pasta going.  I have simmered it with some fresh grilled chicken and once as an emergency a can of chicken breast (like canned tuna) that I usually only use for chicken salad.  Both times it came out nice and delicious.  This is a great 1..2...3... meal that anyone can make and have dinner in minutes.  Combine it with some fresher pasta choices and I think you have a great deal.  I was impressed by this sauce especially that is came out so good with the rice milk.Here are some of the items I have matched this sauce with.Barilla Three Cheese Tortellini, Family, 12 oz (Pack of 4)Al Dente Fiesta (tri color) Fettuccine, 12-Ounce Bag (Pack of 6)Hormel Premium Chicken Breast in Water with Rib Meat, 98% Fat Free, 5-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)Kraft 100% Real Parmesan Cheese - 24 oz. containerRice Dream Drink, Enriched Origina, 32-Ounce Aseptic Boxes (Pack of 12)

I added this to the Ragu spaghetti sauce which tasted like tomato sauce and it was a magical combo...thank God as I have lots of lomein noodles...and this makes me feel like a chef without cooking from scratch as one living alone does not want or need a cupboard full of food items rarely used.

I pour this onto my veggite zucchini noodles. Completely tricks your brain into thinking your eating real noodles and very filling. This is the perfect compliment to the noodles. I plan on going to Walmart today and stocking up on it. At only 20 calories a whole packet you can eat a TON of zucchini noodles-which I don't count as having calories. Anyone who is trying to lose weight, try this. :)

A perfect blend of spices to enhance your seafood cooking. Love it. Was running out, so I ordered more. Package arrived with a factory flawed lid. Not wanting to wait for a replacement, I switched the product from the new can to the old can.
summary: Anyone who likes seafood should use Old Bay.

reviewText: A tin of Old Bay is a staple in my kitchen.Old Bay is a seasoning mix still in a classic metal tin...love the feel of it in my hand even....but that's not the real reasonfor Old Bay.  The tin speaks to its staying power "Same great taste for over 60 years."  And, therefore, it gets 'staple'status, its almost as normal as having salt & pepper at the table.Fetching it's name from the Chesapeake Bay, Old Bay is often considered necessary for all things seafood, yet in myhouse it's often sprinkled over a roast chicken (sprinkled outside and inside the chicken).  It's rubbed on ribs beforegrilling as part of a dry rub.  Sometimes it's on french fries.Back to my obsession with the tin - the yellow and red colors coupled with the recipes found printed on the tin itselfmake it feel a vintage item.  It doesn't hurt that the color of the tin matches the color of my kitchen. LOLINGREDIENTS:  Celery Salt, Paprika, Mustard, Red Pepper, Mace, Bay Leaves, Cloves, All Spice, Ginger, Cardamom,CinnamonUse it on roast chicken....ribs (beef or pork)....Tilapia.....scrambled eggs.....ground turkey, there is no end to the practicaluses, even in tacos.Old Bay is a classic, and as such contains no MSG. A must for your kitchen spice cabinet.  Enjoy the tin as much as I do..enjoy the flavor even more!
I use this seasoning all the time and love it. It is wonderful in sauces for fish dishes.  And this large size on Amazon is perfect.
This is such an old friend. I am so happy to have found it again. It adds a wonderful flavor to sea food in particular.

I like to make my own rubs for meat, fish, pork and poultry. I have always wanted a rub that has a more savory spice than sweet. This and a few other spices does the trick. Now my smoked and bbq meat has an even better taste. You can also use it as a stand alone seasoning.Ingredients read: Celery Salt (salt celery seed), spices (including red pepper and black pepper), and paprika.Also, not as salty as some other types of commercially prepared mixed seasonings.I forgot to add that this is a can spice and it is sturdy, the cap snaps securely and offers, pour, measure and shake ports in the lid. You don't always see cans but more plastic. The lid also comes with an additional seal to prevent opening during shipping. Very well thought out.

My family has always used Old Bay Seasoning for steaming crabs and shrimp, and I also add a small amount to other fish dishes.  A few years ago, however, I discovered what would be my favorite use for it...potato salad.I have never liked deli potato salad and am pretty picky about homemade.  My sister-in-law made some for a party, and it was the best I had ever eaten.  I asked her what her secret was, and she ran down the usual list of potato salad ingredients.  Then she told me she added Old Bay Seasoning.  Bingo!  That was it.I went straight home and made my homemade potato salad, grabbed my can of Old Bay, and sprinkled away.  I can't say exactly how much I use, because I never measure ingredients when I'm making my own recipes.  Just add some, stir it up, and taste....add some, stir it up, and taste till you like it.  The seasoning does not overpower the salad flavor at all, just enhances it.  Don't be concerned that there is going to be a crab or shrimp taste to your salad; it isn't the Old Bay that makes crabs and shrimp taste like seafood.  Old Bay just makes seafood taste better, and now potato salad too.  Try it on your homemade potato salad; I think you'll love it.
summary: Add it to your homemade potato salad for rave reviews!

reviewText: "Old Bay Seasoning is named after the Old Bay Line, a passenger ship line that plied the waters of the Chesapeake Bay from Baltimore to Norfolk, Virginia, in the early 1900s. Gustav Brunn's company became the Old Bay Company in 1939, the year he fled Nazi Germany, producing crab seasonings in the unique yellow can container until the company was purchased by McCormick & Co in 1990." WikiThis seasoning mix includes mustard, paprika, celery salt, bay leaf, black pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, mace, cloves, allspice, nutmeg, cardamom, and ginger. I first tasted Old Bay when I went to Baltimore and had some crab. How delicious!  I now use it whenever I make crab cakes. I use the Old Bay recipe I found in an old cookbook. It is delicious, and I suggest you try it.This 6 oz. can will last me for quite awhile. I do suggest you purchase a small can unless you use this everyday.Highly Recommended. prisrob 07-02-13
It's Old Bay and it is most delicious!  This is a must if you are doing seafood.  It has a wonderful flavor.

Really, this is a Maryland staple.  Used for all kinds of things.  If you get crabs, they're boiled with old bay.  EVERYWHERE.  No other seasoning have I heard being used on crabs.  It's darn good.Also good on fish, and works well to make a shrimp salad.All in all, pretty delicious seasoning.

Ahhh...the joys of ranch dressing.You either love it or hate it.Me, I love ranch.And there is simply no better overall ranch than the original Hidden Valley.So creamy, so delicious.Chips, pizza, you name it.Recommended.
I like this ranch salad dressing. I not only use it for salads but for sandwhiches in place of mayonaisse. I have eaten this product for a long time and enjoy it alot!
This came packaged secured in a case. It has always been a terrific product but this deal just makes it even better. My Daughter just loves to dip her Veggies!

This yummy stuff is ageless. I was never a huge fan of vegetables as a kid, but I'm determined to make my children adore them. Hidden Valley Ranch definitely helps. These SIX bottles were an awesome bulk deal that fit in perfectly with my large family. The only thing I don't like is I wish the bottles were stackable- they're a bit irritating to store.But other than that they were quality stuff. Super yummy, fresh, and great for my whole family. We use them for salads and to dip vegetables in. I also make a light chicken sauce with it and put it on bacon cheese burgers (yum!).Not only does this stuff help inspire my kids to eat bland vegetables, it's dye-able. I take food coloring and make different colors (pink, purple, red, green, and blue) and let me kiddies dip their vegetables in it. They love making rainbow food- and I love that they're eatng healthy. I also mix some dyes in for salads. They get to pick which color they want their salad to be. And it makes it fun for them to eat. The only salad dressing this works efficently with is Ranch. And Hidden Valley is unmatched for quality and taste in the ranch department.
The original Ranch Dressing and still the best tasting.  Get the best at a reasonable price for ordering it in quanity.  Will keep ordering this as I need it.
Hidden Valley Ranch is the only dressing my nine year old will eat in salads but it's so expensive in the stores; this bundle was great!
These crackers are average, though it can be a bit salty/sweet due to the uneven coating. They make a spicy version of these, I prefer those more.

reviewerName: Amazon Customer "Not all who wander are lost..."
reviewText: Slightly sweet, slightly salty, very crispy! Individually wrapped, they don't have much of a distinct taste, just a light crispiness!

I love these cookies and could literally eat the whole bag at one sitting.  They are crunchy with a hint of sweetness AND a hint of saltiness.  And they are fairly easy going as far as sodium, calories and carbs go.  So eating a whole bag may make you feel guilty for pigging out, but it sure won't kill you as far as calories, carbs and sodium go,
I still enjoy my treats from Japan.  These are  light, sweet,  low calorie., as well as individually packaged.  What more could you want?
yummy stuff .. very lite and delicate go well with any tea.. try em you'll like em ..if you can get them thru the mail w/o being destroyed.
I liked these crackers, but they tasted a bit too toasty for me. Good sweetness with a hint of salty. Don't know if I'd buy them again, just ok for me.

I was so disappointed that these crackers came crumbled.  It would have been nice to get an entire cookie.  The taste is okay but a bit bland.  But I took one of the packets and ate all the crumbs. I do appreciate that they are separately packaged however in pecies. Why cannot they pack them so they dont fall apart.  Going to send them back.

At first I was disappointed with how small the container were, but when I realized how little it actually takes to make a cup of tea in my ingenuiTEA pot (which I got for a Christmas present and HIGHLY recommend), I became an almost instant fan.  Nice sampling of teas, seem to be good quality.  As someone new to teas and trying to switch from coffee to tea, I am very happy with this sampler :)
I gave this tea to a co-worker who is just learning tea.  She really liked them and the canisters are quite cute for a gift.
The tea I received was old, old, old, the flavor was gone, and none of it had any taste to it. The tins are very cute, but unless you're into collecting cute little tins, I would skip this one.

Many reviewers did not realize and/or did not like that these are randomly selected prior to shipping. The surprise element was a major reason I chose this sampler. The teas I received were Oolong, Pu-er, Jasmine, Lychee Black, China Green, and Tikuanyin Oolong. All of the teas tasted anywhere from decent to quite good, with the China Green being the stand-out. The Lychee Black would be awesome except for a sort of stale, dusty aftertaste. Up front the Lychee is fruity and sweet, quite enjoyable. Seconds after swallowing though it's like you've just licked a dusty old book from someone's basement. Very odd. At any rate, the tins are adorable so when the tea is gone I will probably reuse them, they'd be great for storing buttons, loose change, incense or what-have-you.

I love tea and wanted to give loose leaf a try. However, loose leaf tea can be pretty expensive and I'm picky with tea. Not a connoisseur at all, just flat out picky. This pack seemed perfect! It was cheap and I would be able to have a variety of teas. I received black tins that included:Lung Ching (dragon well green)Pu-erhJasmineLychee BlackTikuanyin (oolong variety)OolongSo far I've only tried the Tikuanyin but it's decent. Again, as I'm new to loose leaf I might not be the best judge but I find the flavor pleasing. There are stems in all of the tins and some of them are quite big. To their credit the tins are filled to the brim with tea. In the end I think you really get what you pay for. The tea is nice enough but not as high brow as typical loose leaf teas.**Update**Taken down to two stars. The more tea I try the less I like it. I'm probably going to end up throwing all of these out. You're better off buying bagged tea; it's a higher quality!Lychee had a highly metallic taste to it. Took two sips and threw the rest out.Lung Ching was bland and had a dull flavor. Not at all bright and clean as tea normally is. Seemed maybe it was old and stored poorly.Pu-erh was alright, nothing special. (I'm new to Pu-erh tea so I may not be the best judge on this one. I enjoy Foojay Dim Sum Pu-erh quite a bit. This was like a toned down version).I found the more of this I drank the more stems I was picking out. Seemed to be almost half stems.

In reading the reviews it seems some people have received okay tins and some of us have received smelly, moldy, stale, horrible tasting tea.  I usually read all the negative reviews and I did this time but ordered it any way hoping I'd be one of the lucky ones. Besides I don't know a whole lot about how Chinese teas are supposed to smell or taste.  I smelled every can and some were okay but most had a strange smell that I would call musty.  I figured the proof was in the tasting.  I made a cup of oolong tea, the one Chinese tea with which I am a little familiar and had to throw it out.  It tasted worse than it smelled.  The tins are cute and I almost kept the tea so I could have the tins, but common sense says there is no use keeping something when it smells so strange.

I converted to drinking only loose leaf tea last year and gave this gift pack a try. While it was decent, I have since had better and will probably not be ordering it again.For one, it is impossible to tell the age of the teas in the tins. For Pu-erh, that's not such a big deal, but for green teas and the Jasmine, you want normally want to get a batch that is a fresh as possible. PierMall is a big reseller of products from around the world, and there is no telling how long what you get had been sitting in some huge warehouse, slowly losing flavor. Another consideration is that you get a random sampling of Chinese teas, no the specific types that is implied by their Amazon listing. If you visit their website, you will see that they draw from this selection:* China Black Tea* Tiekuanyin (Iron Goddess of Mercy)* Oolong* Lung Ching DragonWell Green Tea* Yunnan Pu-erh* Jasmine Tea* White Tea* PuErh Tea with Chrysanthmum* Lychee Black Tea* Rose Black Tea* Rose Green Tea* Osthsmum Green TeaI don't know about you, but I'd like a little more certainty when buying a product. If you are new to tea and trying different varieties out, or are getting this as a gift, then it isn't such a big deal. Of what I received, the Oolong was the best. The Pu-erh was okay, though nothing special, and the Jasmine has a slight aftertaste, leading me to believe it was artificially flavored. Good Jasmine tea should be flavored by the scent of the flower, nothing else. The green and blacks were just okay.You could do worse if you were to buy teabags, but not much. I would recommend buying good loose leaf tea from dedicated tea vendors who are more upfront about what exactly they are selling you. At this price, you really can't expect to get quality tea. But if you are looking for an inexpensive gift for someone who doesn't know their tea, you could do worse. At least afterward you have some cute little tins in which to store future teas! It may cost a little more, but I think one would be much better served by ordering samples from a company like Heavenly Teas or Adagio.
summary: Decent Tea - Even If Samples Are Random

reviewText: It is a random selection so I don't have much to say yet but so far what I have received is absolutely delicious. As some reviewers have stated this is a great way to get started on drinking hot teas. You can figure out what you like and don't like then decide to get a larger quantity of that one later. I've made quite a few pots of tea so far and my tins aren't even 1/3rd empty. So you get plenty of tries to find your particular taste.

A fairly good size collection but know that most of these are of a poorer quality.  If you really want a finer tea try elsewhere  there are loads of good teas at Amazon and specialists.  But this is good if you are starting out or not too fussy.

I will be traveling with my own teas for hotel convenience. A nice collection of quality teas. Brewed my first cup last night. The Oolong is very flavorful and as good as any I have had the pleasure of tasting at retail locations.

Purchased these as a gift.  I was told by the recipient (an advent tea-drinker) that it tastes wonderful, and the leaves blossom very big.  Pleased w/ my purchase.  Be warned that they are samples, and are not big.

I have ordered this many times over.  I find it is easier to keep this in a container on the shelf than it is to keep fresh in the fridge.  Whenever what I am cooking calls for some sour cream I just add the powder instead and it tastes exactly the same.  I am very pleased with how it comes out every single time.
This is definately not for putting on potatoes, etc.  It is, however, great to have in your pantry for when you need sour cream in a cooked recipe.  It has a good shelf life and is easily prepared.

ALTHOUGH I RECEIVED MY SHIPMENT IN A TIMELY MANNER, I WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE PRODUCT.  IT TASTES LIKE INSTANT NON-FAT DRY MILK AND NOTHING LIKE SOUR CREAM.  IT MAY BE OK TO USE IN COOKING, BUT NOT ON BAKED POTATOES.  ALSO, IT DOES NOT COME WITH DIRECTIONS.  IF I COULD, I WOULD GIVE IT MINUS 5 STARS, THAT'S HOW DISAPPOINTED I AM.  THE COMPANY MAY BE GOOD AND THEIR OTHER PRODUCTS MAY BE GOOD, BUT NOT THE SOUR CREAM POWDER.
I never knew they could dehydrate sour cream before!  I can't wait to get started making my own recipes with this product!

I have ordered from Barry Farm before and was happy with their products. This one is just as good as the other items I ordered.Powders are great for baking! I used this for making scalloped potatoes and everyone loved them. I have not tried to mix and serve for a baked potato.
What is a baked potato without sour cream??  Just another spud!  Great in mashed potatoes too.  Convenient for using in Stroganoff.

As I've gotten into new recipes over the last year, I find myself using sour cream a lot more often than I used to. While I can get locally made sour cream fairly easily, the weather doesn't always allow it. This powder is a great way to have sour cream on hand, especially if you don't buy it that often.

Perfect to have on hand instead of spoiling cream in fridg. Thick and tasty. Not sure about a baked potato but I don't use on those anyway.Very good flavor with perhaps just a slightly noticeable metallic twinge.  Very little, tho.
On baked potatoes ar mix it up to make dip for chips the wife make a potato caserol out of this stuff so good.

I searched for a yogurt starter on Amazon and this product came up as an option.When I received it there was a sticker "not to be used as starter".Amazon did agree to take back the unopened bag. I don't know what to do with the remainderof the open one.

Dehydration directions say that you need guar gum.  I just added the required water in order to mix it in with a recipe and it came out like water.  The guar gum is a thickener, like cornstarch.  Flavor wise, I think it tastes like sheep or goat milk...I'm not sure but I don't like it.
summary: directions say that it needs guar gum

reviewText: A nice way to add yogurt flavor without thinning out the dish you are preparing.  A great item to add to a food storage program.

It is a little expensive for the amount, yet I have nothing to compare it to. I have ordered it twice and will order it again. The first time, I ordered Guar Gum with it. I attempted to add it to the yogurt powder in the blender and it did not turn out well for me. However, I love the taste when added to my oatmeal and fruit smoothies in the morning.
I tried this but did not care as much for it as real home made yogurt.  Still good if you do not have the time or the where with all to make the real stuff.

These are a true ginger candy.  They have that bite and burn of fresh ginger, come individually wrapped and are a blessing for anyone who has chronic stomach nausea.  Ginger is a superb herb for morning sickness, motion sickness or medical issues and Rx's that mess with your stomach.
I remember trying one as a child.. SPICY! I spat it out instantly because the ginger flavor is so overwhelmingly strong. People seem to love it though, but it doesn't suit my palate.

I've been eating Jing Jing Jahe for the past 15 years, even taking some with me when traveling in Indonesia, where it is manufactured.  When you first put a candy in your mouth, you might wonder where the ginger heat is, but don't worry.  After a few minutes your mouth will be enveloped with the most wonderful ginger taste you'll ever experience.  This chewy candy is not for those who do not like "hot" foods, but for ginger affecionados, it's a wonderful treat.

One day I saw these at the store and on a whim decided to buy them for my wife as a treat. The man at the register asked if I had ever tried them before, and I said no. He said "Good...because otherwise you would eat this bag on the way home! They are that good." I was sort of curious, so I thought why not, and opened the bag when I got to the car. I had one, then another, and could have finished the bag before I got home. I expected something sweet and sugary, but was delighted to find no "sugar shell" and a nice kind of "Oh Wow" feeling as it dissolved in my mouth. My wife is now crazy about these, and I always buy a bag for me "for the ride home". I am not a candy eater, so I do not consider these candy, I consider them health food!

We've enjoyed these ginger candies for years. Outstanding product. They also made an improvement warpping them in a foil wrapper, as they used to wrap them in paper. The paper would get all stuck in the candy, so you'd either lose some candy stuck to the paper or wind up eating a chunk of paper. Now that they are wrapped in foil.... voila' .... that does not happen anymore. Smart move.
This candy is just great. The texture is soft and chewy. The flavor is great with that ginger taste and then the bite that it offers after you starting eating it.
I love ginger of all kinds and this is just one way to enjoy the benefits of ginger without a bitter taste. A real after-dinner treat.
The candy is very gingerey, chewy and hits the spot. I have always liked ginger candy but it is very hard to find in my small town. It was good to find an available on line product.

I keep a bag of the ginger candies in my car for long trips and when I fly.  They're great to settle the stomach, and for after meals.  The price is good and cheaper than buying smaller bags in high-end world-goods stores.
The best after meal digestives EVER!I can't keep these in my home since I munch on them all the time!DELISH!

When I have a sweet tooth craving I enjoy eating two or three Ting Ting Jehe Chewy Ginger Candies.  These candies are not only chewy (similar to Gummy Bears), they are also a mild sweet and the Ginger gives it a sharp/peppery taste zing!

This is one of my favorites of olive oil.This extra virgin olive oil has a lovely golden green color and sediment in the bottle.It's got a  good fruity ,rich flavor.It is also a little sweet.I like to use it deliciously compliments salads.I like to drizzle it over  tomato and cheese.I am sure you will enjoy it and I highly recommend it.

First, the seller:  SuperOlive.  The way these bottles were padded & packed was amazing.  many times I've received items from other places that were damaged in some way because they just dump the stuff in a box & don't care what happens to it afterwards.  This box, the jaws of life couldn't open it. That's a good thing. I used a scalpel to slice thru.  Also..the shipping was crazy fast.I tried this olive oil in a restaurant not too long ago, & I really loved it!!  Asked the waitress what brand it was & then I went looking for it. Reasonably priced, too.  My other favorite olive oil is Bariani.

Frantoia has been a personal favorite for over 10 years, having a remarkable capacity to resist oxidationand maintain its freshness beyond most olive oils. All-purpose and one of the best values in the world today,versatile, substantive, spicy, zingy, and reliable.Frantoia is fruity, herbaceous and has a pleasant almond aftertaste. It is a blend of three olive varieties:nocellera del belice, cerasuola and biancolilla. It’s versatile and can be used for cooking, soups, salads anddrizzling over vegetables, cheese, meat, and seafood. Celebrity chef Mario Batali used Frantoia on his FoodNetwork series, Molto Mario. Here’s the owner's tip for a grilled steak (which he loves with Maker’s Mark on therocks). "Immediately before serving drizzle a little EVOO and lemon over the grilled steak and sprinkle with seasalt." Fantastic!
This olive oil was top notch.  I only use it in special recipes and love its pretty green color and silky texture.  I would buy again.

Since reading the other reviews, I decided to try this extra virgin olive oil.  It is subtle and delicious; I keep it in conjunction with another that has a more pronounced olive flavor.  But I can't say enough good things about this seller.  The packaging is done so well, I don't think anything could destroy the contents.  And this is the fastest shipping ever.  I will be visiting Super Olive just to see what else they carry because I'd like to do more business with them.

I just ordered this product from Amazon, and I very much like the taste.  But as soon as I swallow the olive oil I - and others in my family - detect a burning sensation on the back of my throat.  Has anyone else experienced this?  Is this likely a production defect with my specific bottle, or is it a characteristic of the product itself?  I have never had any other olive oil do this.
summary: Anyone Else Get a Burning Sensation?

reviewText: I have been using Frantoia EVOO for 12 years now--it is simply the best there is.  My family is from Vicenza IT on my mothers side and when we visited, I noticed its the only olive oil they keep in their homes.  So I started bring back bottles on every trip.  I have since found it in San Francisco at Molinaris in North Beach but now I can order it online and save the room for bottles of vino instead!
Great price for this quality and quantity.  The oil is a little bit fruity, not very acidic.  Mild flavor overall, and not as heavy and greasy as some EVO's.
summary: One of the finest Olive Oils I have ever had

reviewText: This is fine olive oil with it's own distinctive taste/bouqet. We always have this oil and a Spanish oil in the kitchen because the tastes are different but both are perfect. I regret that this oil is priced as high as it is because I feel there are other oils of equal quality and taste for less money.But....you will not go wrong with this oil. We have been using if for several years. Marvelous stuff.

It's true - this soup has no taste at all.  However,that shouldn't stop you from buying it and adding otherspices to it that will give it some taste.  This is solow sodium, it will not harm your blood pressure, andthat is very good news.  If you are like me, you haveaccidentally not read a label first and ate somethingand then spent the next several hours being really sickbecause the food had so much salt that it drove yourblood pressure up sky high.  This will give you a newchoice of something to eat that you won't have to worryabout.  Get some curry, garlic, pepper, or some otherspices and you can fix the problem of it not having anytaste.  I bought 24 cans of this, and I'm not sorry. NowI have something to eat that won't kill me.
summary: High blood pressure people will be very pleased!

reviewText: This is standard french onion soup from Campbells, just like what you'd get in the store. There's not much else to say.
We use all kinds of low sodium products and prefer them, but there just isn't much flavor to this soup.  The consistency is good, though.
I simply love mushroom soup and by adding some spices, larger chopped mushrooms and a little salt to keep the sodium content much lower than in most soups, you can cook a very tasty final product.
Like the lower sodium version and it still tastes good in my recipes. This is a staple for typical "American" cooking :)
summary: Love to keep this in the cupboard

reviewText: I love cream of mushroom soup especially on a hot day.  Because I am on a sodium restricted diet it's hard to find low sodium soup.  Of course this product doesn't have sodium galore so I'm able to eat it without feeling bad about my sodium intake for the day.  I can add sodium if I need to and the original taste is still there.  I will recommend this to my friends but they aren't on a sodium restricted diet and may not be very receptive to this soup.  For my friends who are on a sodium diet they love it as well.  There are so many things that can be done with this one little can.  Yummy!
summary: I love soup on a hot day!

reviewText: This formula seems to me to be a cheap substitute for the previous one.  I can't use this for recipes-it's runny, goes half as far (you can't dilute it), has cream as ingredient (don't want), no taste at all, scarcely tell it has mushroom bits in it.  I'm not sure what the idea is behind this, unless it is cost-saving; I am really unhappy about the switch!

Ever get that feeling your purchasing something that need, but that when you get the package, you know you got screwed?  Well, that's how I felt when the shipment arrived.  The case was damaged and it looked as if we had bought a damaged case for full price.  Not a good feeling.

always been a huge campbells soup fan.  have been eating it for years.. sorry but this is the worse soup i have ever tasted.i could not even finish one can.. i tried different things to enhance the flavor, but nothing helped.  its just unreal.. surelycampbells did not sample this soup before they put it out for sale.if i could i would give it less than 1 star..lola..

I got what I ordered.  Have to realize that this is low-sodium and ready to serve, meaning you don't add milk or water.  You pour, heat and eat.  If your cooking with this product to replace ready cream of much soup you will be disappointed unless you modify recipe.

When I read the positve reviews on this product, I ordered it.  It is definitely low sodium and if you have a medical condition that requires very low sodium,  this soup would fit the bill.  If you are just trying to cut back on salt, again this soup will work fine.  I personally feel that most of our food has way too much salt and sugar in it so I thought I would give this product a try.  I like the convenience of it being ready to serve but I must admit, it has very little flavor.  It's almost like drinking water with a slight mushroom taste.  Truthfully, I miss the salt.  I think that soup, generally, needs salt but as I stated, most are much too salty, however, this soup is just too bland.  When I added a little bit of salt, that made a big difference.  Also, I noticed that the soup is very watery and thin.  I like my mushroom soup a little more substantial.  I do think this soup would work very well in casserole recipes.  I probably will not purhase the low sodium variety of Campbell's Mushroom Soup but I do like many of their other products.  However, and this is important, if it is an absolute necessity that you cut back on salt for health reason, then this soup would be perfect for you. Some non-salt seasoning could make it more flavorful.  I give Campbell's credit for trying to make their products more health conscious.  More companies should do the same.  Salt and sugar must and should be reduced -- a little can go a long way.

I've noticed more and more large lumps of fat arriving in these cans than used to be the case. The chicken meat is also more broken up than it used to be. That said, it still makes a damned fine sandwich or, if you want to get really creative, you can do what I do: put it in a pan with ginger beer, sriracha, garlic, soy sauce, lime juice, onions and green herbs to taste. Reduce to a thick sauce and serve on a wrap with lettuce. Yay thai chicken wrap!
summary: Good chicken, but quality has slipped a bit

reviewText: Update:  Please note per my information below: product description and photo are no longer accurate.  The product has a sealed lid, not a "pop-top lid" and the amount of protein and sodium have changed.  See below for the correct information.  I have notified Amazon of this error.  Somehow 5 grams of protein have been "lost" from the can contents.I purchased the 4.5 ounce can of Swanson white premium chunk chicken breast on sale at CVS - buy one, get one free for $3.00 ($1.50 per can).  This large size can 12-pack works out to be a better deal even though it's not a sale price and subscribing to purchase this product on a schedule reduces the price per can even more.I am wondering if the person who commented that the meat was a mixture of white and dark meat ordered or received the wrong product since there is a similar product available for a lower price that is a blend of white and dark meat.  This 9.75 ounce net weight can contains all white meat and just the right amount of broth that's easy to drain off or use.  The chicken looks appealing and it tastes mild and flavorful. It is great for making chicken salad sandwiches or for adding to soup or any other food item.  The meat flakes into small pieces easily, so you may not want to add it to your soup stock until just before you are ready to serve it.  It would also make a good filling for enchiladas, tortillas or quesadillas.  I have no problems at all with the taste or texture of this product.  It is appealing when you open the can and it would work well for many recipes or quick meals or snacks.  For those who don't like tuna, it's a great alternative.Basically, it's chicken when you need it ready to go, and it is a good source of protein with very little fat.  One can contains 5 servings with each serving containing 50 calories, 9 grams of protein, 1 gram of fat, 25 mg of cholesterol (8% of DV), 1 gm of carbohydrate and 260 grams of sodium(does that include the broth?).  If sodium is a concern, consider adjusting the amount of salt that you add to your recipe or maybe you could even lightly rinse the drained chicken in a strainer.It's certainly better than buying luncheon meat and keeping it for too long!  It's fresh when you need it.  I have a couple of cans stored in my refrigerator now. This chicken contains no MSG and no artificial flavor - just less than 2% food starch and sodium phosphates.(okay sodium phosphates may not appeal to some)Update:Just opened another can and added it to a healthy variation of macaroni and cheese.I haven't tried the concoction yet, but the chicken looked wonderful when I opened the can - appealing light pink color and chunky bits of meat like baked chicken breast.
summary: Great product to have in your cupboard and a good price

reviewText: This canned chicken is the perfect thing to make a quick salad, sandwhich, or toss into a soup for lunch or dinner.While it will never replace a roast chicken in the oven ready to be served, it's got a nice chicken taste. It's just not as firm as regular chicken you prepared yourself.If you remember to keep a can or two in your desk at work, you won't be without some solid nutrition in a pinch. Try it cold with some yummy salad dressing and a few crackers!Swanson Premium Chunk Chicken Breast is an excellent buy.
summary: If you have this in the pantry, you've got a quick meal.

reviewText: I used this a lot for white bean / chicken chili, chicken salad, fettuccine alfredo with chicken and mushrooms.  The flavor is very good, it's low-fat, the sodium count isn't outrageous, and it works well with a lot of things.  Yes, I prefer using fresh chicken breast, but when I don't have any on hand or can't get to the store, this works very well.

My husband is always hassling me to eat something good with protein, as I am a carb lover.  These white meat chunk chicken in cans are great, because I'm terrible at meal planning.  All of a sudden, I'll be hungry NOW, with no time to cook.So I open a can of this Swanson chicken, drain it, dump it into a tupperware, add a couple heaping tablespoons of lite Miracle Whip, and start mashing at the chunks with a fork.  I scoop up the newly made chicken salad with saltine, Ritz, or butter club crackers.  Ta-da, instant protein-filled meal.  This chicken would be great for serving to kids, too.  I ALWAYS have cans of this in my cupboards.  I can add some more flavor by adding ground black pepper, mustard, relish, and other kitchen staples.It is cheaper at my local stores.  But, if you can't get out to the store, I've always had great service from amazon!
summary: A good, quick source of protein

reviewText: I love Swanson Premium Chuck Chicken Breast, I keep it in my pantry, it is good for chicken salad, I use it in casseroles where chicken can be used..good flavor, and nice amount of chicken in the can, some products are more liquid then product. Not this one.

I like the convenience of having canned chicken on hand. It's great for soup or salad. However, I found the flavor of the Swanson's canned chicken to be good, however, the texture was so soft, it just seems to mush away into whatever you're making. My kids LOVE chicken salad, and they were so happy to see I had just made some. One taste and they were like, what's this? Why is it so soft, so mushy. I bought a dozen cans, so I have to finish them up and we will be eating mushy chicken salad for awhile. I don't recommend this product.
summary: Not as good as other brands, texture too soft

reviewText: Awesomeness in a can.taste great and everything arrived intact. Cheaper than local store. I would recommend this product to anyone.
We enjoy using Swanson's chicken for salads and sandwiches. It is great when combined with white meat tuna. We recommend.

We use for chicken salad during the summer, we can take to festivals (where we sell jewelry), and during the fall and winter for all kinds of recipes.  It is handy, and really good.  It is handy when can't decide what to fix, we always have this on hand.
summary: Great for all kinds of recipes.

reviewText: I love Campbell's chicken & stars soup, but can never find the "at hand" version at the market.  Was happy to find it on Amazon for a great price - signed up for auto delivery, made the value even better :)

I use this several times a week for lunch, or part of a lunch, on very rushed days.  It cooks quickly, tastes good, is convenient, and has low calorie count.  My only complaint is from a total of 4 packages, two or three cans of soup (in different boxes) had congealed goop in the bottom.  I suspect this was some issue with them being stored or transferred in an area that was too hot at some point or due to strange settling.  However, I don't like my soup goopy, so when I came across that it ruined my appetite for this product for a while.  I started eating it again and had it happen again so I am not sure what is causing it but I just pay attention when eating it.  It has never made me sick.

According to the manufacturer, the list price for this item is actually $19.95 for the 8-pack case. The list price of $42 ($39.95 on most sites) is for the 16-pack.  Amazon just made an error, that's all.

A nice low-calorie lunch that is able to keep me full for hours. The flavor is a bit lacking, but I have tried the healthy request version and the regular version and the weaker flavor is because it is healthier. I think the reduced sodium is worth it for me at least. It is still very satisfying on a cold day, and fast!

This clam chowder is very creamy and tasty. One thing that some people may not like is the fact that unlike all of Campbell's other New England clam chowder's, the Soup at Hand clam chowder has NO chunks of anything what so ever. I am not exaggerating when I say that there is nothing much bigger than a grain of rice in this soup. At first I didn't like the texture of the chowder, but now I kind of like it because all the tiny bits in it makes the seem a bit thicker. If you like big chunks of potato and clams you will not find it here.I believe that the other reviewer that talked about the chunks of potato etc. probably has tried Campbell's other microwavable Clam chowder which does indeed have big chunks, but I don't think that reviewer has eaten the Soup at Hand version of the chowder.

Pretty good, definitely not worth 5 stars. The taste is good but is a little weird and bland but it's totally edible. It's also super easy to prepare and consume. Sprinkle some salt and pepper in there and you're good to go.

Wow. I was not expecting this to taste as good as it does. This is a wonderfully flavorful soup. You get real clam taste and a good texture (little on the thin side but acceptable), and even a bit of creaminess. It is actually the best tasting store bought clam chowder from a national brand I have ever tried. I have tried various types of Campbells before and Progresso, and probably some regional brands I can't remember.But this is a very good soup. The first few ingridients in order are water, clam stock, potatoes, celery, clams, vegetable oil. Unfortunately Campell's does use high fructose corn syrup, but it is at least fairly far down the ingridient list. Too bad to save a few pennies or less (maybe even a fraction of a cent over real sugar?) probably per can of production they choose that. It does contain monosodium glutamate in case that is a no go for some people.Overall though this is great to have in your pantry. You get a good amount of fill for 150 calories but you are also getting 15% of DRA for Total Fat 10 grams, and 10% of saturated fat, 2 grams. Zero trans fat is listed. It is good enough to have for lunch a couple of times a week. Pair this with some fruit, and maybe some cheese and you will have a good enjoyable work lunch. Nice to have on hand for rainy days also.It takes 1 minute 15 seconds on high. It is a narrow can but you do have the option of putting the 'sip cap' back on and drinking your soup. The advantage of that is that the can helps keep the soup warm all the way through. Enough good about this product starting with taste, that I do recommend it.
summary: Surprisingly delicious; virtually restaurant quality soup, and among the best ever store bought, But...

reviewText: Cream of Broccoli Soup on the Go is terrific for me.  I love broccoli soup any day, so this is wonderful.  One minute after it has been opened and put into the microwave and you can eat.
summary: Cream of Broccoli Soup on the Go

reviewText: In general, I much prefer the old condensed can varieties to these new "at hand" versions, but this one is the exception.  It is very tasty and the quick and easy preparation is nice when in a hurry.  I found the classic Tomato variety very disappointing (lack of flavor compared to condensed can product), but this one has lots of flavor and is very satisfying.  The other reviews here already cover it pretty well, but I wanted to add my 5 stars vote for this excellent soup.  I have ordered several times now and the quality has been consistent and good.Two thumbs up for this tasty and quick soup.  An excellent quick snack on a cold winters day.
summary: Delicious soup, quick and easy to fix.

reviewText: This is a great price for a quick meal on the go. I really enjoy the flavor of this soup compared to the tradition tomato soup! It's a go to meal on the days that I am on the go!
great product. great price. sent it out to my son so he would have something good and quick to fix

I purchase these via 'subscribe & save.'  They're so convenient.  Although we've had consistently beautiful weather here on the west coast, these would be even more appreciated in the mid-west and the northeast for a delicious 'warming' treat.
But I really liked it. It has a little bit of zing that the regular tomato soup doesn't have. Would order more for myself.

These are soul-warming soups, hot or cold.  My husband actually prefers them cold and drinks them for breakfast, lunch, dinner or late-night snack with total delight.  Great to grab when running off without time to eat, or when planning to be away.  Ideal for travel or emergency stash, because no refrigeration required, not even a microwave for reheating if you're like my husband and enjoy them cold!  We have 2 cases a month on Subscribe-and-Save and go through them pretty fast.  Their nutritional profile isn't as bad as you might think (at least according to Weight Watchers), and they're very satisfying.  If you're craving a late-night snack, think:  would you be better off with cookies/candy/chips or with tomato soup??  I love that these are just as convenient as those usual snack culprits!!
summary: Tasty portable meal, snack or emergency food!

reviewText: But I swear it's "soup on the go" not broth in a cup. The broth is EXTREMELY bland. I had to put hot sauce in it ro actually be able to take the taste. I got the chicken noodle one and it sucks. I eventually got used to the taste, but there wasn't any chicken inside. Nasty slimy carrots , which wasn't mentioned on the can, ew. And all the noodles sank to the bottom, and are basically impossible to get out after the broth is gone.Good thing I only bought two, I actually might buy again just because it was easy and quick. Just add your own seasoning and its basically edible. That'll be my "in a rush" and I dont care what I eat type soup. Other than that, I'll stick to their bowls. They actually have chicken inside their chicken noodle soup.
I dont think it matters which soup at hand you purchase cuz they dont stand UPRIGHT long enough to heat the soup,had it flip over,spilling contents out of course. I will NOT purchase again.
A fast and easy fix for those on-the-go days. Really cream with a bit of chicken. If you like creamy soups, you should like this one.

I have tried other flavors of the Campbell's Soup at Hand and did not like them.  To me they do not taste like the soup they are supposed to be duplicating, nor did they have the same texture.  However, the cream of broccoli hits the mark.  It tastes just like the original.  It's creamy and delicious (and very difficult to find in the stores around my area, so I was glad to find it here).  If you like the taste of the cream of broccoli soup by Campbell's made from a can where you add water, then you will like this. It tastes the same, just more convenient.

If you're like me and get tired of packing lunches, be sure to grab these! They just make it SO much easier and it's easier for the person who's eating the lunch as well.  They taste great too - I like this one better than the regular canned version.  It's healthier too!  I buy these things by the ton it seems like! Highly recommend!

I bought this product for one reason only: to accompany my grilled cheese sandwiches!For me, regular cans of soup just have way too much soup for a meal with one grilled cheese sandwich, but not quite enough to split in half and still have a satisfying amount.  The soup at hand servings are perfect.  The taste is creamy, the consistency is smooth...it pretty delicious for something that comes in a can.Downsides: For a small container of soup, it sure packs a punch of your suggested daily sodium intake (~30%) and it has more calories than I expected (190 cals).  In the future, I would rather get the classic tomato soup and make it creamy on my own by adding a dollop of sour cream (or better yet, greek yogurt) for a much lower calorie, but still creamy, tomato soup.
The soup is pretty good. Not the best, but it's quick and easy so good for a fast meal.

I love New England Clam Chowder and Campbell's Soup At Hand version of Clam Chowder is quite tasty and filling.What I liked: with 10  ounces of soup, this is a great item to have for lunch, especially during a long cold winter.  It only takes a minute and 15 seconds to heat up, so it is a quick and convenient meal. The container is compact enough that you can keep several cans in your desk so you can just grab one when you're ready for lunch. Being able to heat up the container means one less bowl to clean and it's easy enough to rinse out and recycle the can when you are through with it. The soup is filled with potatoes, celery, and clams and is delicious. It's not too salty, which can be a problem with canned soup.What I didn't like: the container. Yes, I love its convenience, but it's too tall. The soup is meant to be sipped, not eaten with a spoon, but you still have to stir it and when you use a spoon to do it, almost the entire spoon goes into the can, which is very messy. Also, the plastic lid on the can is hard to take off and the opening to sip the soup needs to be wider, since items like the potatoes and clams sometimes get stuck and you need to take the lid off to finish the soup - and it's very hard to use a spoon to eat the remainder because of the shape of the can.Nutritional Facts: Each container has one service size that is 160 calories (calories from fat are 90). There are 10 g's total fat, 2 g's of saturated fat, and no trans fat. There are 5 mg's cholesterol and 890 mg's of sodium. Also, there are 13 g's total carbohydrates; 5 g's dietary fiber; 1g sugar; 4 g protein; 2% of the daily value of calcium; and 6% of the daily value of iron.Bottom-line: Campbell's Soup at Hand New England Clam Chowder is very tasty and filling but somewhat inconveniently packaged.

I'm not big on processed foods, but sometimes convenience trumps all. This is a thick, creamy, delicious soup in the perfect portion size. It is easy to prepare and I haven't had any issues with it being too hot or the can being difficult to handle after microwaving. I'll order this again.

I was pleasantly surprised with the taste of this soup.  It really has an excellent flavor and it is so easy to heat and eat.I have always known that I couldn't go wrong with the Campbell's brand.  This soup proves it once again.
